Try brushing your teeth with warm water. Yuk. We tried to spend the entire day sight seeing because we dreaded spending any time in the teeny, hot room.
title: Great location horrible hotel

hotelLocation: 36 South Great Georges Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I've lived in Europe and have traveled extensively throughout the continent but had never been to Ireland until recently. Kellys Hotel was definitely a great place to stay! Perfect location- close to everything, and I walked everywhere. I was unaffected by the noise from the bar (had requested a room in back) but I will say that the seagulls were pretty loud early in the morning (when it was still dark!). Bed was VERY comfortable and wi-fi was easy. Breakfast very convenient. Loved that they had an in-room safe, but it was a bit small (my iPad wouldn't fit). The shower was small, which wasn't an issue for me, but larger people might be upset. Water pressure was great.Being in the back was great for noise but horrible for any kind of view. Kellys should commission an artist to paint something bright and colorful on the concrete wall across from their hotel!
title: Great location and quiet during the week!

review: A bit old in appointments but very welcoming staff makes it pleasant. Old wood, velvet lounges you get the picture. Good tea selection, cookies and spring water in room. Large bath and large comfortable bed. For height of tourist hun bub its QUIET and that is great.
title: Central,classic,old style irish hospitality

review: As with all other hotels in central Dublin noise from people having a good time is to be expected. My room was facing away from the street, and even then could I hear noises from the bar downstairs, plus the air vents were right outside my windows making a racket all through the night. Bring earplugs!The hotel in itself is nothing special, just a good and centrally located place to sleep. My room was tiny, but clean, and the wifi never worked.
title: Noisy

hotelLocation: 36 South Great Georges Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: It started with finding a parking in Dublin near the hotel,phew! Carry luggage to the hotel, negotiate, flight of stairs ( no lifts), only to be told your bedroom is another three flight of stairs!! Not a good start to a holiday.Once in our room, it was beautiful but so very hot!! No fans available,the window just opens a tad, I wanted to scream!!!Breakfast was continental and well laid out.
title: Hard work!

review: A very good travelodge on the outer edges of the city, but a good walk in, and the busess stop right outside and are every few minutes, so no problem with getting in and out. No cafe onsite but a cafe a few doors down that does a really good breakfast and was reasonably priced.
title: Good stay

review: Very good clean bedrooms, big size, clean bathrooms and friendly staff. Close to city and public transport. Thought it should be a little cheaper though. The wifi was excellent. Defintely recommend it
title: Very good

review: I have stayed in a lot of Travelodges as they are budget and affordable. This is a poor standard for usually a very good Travelodge brand. Good points: Bed, Wifi bus stop on the doorstep and staff. Downsides: Dirty needs a good clean and paint work majorly cracked. Our receptionist let us check in early due to our early flight which was super!
title: Average

review: Soulless, exorbitant cube with nowhere near enough furniture and sporadic WiFi.Excellent staff and hardworking housekeepers redeem an otherwise grey establishment. Busy main road in a pleasant area with the splendid Café Moda nearby.
title: Cube

review: Room was nice, bit small but considering it is in Rathmines and Bus stop and supermarket just outside it was ok, using Dublin Bus city center is not far way temple bar and other locations for night life nearby, also Charlemont luas station is 10 mins walking distance and considering most of the day tour start from city center it is a nice location as city center is like 20 mins walking or 10 mins by bus depending on traffic.Also quite a few fooding options within walking distance. Overall nice place to stay.Room was nice and clean.
title: Nice place, nearby to city center

review: Stayed in the 'Maple House' hotel with friends and it was very convenient beside croke park as we were up for an event. The rooms are quite small but very clean which is most important. Nice and quiet outside so no disruption to ones sleep.
title: Nice hotel with friendly staff

review: I liked the location. It was close to airport and was in a nice quiet neighborhood. The restaurant and bar within was very nice and food was good. The room was was small and had not been updated recently.as was the bathroom. We paid $300 for the night, so I would have expected the room to be a bit nicer.
title: Mrs Allison McGrellis

review: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. Firstly I would like to say that whoever gave this place a 3 star rating needs to go back and check again. On arrival the first thing that struck us was the overwhelming smell of stale cooking. The triple room we paid over £400 for was the size of a postage stamp with not enough room to move around in. One of the beds was so near the entrance door that we had to keep pushing it back so that we could close it.The double bed was pushed right up against the wardrobe with very little space between that bed and the single one . To give an indication of how small this room was the tea and coffee facilities were in the wardrobe because there was no space for them anywhere else!!!. The bathroom had no space to move around in and had a damp mouldy smell. We were told that toiletries would be supplied so bought none with us but all that was provided was a hand wash by the sink and an empty shower gel dispenser in the shower. We queried this and were told we could have some toiletries that other guests had left behind!!. Our room was next to the fire exit door but when we looked there were 2 stacks of chairs, a folded up table, broken mirrors with shards of glass all over the floor and a Henry hoover blocking the stair case, not the easiest or safest exit if you are trying to get out of a burning building. All in all the place is shabby and certainly not worth the money the are charging. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
title: NOT IMPRESSED!.

review: I booked two rooms at this hotel recently. The rooms are not large but are very comfortable. There is a pleasant bar and a dining room on site.The management and staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is in a quiet residential area, close to the Botanical Gardens and within walking distance of Dublin city centre. However there are busses available on Botanic Road and Drumcondra Road as well as a train service at Drumcondra station.Will use this hotel again.
title: Convenient for the Botanical Gardens

review: We have spent sature au night 22nd Of July in this hotel and are very disappointed. We haven't been warned that there was a party going on just under our room when we booked the room. This should have been a minimum to warn us.The music was very loud, and even the floor was vibrating! We had a flight at 6 a.m. on sunday so woke up à 3:45 a.m., without being able to sleep before 0:40 - 1:00 am!!When I asked info on that party to the night receptionist, and if we could change room or a have a reduced price due to the circumstances, all he could say was that it's normal in Dublin, saturday is busy/party in the town center and that if we want calm we have to choose a B&B!I'm sorry but I've worked for 2 months in the Clarence Hotel in Temple Bar and I can tell that it was very quiet! Last time we went in Dublin, last year, we slept in another hotel closest to the city center and it was very quiet too!Additionnal to this, the flush was very slow: really comfortable when you are 3 in a room! The beds are ridiculously small (I'm 1m85 and my feet were out of the bed...)And we paid 285€ for this!!!!I sent a mail to the hotel's manager a week ago and no answer!Sure we won't come back!
title: N'y allez pas le week-end!!!!

review: Reception staff was very friendly, beds comfortable and rooms very clean, hotel is located right in the heart of the city centre so what more would you want to enjoy your mini trip to Dublin. The breakfast was divine, couldn't hope for more! Would highly recommend it!
title: Friendliest staff ever, spotless rooms, delicious brteakfast!

review: Being someone who travels extensively for work I can say I've experience my fair share of dump hotels. This place however tops them by a good way. It's pure nasty so where do I begin? I'll start with minor grievance of only 1 towel in a 2 bed room. I've had 4 towels in a no star hotel in Lobito. The front desk staff are not up to their job and are clueless. Could not offer alternative room when I complained at the rooms allocated. Small shoebox rooms with old and substandard furniture. Our daughters bathroom is smaller than our downstairs guest washroom so it's a little on the snug side. Our rooms do have a fantastic view that is if you are an avid trainspotters and want to experience the closeness and rattle of speeding locomotives at all hours. "Ah this city center hotel this normal and what you get" was the sympathetic front desk reply. The all day restaurant is all day if you exclude a large proportion of the day. The photos on the website and booking sites must have been extensively airbrushed or outright doctored as even with lights off and a skin full of Guinness would I be would be hard pushed to say the room is the one shown online. To top it all they claim to have been awarded the hotel of 2016. In what way was that even remotely possible? The only way I can get my head around that if if the catagory was "The best hotel call Beresford on Store street as judged by morons". A disgusting dump that could and should have a more detailed review however, I feel aggrieved at wasting my money on this place I didn't want to waste any time on it but dealt compelled to try and save any poor traveler making the same horrendous mistake I made.
title: Worst dump I've experienced

review: Small hotel great rooms, very clean and spacious. Had a room over looking the Luas line and the noise wasn't a bother at all. Only fault was being told that late checkout wasn't a problem only to be told the next morning it was unavailable.
title: Great stay !

review: I booked here last minute recently as I had to stay over in Dublin unexpectedly. It was one of few rooms available, and I was a little reluctant having seen some of the bad reviews. However, I was pleasantly surprised - my room was clean and had everything I needed, the staff were friendly and efficient, and the bed was comfortable. The location is quite noisy, with bars and the luas nearby, but nothing I wouldn't expect in any city centre hotel. I did think the breakfast was a bit expensive (I thought it was included in my room, but cost €11 extra). Overall I would say it is perfectly sufficient for a one or two night stay.
title: Good location and reasonably priced

review: Stay in Dublin on business frequently - have not stayed here before. Very central and easy to find. Rooms slightly dated however very comfortable and clean. Had dinner in their restaurant - food and service were fantastic. Great breakfast and to put the icing on the cake great value for money compared to other big chain hotels. Would highly recommend. Will definitely stay there again.
title: Lovely hotel

review: Stayed here for the weekend of the coldplay concert. It is super modern. Seriously could not complain about anything. Rooms perfect, on site restaurant perfect, staff perfect and all within a short walk of everything. Will definitely come again
title: Superb Hotel

review: The hotel is subtly located. Inside it brings a welcoming atmosphere and the staff are very very helpful. I was needing to print some papers for a presentation and they were very glad to do it for free. The business lounge, though small is also cozy with a great view of part of the city. The person in charge of the lounge, she is very courteous with a lovely smile, she helps a lot to make you settle comfortably. Thanks.
title: Best Kept Secret

review: Great hotel. Stayed here for business meeting and after flying 27 hours the staff could not have been more helpful. Stayed on level 7 with club access, very high tech room and extremely quite. Across from the train and tram station and right around the corner from Talbot Street. They do a great breakfast and room service is excellent. Only critique was they didn't take down my credit card details which meant I had to pay as I went for the breakfast and room service but the staff were very helpful each time. Will stay here again if ever back in Dublin.
title: Great hotel, great staff and perfectly located.

review: Have to give this Hotel 5 stars. We stayed in a club king room - staff at reception were great and we were shown to our room. Hotel room was lovely, beautiful bathroom and the bed was extremely comfortable. Went up to club lounge, water was complimentary. We even had a complimentary packet of crisps and dairy milk in our room which I forgot to eat unfortunately. Only one thing the coffee pods supplied were espresso, would prefer a cappuccino or Americano. Will definitely return.
title: Excellent Hotel

review: There are some 4 star hotels that could be mistaken for 5 stars from how great they are. Not this one. The rooms are new and very well furnished and comfortable. But the service isnt that great. To start off there is no valet or parking. You have to park your car at the train stations parking 500 meters away. Then the luggage. When we were leaving we had to load our own suitcases into the car. The train runs at the room's window. Really right at the window. The view is beyond horrible at suite 331. Standard room 336 has no view but thats better. The suite is spacious with a good bathroom. The toiletries are definitely like a 2 or 3 star hotel. You get a shampoo/ shower gel in one and conditioner but they are the big containers that you pump out of rather than the small ones usually found in 4 or 5 star hotels. The reception staff are nice enough but one guy that answers the phone is rude. When i asked for a kettle i was told to use the coffee machine. When i insisted to get one because i have a baby i need to boil water for they got me a dirty one. The location is ok not great. The gym is part of the other old hotel belonging to north star hotels. Only one elevator is available for the new hotel.
title: Definitely not 5 stars

review: Clean, full bathroom, quiet, good location. I was very comfortable here. Adelphi bar in hotel is convenient. I have nothing more to say. 200 characters is a bit much to require. Ridiculous. Nothing more to add.
title: Fantastic deal

review: We chanced upon this hotel after our original hotel failed to meet our expectations. Sharon the Manager, warmly greeted us and immediately went to work finding 2 rooms for us for the week at a very resonable price. We had the best stay in a fabulous area because of the hospitality of Sharonville and Richie D. They made our Vist enjoyable. Of course having the pub downstairs was very convenient for food and drink, mostly drink...lol. Clean comfortable rooms with fans and windows that open for a nice Dublin breeze. We honestly did not experience noise from the pub downstairs at any time. We were on the 3rd of 4 floors. They offered us umbrellas when it rained, converter outlets so we didn't need to buy any which by the way they have in the lobby if you wish to buy along with lots of brochures so you can find many many things to do, and they were always interested in your day when you came back. Such nice people. Bagel shop with great sandwiches and coffee on the corner as well as a Marks and Spencer(wonderful food store)across the street. 5-7 min walk to Temple bar area. 1-2 min walk to O'Connell street and the Hop on Hop off yellow bus stop. Everything was close by. The best part about our stay was the staff, we'll definitely be back. Thank you.
title: Wonderful area

review: Didn't know what to expect-never been to Ireland. Seemed expensive for the size of the room, but I think that's just Dublin. Pluses: we could walk everywhere, beds were fairly comfortable, rooms were clean. Minuses: staff not very friendly, room was so hot we couldn't sleep-one fan that couldn't be moved very easily. Some oddities...our house phone was not connected-chord severed. When we asked to have it fixed-no one ever came up.
title: Convenient-average rooms.

review: This is not an easy review because there are pros about this place although I wouldn't choose to stay here again. It is dated but clean. It is in a very convenient area where you can walk to most everything with the farthest location being 20-30 minutes (Guinness Tour, St Stephens, Zoo, Graftin Street, Trinity College, etc). I felt like it was too expensive for the room. We had a triple room (two adults and two kids) and it was small, a bit hot and right above the bar. The tram goes by on Abbey St which wasn't too bad but in the end, it isn't worth what we paid.
title: Really good location but pricey for what you get

hotelLocation: 99-100 Baggot Street Lower, Dublin D02 DF21, Ireland
review: We stayed two nights. The receptionist kindly swapped one of the room so that we had adjacent ground floor rooms and could create a self-contained apartment between them. Microwave, fridge, sink, basic crockery and cutlery provided in each apartment. Supermarkets within easy reach. Nice walk to south to canal and then east along canal by Georgian houses. Easy to walk to city centre. Only downside: the front ground floor room was bathed in floodlighting until about midnight - seems to belong to the restaurant next door, and the receptionist did try to get it switched off earlier. Take eyeshades if staying on this side of the building.
title: Good location, helpful staff

review: Booked in a hurry via a website; I picked the best deal combined with proximity to my ultimate destination. The room is absolutely fine. Clean, functional and suited my needs. Lovely pub below which doubles up as the breakfast bar in the morning.Friendly and down to earth staff. A great location, a little off the track but still easily accessible to the centre of town. Loved it and would definitely stay here again.Thankyou.
title: Extremely satisfied

hotelLocation: 99-100 Baggot Street Lower, Dublin D02 DF21, Ireland
review: I stayed here for a total of 3 nights recently. I booked this as Expedia said there was AC however we go to the place - a bit out of the way from main Dublin- and to our surprise there was no AC. Staff hours are very limited so we weren't even able to get a fan. When we complained they said they can't keep fans in the room due to fire hazards. In addition, on our last night we switched rooms ( this one was even hotter I didn't sleep) and the room looked like it hadn't been cleaned. Hair in the bed and make up on the pillows. Hair in the shower. Definitely not worth over 150 euros /night. I complained to the staff and through Expedia and they thought 50 euro credit was enough - mind you there was false advertising on the website. Definitely would not recommend and will NOT be back
title: Do not stay here - not worth it

review: Herbert Park is a wonderful property that combines great service at reasonable prices in a fantastic location. We thoroughly enjoyed the friendly staff and their ability to accommodate our early arrival.
title: Lovely Stay

review: The Food was very continental and there was no attempt to provide Food to the largest population segment in the World Asia and China and the Middle East. The Kitchen was ill equipped for turning up even basic food say rice and lentils or curried veggies. The bangladeshi cook Paritosh served Thai condiments and passed it as Indian curry. Asians are big spenders so take care of them and the vegetarians. Second, kindly drop the Euro 6.50 service charge for sending anything to Rooms
title: GOOD

review: We had our tea this evening in the Terrace Lounge area of the Herbert Park and the food and the surroundings were beautiful! Two people had the tagliatelle, one had Caesar salad, one had soup and toasted sandwich and I had baked salmon with chive mash - everything was just gorgeous! Having said that, what made the evening even better was the service we received from Dharam! He was friendly, helpful and a joy to talk to! We always enjoy the food in the Herbert Park, but we will especially be looking forward to our next visit in the hopes of once again having the pleasure of meeting Him! Thank you Dharam, for making our visit so enjoyable!
title: Food and service fantastic

review: I had a wonderfull stay in the herbert park hotel for 2 weeks. Especially dharam and samer were the perfect hosts in the hotel bar were i enjoyed a drink every evening. They can make really nice cocktails
title: Business trip

review: Great location to walk into Dublin city centre. Happy and welcoming staff. Absolutely fantastic breakfast buffet spread, I've never seen so much variety. Comfortable rooms with lovely decor and wonderful park right next door.
title: Fabulous hotel and staff

review: This is a nice hotel in a great location, a very quiet road, just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre but still only three stops on the Dart train from Landsdowne Road straight into Tara Street (city centre). The room was modern, clean and spacious although the bathroom wasn't very big and felt more like a cupboard. There was a safe in the room, together with tea and coffee making facilities, a TV and free WiFi. We did have a lovely night sleep in the beds (we had a twin room, one double, one single). We had room-only and when we checked in at 5pm they asked us if we wanted to have breakfast included in our stay and we said yes. We paid for the room plus breakfast. When we went to the dining room the next morning we were told that we were not entitled to breakfast as we hadn't paid for it! They checked the paperwork which said we was room-only and then I asked them to call the reception - which was all rather embarrassing. It was confirmed that we had paid for breakfast but we had not been given our breakfast vouchers. So we had to go back to reception and get these before we were allowed to eat. I was not happy that from checking in at 5pm and turning up for breakfast the next morning at 8am, the hotel hadn't noted this and we hadn't been given our breakfast vouchers. Having said that, the breakfast was lovely with plenty of choices on the buffet: juices, cereals, pasties, fruit and yoghurt, hot breakfast or continental. With free parking on site, we left the car and used public transport to get in to the city centre, 3,95 euro return on the Dart train or get a visitor "Leap" pass which will allow travel on trains, buses and trams.
title: Good hotel

review: I stay in this hotel very regularly on business and cannot fault it at all. It is very homely, staff are very pleasant and the bar food is top quality.Rooms are very comfortable, clean and modern and there is a great car park on site with plenty of room.I've tried various other hotels in the area - cheaper and more expensive and this is the best. Prices are very, very reasonable. I would highly recommend this, not just for business but for family breaks or short weekends.Staying away from home is not so much of a chore in this spot!
title: Regularly stay here on business - best in area

review: A smallish hotel in a pleasant area with friendly staff. The rooms and food were of good quality and the area quiet. Nearby is Sandymount village with shops and pubs and a little further on is a beach which provided a pleasant evening walk.
title: Sandymount

review: The Sandymount Hotel is a good choice. Located in Sandymount quarter it is easy to reach the center of Dublin by the DART train. At the end of an Ireland trip it is very easy to drive to the airport within 15 minutes.
title: Out of the hustle und bustle but very central

review: We stayed in the Sandymount for the Sunday night of the longitude festival. First impression, really lovely decor but not so lovely that you are afraid to put down your glass or touch anything. There was a really relaxed feel in the hotel. People were just sitting around, chilling in various locations (there are chairs and sofas around every corner...so nice). The people on check in were lovely but special praise goes to Beatrice. She went above and beyond. About 10 mins after booking us a taxi to longitude another couple made a similar request and she suggested that they approach us and share, saving us both money. I thought it was a lovely touch. She was there again in the morning when we were checking out and made time to ask how we got on the night before. Silly maybe but we both agreed that Beatrice's kindness added to the great buzz of the weekend.  The beer garden is really lovely. While we didn't get to eat at the hotel (other than late night pizza) but I think you could honestly go to the Sandymount and not leave the grounds. At one point I thought we would just forget Longitude and stay in the garden :) We were driving so with regards to public transport, I am not sure what the options are like but given that the hotel is co-located with the Aviva Stadium, I assume they are good.Last but not least, a shout out to the two gentlemen on reception who were there to greet us on our return from longitude in a perhaps 'little under the weather state' wanting food and more alcohol. I am sure you wanted to murder us but pizza and cokes were a far better option. :) I would highly recommend the location. Only thing, if you are a little claustrophobic, the corridors and lift are tight but other than that, you are good to go.
title: Good times

hotelLocation: Copper Alley Fishamble Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: As a single woman traveler, visiting Dublin for business, I found this to be a comfortable and authentic Irish experience. There is live music, and meal service every night, in an amiable, Irish pub environment. Service desk is excellent.
title: Warm and friendly stay for the single traveller.

hotelLocation: Copper Alley Fishamble Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The room and bathroom were clean, and the location was convenient to a bus-stop served by the Dublin Airport Express route 747. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and they were gracious enough to let us check in a few hours early (to get a much needed jet-lag nap). The Wi-Fi was thankfully free.It has easy walking access to Christchurch Cathedral, shopping, and several restaurants. It's also not too far from Trinity College and other major attractions in the area.The breakfast menu was a little limited, particularly from the perspective of my spouse (who prefers lighter fare and can't eat wheat), but I really enjoyed getting the Full Irish there. They provide free tea & instant coffee for the rooms, but no decaf.The only serious negative was the noise from their nextdoor neighbor: the church. For some archaic reason, Christchurch cathedral still thinks it's appropriate to ring its bells every 15 minutes... ALL NIGHT. Bring earplugs.
title: Great value and great staff, but prepare for all-night church bells!

hotelLocation: Copper Alley Fishamble Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Really enjoyed staying here. The staff was very friendly. The in house breakfast was excellent. And the room was nice. The location for wondering around downtown Dublin was excellent. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Great Hotel

hotelLocation: Copper Alley Fishamble Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The Harding Hotel provided us a wonderful accommodations experience in Dublin. We were originally scheduled to stay in Iceland and then fly to Ireland. After our initial flight was cancelled to Iceland, the hotel was nice enough to extend our stay 2 more days (last minute!) so that we could fly in early to Dublin. The location is perfect being off the busy and noisy Temple Bar district but also being only a 5min walk to Temple Bar and the river. It allows for walking distance to all the main sights in Dublin and there is a bus stop right outside. Our hotel room overlooked the courtyard of the Christ Church cathedral. The room was always cleaned well and we did not have any disturbances from outside noise our adjoining rooms. The front desk was tremendously accommodating to all our needs and quick to provide any suggestions for restaurants or live music that we were interested in. We certainly recommend the Harding House hotel for any stay that you may have in Dublin.
title: Great hotel in the heart of Dublin

hotelLocation: Copper Alley Fishamble Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We spent 8 days in Dublin and loved the Harding Hotel for the location and helpful staff. Walking distance to many of Dublin's tourist's attractions. Room was clean and a good size, but wish the lighting was better. Also, we found we had to unplug the TV so that we could charge our phones and Ipad. We always bring an extension cord, so that helped with putting our phones on the nightstands. Enjoyed the Irish music, food and entertainment at the Darkey Kelly Pub, located in the hotel. Oscars Cafe Bar Christchurch is a good breakfast place around the corner on Fishamble Street. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.
title: Great Location in Dublin

review: We Booked 3 rooms here, total 10 quests for 2 nights, first time in a jurys inn, rooms very clean, everywhere was very clean, Breakfast was the best yet, staff very friendly, would highly recommend. We got a bus from the airport, drop off was 5 min walk from Hotel.
title: 1st Time, But not the Last !!

review: Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel clean and well maintained. Excellent central location in Dublin. Only issue we had was around parking. We had booked stay on-line, it indicated parking available but when we arrived this not so, we could disembark at the hotel as it had traffic pulled in. We ended up going further down road to large city centre car park. When we enquired around parking facilities at the hotel they informed us that they had a discounted deal with nearby car park--Cleary's Q Park. We then had to move car to it albeit we had to pay other car park fees for time spent within it. It would have been very useful to have known this prior to arrival.
title: Jurys Parnell St Dublin--family visit

review: Dublin is a beautiful place but even more so during the Christmas holidays. We have stayed at jury's inn Parnell street the year before and was impressed by the friendliness of the staff and the warm homely atmosphere so we decided to return but with breakfast included this time. Breakfast was amazing. Plenty of choice for fussy eaters just like my youngest son. Will be coming back again for Christmas 2017
title: Family pre Christmas getaway!

review: Friendly reception, nice neat room for 2 adults and 2 children. Very helpful front desk. The breakfast was excellent. Our Dinner experience was exceptionally excellent - the menu had plenty of choices, tasty food and moderately priced. Restaurant was quiet and a cozy place to sit and talk over dinner
title: Nice, neat place to stay

review: In a very central location, not far from O'Connell Street. You can walk to the GPO Museum and the Hop on - Hop off buses depart just opposite it. The airbus from the airport also has a stop nearby. Easy to walk to the river and bars. Good size rooms, décor just as you would expect from Jurys. What made this an exceptional stay was the breakfast. An excellent choice on the buffet and the hot food was kept fresh - it was as good a breakfast as I've had in many more expensive hotels. At the moment there are serious road works going on in Dublin and there are some just outside the hotel. There is only a small pull in / drop off area outside. I left the car in a nearby shopping centre until I found the hotel and checked in. They will give you directions to a nearby car park and validate your ticket for a discount.
title: Excellent place to stay in Dublin

review: We have just come back from 3 nights at the parliament hotel. Room were basic but couldn't see what other people were moaning about. I've personally stayed in worser hotels. Rooms did what was needed-to sleep in. No issues with the bed, slept like a log all 3 nights cuz of all the walking round the city. Staff were helpful everytime we asked something. Ventured down to the pub and one afternoon we had a quick snack. Food was lovely!! Location was good, right on the edge of temple bar Will be visiting the hotel when we return again.
title: Recent stay

review: Location is really excellent! Most of sights are just in 5-10 min walk. And actually that was exactly what we were looking for!Building itself looks quite old. Even despite of recent renovation, you may feel it once step in. Squeaking floors, old-fashioned wooden window frames. Sleeping quality in general could be much much better.It was huge problem to park a car nearby. To manage our luggage we had either to violate the rules & park on sidewalk or to walk with bags from parking the hotel provides discount coupons for. 5 minutes, but still not pleasant.Restaurant: Nice interior & great atmosphere. Irish burger I had there was the best I tasted during our trip to Ireland! Highly recommended!
title: Location is excellent, pub is awesome, the rest ...

review: Went as two couples for my birthday weekend. Good location with most attractions in walking distance. Got to the hotel early and was allowed to leave bags whilst waiting for room. There's leaflets at reception with discounts off activities. There is Lifts to all three floors.Booked through Booking.com. When it came to paying we ended up paying for because of the exchange rate or something to better to pre-pay to avoid paying 30 euros more than expected.Stayed in a double room with bath. The room itself was spacious but the bathroom was cramped, could have a poo brush your teeth and have a shower at the same time. Ran water for a bath and it came out dirty for about a minute. Few stains etc. On furniture, outdated furniture and accessories such as hairdryer was poor or like the steam press just didn't work. Beds were singles put together but thankfully was comfortable.Overall a poor to average experience basically paying for the location.
title: Only good for location

review: Not brilliant.....Grubby rooms, thread bare carpets on main stairs, smells of damp in the stairwellWardrobes knocked up by inept Carpenters, bathroom had mildew on bath surrounds, and the sink was sunk into what seemed to be an excuse of some old piece of kitchen work surface! Radiators were grubby & rusty.... Plaster falling out of RSJ's/ wall supports! Good attempt to hide that behind the curtains folks!!Advice for prospective guests, avoid room 221. Advice for owners, SORT IT OUT and put a bit of your profits back into your business All this for £390 for two nights room only! Welcome to the rip off Parliament Hotel
title: Rip Off!

review: The hotel looked a little tired- could certainly do with some updating. The staff were very pleasant, friendly and helpful and gave good advice about where to buy tickets for the Dublin sights (one can actually get various tickets from Reception eg the Green Line Hop On Hop Off bus with a stop just opposite the hotel- good value). The location was excellent being close to the buzz of Temple Bar and the city centre. Had a 2nd floor, front room overlooking Lord Edward St. It was just as well I had brought some earplugs to deaden the noise from the street! The first night I felt I was being attacked by bed mites so I hardly slept, but I spoke to Reception the next morning and after that I didn’t have any further problems sleeping. The bar/breakfast area was fine and a bonus after my arrival (on a Friday) was being told there would be Irish dancing, which was great. Apparently there will be a refurbishment over the coming months, which is good to hear. Despite everything, I would go back and give the hotel another go due to the location and the welcoming staff.
title: Location, location , location!

review: Quite friendly staff and decent breakfast. Room was okay and clean. Pillow was flat and I don't quite understand the double bed thing, not even separate blankets. No working A/C, no wi-fi in the room, no working usb-loading. A bit disappointed. Situated a bit off from everything. This hotel desperately needs updating.
title: Disappointed, not worth the price

review: This hotel was clean and the rooms large. However, it really isn't near anything so you'll either have to walk quite a ways or take a taxi. The hotel doesn't have A/C and traveling in July, it was quite warm. Since our room looked out into a courtyard, we couldn't get any airflow---the windows only opened about 2" at the most. We opened our room door, but they had painted the hall and fumes were overwhelming. Everything great, other than lack of A/C or a fan.
title: Just OK.

review: This hotel has only just scraped a 3. We weren't expecting high end or luxury, but I do expect at least a good level of service. Unfortunately, the service on the whole left a lot to be desired.Checking in was fine - no smiles or interest in me as a customer, but also not rude. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but the whole 2 double bed thing is still a mystery to me! Bathroom was clean and fresh, with a lovely rain shower and an abundance of products.The TV was rubbish (terrible sound quality, no entertainment and a poor signal). The thing that really let this hotel down is the fact there is no air con!! No air con!! Yes, you read that correctly. It was hot and their was no air con. Not even a fan to compensate. Yes, the windows could open wide, but they opened into a courtyard in the middle of the building, so there was no breeze.There were other guest staying there who decided to have a party in their room - both nights. The second night we had to call down to reception to ask them to do something about the noise as clearly either no-one else noticed or they just didn't care. We, on the other hand, did.The service at the bar was very slow and poor - the guy serving us both nights struggled to understand what we were ordering and took an age to pull 4 drinks together.Checking out, we were met with the same apathy as when checking in - in fact, it felt like we were an inconvenience to them. Sorry for paying to stay with you!!We won't be going back. That's not say it wasn't ok for the money we paid, but some things just leave a sour taste.....
title: Needs a lot of improvement

review: Walk of about ten minutes to red bus, good hotel, clean and updated. Wonderful staff was very accommodating and efficientGood location in town for those who like to stroll. Restaurant is very nice with fresh veggies, good food and fast staff.
title: Quiet room, clean with nice restaurant

hotelLocation: Eliza Lodge 23/24 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I stayed at Eliza Lodge with two friends over a long weekend in June. Fabulous room with a view to the river, we all had separate beds which was great. Temple Bar is a busy party area, which was great for us but perhaps less so if you have small children, because of the noise... which did not bother us (take earplugs though!). You can walk everywhere. There's no breakfast included but that is fine because there are loads of cafés just next door. Rooms are basic but comfortable, just what we needed.
title: Great stay, fabulous location, just what we needed

hotelLocation: Eliza Lodge 23/24 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: stayed at ELIZA. LODGE.COST OF ONE NIGHT FOR 2 WAS 199.00 EURO.WHICH I THINK WAS TOO DEAR FOR WHAT WE GOT.the room was very basick and i had requested breakfast to be included.when i enquired re same,i was informed that we had to go accross the road to another pub/resturant or cross the bridge to another resturant,as they did not provide same.this i found unbelieveable as i nevr had this happen before,we had a nice lunch there on arrival butnot to do breakfast i didnot understand.the staff on arrival at reception(a small space as you come out of elivator)did not knoe directions to theater told me use google.the girl was not irish but when you are on reception i think person shoud be aware and know places in capital city.
title: trip to dublin to see ONCE the musical

hotelLocation: Eliza Lodge 23/24 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: When I stayed here in June with my friends and they're sisters we first got there and couldn't pay by card it had to be the one it was booked on which was very awkward we then stayed a night and cleaned the place up the next morning and a week later told there was 250 been takin of our account when the maximum fee was 200 they had no explanation for it or no proof either and it wasn't cheap to stay in for a night either!!!
title: Terrible

hotelLocation: Eliza Lodge 23/24 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This hotel is in a perfect location for anyone touring Dublin or the surrounding area. It's also great for anyone eager to take advantage of the many pubs and discos in Temple Bar! You can party til you drop and then crawl around the corner to the hotel. If you need total quiet to sleep, bring ear plugs! Remember Temple Bar is THE party district...a Monday night here in the summer looks like Bourbon Street at Mardi Gras! As for the staff here - just excellent! I don't make a habit of hugging hotel clerks, but the night before we left I needed to stop by and hug Iva to thank her for all she did for us!
title: Great Spot in a Great Spot!

review: Myself and my friends went to Dublin for a stag do. Prices for hotels in Dublin are generally pretty extornionate so you expect a decent place to stay. This hotel was just that. The bar and reception were well presented, the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The food menu is good for a 2 day stay, the breakfast buffet in particular was delicious. Location wise a short walk gets you into Dublin although those not as keen on the distance can get a taxi booked at reception. All in all a great hotel!
title: Clean and comfortable

review: The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and checkout is at noon, which is nice. The Irish breakfast was good. We stayed in a basement room with three twin beds, which may or may not be representative of the other rooms. The curtains on the only window in the room were in disrepair, making it difficult to open them during the day and close them at night. The bathroom was large with nice fixtures, but there was limited shelving to place things on or hooks for hanging towels. The heater and exhaust were insufficient for the size of the bathroom, so that as soon as one person took a shower - even a cool or lukewarm one - the mirror was fogged and the bathroom wet for the remainder of the stay. This could be a four star place if they fixed the curtains, added shelves and/or hooks and better ventilation in the bathroom .
title: Torn between two and three stars

hotelLocation: Eliza Lodge 23/24 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This is not a hotel they call it a "Guesrhouse" if you are planning on booking for more than one night they do not service the rooms so be prepared to make your own beds, dry your own bath towels and reuse, wash your coffee cups if you make one in the room and ration the tea, coffee etc. supplied as it's not replenished.
title: This is not a hotel

review: The staff was very nice, informed, and professional. They were able to get us our rooms early, which was great..we arrived in Dublin at 5am..quite tired. The rooms were ok. We were pretty hot Windows didn't open fully and no AC or fans. I had read reviews ahead of time and came prepared for noise in the streets when the bars let out. Earplugs were no help. It was actually fairly amazing how people flooded the street and buzzed with noise and chatter. I wasn't amazed the second night though, just tired. We were able to walk to most things and grab a taxi easily. Staff helped us considerably. Dublin hotels are quite expensive, but I think I would find a different one next time, so we could be better rested...even if paying a lot more.
title: Great Location but alarming loud noise at 4am

review: We stayed in a family room which was plenty big for 2 adults and 2 children. The hotel was very accommodating and provided an extra bed for my brother when he arrived early before his hotel was ready. The rooms are clean and the location can't be beat. You can walk to all the main sites in Dublin. The hotel is in an area that has a lot of nightclubs so if you are a light sleeper, you will be awoken when the clubs let out about 4am from street noise, but if you want to partake, the hotel is partnered with the Harcourt hotel up the street and allows you admission to their bar/club for free.
title: Solid Hotel Centrally Located

review: Stayed here for two nights after booking a triple room. When we were arrived we found out we had been upgraded to room number 11, the suite. It was fabulous! Lots of room and very comfy beds. The breakfast was very nice. The only downside was the noise at night from the nightclubs opposite. We were kept awake til 4am both nights which spoilt the weekend for us as we were very very tired!
title: Great location but very noisy!

review: This really is a gem of a hotel to stay in and a brilliant base for sightseeing in Dublin or travelling further afield to other areas. Straight off the M50 and easy access to main routes as well as a great and regular bus service, which takes you right from outside the hotel into Dublin city centre.The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful - they are happy to please and nothing is too much trouble. There is a lovely family/community feel here with locals enjoying the meals and entertainment too!Business, couples, families - whatever the purpose of your trip, it's the perfect place to cater for your needs.We had some delicious meals, which were plentiful and cooked to our liking - highly recommend the popular carvery, which they serve daily! The bar staff were amazing - worked very hard and are very busy at times yet always clock when you're ready for another! It doesn't matter what time of day it is, there is always an offering of food and drink of some description - you would never go hungry! Breakfasts were also yummy and plentiful and you can have whatever you ask for if you don't want everything on the set menu. I usually steer clear of meals such as curries and lasagnes in places that serve a bit of everything (not an Indian or Italian) but these dishes were also lovely, not forgetting the steak, which came with sautéed onions - a refreshing change to soggy onion rings!! You cannot fault the food here!! Just to add that there is a lovely choice of lunches; both hot and cold too....The room was clean and comfortable with everything you need - a nice shower, hairdryer, TV, coffee & tea making facilities and so on plus plenty of room.There was a live band on Saturday evening, which were brilliant - they sang a mix of stuff to appeal to everyone including a request for my dad's birthday, which added to an already special evening! The lady (Catherine, SHINE) sang the most beautiful ballad that had us in tears....I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return!
title: A fabulous find!

review: We recently stayed in the Harrington Hall Hotel. The hotel is very conveniently located, close to the center of Dublin (about a five minute walk) with a pubs, restaurants and convenience store all close by. On the first night we were placed in room 1, which is directly next to the entrance on the street side. Of course the street gives some noise as can be expected, but since the room has double glass we didn't hear too much of it. However, the wall between the room and the reception/entrance hall is very thin, so it seems like people who are talking in the hall are standing right beside your bed. I sleep quite deep myself and the hotel provides earplugs, but when people start banging on the front door and ringing the bell for 10 minutes at 3AM because no one comes to open the door, this also wakes me up. Besides this, the doorframe of the hotel door is mounted directly to the wall of room 1, so any time people enter or exit the hotel and the door closes with a bang this gives a whole lot of noise. I've stayed in many hotels worldwide, good and bad, but they really shouldn't rent out this room as it's unsuitable to stay in.When we were woken up next morning around 6.30 due to a conversation in the entrance hall, they agreed to give us another room for the second night on the backside of the hotel. Although a bit smaller this was a lovely and cozy room and we had a great and restful stay here.
title: Experience depends on the room you get

review: The hotel is a 10-minutes drive from the airport and has free parking.The rooms are clean and spacious, but lack facilities like hairdryer, iron, and safety box.There's a bar/restaurant where you can buy meals at reasonable prices.The staff are friendly and helpful.
title: Nice hotel

review: Room was clean and big. However we stayed on the 4 floor and the wifi was ridiculous, after sight seeing and travelling we wanted to contact our families but could not get anything to load at all for the two nights we stayed. If you are going to run such a big hotel and we are paying a lot of money to stay there, there should be boosters on every floor so this isn't a problem and everyone can have access to fast loading internet. Also for the price we are paying for accomodation breakfast should be included. The first night we got in after delayed flights we slept in the next morning, deciding to head down to breakfast at 10.15, we payed for full breakfast and once asked if we could get a few things refilled were told that "breakfast is nearly over so no" we are still paying the same amount of price so things that are requested should be refilled or breakfast should be discounted. When checking in we had to fix up our bill which was fine however we were charged an extra $100 Aus dollars for the accomodation as they accidentally converted the money exchange after we asked them not to. Very frustrating stay.
title: Expensive for what?!

review: Located about 40 minutes walk from the Liffey you can also get the DART. Rooms are a decent size and the bed comfortable. WiFi worked well on the second floor. Plug sockets near the bed and centrally controlled lights would be good. Shower was hot but fixed and it was best to set the temperature before stepping into the bath. No hairdryer provided. Towels were a reasonable size. Breakfast was very good.
title: Reasonable hotel

review: Was the only place other than a hostel that we could get booked when attending a Robbie Williams concert in the Aviva stadium. And it was expensive. But soooo worth it. The hotel is within spitting distance of the stadium, you can walk to it in about 3 mins. Unfortunately when we arrived, most of the carpark was taken up by a radio tourbus and we had to park nearly half a mile away and walk back with our cases, in 30 degree heat. But we entered a large, luxury air conditioned lobby. The male receptionist dealt with us very efficiently and we were on our way to the room in minutes. Added security of having to use your room key to access the hallway to the elevators and rooms so no random people wandering about. The rooms were large and airy, very clean. The bathroom was big too. We didnt get time to try dinner or the bar as it was so busy. Breakfast the next morning was great. Wide selection and piping hot buffet. The best coffee ive had in a hotel in a long time. Staff were all lovely. So yes, its expensive but a great hotel. Id like to go back when its not jam packed with robbie fans.
title: Very nice hotel

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: A very clean and tidy hotel, within easy walking distance of the tram and bus and city centre. The receptionist was polite, welcoming and helpful. Absolutely spotless room - large and airy. Very good FREE WIFI!!
title: Convenient location and very friendly staff

review: Nice hotel and well located for Aviva stadium. A short walk to the left when coming out of the hotel leads you to bars/restaurants and a few shops. If you go straight ahead you have a walk of about 20 minutes to St Stephen's Green/ Grafton street and you can enjoy the Georgian architecture.Plenty of shops and restaurants along the way. Our room for 3 people was well fitted out and had most things that are required but no mini bar to keep drinks cool. The 3rd bed was a proper bed. Beds were comfortable and the hotel was quiet overnight. Our room overlooked a construction site which became noisy at 8am. There is no air conditioning but a fan was provided. Fixtures and furnishings were generally good quality although our room had a stain on the carpet. Shampoo and shower gel are provided but not conditioner. We stayed room only at a price of 242 euro which was annoying when our friends stayed a few days earlier for a price of 100 euro. Wifi was good. We decided not to have breakfast at a cost of 12 euro each. We walked elsewhere and had breakfast for the 3 of us for a total of 15 euro. The bar was expensive. 15 euro for a pint and a vodka. It is a nice hotel but would only stay here again if attending the Aviva stadium and I think that when there is an event at the Aviva, the hotel puts their prices up.
title: Good but expensive

review: met at the entrance of the car park by a lovely gentleman who told us we were lucky as a car had just left car park so we would get a space (Man Utd were playing at aviva that night hence Dublin was very busy) ! Good impression. On entering hotel we could see it was extremely busy-we got to the desk to check in -the guy wasn't at all friendly or welcoming ! Asked did we wish to pay then which we did -reached us room card told us our room number and that was it! As I stood staring at him with mouth open he must have known by my face, he then asked us did we know where to go -that would have been a NO!!!! He didn't even mention breakfast or anything else...I was so surprised I myself even forgot to ask re breakfast times etc ! Got to room-good spacious room however on entering we were greeted by a 'damp , mouldy' smell! Apart from that everything else was good ! Next morning we arrived down for breakfast (guessing the times) to be told breakfast hadn't been included-I assured the man I had definitely paid for breakfast when booking-as he checked with reception I was able to bring up my booking.com confirmation on my phone which clearly stated breakfast included !!! He did apologise ! Breakfast was good, decent selection of food and tea coffee is brought to your table by a waitress which is good ! All in all our stay was ok ! The big positive was the hotels handiness /close proximity to the aviva stadium !!!
title: Mixed feelings

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: Like any Travelodge it's very convenient to what you want to stay in! It was a good location to all the bars and restaurants but not to close where it was on your door step! Everyone at reception was very helpful, would definitely stay again :)
title: Good location

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: We chose this hotel for its central location and the reasonable rates. The staff welcomed us very friendly and helpful. The room 310 was sized ok and was clean enough. It had a window to one of the smaller streets, i.e. noise wasn't an issue. They offer 24h parking for 17.50 next door (mall's parking), which is very reasonable.Almost everything was in walking distance from here.
title: Basic, clean, central

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: The location is central. The hotel is basic and clean. The room was completely adequate - very small but so what. The staff were pleasant and efficient. There is nothing to complain about for a reasonable price in central Dublin just off Stephen's green.
title: Typical good value Travelodge in central location

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: Dublin seems generally expensive so we choose travel lodge as a budget hotel. Dublin (Stephens Green ) is more expensive than most TL's but is better than most TL's, as we had a very nice and large room and bathroom. It is very well located just off Grafton Street - not far from the Liffey and Temple Bar. You can walk to most places, 25 - 30 mins maybe to the Guinness Store house and Jamesons distillery. For Kilmainham prison you will probably need transport - and be sure to book in advance.
title: 7 Days in Dublin

review: We stayed at The Clayton Hotel, Ballsbridge for a wedding that was taking place in the adjacent Thomas Prior Hall. The hotel team did a wonderful job.Check-in was smooth and easy - the room was ready at 2pm, the promised time and the receptionist was very welcoming. The room was spotlessly clean and had a good bathroom with a powerful shower.The lady who greeted us in the restaurant for breakfast was so friendly, even though we arrived only 5 minutes before breakfast was due to end.Imelda who checked us out was super-friendly and full of smiles. When she saw our suitcases, she immediately offered to arrange a taxi for us - a very nice, unprompted touch. She really made our departure a warm and friendly experience with lots of personality.The wedding reception itself was wonderful - great service and very nice food.Thank you Clayton Hotel team :-)
title: Very nice experience

review: The hotel is really centrally located just 5-10 mins taxi journey from grafton street. It is also very close to the train station.The hotel is a beautifully preserved old building with Parisian windows. The rooms are a bit basic but are a decent size for a hotel in a central location. The hotel is very clean and the staff are also very friendly and helpful.If in Dublin for a few days, this could be an ideal hotel for your stay.
title: Stayed over after a wedding

review: After a couple of great experiences at the Clayton Dublin Airport Hotel we decided to stay here in Ballsbridge for a couple of nights. Our room was not quite as spacious as the ones we have had in Dublin Airport, but almost everything else was spot on. We enjoyed an excellent vegetarian meal in the bar. The gym is very well set up and I enjoyed the virtual reality running machines. The beds are super comfortable.Similar to other hotels the buffet breakfast is expensive especially if you are vegetarian but the hotel is located close to some excellent cafes where we went for a morning meal, unfortunately none of these were open on the Sunday morning and we circled back to the hotel where we found we could order off the menu. I don't know if many peolpe do this, as there was a lot of confusion from our waiter!The food was typical hotel breakfast food nothing bad nothing amazing. Other than that our experience was great and the staff in general are fantastic.
title: Our Clayton Hotel experiences have always been good so far!

review: I can see how this might be an appropriate business hotel, but I wouldn't recommend this to someone traveling and visiting Dublin. It is a bit too far outside the city center for me. We stayed for 2 nights and we purchased a hop on hop off bus pass, obviously it was our fault for not checking the route before we purchased, the closest stop for the bus requires a 15euro cab ride from the hotel to even get to the bus. The hotel itself is very pretty from the outside, and the lobby and restaurant/bar area is maintained nicely, but the hallways and rooms of the accommodations could use some upgrading. No air conditioning, which we half expected since we've heard that about Europe but still kind of disappointed. It was August so it was still pretty warm out. The breakfast had some basic items, but even the scrambled eggs were a little off. Mostly I was just disappointed with how disconnected from the rest of Dublin it was. Like I said, for someone traveling for business it probably makes sense, but didn't really fit our needs.
title: A little outdated, not the best for visiting

review: Good value in a great location. Double room with a huge (kingsize) bed but bathroom a little dated. Overall good value, if bordering on slightly worn. Very handy for quick access to city centre, as tons of buses stop almost outside hotel. No room service the first night of our stay, due to 'technical problems' which made my partner's birthday, a little less special than I'd planned it to be. We'd enquired twice beforehand (once over the phone and once, upon checking in) to make sure there would be but due to a 'lack of communication,' neither reception when we rang, nor check in when we arrived, were told it wouldn't be available that night. So we toasted with tap water, rather than champagne.However, we both agreed we'd still go back and not just bcs they offered us a late check out, by way of compensation. All in all, it's not a bad deal. Esp if you're in Dublin for the sort of night where you'll only return to your room to sleep, after eating out and going to the theatre. The building itself is quite interesting, as it's a former masonic hall and the tiled mosaic on the floor of the entrance, is worth a photo.
title: Good value but no frills...

review: The Dean is not for travelers who want a quiet night's rest.It is a fun and rocking hotel with a very cool bar/lobby and a truly Epic rooftop restaurant called Maggie's . Good is excellent with a fun vibe and beautifying views of Dublin.Could be the best restaurant scene in all of Dublin.Good pizza and pasta (and breakfast was also )Rooms are funky , but very loud at nightThe hotel is in a row of nightclubs and the bass and music is thumping into very late in the night...Earplugs might be needed.Fun times ; but koud
title: Stylish Boutique Hotel, fun but noisy

review: Wow! Very Boutique, Chic, Stylish hotel - not my traditional style but I was blown away by the service and accommodations. I would highly recommend The Dean to every person staying in Dublin. The accommodations were great but most importantly the staff was AMAZING - it's like having you're own personal concierge!!!! When I return to Dublin I will only stay at The Dean. Love Love The Dean! Ally and Tom were awesome.
title: Amazing Experience

review: Just the best in hotel hospitality I've experienced from the moment we arrived the staff were amazing and soo thoughtful!! Finding out what we needed to do and helping us to achieve it.Reception staff and especially "Apple" in the rooftop breakfast , soo happy and full of enthusiasm. Management take note you are very lucky to have a great team ! Only one little niggle which seems to be a popular negative is the nightclubs close by , and the music into the small hours , if you can't bear the noise .......join them Or ask really politely to move , they will help if they can. Or bigger ear defenders!! So a massive thank you for making our 18th birthday celebration a truly memorable one and hope to see you guys and girls next time Best always Liam McG
title: 18th birthday treat

review: I was excited on arrival by the look and feel of this hotel, but by the time I left the following day I was utterly disgusted by their utter disregard for their guests' comfort and satisfaction. I thin the following response to my agent's complaint letter will tell you all you need to know about why you should choose ANY other hotel in Dublin. So disappointed - Goodness only knows just how appalling it might of been, had I been a leisure traveller!Management Response:I'm sorry your client had a noise affected stay with us. Thanks for taking the time to flag this with us. We do have big issues with noise on Harcourt Street. We have some rooms that are quiet-er but nothing we'd consider silent by a long stretch. Harcourt street is the singlemost busiest area in Dublin/Ireland for nightlife in general, we're completely surrounded by night clubs/late venues. Although there is little we can do to control this, we try to assign the quiet-est rooms to corporate guests, longer stays, pre-requests etc. to minimize the impact on our guests. I'm sorry if this wasn't communicated on arrival, I will follow up internally to prevent the next guest from being in the same position.  As recently as this week we have undertaken additional construction work/acoustic insulation at our expense to isolate us from our neighbours. We're working hard behind the scenes as a management to lessen the impact of noise on our guests comfort.  In relation to the lights, coffee machine and basin - we greatly appreciate feedback and I have personally followed up with our housekeeping and maintenance teams to ensure it does not happen for another guest.  As a gesture, let me look after your client for the following should you ever be in a position to return:
title: DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT TO HAVE ANY REST AT ALL

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: We stayed on the return leg of our Italian holiday - they treat their diamond members very well, we were upgraded to a lovely corner room. Combined with complimentary breakfast the stay was great value. Given the size of long stay parking in Dublin, and the frequency of the buses to the car park, you can get to the hotel quicker than your car most times. Pity the shuttle doesn't run for an extra hour as many European flights arrive around midnight - the taxi is only €15 though.
title: Very comfortable hotel, away from the husle and bustle of the airport

review: Stayed here for one night, location is great, very chilled atmosphere, the rooms are great so innovative from a record player to the mini bar and munchie tray and the decor. There is a bit of noise outside from the night clubs but typically at the weekend didn't really bother me I slept like a baby on the comfortable beds. I will definitely come back to raid the munchie tray and the mini bar and chill out and watch some Netflix.
title: Amazing hotel

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: First time I was not happy with your facility, have stayed there numerous times. The restaurant / bar upgrade was a step in the right direction but the drop off in service and attention to detail on food orders was definitely a step in the wrong direction, hope fully this can be fixed before it causes you to loose loyal customers.
title: First time unhappy with overall experience at your facility

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: The hotel was excellent and surprisingly quiet with a big wedding going on. Room was as expected. We did have to wait for the shuttle for 20-30 minutes upon arrival but it was a busy time, especially with a large group arriving along with us. Shuttle ride was about 10-15 minutes.Drawbacks-Left on 6:30am shuttle so missed breakfast. Was told there would be a breakfast takeaway for us but I didn't see one nor was offered at checkout.-Was given a voucher for 2 free drinks at bar due to slight mixup with shuttles etc but the drinks appeared on our bill at checkout. But were quickly removed.-Had hotel call for cab and they asked cash or credit. I said credit but when cab showed up they had us as cash. Not sure whose mistake but left us scrambling a bit to find atm in the city for the return trip.Other Info 20 euro cab ride to airport. 20 euro cab ride to Dublin city. I'd say this hotel is halfway between airport and city so I'd have to say if we had a later flight I probably would've preferred staying in the city and taking the bus back and forth to airport. Not a slight to hotel, just whether or not you want to walk home or cab home after a late night out.
title: Not "AT" the Airport but close enough

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: A really disappointing Hilton. Firstly, the 10.20pm hotel shuttle didn't show up to the airport as per the schedule - annoying in the height of summer but if the weather was bad or if it was the depths of winter, I would be going nuts.There was a chipped cup in the bedroom and there were marks on the splashback if the bathroom sink - obviously not been cleaned properly after the last occupant.We went out on Saturday and when we got back late on Saturday evening, our room hadn't been serviced which was really annoying - especially as we're supposed to be valued members of the Hilton loyalty programme. We had a late checkout booked as my partner is undergoing medical treatment and I knew he wouldn't be bright eyed and bushy tailed the next day yet despite having the Do Not Disturb card on the door, we still had housekeeping knocking on the door 2 hours before we were due to check out.The buffet breakfast was terrible, lukewarm everything and dried out to within an inch of its life.There's work to be done here
title: What would Conrad say?

review: Stayed at this hotel numerous times. Always reminds me of the library from the board game "Clue". :) Rooms could be a little more spacious and updated, but overall it's a great experience. Staff are super super friendly and go out of their way to make you comfortable.
title: Great location, Friendly Staff

review: I stayed in the Dergvale with two other friends. We had a lovely bright three single bed room. In my opinion the breakfast was delicious and enough. You get orange juice, tea (which gets topped up if you wish), a choice of differently done eggs with sausage and bacon, cereal, lovely sour dough with jams. The people who run it are really lovely and nothing was too much trouble for them. It is only about a fifteen minute walk to the Temple Bar area. I would definitely recommend the Dergvale and would stay there again.
title: Lovely hotel

review: Stayed here four nights. Very clean, efficient and reasonably priced. Jerry and Nancy were friendly and most helpful whenever I needed assistance. Will definitely stay here again when I am in Dublin. Great value for the price.
title: Comfortable smaller hotel near Mountjoy Square in Dublin

review: We stayed here on a stag in May. It's in a pretty good location and good value. The staff are also very pleasant and reasonable breakfast included.A couple of things weren't so good - I'd booked triple rooms and I thought these would be three beds but it's actual a double and a single so bed sharing was needed - this might have been my fault in not reading carefully enough the documentation so won't mark down for that but just to be aware.Second thing was that our shower ran either extremely hot or extremely cold for all three nights of our stay - I did point this out after our first night and the owner was very concerned but unfortunately nothing changed while we were there - maybe because it was the weekend. Did make showers extremely unpleasant though!So for a no thrills visit, I'd say it's fine, maybe better in a couple than a group of three blokes though!
title: Decent hotel for no thrills trip

review: I totally agree with all the comments made by my friend Sally. We were three ladies who came to Dublin to celebrate another friend's special birthday. The Dergvale Hotel made our visit to Dublin even more special. Breakfast every morning was plentiful and my friend described the scrambled eggs as looking like soft yellow pillows. Would definitely recommend The Dergvale Hotel and would love to return.
title: Ladies in Dublin

review: My partner and I have recently stayed at his hotel for two nights. The hotel room was clean and tidy but wasn't overly large, however, there was more than enough room for the two of us. The bathroom was sparkling and had plenty of towels. The staff were great, very helpful with any questions we had, including, allowing us to leave our bags at the desk, after we checked out, saving us from having to carry them around until we got our bus. My only fault with the hotel was how thin the walls were, we could clearly hear the people in the room next to us talking, walking and opening their wardrobes. Other than that one issue, I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.
title: Lovely hotel, relatively central, helpful staff

review: Had a tour around Trinity College Campus by one of the students who had only done one tour but she was excellent, very enthusiastic and knowledgeable. Was very interesting to look around and the personable experiences bought I to life of living on campus and the history behind the different buildings. However the queue for Bok of kells was quite long and was rather disappointing in the end.
title: Very enjoyable tour

review: Clean, secure and central in Dublin. Expensive for what it was - a tiny room with single bed and shared bathroom worked out at £50 on HostelWorld for a midweek night. Should be cheaper as comparable prices around Dublin can get you lots more for an extra £10 or £20.
title: Goldsmith Hall Accommodation

review: I booked this for a city break with my daughter and was attracted by the central location. Accommodation in Dublin is relatively expensive, particularly the city centre hotels. I booked online and chose a twin ensuite room but what we actually got was a whole apartment with 2 single rooms, a bathroom, a lounge and a kitchen. We were only there for one night but if we'd been staying longer we would have made more use of the lounge and kitchen. It was clean, secure, had free Wi-Fi and was located in a nice quiet corner of the campus - ideal for our needs. There was also luggage storage available before check-in and after check-out, which was handy.
title: Great location at a reasonable price

review: Central, but quiet location, clean room and bathroom, very helpful staff. I had a private room which was not too small for a single person. Kitchen facilities were ok. Would stay there again next time!
title: Helpful staff!

review: The location is fantastic. We stayed in a two room apartment at Botany Bay. It is basic but fine. There were no cooking pots although there was a cooker. But Maureen, the cleaning lady, was extremely nice and helpful, and she found us some pots. Main issue is the price. We paid 800 euros for six nights plus 60 for a camp bed for three of nights. This was the best part of 1000 euros for STUDENT rooms for less than a week.Also the door cards stopped working several times and we had to go back to the accommodation office repeatedly to have them reactivated.The restaurant in the campus closes at 15.30 which is very early.On Friday night the students upstairs were extremely extremely rowdy and disruptive and were shouting and jumping around like a herd of animals
title: Central, quite ok accommodation, but very expensive. Maureen the cleaning lady great. Extremely noisy students upstairs.

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The room was small with small windows, so there was little ventilation. Every major attraction is within walking distance. Room was clean and the staff was nice. Elevator worked while we were here, but the signs discouraged its use, so we took the stairs unless we had our luggage with us.I would stay here again when visiting Dublin.
title: Good Place to Stay

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We have stayed just one night and enjoyed our stay. Very central location to temple bar, Liffey river. Nostalgic design rooms. Comfy bed. Good value for money. We will recommend the hotel to our friends.
title: Very central

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This hotel has great location. Just a 5-min walk from the famous Temple bar. Rooms are cozy, equipped with vintage furniture. It's also clean, and there is complementary tea and coffee. We suggest this hotel for a short stay in Dublin.
title: Cozy hotel

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Clean room although a bit dated. Lift dodgy as advised by sign(advised to take stairs).Very central location with a great pub below. Bar staff very friendly and hospitable. Good selection of pub grub. Will definitely be visiting the pub a few times during our stay.
title: Short stay

review: The House offers first class accomodation in a very convenient location. Excellent breakfast. Coffee facilities in the room would be a bonus, but is available in the lounge 24 hours. Staff really helpful and obliging.. secure parking off road.
title: Highly recommended and centrally located.

review: It was a lovely townhouse, close to the city centre. The room was quite spacious with antique looking furniture. It was walking distance to tourist attractions (15-20 minutes). The breakfast was quite good. I would recommend it for business trips.
title: Charming townhouse

review: From the moment we arrived at the Pembroke Townhouse Hotel we were made to feel as welcome as if we were staying with friends. Lovely touches like homemade elderflower cordial at reception and a kitchenette opposite reception where you can make tea and coffee and help yourself to gorgeous home baked cookies before flopping into the comfy sofa and armchairs in the lounge area. The staff are all extremely helpful and seem happy to go beyond the call of duty to ensure their guests' comfort. We had asked for 2 rooms next to each other and got 2 rooms in their own little corridor which was lovely. The rooms are not high spec, but clean, quiet and the double beds are huge and very comfortable. Good TV too. Breakfasts are really worth including in your booking. Really the best hotel breakfasts I've had in a long time. Home baking with heavenly soda bread, scones and cakes, even homemade baked beans! The waiting staff were lovely and made each morning a treat. The location is perfect, as it's a 20 minute walk away from the very busy centre, so convenient, but a lovely place to begin and end a busy day of sightseeing in Dublin. And in the evening, if you want to stay close to home, a few v good restaurants within a 10 minute walk. We will be back to Dublin and definitely back to the Pembroke Townhouse Hotel.
title: Home from Home

review: We stayed two nights at the Pembroke in July. It was an easy 30-minute drive from the airport and had convenient, free parking behind the property. We walked all over Dublin, and reaching the center from the Pembroke took only about 15 minutes. The room was quiet and immaculate, with a super comfy bed and speedy, free wifi. The best parts of the hotel, however, were the service and the food. The breakfast every morning was delicious -- freshly-made, warm scones, soda bread, and other pastries and breads. And every afternoon there was a homemade cake (the Guinness chocolate cake with Baileys frosting was amazing) at reception and a cheeseboard in the sitting area across from reception. Finally, the staff were lovely and helpful. Highly recommend and would stay here again.
title: Perfect stay in Dublin

review: If you are coming to Dublin and if you rather escape the touristic area, select the Pembroke Townhouse. This family hotel is located in an up scale area of Dublin with embassies near by. The area is quiet and refreshing. Easy to go to the city center of Dublin with buses passing by 5 minutes walk (get the Dublin pass).
