We flew into Dublin, spent one night at the hotel, then left the next morning for a tour of the Emerald Isle. Upon our return to Dublin we spent three more nights at the hotel. The hotel was clean, close to the sites we wanted to see, the staff was helpful, breakfast was good, Oscars food was decent "bar food", there was a good selection of beers & was reasonably priced. We would rate them a 3.5
title: Stays in Dublin

review: Worst hotel I have stayed in. There's no AC, holes in the door, holes in bathtub, dirty carpeting and a nightclub in the basement that goes till 4 am. Someone should buy this hotel and make it fabulous. It probably has really good "bones" and could be redone as a boutique hotel. The staff on the other hand was VERY KIND when we told them we had to leave due to the noise and the lack of air. Wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
title: AWFUL HOTEL but nice staff!!

review: I was aware when i booked this hotel a club was attached. There was no soundproofing for the rooms. I stayed for 3 nights in 2 goes. The last room vibrated with the music. I found both rooms needed work. The rooms where clean and tidy. But i wont be staying here again.
title: Hotel club

review: This hotel looks like a converted grand house in a posh part of town. There are many period features with some very 70's like in decor. At first it looked inviting but then not very coordinated The room was very dated. It had a period fireplace but a shabby wardrobe. The lovely white sheets covered a poorly spring mattress. Not very comfortable for sleeping. The period like bathroom features looked lost next to plastic door showers with shower heads that did not function well and shaving sockets that felt loose and did not workIt is probably unusual to complain of barmy summer heat in Dublin but you have to when the room is stuffy and lacks any air conditioning. There was no extractor fan in the bathroom The open window was the only cool air... To my surprise ear plugs were available x3 in the bathroom. Their use only become apparent in the evening as the night club / bar noise reached 65 decibels (as recorded on my mobile app). This persisted until 0245 hours and was punctuated with sirens followed by shouts and incoherent ramblings of drunk party goers This also explained a bouncer on the hotel door when I arrived. He asked if I was staying in the hotel - does the hotel entrance also lead to the 'best bar ' in Dublin according to the bouncer ?I booked through a third party. I asked the desk about the noise element in the morning (there was no answer at 0215)and they did tell me that the noise element is clearly stated on their website. Guests are warned according to the man on the desk. Had I known I almost certainly would not have stayed here. This was not an ideal one night business stop as I lost a lot of sleepThere is something period and quaint about the place on first glance but looking further, it is shabby. For me it failed as did not function as a hotel for an executive overnight stay and the wifi connection was dreadful.
title: Mmmm

review: Stayed one night, at a hugely overpriced rate, got back to hotel at about 12 midnight. Got to sleep at about 5:30am. Made complaint at about 3am to night manager (Mark, who was very nice it must be said) about the noise, as was told by the receptionist that it would continue until probably 4:30. I was aware of the nightclub when I made the booking, and was prepared to be awake till around 3, but 5:30 is ridiculous. Nowhere on the website does it specify when nightclubs close or when the noise is likely to settle down.Our room faced onto the street, and the windows are not double glazed. The noise from the street, coupled with the noise from the nightclub, was deafening. On checkout I refused to pay the full fee, and without even coming to meet me and apologise, the manager on duty told the receptionist to give me a discount. Now, while I appreciated the gesture, the reduction only brought the charge down to the 'normal' nightly rate, which in my opinion is still overpriced. This is a perfect hotel for those who plan to be out all night, and only get a little bit of sleep. Not for anyone who is going to bed 'early'.
title: Do not stay here if you want to sleep!

review: Lovely olde worlde hotel,spotlessly clean,very nice rooms the decor is amazing,couldn't believe how many people were at the nightclub under the hotel on a Tuesday evening! Could of been the€2 a pint offers! Security on door on an evening to stop people from club wandering into hotel! Great cooked breakfast next morning,good choice of continental as well,only fault I could pick,beware the windows open very very wide! Be careful if you have children
title: Mid week break

review: The hotelbuilding is old and charming. Big room, good service and nice breakfast. The hotel is close to the city center. Unfortunatly the nightclub on the first floor is rather noisy. Therefor the hotel is best suitable for young people and others who like to party.
title: Elegant hotel with noisy nightclub

review: This was the biggest mistake I have made on my trip to Ireland. Please learn from my mistake. This place must make money on the bar only, it did not look like they put any money into the hotel itself. The sour milk/beer smell in the room was horrible. The twin beds leaned to one side, had to use a pillow to stop from rolling off the bed, cramped,small. The bathroom was so small you had to turn sideways to get into the 4x4 shower that did not have hot water. The music and young kids started lining up at 6pm for a night of fun... don't worry but 4AM they were leaving , but then again the staff would start putting the empty kegs on the street at 6AM sooo enjoy the 2 hours of sleep. Food was not hot...or tasty. The dining room was a makeshift coat check at night made sure it still had a wonderful "aroma" in the morning for breakfast.... Please note...pay the extra few dollars and find a better place.The only plus side....it's walking distance to down town.
title: Never Again !!!

review: Clean and tidy room with helpful staff. Negatives were the Wi-Fi doesn't work anywhere except the foyer. There is a warning aboit the nightclub downstairs but would not recommend staying here on a Saturday night if you want to sleep.
title: Nice hotel

review: Spent three days at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. Breakfast was very good and as much as you wanted. Staff very friendly and couldn't do enough to help. Yes, it is noisy at night time due to the night club at the back, that's why we requested a room on the top floor. Also lots of security around at night time in case of any trouble. Would definitely return.
title: Nice hotel well situated

review: Hopfully someone contemplating this hotel reads this and saves themselves the hassel. I've never written a review for a hotel but here I am writing my first review on my way to a new hotel.Paid for two nights and checked out after a couple of hours due to the extremely loud music of their downstairs Bar/Club. Reception told me it would continue until 3:30am, and they offer ear plugs.If you're looking for a hotel room where you want to sleep before 3:30am this isn't it.
title: Worst hotel ive seen in a month long Europe trip

review: Shabby run down room, sheets stank of smoke. Shower door had to be held shut to prevent flooding the bathroom. Blaring music from nightclub kept me awake until 3am. Ear plugs in bathroom didn't help because my bed was literally vibrating from the music. This hotel may be good value and right in the heart of Dublin but it's not suitable for business travellers who value their sleep and appreciate small creature comforts when away from home.
title: Avoid Avoid Avoid.....

review: The location was good for what we needed on the nightFirst impression is good - but the let down is when we got to the room (106)Room key wasn't working, bathroom was run down and shabby as was the bedroom - definitely needs to be renovated.Sound proof windows great for outside noise - but noise in hotel due to Krystle's nightclub went on till about 5am - even though ear-plugs are provided - not much use.Breakfast well - the scrambled eggs were just terrible - hash brown over done as were the sausages.... Croissants were also overcooked - brown and dryOn handing back the breakfast to the waitress she even commented on the eggs and reported the returned breakfast to the Chef - who sent her back into the kitchen with the plate -- last we heard or seen of the food - no apologise or asked if we would like anything else -- the breakfast chef serving the hot food spent the majority of his time on his mobile phone
title: Central location, very noisy late into the early morning, Awful breakfast, Shabby room”

review: (+)1/it is considerably affordable 2/the room is very spacious3/location is good, nearby St. Stephen's Green4/wifi works (-)1/it is pretty loud (as described) which could continued until around 3-4am by some drunk people after party2/bathroom is old. they need to seriously do something about the stain
title: pros and cons

review: We stayed one night in June, after a tour of Ireland. I have to say that we had the BEST sleep at this hotel than any of the others we encountered. It is centrally located, easy to get to the Luas, train and walking over to shopping areas. Don't let the entrance/reception area fool you, it is a great little hotel! Very clean, friendly and helpful staff
title: Great location, Nice & Clean

review: Good hotel just on the outskirts of town next to the park bus station just across the road along with the tram would go back nice little hotel also you get a free Continental breakfast also free wifi and a good pizza shop just a cross the road with a few shops
title: U2 gig

review: Small room for 2 people, no toilet paper, shampoo or shower gel. Uncomfortable beds and noisy springs when you turn over. Very few tea coffee and milk in room. On the positive side it's very near to heuston station. When you close the windows the room is nice and quiet otherwise it's on a busy noisy road. Very reasonable rates and with a free breakfast of tea/coffee, cereal and toast.
title: Could be better

review: Stayed here for two nights, close to attractions and buses. Easy to find and bus from airport just stops around the corner. Staff are friendly and helpful. Very clean and tidy, beds are comfy also. Restaurant down stairs is pricey, and would be my only complaint.
title: Great Stay

review: The location is great - next to the train station and public transportation. The bus stop of 747 to the airport is right next to the train station. The breakfast is simple, but I have no complaints because of the good price. The room is clean and comfortable. They gave me a quiet room.
title: An excellent one night stay

hotelLocation: Fitzsimons Hotel 21-22 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Exactly what it says on the tin. The hotel isn't very pricey so don't expect 5 star luxury. However it is right in the centre of temple bar so ideal for that!The room was to a good standard and always kept clean daily. However many improvements could be made but cannot complain with the price we paid.Although it is above a very busy bar I didn't hear this once during our stay but we were on the 3rd floor! Ideal for those who aren't planning on spending much time in the hotel and want to be right in the heart of temple bar!
title: Pay for what you get

hotelLocation: Fitzsimons Hotel 21-22 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel last week and we liked it quite well. It was clean the staff friendly and The breakfast was good and we didnt need to stop for a lunch break as breakfast was filling. The view was great too we were on the third floor and we saw and heard lots of seagulls and life going by on the millenium and ha penny bridges which were directly opposite the hotel. The location was great you could go nearly everywhere on foot as it is very near to nearly all the attractions. One negative review for people who tend to have dufficulty sleeping is that there is a pub under the hotel so there is a lot of noise till about 3 in the morning.... However when one books one is told when booking that there will be noise in the evening till the early hours of the morning so one knows what to expect. In our case we both slept well as after a long day of sightseeing , shopping and ending the day with a beer or two we were usually tired out. All in all we enjoyed our stay in this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to be within easy reach of main attractions.
title: Good location ..... Not good for light sleepers :)

hotelLocation: Fitzsimons Hotel 21-22 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Good location in Temple Bar, walking distance to the attractions. Staff was very nice and helpful.The room was spacious, but very dated. It was very loud at night despite being on the second floor with windows closed-can hear everything happening below.
title: Good location, dated hotel

review: Maple hotel was an uninspiring experience. Ok, the location is good, but that is the only positive response I can give. We had a "double" the size of a cubicle. One had to sit in the bed while the other moved.. We were on the first floor, facing the heavily trafficked street. Thank god we had earplugs.
title: A noisy wardrobe in Dublin

review: Needed a hotel/inn for coldplay concert and saw leeson inn on booking.com for just under €200 for 1 night the fotos looked good and felt that for the price it must be good. The reality was a dirty hole damp walls black spot all over curtains dirty brown carpet with car mats strategically covering stains badly broken glass in front window that permanently rattled noise from street all night the beds ....I've never seen a bed arrangement like it....... I could go on but couldn't give the place any more airtime ... I would say that if you had a big smelly dog and needed to stay in an inn this would be the one as it has the ambiance of a dog kennel
title: Dirty filthy noisy chancers

hotelLocation: Merrion Road, Dublin D04 A3K1, Ireland
review: The hotel is in need in refurb (the bathrooms especially) but the staff at the hotel are very good people, Dec from behind the bar is a great asset to the hotel, very friendly and welcoming, and always going above and beyond.There was a good selection of food at breakfast, and a bar menu at dinner served a good selection of food. I would visit the hotel again as the price is a good, the rooms are OK and the staff are great.
title: Good hotel for the price

hotelLocation: Merrion Road, Dublin D04 A3K1, Ireland
review: We had a great stay at this hotel the staff where very friendly. The breakfast where great, couldn't ask for more, staff where very helpfulThe rooms where clean and a beautiful view. We where more then happy, and would visit again.
title: Great hotel and very friend staff

hotelLocation: Merrion Road, Dublin D04 A3K1, Ireland
review: Myself and my sister stayed here as we were in Dublin for a concert. The decor really needs a bit of tlc, but the food and the staff are commendable. I would have rated it 5 out of 5 apart from the decor
title: Kings of Leon concert

hotelLocation: Merrion Road, Dublin D04 A3K1, Ireland
review: We wanted a cheap hotel that offered free parking that was between town and Marlay Park, so this hotel was perfect. As other reviews have stated, decor could do with updating, especially the bathroom in the room, but for the price paid and the fact that there was free parking which is rare, we couldn't complain. Bus to town right outside the door too.
title: Ideal for midway location and parking

hotelLocation: 83 St. Stephen's Green South, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: located within walking distance of restaurants & shops. Stephen's Green is not as well manicured as it was 20 years ago but centrally located to restaurants. Hotel is older with old world feel but there is an annex of back which makes you feel disconnected from main sections. If in Rooms 417-421 you are in the attic with no windows but skylights; no A/C and could not open skylights unless want birds flying in that sit on roof. Great breakfast but twin rooms are tight and not worth the money.
title: Good location beware of attic rooms and music venue next door

hotelLocation: 83 St. Stephen's Green South, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I stayed at Stauntons on the Green for a single overnight stop in Dublin, and the hotel was convenient for all of the things I needed/wanted to do before moving on. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and though the room was older, it was clean and tidy; breakfast was great. Only note is that there is no on-site parking, but there is a parking garage on the northwest side of the Green that will give you a discounted rate for an over-night stay with a stamp from the hotel on your parking ticket. The location is convenient to a number of restaurants and pubs just east of St. Stephen's Green, and apart from St. Stephen's Green itself, it's also possible to reach a number of sites of interest (such as St. Patrick's Cathedral) from the hotel on foot. Overall, good value for the room, service, and location right in downtown Dublin.
title: Good Location and Hospitality

hotelLocation: 83 St. Stephen's Green South, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Wonderful location to get to all the sites! Loved walking daily through St Stephen's Green. Family room was great with the two rooms and two bathrooms. Fantastic full breakfasts. Friendly, knowledgable and attentive staff especially Katie and Jake. Old world charm.
title: Loved the hotel

hotelLocation: 83 St. Stephen's Green South, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We stayed at Stauntons on a Saturday night before heading to the airport. The service was great. The porter met us at the taxi and brought all of our bags in. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel while we went out for the day (we were early). When we returned, our bags had been brought up to our room. (Hooray! We were on the second floor, and as folks have noted, there is no lift.)Our room was beautiful. We were in a triple with our young daughter. The bathroom was beautiful and we appreciated the deep tub and plush towels. At about 9 p.m. the music started. There was an outdoor concert in the park next door and it was LOUD (our room faced the back garden). The concert was Nathan Carter. And it was GREAT! Instead of being miffed, we were happy to have a front row seat to this wonderful concert!Breakfast was not included in our rate, but we went anyway because breakfast is tough to find early on a Sunday. Service was very good. Always tough to pay full price for a full breakfast for a five year old, but that was fine. Check out was easy and a taxi was called and promptly came to take us to the airport.My only beef (and this is for Irish hotels in general) - it was WARM. And without a top sheet (only a duvet), it was tough to get comfortable.
title: Wonderful service!

hotelLocation: 83 St. Stephen's Green South, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The building is Georgian and I liked the location,reception area and the sitting areas. The breakfast included fresh fruit salad and a variety of breads and croissants.The Full Irish breakfast was very well cooked and presented and the menu offered a choice including smoked salmon and scrambled eggs and also pancakes.Although my room small I was comfortable and everything was clean. I had booked a single but the room had a double bed which pleased me. I did see that there were spacious double rooms available.
title: A good location

hotelLocation: 83 St. Stephen's Green South, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I was very pleased with my stay at Stauntons on the Green. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to help with my luggage, directions, and restaurant ideas. Regrettably, I was only there for one night :(. The room was comfortable, clean, and well appointed. I could easily have stayed a week!
title: Great stay

hotelLocation: Merrion Road, Dublin D04 A3K1, Ireland
review: The hotel is easy to find. Food in the bar was lovely. the room itself was clean but would really benefit from a bit of tlc,i.e new windows. we were on the second floor so the A/C unit was loud (there were building works at the back of the hotel which were quite loud with the single glaze windows) and paint to cover bad patches on the walls. The highlight of our stay was definitely the staff!!! They couldn't have been more helpful in every way, from printing maps for us to the bar staff. Declan was a real tonic and seemed to be popular with all the guests.
title: Easy to get to when not used to driving in Dublin

hotelLocation: Merrion Road, Dublin D04 A3K1, Ireland
review: We stayed at the Tara Towers hotel last week.The hotel was conveniently located yo UCD,walking distance to where we had our conference.The staff was very helpful and courteous.Breakfast was sumptuous,loved it.The bus and dart stations were nearby.Excellent place to stay.Clean and comfy.
title: Great place to stay

hotelLocation: Merrion Road, Dublin D04 A3K1, Ireland
review: Rooms are big, beds are confortableContinental breakfast okClean of bathrooms and bedroom okThe bus-stop for going to the centre of Dublin is in front of the hotelall the bedrooms have view to the see.
title: Good hotel near the centre

hotelLocation: Merrion Road, Dublin D04 A3K1, Ireland
review: This hotel is a major dump. Some of the staff (not all -- there was one young man who was so helpful in finding us a taxi after telling us that Uber doesn't have enough cars there!) were so rude and disinterested, they should really find another job. The room had lights that were broken, some hanging out of the ceiling, one of the night tables had a handle pulled off so they simply drilling another hole to the right and put another in, the shower was built for people 4 ft. tall, and the floor of the bathtub was so slippery that my 25 year old niece fell and thought she broke her leg. It is a terrible hotel. Pay a little more and stay somewhere else.
title: You pay for what you don't get

hotelLocation: Merrion Road, Dublin D04 A3K1, Ireland
review: A hotel that can be reached by all means of transport. From the airport we used the airport shuttle express . In just 40 minutes you will be infront of the hotel. In about 35 minutes you can be in o'Connell street by the frequent buses they pass from just outside the hotel nos. 4 , 7, and 7A. Just beside the hotel there is a food store which is open 24 hours and a petrol station if you are to be using a hired car. Regarding the hotel , it is clean , with good breakfast. The only 2 problems were : (1) our room 501 had a really noisy , really headache bathroom extractor . If somebody uses the bathroom at night , he wakes up the rest. (2) We arrived saturday after 20.15, and when we went down again at about 21.10 and asked for the restaurant the receptionist told us that its' till 21.00. She should have told us when we arrived . We had to go outside looking for a restaurant by walk. But on the other hand when we needed to go out very early for our excursions , they made us a good packed lunch . Thank you for Heather and Hannah. They were very helpful.
title: " Close to all transportation "

hotelLocation: 83 St. Stephen's Green South, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Before Dublin prices rocketed, I used to stay in the Shelbourne (5*) but the room price now well out of reach so looked around and found Stauntons. It's like a mini Shelbourne, quaint but spotlessly clean, location just as good. No long walks or lifts necessary, and room is a minute from the front desk. Can't fault it. Completely recommend for business or pleasure trips.
title: Super location, spotlessly clean, great price

review: Booked this at the last minute based on price and location. Very happy with the decision, the hotel was clean and comfortable and all the staff were freindly and helpful. Nice touches in the room: coffee machine, biscuits, bottled water and mints. Would happily stay again!
title: Very Decent Hotel in Good Location

review: The location is perfect close enough to the busy downtown far enough to have quite. The hotel is clean the staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast not included unless you purchase it before hand. A five minute walk to the buses tour bus airport bus perfect.
title: Perfect location

review: This is a quirky little hotel on the north side of the River Liffey. Something to understand, especially if it's your first time in Dublin is that the south side of the river is considered a little more up market than the north side. That being said, the hotel was good for what you paid and not run down. Just be aware there is a stigma attached to the north side. We were on the 6th floor and the elevator only goes to the 5th so we had to go the last floor on a small creaky set of stairs. The room we were in had a double and single bed with an en suite bathroom and over looked a courtyard so it was relatively quiet. The staff was super friendly and check in went smoothly. In addition the staff was attentive as we were coming and going. There are a lot of restaurants, coffees shops and shopping within a few minute walk. Also, there is a major bus stop right outside the hotel for easy access to public transportation and is about a 5 minute walk to the airlink to the airport. The only negative is that the wifi would come and go in our room. Overall, I would stay here again and it's a perfect hotel for mid-budget travelers.
title: Good for the price

review: We stayed for 5 nights in July 2017. It's a sweet little hotel, in a great location. Everything is a short walking distance. The staff was attentive and sweet. There's coffee machine and a kettle for tea in the room. The complementary goody bag they left us for the U2 concert was a beautiful gesture. If you book breakfast on the night before, you get a discount.
title: sweet hotel in a great location

review: We booked a two bedroom apartment, absolutely brilliant. We were near O'Connell street right in the heart of the city. We will definitely book again.The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. The only problem was having to walk quite a way as the apart ent was not in the actual hotel.
title: Apartment

review: Hotel is perfectly located within minutes walking distance of all the major attractions. Very clean and specious room. Very helpful and friendly staff. Can highly recommend this hotel. Good value for money for hotel in the city centre.
title: Perfect Location

review: We stayed one night here in advance of a ferry trip and found it well located and happy to have our dog Poppy (which isn't always in all hotels which profess themselves to be dog friendly). Our room was clean and had a good sized bed. There was a bit of noise from their bar next door but this was to be expected on a Saturday night.We had to leave early so missed breakfast but the kitchen had arranged for a packed breakfast for us to take away.We ate in the restaurant and were allowed to take our dog with us.Staff were friendly and helpful.
title: Dog friendly stay

review: The first time I stayed at this hotel was on a Friday to Saturday. As soon as you walk in, this hotel feels very homely. The staff are welcoming and friendly. I had special religious requirements and the staff we able to accommodate these while being very respectful. My stay was so nice that I came back a second time the following week, where I stayed for a few more nights. The hotel is conveniently located close enough to downtown Dublin so you can walk there, while being far enough to avoid the hordes of tourists. The rooms are comfortable and clean. I had one issue with plumbing, and the response of the staff was excellent. They moved me into another room and provided compensation for the inconvenience. This is a professional outfit, and yet at the same time personable. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a convenient, friendly and comfortable stay in Dublin. A special mention to Brian Garvan at reception who helped out with recommendations for places to eat and visit. Also Ann Marie, Marcela and Laura deserve a mention for being so responsive to email enquiries regarding reservations prior to and during the stay.
title: A cozy and convenient place to stay

review: The staff were very nice from top to bottom. The pub was nice and the breakfast was good. The room was dirty, and in great need of maintenance. Don't look under the bed. The lamp shades were barely hanging on, the hot water faucet was loose, the shower was leaking and the safe was in operable and broke. Either they plan on selling the property soon or plan to rent out each room until it can't be rented again. The one I was in was very close to this point. But, on the positive side, the location was great, they can arrange parking for you about a block away underground and the staff is very nice. Bring earplugs and an open mind, don't pay too much, and the place will be fine.
title: Really nice staff, hotel room was a dump

review: The Maldron Hotel Pearse Street is a clean comfortable mid-range hotel. The hotel is walking distance from City Center and about 5 minutes from the Dublin Bus Airlink 757 Pearse Street Station stop - making this hotel ideal for a short stay on a long layover. Front desk staff is excellent and at times, provided rooms are available, will allow early check-in.Highly recommended!
title: Nice Hotel - Easy Transportation to Airport

review: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. After given a room, we were told that not every room has AC. How is that even possible? The rooms were updated and a good size. My real issue was the staff on all both shifts. They were very arrogant and really didn't want to be bothered with any guest interactions. The location is average but it was getting closer to the bad parts of town. The beds were the worst of our two week trip by far!!!
title: Arrogant staff, borderline location and AC in select rooms

review: We had a very nice check in and check out. Friendly staff, rooms were clean beds comfortable. Close to attractions and train/ bus terminal. Breakfast was good different cereals,eggs, bacon, toast, tea, coffee. I would recommend this place.
title: One night stay

review: Solid Hotel in perfect location at edge of Temple Bar with clean safe and spacious rooms and good value for money. Walk out the front door and you are right in the best tourist walking area in Dublin.
title: Great Location

review: Good location for Temple Bar and central Dublin attractions/bars/restaurants and cafés. Rooms somewhat 'tired', and would benefit from new linen but functional enough. There's a reasonable bar with friendly staff serving a nice pint of Guinness attached to the hotel, with music in the evenings.
title: Good location for city attractions

review: Stopped in for lunch after walking around the Temple Bar area meal was large & good service was excellent and the staff could not do enough will go back again. The bar area was nice plenty of beers on tap and a relaxing place.
title: Lunch meal

review: I stayed here for 6 nights recently and found it to be very good for my purposes. The location is very close to everything I wanted to see in the central area of Dublin, and it’s very close to the Temple Bar area. I wasn’t particularly interested in seeing that aspect of Dublin, though it was certainly worth walking through. It’s only a couple of blocks from the Liffey River, which is also enjoyable to stroll next to. The hotel is situated on a very busy street with lots of vehicle and pedestrian traffic. This is probably one of the reasons there are very heavy drapes that can be pulled to cover the windows at night. I was one floor above ground level, so there was a noticeable amount of noise. It is not particularly quiet in the early part of the evening, when there is a band playing in the bar downstairs and lots of street traffic. This seemed to end by 11:00PM each evening, so one could get some sleep after that.The condition of the hotel is acceptable, though there is very obvious wear and tear. As a solo traveler this wasn’t really a problem, though, if she had been with me, my girlfriend might not have felt quite as comfortable. The room was quite large, as was the bathroom, which was an aspect I appreciated after having stayed in very small rooms in Amsterdam, London, Paris and Rome. There was a tub/shower with one of those retractable laundry lines in the bathroom. There is a restaurant downstairs, where the bar is, which serves food throughout the day. I tried the breakfast buffet one morning for 9 euro but did not eat there again. The price did not seem fair to me given what was available, so I used nearby restaurants and stores after that. There are many choices nearby. I used the Spar store several times, which was 2 blocks from the hotel. There is also a pot for boiling water in the room, so I could have tea each morning. I bought a box of 50 teabags for 4 euro at Spar. The desk clerks were always present and reasonably congenial. They offered to keep my bags after check-out on the day I left, which was very helpful.Overall I found this to be a good hotel for my purposes on this trip. It is not fancy, but the price was reasonable, and the location worked very well.
title: Not Fancy, though Perfectly Acceptable

review: The loaction of this hotel is perfect. Really close to everything. Tge rooms however are pretty basic if not slightly below average. It's not fancy, no fridge, no toiletries, no AC, but they do have a coffee tray :).. Also my room view was facing a wall but I'm sure there are better ones if you ask. Wi-Fi worked perfectly in the room.The staff were amazing, very friendly, helpful and nice. Also their bar "Legend's bar" is perfect. Great service and staff.
title: Great Location and staff, basic rooms

review: The Parliament hotel is the location you want. Walking distance to Grafton st, Temple Bar area, the river Liffey etc..There is a bar on the main floor with friendly staff where you can also get your free breakfast (if pre-paid) in the morning, Staff informed us the hotel will be going through major renovation as it was recently purchased and the last bookings were set for July 31, 2017 which is a good thing as the floors and rooms are dated.Wifi works fine in all locations I went to, elevator is slow so you will likely end up taking the stairs as you will beat it every time.Parking is 24 Euro/day though you will get a discount ticket that gives you almost 50% off when you go to get your car (two blocks away) be ready to test your driving skills at the parking lot as the the spots are incredibly tight and you will see people trying several times to make it in.I would stay again as I mentioned earlier the location was ideal
title: Great location even though parking is blocks away

review: We stopped for a drink during the day whilst walking around and went back in the evening just to watch the Irish dancing and listen to the music. Friendly place, large area so plenty of seating and was an enjoyable evening. Better than being on Temple Bar area which is much busier and more rowdy.
title: Good place for a drink in the evening with Irish dancing and music

review: Not brilliant.....Grubby rooms, thread bare carpets on main stairs, smells of damp in the stairwellWardrobes knocked up by inept Carpenters, bathroom had mildew on bath surrounds, and the sink was sunk into what seemed to be an excuse of some old piece of kitchen work surface! Radiators were grubby & rusty.... Plaster falling out of RSJ's/ wall supports! Good attempt to hide that behind the curtains folks!!Advice for prospective guests, avoid room 221. Advice for owners, SORT IT OUT and put a bit of your profits back into your business All this for £390 for two nights room only! Welcome to the rip off Parliament Hotel
title: Rip Off!

review: We normally stay a little way out of the city centre when we visit Dublin but as U2 were in town we had struggled to find accommodation and the Parliament Hotel turned out to be the most affordable option we could find - hotel prices had inflated everywhere in town by at least 50% - however, we weren't disappointed. The location of the hotel is excellent -Right on the edge of Temple Bar (which we normally avoid like the plague) so really accessible without being ridiculously busy and loud. I slept really well on the third floor with the window open - even with the fan in the room it would have been too warm and stuffy without. There was very little noise, though yes, the walls are thin and floorboards creak. Couldn't hear the music from the bar at all. The doors slam a little too easily, I suppose, but that's down to other guests not treating people with the level of respect that we afforded them when coming and going from the room. The staff are approachable and personable and the bar/restaurant downstairs has a pleasant atmosphere, free entertainment in the evenings and isn't badly priced. We ate there the first evening and the food was excellent. The hotel has already stated on here that they are having a refurb in the coming months, so I won't comment on the decor other than to say it's just a bit tired. The bed however I will not have a bad word said against - yes, it's two singles put together to make one but that is common throughout Europe now. Unlike many places though it was one queen size duvet instead of two singles - far better! I slept wonderfully on a firmer bed to the point that I think it's time I looked at changing my own for something similar. I have scoliosis and struggle to find a comfortable position to sleep in but this bed supported me however I lay. One thing to note is that housekeeping is carried out earlier in the day than I have experienced elsewhere - 9am on a Sunday morning! However, the do not disturb sign was honoured with a note pushed under the door saying to contact reception for fresh towels, tea making facilities etc. On the subject of tea - my only piece of (constructive) criticism is that three teabags for a double room is liable to lead to divorce! We picked up a box of Barry's tea from Spar for €2.30 but that of course left us short of milk and sugar - however I'm sure if we'd been desperate we could just have asked for more!Teabags and Temple Bar aside, we would not hesitate to book with the Parliament Hotel in future and definitely recommend it to anyone wanting a conveniently located base for all Dublin has to offer.
title: Great location

review: There must be 5 or 6 Maldron Hotels in Dublin, this just south of the river, towards the port. Pearce Street is one of the main streets heading towards the centre, nothing at all special about it, but it's a direct 10 minutes walk to O'Connel Bridge, Temple Bar or Grafton Street.The hotel is modern, well equipped, nice rooms, great buffet breakfast, and if you're lucky you may be able to get parked in the basement.Rooms along the front tend to be fairly noisy especially early morning.
title: Comfortable, good, reasonable cost

review: This hotel was clean and the rooms large. However, it really isn't near anything so you'll either have to walk quite a ways or take a taxi. The hotel doesn't have A/C and traveling in July, it was quite warm. Since our room looked out into a courtyard, we couldn't get any airflow---the windows only opened about 2" at the most. We opened our room door, but they had painted the hall and fumes were overwhelming. Everything great, other than lack of A/C or a fan.
title: Just OK.

review: Firstly I'd advise anyone booking the hotel to do it through booking.com as my partner and i had know where booked we just were going to see what was available so I searched the different sites when we arrived at the hotel I asked for two nights stay and reception told me no problem that would be £358 plus another £30 for parking I explained about how it was cheaper on booking.com so receptionist told me to go book it online I got the to nights bed n breakfast and parking for £255.The hotel was very comfortable shower was fantastic I want 1 like that haha.. breakfast was brill set you up for the ......everything was in walking distance we will definitely stay again.
title: Some time out

review: Walk of about ten minutes to red bus, good hotel, clean and updated. Wonderful staff was very accommodating and efficientGood location in town for those who like to stroll. Restaurant is very nice with fresh veggies, good food and fast staff.
title: Quiet room, clean with nice restaurant

review: This hotel has only just scraped a 3. We weren't expecting high end or luxury, but I do expect at least a good level of service. Unfortunately, the service on the whole left a lot to be desired.Checking in was fine - no smiles or interest in me as a customer, but also not rude. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but the whole 2 double bed thing is still a mystery to me! Bathroom was clean and fresh, with a lovely rain shower and an abundance of products.The TV was rubbish (terrible sound quality, no entertainment and a poor signal). The thing that really let this hotel down is the fact there is no air con!! No air con!! Yes, you read that correctly. It was hot and their was no air con. Not even a fan to compensate. Yes, the windows could open wide, but they opened into a courtyard in the middle of the building, so there was no breeze.There were other guest staying there who decided to have a party in their room - both nights. The second night we had to call down to reception to ask them to do something about the noise as clearly either no-one else noticed or they just didn't care. We, on the other hand, did.The service at the bar was very slow and poor - the guy serving us both nights struggled to understand what we were ordering and took an age to pull 4 drinks together.Checking out, we were met with the same apathy as when checking in - in fact, it felt like we were an inconvenience to them. Sorry for paying to stay with you!!We won't be going back. That's not say it wasn't ok for the money we paid, but some things just leave a sour taste.....
title: Needs a lot of improvement

review: Just here for one night so location was key and is in the heart of things. Hotel and rooms really basic and was expecting a lot more. No air conditioning in rooms so on a Hot night needed window open and could not sleep as the noise from the road first thing in the morning from deliveries was horrific. Dont pay for breakfast it was really poor plenty of better choices minutes away outside
title: Loud and Basic

review: We were street facing and although the part revellers were expected, the constant noise of lorries unloading, beer barrels, street cleaners and the like kept us awake all night. The staff were very helpful there really is nothing they can do about the noise. The owners need to address the lack of air conditioning and windows. The rooms need modernising but If you are staying for just one night or two it's a great location. Breakfast was nothing special, I would have liked a traditional full Irish but it was more like an English chain hotel. Reception staff very helpful
title: Little too noisy but good customer service

review: This was a short family break, so location was key and this was ideally located. On the first day, before we checked in we were allowed to leave our bags whilst we explored the city at no charge. On the second day, once we had checked out, a charge was levied - it was a small charge but such things leave a sour taste with me.The bedroom was fine, beds comfortable and equipment in the room worked fine. The bathroom was tired. The dispenser for the shower was empty, but we did have complimentary soap, etc. The shower would not stay in position, just sliding to the bottom. The water-flow was a mystery - whatever combination used with the mixer taps, by itself, the water would heat up or turn cold.We only had one night, so this was bearable, but I would not like to stay in that room for any longer.Other than charging for bags on day 2, the staff were excellent; helpful and patient.
title: would really like to award a 3.5 rating

review: Blooms hotel's excellent location possibly is the main reason I rate the hotel as good coz it's within 3 minutes walk to airport bus stops, sightseeing tour bus stop, visitor centre, temple bar area. 5 minutes walk to ha'penny bridge and shopping street. Within 15 mins walk to Christ Church Cathedral & St Patrick Cathedral. Within 20 mins walk to Guinness & Jameson and other shopping area. Totally no hassle for the location. Staffs were friendly & helpful and fast every time we needed to call taxi. Welcome free Guinness at VAT pub was nice and we even ordered oyster, mussels & chicken wings which weren't expensive at all. Room is a bit old & dusty and could be a bit noisy from the street at night sometimes but consider hotels are generally expensive in Dublin, Blooms Hotel would be the one which doesn't smash your credit card and still offers excellent location, decent pub & restaurant with okay room.
title: Excellent location. Helpful staff. Traditional Irish pub & okay room

review: Very lucky with location, not too far from pubs and shops. Unfortunately the windows are single pane so the noise from below is quite audible (I suggest ear plugs if you need it quiet whilst you sleep!). Hey we're very helpful, provided us with a fan as it was fairly warm at night.We were even given drink vouchers each to have at the VAT bar, which is next door (Guinness, larger or baileys, two of us had a larger shandy for no extra cost).Breakfast is not included though, €10 for an Irish breakfast but there are coffee shops and a Tesco extra across the main road.
title: Clean but a little noisy

review: We stayed here for 2 nights. Very comfortable stay, we were concerned it maybe noisy but we were pleasantly surprised as our room was very quiet. Room and beds clean and comfortable, bathroom very clean. The bar attached provided some night time entertainment. Will definitely return!
title: Pleasant Stay

review: I stayed here with a friend for two nights in July --> I'll start with the positives;- great location in the Temple Bar area (which is really the best place to be staying if you're visiting Dublin to drink and eat)- close to all of the main restaurants and pubs - that's about it.We weren't impressed with the room for what we paid (about AUD$207 a night for a basic room with two single beds - you're paying for location not amenities). The hallway smelt like urine and beer, and two receptionists we dealt with both weren't the friendliest of people.We expected there would be some noise throughout the night because of where it is (above bars and pubs) and we were okay with that... but honestly those windows weren't doing a single thing to block the sound.. we might as well have been sleeping on the street for how loud it was at times. All in all I'd say if you just want good location and don't care about anything else then this is the place for you. One or two nights here was manageable but I wouldn't want to stay longer.
title: Good location, average everything else

review: Great hotel on the doorstep of all the vibrant pubs of Temple Bar. 2 min walk from the River Liffey. All local buses and tour buses within a few yards. Lovely breakfast in the 1st floor restaurant. Entertainment every night in the VAT Bar in the hotel. Look forward to coming back some day.
title: Ideal location

review: This hotel was the perfect location for us. Our room was for 2 people and had 3 single beds, much bigger than everyone else's in our party! The hotel was full so I guess they upgraded us!Room was nice and clean, bathroom big and clean. Super noisy until 3am because of the nightclub on site (worst club EVER). We were top floor and could still hear it!!We had a good stay and this hotel is perfectly placed.
title: Perfect location

review: I seldom post an unfavourable review preferring to deal directly with the restaurant or hotel reference complaints.Last Saturday we had occasion to overnight in Dublin .I checked my favourite websites and for last minute price and location .Blooms Hotel seemed to fit the bill, central and at £155.00 very cheap indeed for Dublin in July .On arrival our reservation, made and paid for a few hours earlier, was confirmed but we were asked for 50 euros cash "as a deposit for any room damage"!!Well travelled at 60plus years of age we were astonished at this request indicating that we were reluctant to stay at an establishment where the guests obviously trashed or ransacked the rooms.We were advised that it was unusual for the charge to be levied but it was the "managers idea "and the reception staff could not get the policy changed.We were however advised that had we used an alternative website to book there would have been no charge which mystified us further.We were given 4 vouchers for a free drink at the bar at 5.30 at check inWhen we looked at them later they expired at 6.00pm!The room was adequate but when I dropped an earring on the bathroom floor I gave up the search early on as the discovery of a less than clean floor left me feeling a little illThe final insult came at checkout when we were advised that there was a chargeof two euros per bag if we wishedtoleave our small overnight bag with them for a few hours. We felt sorry for all the American /European tourists with bags galore to be storesShame on you BloomsYou should treat guests with respect.
title: Bloomin awful!

review: Not impressed! Rude reception staff. Extremely rude manager. Myself & two friends stayed in Blooms as we attended a concert in Dublin. When we arrived back at hotel after our night out, it took the doorman about 15 minutes to answer the door! There wasn't anyone on the reception desk or answering the 'phone! We were three women, in a not-so-friendly part of town, who didn't appreciate being locked out! At that hour of the night, approximately 3am, it isn't safe anywhere! The breakfast was horrible and I had to ask 3 times for some ice for the OJ as it was just sitting out all morning. This hotel is a pure tourist trap and they should be ashamed to be changing people to stay there! NEVER AGAIN! I wrote a review on their Facebook page and they didn't reply- I noticed that they only replied to 'nice' comments- which there weren't many of!
title: Glooms

review: I was here in May '17. It's located right on the edge of Temple Bar and from my room I barely heard any noise at night. It's within walking distance of so many sights! I was in Dublin for three days and walked everywhere except for my visit to the Gaol at which time I took the bus. Speaking of buses...the one from the airport brings you within 125 steps of the hotel. I counted!!! If I get back to Dublin again...I will definitely stay here.
title: Awesome Location

review: While the rooms were clean, it was extremely noisy. The noise from the street till the wee hours was unbelievable. Great location but too noisy. Young people would probably enjoy this location as right in the middle of everything.
title: Templebar the heart of the city.

review: The hotel is very central to the nightlife got there early and our room was ready which was a bonus. The room was basic but clean unfortunately outside there was an air con unit which went off at regular intervals which did disturb our sleep it was better with the window shut but it was hot weather and we were melting no air con in the room. What also didn't help was the amount of construction going on in the area but that wasn't the hotels fault and it was very noisy. The bar attached was nice and the food looked nice although we didn't partake only breakfast which was a buffet and was plentiful and tasty. All in all the staff were polite and helpful and I would more than likely stay here again.
title: Visiting Dublin

review: I called Blooms this morning and spoke to Grainne in reservations who was very plesant and professional. My request was for a single room and Grainne bet all the "famous websites" on price this I was surprised at bit she did it. Great work Grainne
title: Great customer service

review: myself and my husband stayed here lastnight and it was honestly the worst hotel we've ever stayed in - and we have stayed in many hotels over the time. I never usually do reviews but feel the need to save someone else their money! It mentions there is a nightclub but they do not give away the extent of the noise disturbances caused. our room was literally vibrating it felt like we trying to sleep on the dancefloor. I complained to the guy on reception and he couldn't have cared less. I got the impression from the staff that they are just there to do the transaction, no attentiveness or presence about them at all. I'm all for casual hotels but when they lose sight of customer satisfaction then it just leaves you angry that you spent your money there instead of a nicer hotel that actually cares about your experience. for us it was a night away from our baby and crappy nights sleeps at home but instead we got an even crappier nights sleep! they should at least offer cheaper rates for the lower floor levels that are most affected... anyway to cut a long story short - go somewhere else!
title: appalling

review: Our room was very small but clean and comfortable and adequately catered to our needs. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful and we were made to feel welcome.The hotel is in a fantastic position for exploring Dublin and all it's attractions.
title: Lovely old Hotel in a central location

review: Blooms has a fantastic location. Rooms are pretty ordinary and not big. If you get it for a reasonable price it is worth staying here - no frills - but in the heart of temple bar and Dame Street. It is a high building and slightly off the main strip of temple bar - so street noise didn't impact us.
title: Great Location, Basic Hotel

review: Loved the VAT Pub traditional Irish music. After 11:00, from somewhere, pounding, driving music from nearby venue kept us awake all night long!! Front desk wasn't interested the next day when I reported it. It's more like a hostel. Taxi driver had had an ominous smirk when he dropped us off. Now I know why.
title: Soundtrack from Hell

review: bed for the night thats all we needed was quiet when were were there but can imagine in the heights of tourist time would be very noisy carpets need a good clean but bathroom and beds clean ideal central location
title: quick visit

review: Stayed at this hotel with a friend - it was right by Temple bar so it was positioned in such a great location! The staff on reception were very helpful, and we enjoyed the free entrance to Club M - worth a stay! It has its own pub within the hotel and we were given a drinks token on arrival to get a free drink!
title: Great Location

review: Stayed here twice now and both times have been great.The rooms are nice enough, clean, decent size and have everything you need.The vat house pub downstairs is a nice quiet-ish 'start of the night' type place to have 1 or 2 before you set off. However the true beauty of the hotel lies in the location. Right in the heart of templebar, making the night life only a short walk away in all directions.Upon returning to Dublin this is definitely the first place i would look to book.
title: Superb location

review: This is a great hotel. Expensive but we got a good deal on a website provider, the rooms were clean with pleasant staff. The hotel is massive and quite posh! My boyfriend and I got upgraded to the Executive Suite aswell which was amazing. ALSO.. get the breakfast for €15 which is absolutely amazing value as you get so much with it. Would come again.
title: Great

review: Stayed here for 3 nights while on a visit to Dublin. Hotel was spotless. Staff were warm and friendly. Room was lovely and bed was very comfy with crisp white bed linen. Great location with both dart and bus service on your doorstep. The only thing missing was a fridge in the room however it was available on request. Will definitely be back. Well done to all. A very comfortable stay
title: Great value and location

review: Stayed in the Ballsbridge this weekend for the Coldplay concert. Although the hotel was nice, it was hugely overpriced for the quality. The room is a little dated, and I have still not heard back about when I will get my deposit back, as my card has the money taken and a pending transation.The staff were nice, and the food was OK!
title: Weekend visit

review: Unless you're in town for a quick overnight, you should find another option. Rooms totally outdated, no air conditioning, bad wifi connection, no channel options on tv, no ventilation in bathrooms (worse coupled with hot week and no air), expensive breakfast that isn't much better than a free continental breakfast, no fridge in rooms. Front desk staff is friendly but did not get the same impression from the staff in the Dubliner restaurant (attached). Large amount of inviting seating space in the lobby- great because it's much cooler than the rooms when it's hot. Excellent concierge staff who help with the usual tourist stuff, info about airport trips, and getting taxis. Excessive bar noise/ smoke in the evenings if you're staying in rooms with windows open above the restaurant.
title: Outdated, not worth it

review: Reception area is a lovely space, staff were friendly and welcoming.Room overlooked a construction site, window could only be opened an inch and no air con, had to sleep with no blankets and curtains open to try and keep room cool, was awoken at 6am by workers on building site operating machinery. Checked out at 8.30am, could not stick heat and noise any longer. Breakfast was disappointing.
title: Heat & Noise

review: Clean hotel, pleasant staff. Only fault was not being aware of construction work nearby which woke us very early each morning when we were away. Also breakfast not included in our price which may even have been a nice guesture, considering we chose there as a rest period from work and not pre warned about the noise. Overall a lovely hotel.
title: Pleasant staff

review: Most of the staff we encountered during our tour were absolutely brilliant and this place was no exception. The staff were genuinely just plain nice, they were also very good at their jobs so when you get to the tired and frustrated stage after a busy and tiring day touring then this place was just plain worth it.It was good.They also had taps that were easy to use. They had a hot tap and a cold tap that mixed in the pipes and you didn't get scalded trying to use them.Anyway we had a very comfortable night.Recommended although I do have one bone to pick with the staff and that is the the staff took our baggage out the front door but refused to assist our drive with loading the bus. This was the only aspect that I really could fault and did make me a little angry considering the amount of money they get paid by our Tour Company.It didn't affect the rest of the service.
title: Glad we stayed

review: Stayed here for one night - last week - public areas clean and staff generally helpful but they all tell the same storey " hotel being knocked down for apartments" - this has defiantly impacted on staff morale. The room (647) was clean and spacious, and on arrival in daylight the curtains were pulled - come 6.45am you know why - building work starts outside the window. Sorry but that was the end of sleep!!When you look out the window you could have a conversation with the builders - they are that close!! - breakfast was poor. I mentioned the noise on checkout - all I got was sorry - the receptionist did validate my overnight parking FOC - such a pity as this hotel used to be one of the top locations in Dublin - obviously the owners have succumbed to property development rather than hospitality
title: Disappointing

review: Well, they do not have safes/lockers at room, also, no fridge, but the do have some insects.And of course - a bit overpriced I would say.I have been staying for more than a week - breakfast was the same without any changes.. like the food was good, the staff is nice, but the same thing for more than 10 days is annoying
title: Nothing special

review: My wife and i Arrived on 13th July with a child and 2 others. 1st off price was supposed to be £136 at reception we were charged £148 on asking why it costed more I was told it was because of the exchange rate. Doubt that this would have fluctuated by £12. Also 1st time I have ever had to pay to park in the hotel car park which cost €12. Honestly though the rooms were a bit grubby and dated. We We're told that we had been upgraded to an executive room as there was construction work going on next door. We were grateful of this. However if we stayed in an executive room I wouldn't want to see the standard room. Found the staff quite rude in the breakfast room.All in all not a grate experience will not be back.
title: Night away

review: Stayed for one night the hotel looks good from the outside and reception area but as soon as you go in halls leading to rooms its like you stepped back in time to the 1980's. Rooms very dated we booked an executive room only difference it seems was the bed was bigger. Building site to the rear of the hotel so its very noisy from 7am.
title: Very dated

review: i am here for 3 days. yesterday the wifi did not work at all. today it is intermittent .... either way it is not possible to work. at breakfast today i had scrambled egg on toast with beans. and the eggs and beans were cold which is a bit much given that breakfast costs $15. so with not wifi, no safe in the room, and cold breakfast ..... not great! stay elsewhere.
title: poor wifi, poor breakfast, overpriced

review: Convient location but overpriced at approximately 96 euro per person for one night, breakfast NOT included then an additional incredible 12 euro for guests to park in car park, clean and relatively comfortable but not any better than expected from any b/b, dated and shabby corridors , building site next door. Very little customer care involved, wouldn't return to be honest
title: Good location but seriously overpriced

review: We stayed 2 nights - on arrival no offer of any help with the bags and it only got worse! Staff decidedly unhappy in most areas - breakfast was busy but again staff inattentive - the hotel itself was tired and clearly ready for redevelopment which was happening on almost every side of the hotel - avoid if possible as there are much better hotels nearby.
title: Tired and Could do a lot Better

review: When we first walked in I thought "Wow nice looking place". Well that was as far as it went. First of all they gave us a room so far a way that it was like going through a rat's maze to find the room. My husband uses oxygen and that was a long way for him to walk. The heat that has been mentioned in other reviews is true because there is no air conditioning. Luckily we were able to obtain a fan. Unfortunately we were unable to open a window because we were on the first floor and windows didn't open. Our friends on upper floors had windows that opened. We had a door we could open on to courtyard but leaves a door open in the middle of the night. The bath tub was rather moldy around the caulking and out of date as was much else. Not surprising when hot and warm. One thing that was a definite all the furnishing though run down were very comfortable and lots of space to place things. A plus was a table with chair that you could sit at with a mirror and plugs so you could do makeup and hair. The breakfast was good.
title: Run down at the mouth

review: Ballsbridge hotel is in a wonderful location close to the city centre but far enough away from the hustle and bustle. I picked this hotel because of this. I arrived much too early for our check in but the staff were extremely accommodating and I was in my room less than 20 minutes later!A huge Thank you to Steven at reception who was the most amazing help to me. Making sure our stay would be as relaxing and luxurious as possible. Very friendly and personable, putting me in a great mood for the rest of the day and having very enjoyable light hearted conversation while he sorted out our room. Could not have asked for a better hotel and a better person to check us in. Absolutely superb customer service from Steven and comfortable spacious rooms.I have enjoyed my time here 100%.Cannot go wrong booking this hotel and I will definitely be coming back!!
title: Absolutely fabulous!

review: It is a nice hotel but it could do with a revamp, getting a little run down looking. Rooms are nice and big,shower not great, power was good but heat kept altering. No shower caps.Windows creaky to open. we were unfortunate that there was building going on right across from our room and it started really early in the morning. Breakfast was nice but could do with staff been more informative, a lot of people had to ask for coffee and tea to be told they had to help themselves from a particular area. The pot of coffee i got was cold. No member of staff enquired at any time if we were ok. The meal in the Dubliner was nice, good price and nice staff. Not sure if i would stay again but rumour has it that it may not be there for long.
title: Overnight stay

review: Nice hotel and well located for Aviva stadium. A short walk to the left when coming out of the hotel leads you to bars/restaurants and a few shops. If you go straight ahead you have a walk of about 20 minutes to St Stephen's Green/ Grafton street and you can enjoy the Georgian architecture.Plenty of shops and restaurants along the way. Our room for 3 people was well fitted out and had most things that are required but no mini bar to keep drinks cool. The 3rd bed was a proper bed. Beds were comfortable and the hotel was quiet overnight. Our room overlooked a construction site which became noisy at 8am. There is no air conditioning but a fan was provided. Fixtures and furnishings were generally good quality although our room had a stain on the carpet. Shampoo and shower gel are provided but not conditioner. We stayed room only at a price of 242 euro which was annoying when our friends stayed a few days earlier for a price of 100 euro. Wifi was good. We decided not to have breakfast at a cost of 12 euro each. We walked elsewhere and had breakfast for the 3 of us for a total of 15 euro. The bar was expensive. 15 euro for a pint and a vodka. It is a nice hotel but would only stay here again if attending the Aviva stadium and I think that when there is an event at the Aviva, the hotel puts their prices up.
title: Good but expensive

review: Located about 40 minutes walk from the Liffey you can also get the DART. Rooms are a decent size and the bed comfortable. WiFi worked well on the second floor. Plug sockets near the bed and centrally controlled lights would be good. Shower was hot but fixed and it was best to set the temperature before stepping into the bath. No hairdryer provided. Towels were a reasonable size. Breakfast was very good.
title: Reasonable hotel

review: Was the only place other than a hostel that we could get booked when attending a Robbie Williams concert in the Aviva stadium. And it was expensive. But soooo worth it. The hotel is within spitting distance of the stadium, you can walk to it in about 3 mins. Unfortunately when we arrived, most of the carpark was taken up by a radio tourbus and we had to park nearly half a mile away and walk back with our cases, in 30 degree heat. But we entered a large, luxury air conditioned lobby. The male receptionist dealt with us very efficiently and we were on our way to the room in minutes. Added security of having to use your room key to access the hallway to the elevators and rooms so no random people wandering about. The rooms were large and airy, very clean. The bathroom was big too. We didnt get time to try dinner or the bar as it was so busy. Breakfast the next morning was great. Wide selection and piping hot buffet. The best coffee ive had in a hotel in a long time. Staff were all lovely. So yes, its expensive but a great hotel. Id like to go back when its not jam packed with robbie fans.
title: Very nice hotel

review: met at the entrance of the car park by a lovely gentleman who told us we were lucky as a car had just left car park so we would get a space (Man Utd were playing at aviva that night hence Dublin was very busy) ! Good impression. On entering hotel we could see it was extremely busy-we got to the desk to check in -the guy wasn't at all friendly or welcoming ! Asked did we wish to pay then which we did -reached us room card told us our room number and that was it! As I stood staring at him with mouth open he must have known by my face, he then asked us did we know where to go -that would have been a NO!!!! He didn't even mention breakfast or anything else...I was so surprised I myself even forgot to ask re breakfast times etc ! Got to room-good spacious room however on entering we were greeted by a 'damp , mouldy' smell! Apart from that everything else was good ! Next morning we arrived down for breakfast (guessing the times) to be told breakfast hadn't been included-I assured the man I had definitely paid for breakfast when booking-as he checked with reception I was able to bring up my booking.com confirmation on my phone which clearly stated breakfast included !!! He did apologise ! Breakfast was good, decent selection of food and tea coffee is brought to your table by a waitress which is good ! All in all our stay was ok ! The big positive was the hotels handiness /close proximity to the aviva stadium !!!
title: Mixed feelings

review: On arrival in Dublin our accommodation had been double booked. Our party of 9 ended up for 1 night at the Clayton and the staff couldn't do enough for us. The rooms were beautiful and the breakfast was amazing! A gentleman called Marcus spent the entire Saturday morning on the telephone trying to find us another hotel to spend the weekend as The Clayton was fully booked. Eventually Marcus found us somewhere and we had a fantastic time all thanks to him. His supervisor was also a lovely, helpful lady. We would all definitely return to this beautiful hotel.
title: Best staff ever

review: From the moment I entered I was already impressed. This hotel oozes luxury . I had so many beautiful photos but due to a dodgy phone I have been unable to retrieve them for this review. The staff go above and beyond to make your stay so lovely. We received in a room I would personally LIVE IN . It was so elegantly decorated and absolutely spotless. We stayed 4 days and it was cleaned daily. On our first evening going for drinks in the bar the receptionist noticed us "trying" to take photos and offered to take them for us . It is so difficult to get a good photo on a couple holiday. She was so kind she would have stood there all evening to help us out it was so sweet. I being a major rugby fan loved the fact that our room over looked the Aviva stadium.The best was yet to come : when we went to breakfast the following morning WOW I have never seen such a selection in a hotel. Every fried food you could possibly think of , 3 different varieties of eggs. Even tough it was buffet it did not taste at all like B&B it was batch cooked. Nothing was soggy or kind of getting cold it was all superb. A firm favourite of mine the cold meats and cheeses had an entire section to themselves along with every bread type known to man.It was a banquet not a breakfast. The location of the hotel was ideal ,Aviva,3 arena walking distance and city centre 10 mins .with buses outside the hotel including an airport shuttle bus there was no where you could not get to from this place. The staff also were very informative about activities and restaurants and bars around dublin. I cannot wait to go there again.
title: Cannot wait to go back

review: Recently I stayed two nights here. The hotel staff was very nice and the breakfast was very good. The location is about a 20-25 minute walk to the shopping area and parks, but there are nearby bus stops.The lobby of the hotel is very nice and the hotel itself is very clean. With that said, and you can see by the attached photos, my hotel room was very worn. There were scuff marks on the wall, you could see wood where the paint had worn off and the tub drain left something to be desired (couldn't tell if the metal finish wore off or if it was rusting). Overall, this is a good hotel for a night or two.
title: Average at best...at least my room

review: Stayed overnight at the Ballsbridge ready for an early ferry crossing back to the UK. the Hotel is bright and clean, the rooms spacious and very clean & and a top notch "American" bed. we wanted to experience Dublin so took off on a hike towards Temple bar (its a good walk!!) what a great cosmopolitan atmosphere. The next morning we had to be at the port so wondered if we could get breakfast as they opened at 7, in-fact they are very helpful and opened at 6.50 we were not the only people to take advantage of this early opportunity, now this is a proper breakfast just wish we had more time to enjoy the experience. One downside is car parking 12 euros, is it me? car parking should be included if you are paying 456 euros for a night.
title: Dublin Virgin

review: This is a perfectly decent hotel - nothing spectacular, but pleasant rooms, good breakfast, and a great location. A 10 minute walk up Penbrooke takes you past beautiful Georgian townhouses to a small community along the canal - groceries, a few bars, good restaurants, fast food, bakery, etc. Another 10 minutes and you're at St. Stephen Green. All the best of Dublin city center just a shortwalk away!
title: Great location!

review: I do not know where to start, 3 day stay, booked a classic twin room. Upon arrival we were informed that we were upgraded to a deluxe twin room, visions of luxury came to mind..oh how i was wrong. No one offered to take our bags of which we had 3 very heavy ones which was not too nice after having to walk a while. The room looks like an elderly person's winter lodge, the room was dark and the colours felt heavy and outdated, there was marks and chips all over the walls which looked awful. The TV was probably the worst TV I've seen in the past ten years, it was not even digital and for a 'Deluxe' room that is disappointing. Furthermore, there was no fridge at all-nothing, so if you want a cold drink or a cup of tea or cereal you are going to have to pay more for this and the breakfast is 15 euro pp which is a lot if you want a bowl of rice crispies! The room was very warm, opening the window offered no relief and there is no air conditioning but I understand it is Dublin not Dubai. The lock on the bathroom door did not work so there was a few close calls...The whole establishment is not attractive and the photos are very misleading, far nicer hotels in Dublin!!
title: Avoid...harsh but helpful

review: This hotel is well located, easy to get to Aviva stadium, and not a bad walk over to Trinity College etc. The area is nice and we had no issues with walking about even later at night. The heat in the room was unbearable, even with a fan it was very muggy, hot and sticky, and the window only opens a bit. The elevator is a fair bit from the reception desk and every time we came and went we had long waits for the elevator
title: Great Location - Poor Sleep

review: Room was clean and big. However we stayed on the 4 floor and the wifi was ridiculous, after sight seeing and travelling we wanted to contact our families but could not get anything to load at all for the two nights we stayed. If you are going to run such a big hotel and we are paying a lot of money to stay there, there should be boosters on every floor so this isn't a problem and everyone can have access to fast loading internet. Also for the price we are paying for accomodation breakfast should be included. The first night we got in after delayed flights we slept in the next morning, deciding to head down to breakfast at 10.15, we payed for full breakfast and once asked if we could get a few things refilled were told that "breakfast is nearly over so no" we are still paying the same amount of price so things that are requested should be refilled or breakfast should be discounted. When checking in we had to fix up our bill which was fine however we were charged an extra $100 Aus dollars for the accomodation as they accidentally converted the money exchange after we asked them not to. Very frustrating stay.
title: Expensive for what?!

review: My family stayed in this hotel (2 rooms) as part of a tour group. It was far from the city center in a fairly quiet location. The rooms were good and beds comfy. No A/C and the windows barely opened. It was quiet warm in the room. Breakfast was good.
title: Good hotel far from city center

review: I arrived in the Ballsbridge Hotel with very high expectations due to hearing very good things about it from various people. However, with the hotel being supposedly 4-star and so well renowned, it was highly disappointing and is, at best, average. In this day and age, having wifi at a snail-like pace is an absolute disgrace and having to go down to the lobby in the middle of the night to check your messages is a joke. Despite having full bars of wifi on your device, the wifi still will not work. I had to go through the hassle of calling reception on multiple occasions to resolve this issue, but the staff at reception always turned the sitatuion around to make it seem like I was the one slowing down the wifi; the wifi was hotel-wide and not per room, so the mere suggestion of the cause of the problem being me and my devices was ridiculous.Aside from this overwhelming techonolgical difficulty, the room was clean, spacious and there was a TV and a nice ambience in the hotel as a whole. However, where the room fell short was the lack of mini-frdge (although it is available upon request), the room service was extremely overpriced (€16.95 for a portion of fish and chips) and there was no air conditioning or any sort of temperature control. There was also a bit of stinginess with the lgithing, as there was no main lgithing fixure in the room, only lamps.The door was also very creaky, so much so that my dad compared it to an accordion. The bathroom had a few problems - smelt vaguely of urine, the showerhead was not detachable, and there was no conditioner.Overall, the hotel is frankly not good enough for the "4-star" title it carries, and falls flat on the face of the 21st century. Requires massive updating (specifically the wifi) to be even in the same ballpark as most 4-star hotels these days.
title: Not very good for a 4-star hotel

review: We have recently stayed at the Bellagio in Vegas and ballsridge hotel was right up there with it. Huge room, welcoming staff, great bar with good atmosphere. Situated just out of the main area of Dublin- very near the big stadium
title: Top notch

review: I stayed here at the Ballsbridge Hotel when I was on tour and I thought that it was an okay hotel to stay at. To me, it seems a little old and run down. The room I stayed in was far away from the lobby. The room its self was okay, however it was very loud. Even though the room was located on a high floor in the hotel, I was able to hear the street below. Sleep wise, I had a very difficult time sleeping. The other amenities made the stay a little bit better, like having a pub in-house, decent wi-fi and a nice breakfast.
title: Decent Stay in Dublin

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
