review: We chose this hotel for its central location and the reasonable rates. The staff welcomed us very friendly and helpful. The room 310 was sized ok and was clean enough. It had a window to one of the smaller streets, i.e. noise wasn't an issue. They offer 24h parking for 17.50 next door (mall's parking), which is very reasonable.Almost everything was in walking distance from here.
title: Basic, clean, central

review: stayed here on the 2 aug for the man utd match in the aviva. for a four star hotel it is very average. definitely not worth the 269 euro we paid for 2 adults and 1 child, bed only. paid another 12 euro per adult for breakfast which was very disappointing. had to stand around waiting for a table to be cleared. there was about 10-12 free tables, but all of them dirty. staff not very attentive. also had to pay 12 euro for overnight parking. won't be back.
title: very expensive

review: I've never written a scathing review in my life but so disappointed with our stay feel I have to try and give a true reflection of this place. An over night stay booked as close to Ariva stadium, cost £200 without breakfast. On arrival the hotel was chock a block with football fans (not a problem was a nice atmosphere) but queuing to check in was painful....staff pleasant enough just not enough of them. A quick visit to room on 7th floor to drop bags off....very shocked by state of the room...I've honestly stayed in better Blackpool b&bs on hen nights! The walls were filthy...not dirty or in need of a spruce they were absolutely black :( skirting boards had big chunks of wood missing and again dirty beyond words. Furniture and curtains ok, drab and outdated but in ok condition. No main light only lamps that didn't work.When we returned in the evening hotel was still packed with footy fans and after trying to find a table for food we gave up and returned to room to order room service. A Blt and burger with chips 2 soft drinks 50 euros...I could live with that if it was nice...deliver on filthy trays and the glass was that dirty I had to use a mug to drink out of. Food order was wrong and as I have an allergy couldn't eat it....chunky chips not cooked so literally ate the burger out of both meals as the thought of trying to wait any longer wasn't worth it.Overnight kept waking up to the overpowering smell of body odour :( after checking several times it wasn't me! Quick investigation it was the mattress that stunk.Next morning had to be up early for taxi so needed to get up and out quick only to find the shower didn't work....had to stand in 2 inch of bath (no time to run a full bath) water and try and wash the smell of someone else's BO off. Toilet also flooded every time you used it.I've stayed in some holes in my time but never paid £200 for the privilege....taxi driver said it's due to be demolished soon.....got to say I can see why! Such a shame as you can tell it was probably a lovely place years ago but the lack of upkeep has taken its toll. I genuinely wouldn't stay there again if it was free although I can see why it stays open with the location. Must say I didn't have any problems with staff always pleasant just not enough of them. I wish I'd complained but as were running late when we arrived and early check out we just didn't have time. It's the only time I've ever been grateful of a delayed flight as it knocked 2 hours off the time in the hotel!
title: Never again!

review: Clearly awaiting its end when lease up. Room air con not working. Room smelt damp. Vent in bathroom not working so after shower couldnt see a thing. Woke at 7am by work on building site next door....no not 1980s Spain but an alleged 4 star in Dublin. Worst hotel i have stayed in for a long time. Still waiting for the fried eggs i ordered for breakfast! At least if they rebadged it as 2 star you could accept this esp if 2 star prices and not the 200 euro plus i paid. Never ever will i be in this place again.
title: 4 star joke

review: This was a good hotel that was close to the city centre which was really convenient, we just popped on the tour bus and it took us everywhere we wanted to go, the staff were really friendly too, the food was tasty and really nice.
title: Nice hotel, close to the city centre.

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: Like any Travelodge it's very convenient to what you want to stay in! It was a good location to all the bars and restaurants but not to close where it was on your door step! Everyone at reception was very helpful, would definitely stay again :)
title: Good location

review: Room was reasonable but not worth the €183 and €283 per night... shoddy repair work throughout broken mirror covered up with piece of new mirror, shower head moving in and out of the wall.the window could not be opened very much so the room was very warm.Breakfast could be best described as disorganised with large amount of tables left unclean after the previous visitors.Car park... on arrival day 1 there was plenty of space having returned day 2 I was forced to park on street as the car park was full of match patrons. As pay parking commences at 7Am I had to relocate my car the following morning at 7am to the hotel car park which when checking out I discovered that they attempted to charge me for 2 x 24hr car park stays at a cost of €24. Not a good example of a Dublin hotel therefore I will chose a different hotel next time.
title: Disappointing stay at the Ballsbridge hotel

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: The location is central. The hotel is basic and clean. The room was completely adequate - very small but so what. The staff were pleasant and efficient. There is nothing to complain about for a reasonable price in central Dublin just off Stephen's green.
title: Typical good value Travelodge in central location

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: fantastic location to walk Dublin sights, good value for money, good room and value , safe parking under hotel. the staff are all friendly and helpful, and the hotel i secure with added car park security of you need in the car park. we will use this hotel again.
title: good value

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: Dublin seems generally expensive so we choose travel lodge as a budget hotel. Dublin (Stephens Green ) is more expensive than most TL's but is better than most TL's, as we had a very nice and large room and bathroom. It is very well located just off Grafton Street - not far from the Liffey and Temple Bar. You can walk to most places, 25 - 30 mins maybe to the Guinness Store house and Jamesons distillery. For Kilmainham prison you will probably need transport - and be sure to book in advance.
title: 7 Days in Dublin

hotelName: Travelodge Dublin City Centre, Stephens Green Hotel
review: Stayed on lower level room. Basic room, bathroom door didn't shut. Finished to poor standard inside. Tiling was Bodge job and grout was green. Windows didn't seal people letting in all of the noise from passers by through out night...didn't sleep. (Friday night in Dublin). Reception didn't seem interested after we told them of the issues. No apology. £170 room which wasn't worth it. Wish I booked something else.
title: Noisey

hotelLocation: Eliza Lodge 23/24 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: When I stayed here in June with my friends and they're sisters we first got there and couldn't pay by card it had to be the one it was booked on which was very awkward we then stayed a night and cleaned the place up the next morning and a week later told there was 250 been takin of our account when the maximum fee was 200 they had no explanation for it or no proof either and it wasn't cheap to stay in for a night either!!!
title: Terrible

hotelLocation: Eliza Lodge 23/24 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: My sisters and I travelled to Dublin on June 1/17. We choose what we thought was a nice small quiet lodge with an Inn type ambience. This was to be a trip of a lifetime. The room was gorgeous with windows all around and a view of the river Liffey. However, there was a bar just across from us with a big sign on it. it said "FIVE FLOORS OF FUN AND MUSIC" As you can imagine my heart sunk when I saw this. We tried to sleep that first night, sleep which was desperately need as we had travelled at night time. No sleep was to be had and when we asked the girl about it she said "what did you expect, This is Temple Bar." The name meant nothing to us as this was our first time in Ireland. All three of us took turns trying to explain our predicament to the girl to no avail. Finally I asked to see the manager who moved us, thank goodness, to a very small room. We didn't mind as the noise was considerably less. my problem is this. We contacted Eliza Lodge with two very polite letters asking for some kind of a credit as we moved from a three person room to a little 2 person room which was considerably cheaper. No response whatsoever. Most of the staff was amazing. We were very disappointed.
title: 5 FLOORS OF MUSIC AND FUN

review: This place had gotten fine reviews in my home country, but I was still surprised how fresh and clean the rooms were. This place is in a good location for exploring Dublin and is great value for money. Only "complaints" would be that there's no elevator and that the pillows were a bit too hard for my taste. But hey! All in all this is a excellent B&B. Highly recommended.
title: Luxury

review: Very nice and clean hotel with friendly staff. Breakfast very nice. Location perfect as it was close to shopping streets, railway station and Croke Park.Only negative things were that walls were not very thick, so you could hear noise from other rooms. Also we were given a very small room, but this was ok.
title: Weekend in Dublin

review: Our recent stay at Dublin's Dawson Hotel is a reminder that running a boutique hotel is a lot harder than getting in a good designer. While the Dawson had a fantastic location and looked great, its beauty was only skin deep. It has a long way to go to get near other boutique hotels we've paid similar prices for.Things started well. It would be hard to better the Dawson's location, on a gracious street full of upscale shops and restaurants that links Trinity College to St. Stephen's Green. Directly across the street is the gracious Georgian facade of the Lord Mayor's residence, Mansion House. After passing under a glass and wrought-iron canopy most likely added by the Victorians, you enter a classic Georgian entry hall and proceed up broad, elegant stairs to the lobby on the first floor. They certainly have the boutique look down, with oversized gold-gilt Georgian and Baroque furniture and luxe fabrics mixed with modern accessories and lighting, and all of the calming neutral wall colours currently in vogue.We'd upgraded to a junior suite, primarily because we'd booked at short notice and rooms in the city were limited. It was also clear that people in search of peace and quiet should avoid the cheaper rooms facing onto the main street; the Dawson described them as "vibrant", especially on weekends. (Translation: the hotel's bar is just one in a line of trendy establishments that pour loud groups of merry-makers onto the pavements at night. During the day, construction noise and a bus stop for several of the city's hop-on-hop-off tours keep things lively.) Thus the anticipation of almost £200 a night hitting our debit card raised expectations, as well.The Ares Suite was indeed beautiful, with an enormous bed under a canopy, a fanciful footstool and sofa, a capsule-style coffee maker and a bathroom the size of a double bedroom with a striking free-standing tub. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the linens of top quality, and the room was blessedly quiet. But little things niggled. There was no shaver point in the bathroom, leaving us without the ability to charge our toothbrush. There was an unprepared hole in the wall (perhaps power was on the way?) More frustrating, the bathroom only had dusky mood lighting. Great for a romantic soak, but frustrating for more prosaic business. Surely a luxury boutique could offer two-stage lighting? I appreciated the fridge in the room, but was puzzled to find it hadn't been plugged in (hope nobody arrives with stuff they need to keep cold) and surprised to find it completely empty. A true boutique usually stocks your rooms with a few goodies.Service was adequate, but lacked the personal interest and the sense of going above and beyond I associate with boutiques. This might have been, in part, because the lobby is off to the side of the main stair. Once you check in, you have no reason to pass through. This means there's little contact with staff. When we did interact, it was efficient but perfunctory. We didn't encounter anyone with a local accent; though it may be an unfair assumption, the whole staff seemed to be from somewhere else, adding to a more corporate, impersonal feel.Our biggest issue, however, was breakfast. I hadn't confirmed that it was included in the rate, making an assumption that at that price ... and in a country that makes a big deal of its breakfast ... the meal would be part of the experience. And I sense that, under normal circumstances, it is. But we arrived to a notice that the kitchen had been closed due to "unavoidable circumstances". Probably just unfortunate wording, but I immediately imagined a health inspection shut down. The offered a continental breakfast instead. This was a disaster.Breakfast took place in a bar to the side of the main entrance, primarily free of staff and curiously cluttered with boxes, as if throwing people into the room for breakfast was an afterthought. The breakfast spread ... inelegantly scattered on a side table ... comprised boxed cereal, some fruit, yogurt containers and a stack of sale scones. There was a vat of boiling water and tea bags, but NO COFFEE. And no staff to handle any requests. Climbing upstairs to the lobby, we discovered they would bring us cups from the Nespresso machine there.I understand kitchen issues. But if you're going to put yourself out there as a luxury boutique hotel, you can do a better job on the continental breakfast. Have a staff member in the room to take care of people. Decant your cereals into glass jars. Lay on some platters of sliced meats and cheeses. Offer a varieties of pastries. Fresh ones. And, for heavens' sake, coffee. Ideally cafetieres or pots for each table so people can linger over their breakfast without having to request the next cup. Lacking all of these things, we sought breakfast elsewhere two of our three mornings.I wouldn't completely dismiss the Dawson. Its location is extraordinary and the bed was wonderfully comfortable. But all those little issues frustrate when you're presented with a sizeable bill on checkout. It's a hotel that could be great but, right now, it's not fully earning its "boutique" appellation.
title: Great location, but misses the fine points needed to earn the boutique badge

hotelLocation: Charleville Lodge 268/272 North Circular Road, Dublin 7, Ireland
review: There were a few notes and notices from management about people who complain etc but I don't see what they would be complaining about. We had a lovely twin room, ensuite & car parking (extra €7). Clean, tidy, great for the price. Could walk to most places in half an hour
title: Clean & tidy

hotelLocation: Charleville Lodge 268/272 North Circular Road, Dublin 7, Ireland
review: What a wonderful quirky hotel. Great transport links into the City. Good value accommodation with witty comments everywhere. Excellent food in the White Moose but at an additional costBonus was that Burnley beat Shamrock Rovers 4-0Recommended budget hotel
title: Burnley on Tour

hotelLocation: Charleville Lodge 268/272 North Circular Road, Dublin 7, Ireland
review: An overnight stay whilst in Dublin, in this very clean and welcoming hotel. The rooms comfortable and clean and although basic that is reflected in the very reasonable price. The hotel is situated just outside the city but within easy access with good transport in. Also, not too far from the ferry terminal and has a small car park to the rear of the hotel.
title: Clean welcoming hotel

hotelLocation: Charleville Lodge 268/272 North Circular Road, Dublin 7, Ireland
review: Stayed here last monday with my girlfriend and baby and we could have been happier.The location is great. 10 minute drive to city centre and only a short drive from phoenix park.The staff were all so friendly and helpful and the room was just right. And at 107 euro for the night, including parking, an absolute bargain for dublin.Breakfast in the infamous white moose was absolutely excellent. We were pleasantly surprised with how good it actually was.We will definitely stay here again
title: The only place you should ever stay in dublin

hotelLocation: Apartment 62 The Plaza Shangan Road, Dublin 9, Ireland
review: All is stated in the title, it was a very noisy room (I recommend to request a room on the opposite side of the entrance) and the air smells a lot the cigarette when we entered which were very annoying for non-smokers like us.Hopefully 2 good points are : large room with comfortable beds and a free car park.
title: Noisy and cigarette smell when we enter in the room

hotelLocation: Apartment 62 The Plaza Shangan Road, Dublin 9, Ireland
review: Ok for one night as a stop over or for an early flight as it's nearby airport but wouldn't recommend as a base for visiting Dublin. They have shut the restaurant so no food Available no bar either , there was a Chinese over the road that was good , there was a bar next door but looked a bit rough to me like the whole of the ballymun area I wouldn't walk round here after dark.Hotels in Dublin are expensive in summer so if you end up here it's better than no room at all but if you are on holiday and are visiting Dublin this would be the last hotel you would want to book ballymun although supposedly being regenerated it's still the same old dump it was. Wouldn't recommend this hotel for families or couples the hotel itself is ok but the area lets it down and it's no where near Dublin .
title: Ok for one night

hotelLocation: Apartment 62 The Plaza Shangan Road, Dublin 9, Ireland
review: We needed a convenient hotel to stay in with airport shuttle for our early morning flight out of Dublin. This place is located in a sort of wasteland. We pulled up, the cab driver didn't even know this place was here & seemed afraid to just leave us here(!), there was a group of loud guys from the pub next door outside. Our room was typical Travelodge, but the view outside was a crappy apartment complex with loud people. We were hungry, but I didn't want to walk around the sketchy neighborhood! No way would I ever go here again!
title: Dumpy. Sketchy.

hotelLocation: Apartment 62 The Plaza Shangan Road, Dublin 9, Ireland
review: My flight had an 18hr layover in Dublin so I searched for an inexpensive place to stay near the airport. I arrived at the airport around 9pm and had to take a cab to the hotel that cost nearly €18 (remember that detail). Upon arrival, the check in process was smooth and the staff was somewhat friendly. I asked about the airport shuttle they advertised and was shown the timetable for the shuttle that limited its use to a few hours in the morning and a few hours in the early evening. On the way up to my room, I noticed the place was either new or recently renovated. Either way, it was nice. The room was hot due to unseasonably warm weather in the area. The entire exterior wall was made up of windows and a glass balcony door but only one window opened a few inches and the door was locked. There was no other source of ventilation so I accepted the mildly uncomfortable room. On the balcony was a large seagull sitting very still. The bird was so still that I assumed she was sitting on an egg or a hatchling. It wasn't until I noticed a couple of flies that I realized it was in fact dead. The bathroom was very nice with a huge bathtub and very modern fixtures. The television was slightly larger than a postage stamp but there were quite a few channels to watch. Thinking that this part of Ireland was still part of the U.K., I tried plugging in my phone with my U.K. adapter only to find the Euro style plugs. Luckily I had both adapters. There was plenty of hot water for bath/shower and minimal noise while I slept. The breakfast downstairs was hot and filling and the dead seagull had been removed by morning. While checking out, Shannon at the front desk frowned deeply when I told her about the €18 cab ride. She said the cab shouldn't be more than €12 and called me a cab from a reputable company that the hotel frequently uses. She also addressed the hot room by pointing out the unusually warm weather and said they had fans for guest use. I didn't think to ask. Either way, if it's hot they have fans for guests. The cab Shannon called arrived within a few minutes and her estimate was pretty spot on: €13 for the ride. If I have another lengthy layover in Dublin again, I'll most likely stay here.
title: Decent and Affordable

hotelLocation: Apartment 62 The Plaza Shangan Road, Dublin 9, Ireland
review: Good experience. Underground free car park is handy. Room is standard fit but was clean. Only two small issues - the room was very warm on the top floor and hard to regulate temperature without opening the window which then made the room noisy. Also there was a light bulb missing from a table lamp.
title: Decent hotel

hotelLocation: Apartment 62 The Plaza Shangan Road, Dublin 9, Ireland
review: Near to airport. Shuttle bus available at certain times early morning and later in the day.. Taxi from airport approx 15 euros. Good value compared to other hotels. Friendly staff. Local supermarket, take away pizza nearby.
title: good value

hotelLocation: Apartment 62 The Plaza Shangan Road, Dublin 9, Ireland
review: The hotel was clean and close to the airport. But those are the only two good things about it. The airport shuttle rarely runs -- only between 5am-9am and 5pm-9pm. Not dependable. The hotel is also in the middle of nowhere and the restaurant/bar in the hotel was closed during our stay. As well as this, there were only two power outlets in a room that was housing 3 people.
title: Okay, deserted area, lacked power outlets

hotelLocation: Apartment 62 The Plaza Shangan Road, Dublin 9, Ireland
review: After a very bad experience at a Travelodge years ago I usually avoid them like the plague. So I wasn't looking to forward to staying here when my sister in law booked us in for a night on a trip to Dublin. The hotel completely changed my opinion.The hotel itself was very bright and fresh and spacious. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. Everything was well maintained and had everything you could want.What really made it stand out was the excellent service. We arrived at midnight after a delayed flight and the night staff could not have been more helpful. Unfortunately I didn't get their names but both guys could not do enough to help us and other guests who arrived at the same time. The next morning the reception and restaurant staff were friendly and helpful. Travelodge - this hotel and particularly the staff are a great advertisement for youVisit 10/11 July 2017
title: The best Travelodge I have stayed in

review: I enjoyed the proximity to the National Theater as I was attending an event there for three days. Also relatively close to the major sites. The rooms were clean and everything was in working order. The staff was also very friendly.
title: Charming and Clean

review: Lovely hotel nice staff rooms perfect for a hen party or girly night away. Clean and comfortable. The only fault for me was the room was extremely warm otherwise all great . Pleasant stay. The bar serves lovely food / cocktails also.
title: Hen Party Weekend

review: LOUD MUSIC until 4:00-4:30 am every night. No accommodations made to help filter the noise - (light curtain on window, no air conditioner, no sound insulation whatsoever) At one point in the night, I wanted to stuff the single bed mattress, covers and pillows against the window to block out the noise. All they gave was ear plugs. Our adult children were traveling with us and enjoyed the club the first night however, they had an early flight out the second night and didn't get any sleep even though their room was around the corner from the club.Parking wasn't a real issue as we were aware of the fact that we had to park several blocks away with a discounted rate.Hotel staff is courteous and very friendly. Rooms are dated but adequate.
title: Cancel your reservations unless you are partying into the night!

review: Clean and quiet when I was there, though it was a week night. Welcoming staff allowed an early check-in and were helpful recommending restaurants. Room spacious and comfortable. Would happily stay again.
title: Perfectly good

review: Staff very pleasant. We had a triple room clean & basic. We where at a music festival with a group of girls some stayed on the first floor & some on the second. The girls on the first floor had no sleep as the music was thumping into their room throughout the night from the beer garden, nightclub & bar (you are supplied with earplugs in the drawer) they got some discount the next day after complaining. We paid 9e each for breakfast. But it was not worth it. Fine for hens/stags but I wouldn't recommend for a family.
title: Breakfast not included

review: I visited with my wife for just the weekend and we found this hotel good. The only problem was that they gave us a room with 2 singles instead of a double. We were offered to have the bed changed but since it was only for 2 nights we decided not to go through the hassle.Location is good, just 10-15min walk from the centre, plenty of nightclubs and restaurants within 5 mins walk.
title: Frendly Staff good location

review: Great central locationClean Staff could be more helpful and friendly Rooms very hot, no fans or air conditioning Breakfast would be value for money as long as you fill plate first time around as you can't get anything after
title: Birthday treat

review: Good news - great location, friendly staff, comfy , big Irish breakfast , well priced, Minuses - no where to park ( we had hire car ) , parking station long way away - difficult with luggage if overseas travellershowers Luke warm and 3am disco / bar Very noisy
title: Good location

review: We stayed at the Harcourt Hotel for the U2 concert in Dublin (July 2017), the hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating however this hotel is strictly for those planning on partying into the early hours of the following morning. The hotel is connected to a night-club and hotel guests must use the night-club bars in order to get food & drink, hotel food is served in the night-club garden on a BBQ. Whilst the hotel staff were great, we had issues with nightclub door-staff on a few of the nights as the hotel entrance was also strangely used as the nightclub entrance also. Security were pushy and we ended up losing our temper with one security guard whilst trying to get food one night.. I don't think he was expecting it as his job usually seems to consist of pushing Dublin teens around on the 'meat-market' terrace and having two middle aged blokes challenge his nonsense quickly lead to a change in attitude. Food and drink prices were however good with most drinks costing €2.00 in the afternoon/early evening. Whilst the rooms were extremely dated in terms of emanates and decor, they were comfortable and were good value for money. The only faults were the lighting (extremely dim) and the constant music that went on until 3:00am every night, we were on the top floor and it was still loud, however ear-plugs were provided in the room on arrival. We only ate breakfast on one of the mornings of our 4-day stay and it was very nice, a traditional Irish breakfast with black and white pudding. Additional offerings of continental breakfasts were also offered. All-In-All, the hotel was good value for money however was let down by the night-club as punters roamed the lower floor at their own leisure and the club’s security seem to need some education in telling apart drunk 18 year old clubbers and 30-odd year old knackered hotel guests!
title: Only go if you are partying!

review: The staff at this hotel really made my experience so much better than what the actual rooms were. The rooms are fine, nothing fancy, but clean. A few things could be spruced up. But the hotel is old and so has the character you'd expect: slanting staircases, small bathrooms with floors that have been recovered many times, small windows under the eaves in the top floor rooms. You have to be buzzed in, which I liked, and the place seems secure. When I first found the building, it looked a bit sketchy from the outside, but I came to appreciate the convenience of the location. I agree with others about the music. I didn't enjoy the first-thing-in-the-morning loud music in Murray's bar where we get breakfast. And the music does go on all day into the wee hours. I wore earplugs to sleep. If you think it's really going to bug you, ask for a top floor room. But as I said, the staff were just delightful -- so helpful and polite.
title: Character hotel in good location, great staff

hotelLocation: Eliza Lodge 23/24 Wellington Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The staff are friendly but the rooms are in a very noisy part of town and there is no adjacent car pArk. If I was thirty years younger with little luggage I would think it was brilliantYou have to drag your luggage up one floor and then go in a tiny lift. As I have said, being younger would have helped
title: Awkward place

review: Totally honest review from a family perspective.We stayed at the beginning of July for 2 nights. We booked the family deal with Dublin zoo tickets, dinner on the first evening and breakfast both mornings. I was a little nervous about staying after reading some of the reviews and on arrival as we turned the corner I got even more nervous with the appearance of the hotel, however on entering the hotel I noted that it was definitely more modern and nicer looking. We were quickly checked in and given our tickets for Dublin zoo and I was pleasantly surprised when we entered our room. We could immediately smell fresh paint which was nice and our room was really clean and nicely made up. It wasn't a huge room but fitted us all in nicely, the bathroom had little flaws but was clean. I think we stayed in the refurbed part of the hotel as it looked a lot differently than the other part of the hotel where the kids movie night was held. The kids movie night was being hosted by two very young hotel workers but they were pleasant and very helpful. We had our evening meal which also surprised us as it was 3 courses for adults and 2 for children. The food was nice and ok. Not fancy in any way but totally edible, feeling and nice. We had a drink in the bar located in the hotel and it was nice and had tvs to watch. There was music on the second night but we didn't go in. We slept ok, very warm but the beds were comfortable. We didn't use the pool as we couldn't justify paying for the head caps required to use the pool. They were 3 euro each. Our kids were excited to go to the pool but we thought the price was unjustifiable for the length we would be in. The times weren't also suitable as kids weren't allowed in before 9am and after 7pm which meant if your planning to go to Dublin for the day as we did, we would have to cut short our day. Breakfast was a little limited, fry items, wheaten bread, toast and a small selection of cereal and yoghurt. some pastries would of been nice All in all we enjoyed our stay and would stay again.
title: Would stay again! 3 1/2 out of 5, not quite a 4.

review: I have stayed here a number of time when needing to be on a red eye flight the following morning. The corporate rate is excellent - it includes free parking and breakfast for a very reasonable price. The rooms are always clean and comfortable with good wifi access. Ramona and the front of house staff are always very friendly and helpful (it's a plus that they remember faces too!). The bar is nice and there's always a decent atmosphere in there. The food in the bar is always lovely. Any time I've stayed here I've always been up before breakfast is service however, bringing a continental breakfast up to my room is never a problem. I will stay again soon.
title: Ideal for Dublin Airport

review: I paid approx £220 for a room for one night (breakfast not included). As my partner and I were down to Dublin to watch Coldplay I will admit it was close to Croke Park. Upon arrival the guy on reception assumed my partner and I would want 2 single beds (being 2 guys), when I corrected him and said the double was fine he smirked and went ahead with checking us in. The hotel must of been grand and luxurious at one stage, but it is dated and old now. A bit of reinvestment by the owners would do wonders for the business. The bedroom had old creaky furniture which was too big in a small room, the bathroom was tiny but did have a nice selection of soaps and products. A wet room would be much better here. The room was spotless and there was a kettle and coffee but no tea. Also in the room is an iron plus board and a hairdryer. There was no air conditioning unit and the room was roasting hot.It would have been ok with 2 windows there but we couldn't open them more than a crack. Although we were there on a Saturday the area didn't have much happening and seems to be pretty quiet. The hotel has a pool and leisure facility which we didn't have time to see/experience but you do need a code from reception to get into it. A carvery was offered in the bar/restaurant and upon inspection we decided it would be better to go somewhere else and get something modern. Overall this is a basic hotel offering a basic service and charging far too much money. It has tonnes of potential but the owners seriously need to reinvest and get it up to the standard of the times.
title: Not worth the price!

review: The staff at the regency hotel were very friendly and helpful at all costsThere is a weird layout to the hotel that if you are on certain floors the lift does not go to you have to get off at one floor and take the stairs.... it was a nightmare. I got to my room and i asked to be switched, and the receptionist got me another room straight away.This room was not much better, there were cigarette butts on the window sill, questionable stains on the pillow and bed cover. The bath/shower was very dirty.Also the cleaners would come in even when you have a 'DO NOT DISTURB' sign on the door. The hotel has a nice pub downstairs which I have no complaints about.This hotel is a bus ride away from the center of Dublin and a 10 min drive from airport.I am certain that there are much better hotels around DublinI wont be coming here againNothing against the staff because they were all good, just not a fan of the hotel
title: Im sure there are much better places to stay in Dublin

review: This was our second time staying in the Regency Hotel, after an absence of several years. Since our last visit to Dublin, the hotel has been revamped and now has a very pleasant interior for rooms, corridors, etc. Part of the former quaintness of the hotel is now missing but the staff remain friendly and helpful, the location excellent and accommodation comfortable. Breakfast in the large room is not ideal and perhaps this may be an area for future reviews of the hotel layout.
title: Most acceptable

review: This is a large, older hotel with a very good pub but the hotel itself in need of upgrade. Live music in the pub on the Saturday night we checked in. The singer was really good and the pub was lively and fun with an excellent choice of cold beers on tap. The bathrooms were clean but older. On the plus side, our room did have in-room controlled AC but it took a while to cool the room down. Carpets throughout the place could use replacement. On the negative side, our room was on floor 5. This didn't seem a problem until after checkin when we realized that the elevator goes only to floor 4 and then we had to carry our suitcases up the back stairwell. A very nice bellman helped on checkin but checkout was on our own. Not sure why we were given this room (5116 which could not have been further from the reception area) when it seemed that there were many rooms on 4 that we walked past that seemed vacant. We are not yet "elderly" but not exactly young either (60'ish) and the man at reception probably should have asked us or considered that we were carrying 5 pieces of luggage and two of them quite large, when he assigned us to the most difficult room in the hotel. We had to pay full payment on check-in. Not a problem for us but I saw one traveler who was upset about this. Set back off of a main road with close bus stops for travel by bus to City Center in one direction or the Dublin Airport and Bus depot in the other. Get a bus schedule when you get there. Bus drivers will help.
title: Decent hotel in need of upgrade

review: Debated whether to put very good but there are a few things that let it down. The reception and bar staff are absolutely amazing and very helpful except for the grumpy concierge man. Very comfortable rooms but no fridge in ours, our shower was blocked and the aircon didn't work well. The outside looks like an absolute dive but the interior is neat and tidy. We had 2 rooms and even though we booked 10 months ago ended up nowhere near each other. The bar is a really cosy place to wind down at the end of the day and the breakfast is edible with a good variation.
title: Perfectly acceptable

review: Stayed her for one night check in was quick but we were asked to pay on the arrival a bit unusual. Informed that breakfast was an additional ten Euro which could be paid in the restaurant in the morning but this was wrong we had to go back to reception pay and get vouchers then go back to the restaurant. Also enquired at the main reception if the spa sold swimsuits and told no so went into dublin to buy one but I checked the next morning at the spa and they do indeed sell swimwear so could have bought one there,you also have to pay deposits for towels and lockers and buy swimhats decided not to bother. Breakfast was awful very poor choice definately not worth ten Euro each Apple juice was like water no flavour at all very disappointed with breakfast.Room looked out on a flat roof with lots of air con equipment. Supposed to be fifteen minutes walk from Croke park more like thirty five.
title: Dated and not very clean

review: OK hotel needs improvement, but no negatives with staff or rooms . I stayed in room 3122 on the 2nd of August when Dublin was very busy . Right from our entry at reception until we left the staff were exceptional, reception staff and bar staff excellent . I lost my bank card and the receptionist made sure I did not have to pay for parking but was more worried that I got it sorted. It was the girl with blonde hair on at 2.30 pm on the 3rd.Bar staff one bar man in particular made it his to make us feel at home I think his name was Niall . The hotel has had its fair share of negativity but from Belfast it's great if you're driving as it's next to motorway. Again dated but if your in Dublin to comment on a family trip this is the spot.Public bus outside every 3-4 mins. €2-€3 fare into city centre.
title: Second stay .

review: My niece had her communion here and we weren't happy at all with the food. I had chicken wings for starter which had barely any meat on them and got about 3 on the plate. The mains came out about 30 minutes after and I got penne pasta which was absolutely vile to say the least. The pasta was dry and hard and the sauce tasted like tinned tomatoes. It was basically day old pasta with a tin of tomatoes poured over it with no meat or anything. Disgusting
title: The food is terrible

review: Good hotel and excellent location. The staff really were lovely and so helpful. Our only issue was that it was quite expensive for what it was, especially as when we checked in the man next to us paid less than half we had for some reason! Equally although spotless when we checked in to the room, the cleaning was terrible after the first night and we complained on check out. Having said that it was a comfortable room and the location/staff more than made up for it.
title: Good location.. but none too cheap!

review: This hotel and most historians claim that this is where Handel held the premier performance of his famous "Messiah" on 13 April 1742. For that reason it has been officially designated historic, proscribing major structural changes in the building. Today it is a charming boutique hotel, one must take stairs to reach the elevator, open the windows in summer as there are no temperature controls in the room, and abide by the room configurations. One wonders, though, if the proscription extends to buying new and comfortable mattresses for the beds or keeping the televisions ll workable or fresh batteries in the remote controls. Little things. The staff was very pleasant in every way and tried to promptly remedy all that they could for the clientele. The rooms were clean. On the back side of the hotel one is away from busy street noises, and only hears intermittent machine sounds coming from the backs of other buildings--perhaps their air conditioning/heating systems. The location is perfect for cultural events, night life, and conveniences. For history buffs and music lovers it may be worth one expensive night. For others, the Temple Bar (named for sand bars built along the waterway by the Temple family and others against the ravages of over flowing?) offers much more and at a better value.
title: Historic

review: i've stayed at this hotel twice and i can't say about word about it - the staff are great, location is marvellous and the rooms are superb. last time i visited i left my passport in the room and the staff got it in a taxi and got it to the airport in time for me to catch my flight ! amazing hotel !
title: Amazing

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I booked a single room and it was very small, but otherwise not bad. The desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. The pub adjoining the lobby is lively and has good music too. On the whole, my stay was comfortable.Issues with the room were that it was very small for the price, the shower door is too narrow, and the lamp by the bed is too low for reading. The lift did not work when I arrived, but it was fixed the next day. Also, the TV info provided in the room was out of date and inaccurate.
title: Great location, lively area, nice people

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Stayed at the Citi Hotel for a gig in 3 Arena a few weeks ago with my fiance and it was ideal. Directly in centre of City/Temple Bar for €100 double room. Location is brilliant, perfect for having a few pints in town and short walk back, rooms grand and clean and staff really nice. Would highly recommend for anyone planning a night out in Dublin.
title: The finest

review: Excellent location (5min walk from O'Connell), the room was small (and bathroom tiny!) but clean enough. A little noisy at nights because of the traffic and pubs in the streets.Staff at reception was ok, you just have to ask if you need anything because they won't ask you first, Esther (in care of breakfast) is lovely and funny.No wifi in the hotel apart from the lobby.
title: nice hotel

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Room is very small and too much noise once we open the window. But good thing is that everything accessible from here like sight seen, Airport bus, Tample BAR, and hotel staffs are friendly and helpful.
title: Good to walk around

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This is wonderful heritage building with a great location and a great staff. It can be a little loud due to all the bar/pub traffic on the main street, but they helpfully provide earplugs! They let you store your bags before or after check in, and this tiny extra is incredibly helpful in a downtown area!
title: Great location, good rooms!

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The room is small and warm since we stayed here in July. However, the location is right in the middle of everything, making it easy to walk to different sights and pubs. The pub attached to the hotel offered great music at night. Even though the hotel is located in the middle of Temple Bar, we did not have an issues with noise at night.~Lindsay
title: Great location

review: Chose this hotel since it was 5 mins walk from a conference venue. Great location. Building clean and well appointed. Staff were 100% and a true asset to the hotel. I would stay there again if the opportunity arose.
title: Quick visit to Dublin

review: We stayed at the Clayton Hotel Ballsbridge from 7/4/17 - 7/12/17. The hotel is a former Masonic girl's orphanage and it is quite beautiful. The rooms were spacious. We thought the location was perfect. It was not in the middle of noisy downtown but there was a bus stop right outside the door which would easily take you downtown in about five minutes on the 4 or 7 and the AirCoach to and from the airport also stopped right outside of the door. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. In particular, Imelda, at the front desk, was wonderful. We would highly recommend the Clayton Hotel, Ballsbridge. Robert and Graham - Chattanooga, TN
title: Beautiful hotel, great location, wonderful staff!!

review: My wife and I stayed here one night during our trip to Ireland with Gate 1 Travel. The room was clean and the bathroom was very nice -- great water pressure and plenty of hot water. We also had dinner at the hotel restaurant and it was very good Breakfast the next morning was also good. If I had one complaint it would be the bed quality -- the mattress was uncomfortable, but this could easily be a personal preference.
title: Nice Hotel

review: Myself and my husband stayed here after getting a really good price for the night online, hotel is lovely building in a nice area of Dublin. Room standard enough but both bathroom and bed area was spotless. Parking €12 which is slightly annoying when you are a paying guest but I would stay again.
title: Great value

review: Booked in here for three nights and have to say the room was clean and comfortable. A bit warm but that's something I have come to expect from hotel rooms Breakfast is a self service affair with many different treats and offerings blending the traditional Irish hot breakfast with the continental style really enjoyable and sets you up for the day. Staff extremely friendly Lunch in the coffee dock was very tasty one small criticism €3.10 for a small 200ml glass bottle of coke a bit expensive again staff very helpful and nice
title: Room/Breakfast/Lunch

review: We had a great stay for 3 nights at the Hotel. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make us comfortable. We stayed there during the U2 concert at they tailored special services for guests attending the show. A special shout out to Carlos, Fernando and Roman for their great service!
title: Excellent service!

review: Picked this hotel as I had stayed at the Clayton Dublin airport before and it was lovely and was sure I would have the same experience. I have never been so disappointed in a hotel that I had high expectations about. On arrival hotel looked beautiful. Taxi ride there was OK. Genuine taxi man. 13 euro from bus station. A male receptionist greeted us on arrival. Was not helpful at all. Got to room. Very clean and tidy. Beds very comfortable. We ate dinner that evening. Was disappointed with the food. Expected it to be alot nicer for the standard of hotel. Staff were excellent though. Especially would like to mention Vanessa and the Brazilian waitress. Fantastic staff in restaurant. The bar man from Madrid was so helpful and made our stay very pleasant. The breakfast was disappointing as well. Staff on duty on both mornings were not very pleasant or helpful. Very rude lady showed us to table one morning and charged me for breakfast that was already payed for. I was not happy at all. Explained this to reception staff and they were fantastic. Most of the staff at this hotel were great. Just a pity there are a few that let it down badly. No entertainment in hotel. Nothing for children. No pool. Would not recommend for family.
title: Undecided

review: I can see how this might be an appropriate business hotel, but I wouldn't recommend this to someone traveling and visiting Dublin. It is a bit too far outside the city center for me. We stayed for 2 nights and we purchased a hop on hop off bus pass, obviously it was our fault for not checking the route before we purchased, the closest stop for the bus requires a 15euro cab ride from the hotel to even get to the bus. The hotel itself is very pretty from the outside, and the lobby and restaurant/bar area is maintained nicely, but the hallways and rooms of the accommodations could use some upgrading. No air conditioning, which we half expected since we've heard that about Europe but still kind of disappointed. It was August so it was still pretty warm out. The breakfast had some basic items, but even the scrambled eggs were a little off. Mostly I was just disappointed with how disconnected from the rest of Dublin it was. Like I said, for someone traveling for business it probably makes sense, but didn't really fit our needs.
title: A little outdated, not the best for visiting

review: Good value in a great location. Double room with a huge (kingsize) bed but bathroom a little dated. Overall good value, if bordering on slightly worn. Very handy for quick access to city centre, as tons of buses stop almost outside hotel. No room service the first night of our stay, due to 'technical problems' which made my partner's birthday, a little less special than I'd planned it to be. We'd enquired twice beforehand (once over the phone and once, upon checking in) to make sure there would be but due to a 'lack of communication,' neither reception when we rang, nor check in when we arrived, were told it wouldn't be available that night. So we toasted with tap water, rather than champagne.However, we both agreed we'd still go back and not just bcs they offered us a late check out, by way of compensation. All in all, it's not a bad deal. Esp if you're in Dublin for the sort of night where you'll only return to your room to sleep, after eating out and going to the theatre. The building itself is quite interesting, as it's a former masonic hall and the tiled mosaic on the floor of the entrance, is worth a photo.
title: Good value but no frills...

review: We stayed at the Clayton Hotel Ballsbridge for two nights in July. The rooms were big compared to other hotels in Ireland. Restaurants and pubs within walking distance. The breakfast buffet was good. WiFi was not good in our hotel room. We went to the lobby for better WiFi access. Bus stop in front of hotel with timer that tells you when the next bus will arrive.I would recommend this hotel.
title: CIE bus tour hotel in Dublin

review: We stayed from 30th July to 1st August with our two children. The location was 35 minutes walking straight to the centre of Dublin. The room was very spacious, toiletries were very good quality, very comfortable beds (included children's!) and the breakfast was fantastic: great variety in a spacious lounge.All the staff, from the reception desk to the waiters /waitresses and cleaning staff very very nice and helpful. It was a great experience for us all!.
title: Beautiful builiding inside and outside, great rooms for families and great attention

review: Our first taste of Ireland...We checked in early after an overnight flight. The front desk was more than accommodating! Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom were spacious and spotless. The hotel is conveniently located -- not in the city center, but easily accessible nonetheless -- and the neighborhood is beautiful.Cannot stress enough how helpful everyone was. At one point, we saw a woman who was a manager of some sort. First, she was delivering trays to tables when the coffee bar was getting busy; then she was escorting folks to the restrooms (not just pointing the way); not more than 30 minutes later we found her out front assisting guests in getting taxis -- all with a smile and kind word! We would highly recommend Clayton Ballsbridge!
title: Wonderful, unique hotel!

review: Hotel was very good. Excellent service and great rooms. The breakfast is great and parking very handy. Location spot on, only a quick Dart into town or the beach a 10 min walk east. Loved it. Only thing was we thought the bed was a bit hard, so used an extra quilt which they were quite happy to give us.
title: Dublin in summer

review: The hotel is really centrally located just 5-10 mins taxi journey from grafton street. It is also very close to the train station.The hotel is a beautifully preserved old building with Parisian windows. The rooms are a bit basic but are a decent size for a hotel in a central location. The hotel is very clean and the staff are also very friendly and helpful.If in Dublin for a few days, this could be an ideal hotel for your stay.
title: Stayed over after a wedding

review: We stayed at The Clayton Hotel, Ballsbridge for a wedding that was taking place in the adjacent Thomas Prior Hall. The hotel team did a wonderful job.Check-in was smooth and easy - the room was ready at 2pm, the promised time and the receptionist was very welcoming. The room was spotlessly clean and had a good bathroom with a powerful shower.The lady who greeted us in the restaurant for breakfast was so friendly, even though we arrived only 5 minutes before breakfast was due to end.Imelda who checked us out was super-friendly and full of smiles. When she saw our suitcases, she immediately offered to arrange a taxi for us - a very nice, unprompted touch. She really made our departure a warm and friendly experience with lots of personality.The wedding reception itself was wonderful - great service and very nice food.Thank you Clayton Hotel team :-)
title: Very nice experience

review: We stayed 2 nights and we had a pleasant stay in the hotel. We were in Dublin for the concert of U2. It was also our first time in Ireland. The hotel is really nice and with easy access to public transportation. There is a very nice square with restaurants, pubs and small stores near by the hotel. The hotel staff is very friendly.
title: Concert U2

review: After a couple of great experiences at the Clayton Dublin Airport Hotel we decided to stay here in Ballsbridge for a couple of nights. Our room was not quite as spacious as the ones we have had in Dublin Airport, but almost everything else was spot on. We enjoyed an excellent vegetarian meal in the bar. The gym is very well set up and I enjoyed the virtual reality running machines. The beds are super comfortable.Similar to other hotels the buffet breakfast is expensive especially if you are vegetarian but the hotel is located close to some excellent cafes where we went for a morning meal, unfortunately none of these were open on the Sunday morning and we circled back to the hotel where we found we could order off the menu. I don't know if many peolpe do this, as there was a lot of confusion from our waiter!The food was typical hotel breakfast food nothing bad nothing amazing. Other than that our experience was great and the staff in general are fantastic.
title: Our Clayton Hotel experiences have always been good so far!

review: I have been staying in the Hotel for over 2 and a half years between 2 and 3 nights per week and it is highly recommended for its location, welcoming and overall comfort. The staff are very pleasant and in particular the reception team on arrival.The bar staff are also very good and the quality and value of the food is very acceptable. The girls n Reservations are also excellent and whilst I communicate with them a lot by mail I rarely see them - Andrea and Imelda come to mind.
title: Nice place to stay long term

review: Booking in late after a long flight from Asia we arrived, was upgraded and had the most beautiful bed and lovely room. The soft furnishings and quality of the bed was the highest standard of our 2 weeks in Ireland.
title: First night in Ireland was a lovely surprise.

review: We stayed for three unforgettable nights. The people there made us feeling home. Whatever need we expressed they were there to carry them forward. The openness and kindness of the person in charge (a lady) was something I have not experienced in my life and I travel quite often, being a psychologist attend a lot of conferences around the world. The location also could not be more convenient.
title: Wishing to be back!!

review: Nice hotel, rooms are clean and affordable, especially if you go with friends and share rooms together. Didn't try the breakfast there but seemed nice. Service is good.We were there for a U2 concert in Croke Park and we spent a good week-end although it was a mess to find cabs in the city!
title: Good hotel, affordable although a bit far away from the center

review: room very clean and airy,well laid out,all meals excellent,staff attentive ,professional and friendly,seems to come from the top,was asked how was my visit and could he do anything to help more than once,good location ,buses at front of hotel to centre city and other destinations,lawns and trees very soothing after long trip
title: very friendly professional staff

review: If you want to want to be in the city, but just slightly off the beaten track then this hotel is well located. 1) airport bus to and from front door2) DART is 5 mins walk.3) regular bus service into city centre on the door stepOur family room was on the ground floor. We had an issue with the shower - thermostat was very sensitive and made water too hot. When we raised at breakfast the issue was swiftly escalated and resolved before we had finished along with assistance to move room when we had finished.Staff were friendly and attentive. Breakfast was more than adequate and very tasty.My only personal gripe, was the residents bar was shut abruptly! There was an exciting golf match on the tv and for what I would think as a significant hotel they were trying too quick to shut everything around those that were resident and watching and enjoying a drink. The hotel has 24 hour service and I would have expected some discretion - up to 1am at least.As an emigrant from the city, it is well located for a trip to Dublin and enjoy all it has to offer.
title: Well located to enjoy the city

review: This used to be called Bewleys Hotel, and it had been a couple of years since my last visit. However, the hotel is ideally situated next to the British Embassy and for central Dublin. Spacious rooms, pleasant helpful staff. Breakfast was buffet style and plentiful. Will be back.
title: Still a high standard

review: We found the rooms nice and large and the staff very friendly and helpful.Breakfast was excellent.Location good with easy connections to the city centreThe setting of the hotel is in a beautiful old school building
title: Nice friendly well appointed hotel i

review: I stayed here for two nights last weekend, over all it was a very good experience. Location is excellent, pubs, shops etc within a 5 minute walk, very safe to go for a stroll, Room was spotless, great amenities, comfortable bed etc, ate in the bar it was absolutely excellent, service in the bar was also top notch! Breakfast was ok, I didn't find the quality great but it was ok, service for breakfast is excellent though. Reception were very efficient and helpful especially a young man I think his name is Stephen? I couldn't thank him enough so friendly & efficient, and sooooo helpful, no matter what he always gave a service with a smile . I would definitely recommend this hotel & I will certainly be back.
title: 2 night stay

review: This is a no nonsense functional hotel in a great location in Dublin. As always in life you get what you pay for.The staff are friendly and helpful. The food is ok but then one should not expect gourmet standard in any hotel.
title: Functional Hotel

review: This is a beautiful hotel but the rooms were hot and stuffy. One window that only opens part way and a cheap fan did not help much. They show care in most details but our south facing room was just about unlivable. No ice in the rooms. The lobby was like a meat locker and even the halls were cooled! Breakfast was very good but with little sleep, almost nothing is good.
title: No AC in rooms

review: I booked this hotel for a birthday party for my 90 year old mum. The staff were so accommodating of each need,the meal was lovely and it was all handled most professionally by Abbie in bookings. The staff on the day were exceptionally helpful, every request was fulfilled. Great service and most enjoyable... Really recommend it . The atmosphere very relaxed. Thank you. Christine
title: Birthday party

review: This Hotel has an interesting history and a character of its own. The room was clean and comfortable. The food for breakfast is good but advise guests to get up and eat early as the tour buses really impact the food options quickly. Service was always pleasant but also always slow. It is a nice location and gives good access to the sights in Dublin.
title: Stayed three nights, worth it

review: The hotel is really nice and with easy access to public transportation (airport, city center and hop on-hop off busses). The public bus to the city center is only 5 minutes and then 5 minutes walk. There is a very nice square with restaurants, pubs and small store near by the hotel. The hotel is an old well preserved castle with nice rooms. The hotel staff is accommodating and friendly. The breakfast is great and worth the extra 13 euros. The wifi works great. All in all a great experience which we would like to repeat and definitely recommend!
title: Great atmosphere and easy access to public transportation

review: The service received from Vanessa whilst staying at the Clayton was excellent, despite being busy the service was efficient and friendly. The room itself was clean, well laid out and with everything you need, including the best bed I've stayed in.
title: Great service and the comfiest beds!

review: The rooms are big for Ireland and very comfortable. We were only here one night and our evening was planned out for us so I do not know how convenient it is to places in the area. If you are looking for a clean, large comfortable room this is the place to stay.
title: Large clean rooms!

review: My wife and I stayed for 5 days at Clayton Hotel Ballsbridge in Dublin. Upscale location close to restaurants and transportation. The staff was very accomodating and pleasant to deal with from reception to housekeeping, especially Ana and Imelda in reception. The facility could use some refurbishing, but the cost of a stay was about half of the facility across the street. Overall, it was a good experience. Recommended
title: Clayton recommended

review: I foolishly pre-booked and paid for a room here in advance and tried to cancel at late notice but over a busy summer weekend. I tried to recoup some or part of the high price I had paid but it was a flat no referring me to the fine print in their T&C's. Typical big chain approach here. I can't comment on the hotel or amenities as I didn't actually stay here but I certainly won't be back.
title: Read The terms and conditions

review: We stayed at this hotel on our first night in Ireland! Unfortunately, it's quite far from Dublin AND it charges for parking even though it's not right in the city! The breakfast was a typical buffet and wasn't too impressive.The hotel itself isn't as great as it looks online in the photos. However, it is clean & comfortable with very good service.
title: Nice hotel with poor location

review: The hotel is in a nice old building but has all the comfort you need. Staff is very friendly and helpful and breakfast is great. A bus stop right in front of the hotel takes you to the city center very quickly. If you enjoy walking, it takes about 1h...In case you're coming for an event at the Aviva Stadium, it is a 20m walk which is great.The only thing I missed was a gym where I could spend some time while my kids were in their activities.
title: Excellent choice for Dublin

review: At the hotel for 3 nights. No temperature controls for the room. Came back at 3pm still no housekeeping service for the room. No bottled water on arrival or mini bar. Food not great. Not great value for money. Nice staff. As a whole would not recommend. Very far from town centre to. 45 min walk
title: Miss M A Brightly

review: We stayed in this hotel for one night, Friday 15 July 2017. We were able to get a room at very short notice, within two hours of arriving in fact. The hotel is large and busy. The building is really beautiful. We had a most comfortable room, great bed, good bathroom. We also had dinner in the restaurant where we were served by Magda. Magda is a real live asset for this hotel. She was excellent in every way, smiling, polite, erudite and helpful. I hope she is appreciated by her employers. She is a classic example of the old saying - you don't get many like her in a half dozen!- We'll most certainly use this hotel again and look forward to it.
title: Comfortable with great staff

review: My son and I stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are well maintained and bathrooms are clean but with the shower in the bath.We were allocated a room with poor wifi connectivity but were moved once we reported the issue. Wifi is good in the room and lounges. But, be careful as some rooms do not have wifi repeaters and therefore poor connectivity.We only had one meal at the hotel and enjoyed it. Staff are friendly and helpful.
title: Clayton Ballsbridge = good experiences

review: the hotel was very quiet and it was a lovely setting and the bar and food was Good value for money. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to the Aviva Stadium. staff were very friendly and the breakfast was also very nice .
title: Ireland rugby match

review: Comfy hotel, all mod cons, really good breakfast available and caters well for those with allergies/food intolerances. We had a basement room with a courtyard view but it was lovely and airy so didn't actually feel like we were downstairs at all.
title: lovely base to view Dublin from

review: Nice visit with the family. The hotel is in a great location. Near the city centre. Probably 15 mins by bus. Staff are very friendly. Hotel could do with an update but this did not take away from out break.
title: Nice

review: While we have stayed on several occasions at this Hotel it was the last visit gave me the push to give a review.The staff are very professional and welcoming but particularly at the ReceptionThe rooms are perfect and well equippedThe location is terrific being in D4 and very accessible to Dublin by foot or public transport. This is most relevant to us as regular visitors to the City to see our children family and friendsConvenient Parking is chargeable @€10 nightly but we did not need to exit till 6 pm that eveningBreakfast is well worth the extra charge.Overall a nice practical pleasant place to stay and compares very favourably with other Hotels in the area.It suffers the common problem in the Tourist Season of higher prices than the rest of the year.
title: Very practical and pleasant location

review: on a corner of a busy intersection (they all are in Dublin) sits this regal and well-attended hotel with a great staff and welcoming dining are, and the best bed I have EVER slept on! A nifty enclosed central veranda and old style wood and marble everywhere else make this a nice place to see, and stay in.
title: Best beds ever

review: This is a nice hotel a little off the beaten path. It's in an affluent area of the city (Dublin 4) and the building was originally a Masonic girls school in the 1800s. If you're looking for a super-modern chain hotel, this shouldn't be your choice, but if you like some character and charm, check out the Clayton Hotel Ballsbridge. And the staff is very friendly, which made the stay even more pleasant.
title: Very unique place to stay in Dublin

review: Really nice hotel with great staff service. Hotel is slightly outdated, but due to the age it is very nice.We had great friendly service from the entire staff and especially from Fernando in the bar area. He offered great wine selections and made us feel very welcome.
title: Interesting history is the main reason we selected this hotel. Also has good ratings.

review: My husband, daughter & I stayed here for two nights at the start of our visit to Ireland. We enjoyed the hotel & found it to be comfortable for our time in Dublin - clean & the staff was helpful. The hotel is a good 30 minute walk to Trinity College but we enjoyed the walk. We liked being out of the crowds after a day of sightseeing in the center of the city. The breakfast buffet was really nice & the bar is decent if you want a quick bite to eat. I would stay here again if I was back in Dublin.
title: Nice stay at the Clayton Hotel Ballsbridge

review: The 4 night stay was very enjoyable. Without exception the staff were friendly and accommodating. Special mention to Maria and Renata at the terrific Coffee Shop for going out of their way to obtain the perfect coffee for my elderly mother and making a big fuss of my daughter. Please can we have more of your gorgeous cakes on display to choose from next year?! Rooms were of excellent standard and cleanliness, would it be possible to include hot chocolate and biscuits with the beverages? Can't forget to mention the fabulous breakfast - the choice and quality were probably up there with anywhere else on offer in the City. The hotel is situated in a lovely area of Dublin and was close to all the major travel routes. Shall be back soon x
title: Great Stay

review: We stayed in the hotel for the second time in July. Our stay got off to a disappointing start when we were allocated a very small room on the executive floor. The staff on reception seemed surprised we didn't like the room but did move us to a better room when I expressed my disappointment with our room. The location is great to explore Dublin City or the beautiful area surrounding the hotel.Would recommend the hotel for those who want a hotel close to the city centre but away from the hustle and bustle
title: Good Location

review: I have now been to Dublin a few times and stayed in multiple hotels. I love the city and have stayed in great locations, but this is my favorite and where I will stay from now on. First, the location is perfect. You can still walk to Temple Bar and Grafton for all the main shopping areas and bars. But you are in a lovely, quiet area with everything still at your fingertips. You also have more locals around you than just the tourists that take over Temple Bar. The hotel is beautifully designed and very artistic. We had a king room with an entire corner of windows. The rooms are also designed very creatively, but also very clean and elegant. We had a record player with and a vintage speaker with modern technology (blue tooth, adapters, etc). At level 2 of 10 it was SO loud - we are actually going to order one for our own house. We have a Samsung sound bar, but this speaker was so clear and crisp. I love the unique art in the rooms with the artists listed- I took pictures and plan on ordering art by them! The bathroom was large and clean with a great shower and even heated towel racks. A lovely bar and beer garden - also a full rooftop restaurant. I loved this place - it was truly unique without trying too hard. Can't wait to go back!
title: New Favorite Hotel in Dublin - Beautiful Rooms and Art - Better location than Temple Bar!

review: The service is warm and personal. There are so many sweet and personal touches which set them apart. The room itself (note; we did stay in a Penthouse, however I believe it's just a bigger version of other rooms) has such modern and warm decor, with the perfect amenities. The rooftop restaurant / bar had delish cocktails and food with a wonderful view. Fantastic location. Very fair pricing. All in all - great concept.
title: Hotel provides an experience. Outstanding.

review: When you book a hotel it's usually to sleep. With the nightclub in this hotel literally shaking the walls of your room down you will not sleep a wink. It's 2.54 am as I write this and I feel as if I have just been scammed by the Dean. I'm a frequent traveler and hands down my worst experience at a hotel ever.
title: Do not stay here!

review: I wish I had nothing bad to say about The Dean as is a gorgeous quirky hotel, with great deco. But, the absurd amount of noise that comes from the night club on the ground floor, is horrendous and a massive disruption for the night sleep, even if my night sleep only started at 02.00 am. Is ridiculous loud and not acceptable. It outweighs any other good feedback about this place. Is a shame and I actually feel sorry for the staff, as they do a great job, but at the end, the noise from the night club, kills any effort and positive feedback.
title: Quirky hotel where is impossible to sleep!!

review: This hotel is conveniently located to all the central Dublin sights. It is also located amid some nightclubs and has one itself. That said, it is not a perfectly quiet place for lodging. But, soundproofing is actually very good and we had no problems staying on the first floor. The room was tiny but so fun with a twin over queen bunk. The shower was awesome after a long day of walking beautiful Dublin. Rooftop restaurant/bar is lovely and lobby bar is active all day. Overall we would recommend The Dean and happily stay there again!
title: Cool boutique hotel in great location

review: Stayed at the hotel for three nights and really have only positive things to saw. What a great / hip / buzzing hotel (a little loud perhaps but that is no secret if you read the reviews before coming - they do give earplugs to sleep too which I found hilarious). The service was fantastic / great bar and restaurant which was also gluten free & vegan friendly. Loved the room decor and features. Can't wait to go back with the Mrs.
title: Fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of the city

review: I really want to like this place and write a great review, and it is great in many respects - funky, quirky designed room, great bar and reception area and friendly staff. But I'm in a room which is literally a handful of metres from Copperface Jacks Nightclub. It's 3.20am on a Tuesday night and the music has only just stopped pumping out. I booked via Booking.com and didn't see any reference at point of purchase to the noise level, and it's fair to say I haven't experienced anything like it in a hotel. Really disappointed - I'm here for business, have barely slept and will be knackered tomorrow. The earplugs were not a good sign when I first arrived - if the hotel owners know it's that bad, specific reference needs to be made to the noise issue when booking. I'm being moved tomorrow night, but having now seen the other reviews on Trip Advisor it's clearly a common issue. Shame.
title: Nightclub noise till 3.30am

review: Really cool and nice hotel situated within walkable distance to many sights in Dublin. Stayed for 3 nights. The room was nice (superoom), comfortable bed and lots of amenities. As we stayed over the weekend and on the 2nd floor, there was a lot of noise from the hotel bars. Luckily they provide you with earplugs - so we got a good night sleep either way. Had dinner one night at Sophie's (topfloor) and had tasteful gnocchi. Reservation is recommended, aspecially during the weekend, as the place was packed. Would like to come back at another occasion. Recommended!
title: Nice hotel

review: Wow! Very Boutique, Chic, Stylish hotel - not my traditional style but I was blown away by the service and accommodations. I would highly recommend The Dean to every person staying in Dublin. The accommodations were great but most importantly the staff was AMAZING - it's like having you're own personal concierge!!!! When I return to Dublin I will only stay at The Dean. Love Love The Dean! Ally and Tom were awesome.
title: Amazing Experience

review: We stayed in the Dean for a one night trip, we were attending a concert across the road from the hotel so the location was perfect. The room was A Hi-Fi room that we paid 225e for without breakfast. The room was stunning, very unique. Lots of quirky touches like the orange SMEG mini fridge. We ate in the restaurant...slightly pricey but we just had pizza and that was reasonable. We drank in the bar, very friendly staff...expensive drinks. We had been warned about the noise and as we were out until 11 30 ourselves we did sleep through it ( with the help of the pricey drinks I mentioned earlier) . They leave ear plugs beside the bed...they were very useful. Rooms were very warm...and when I opened the window the noise obviously increased so we just left the ceiling fan on all night. I would recommend this hotel for young couples, groups of friends. Maybe not families or older folks...we really enjoyed the experience even if we are quite tired now!!
title: Super Stylish Boutique hotel

review: Just the best in hotel hospitality I've experienced from the moment we arrived the staff were amazing and soo thoughtful!! Finding out what we needed to do and helping us to achieve it.Reception staff and especially "Apple" in the rooftop breakfast , soo happy and full of enthusiasm. Management take note you are very lucky to have a great team ! Only one little niggle which seems to be a popular negative is the nightclubs close by , and the music into the small hours , if you can't bear the noise .......join them Or ask really politely to move , they will help if they can. Or bigger ear defenders!! So a massive thank you for making our 18th birthday celebration a truly memorable one and hope to see you guys and girls next time Best always Liam McG
title: 18th birthday treat

review: I was excited on arrival by the look and feel of this hotel, but by the time I left the following day I was utterly disgusted by their utter disregard for their guests' comfort and satisfaction. I thin the following response to my agent's complaint letter will tell you all you need to know about why you should choose ANY other hotel in Dublin. So disappointed - Goodness only knows just how appalling it might of been, had I been a leisure traveller!Management Response:I'm sorry your client had a noise affected stay with us. Thanks for taking the time to flag this with us. We do have big issues with noise on Harcourt Street. We have some rooms that are quiet-er but nothing we'd consider silent by a long stretch. Harcourt street is the singlemost busiest area in Dublin/Ireland for nightlife in general, we're completely surrounded by night clubs/late venues.
