Although there is little we can do to control this, we try to assign the quiet-est rooms to corporate guests, longer stays, pre-requests etc. to minimize the impact on our guests. I'm sorry if this wasn't communicated on arrival, I will follow up internally to prevent the next guest from being in the same position.  As recently as this week we have undertaken additional construction work/acoustic insulation at our expense to isolate us from our neighbours. We're working hard behind the scenes as a management to lessen the impact of noise on our guests comfort.  In relation to the lights, coffee machine and basin - we greatly appreciate feedback and I have personally followed up with our housekeeping and maintenance teams to ensure it does not happen for another guest.  As a gesture, let me look after your client for the following should you ever be in a position to return:
title: DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT TO HAVE ANY REST AT ALL

review: The Dean is not for travelers who want a quiet night's rest.It is a fun and rocking hotel with a very cool bar/lobby and a truly Epic rooftop restaurant called Maggie's . Good is excellent with a fun vibe and beautifying views of Dublin.Could be the best restaurant scene in all of Dublin.Good pizza and pasta (and breakfast was also )Rooms are funky , but very loud at nightThe hotel is in a row of nightclubs and the bass and music is thumping into very late in the night...Earplugs might be needed.Fun times ; but koud
title: Stylish Boutique Hotel, fun but noisy

review: The accommodation was exceptionally clean and the location is a centre as can be which is amazing for the low price of the accommodation. The shared kitchen is great for travellers on a budget as it allows you to prepare your own meals. Staff are very helpful if you have any issues and security on the site seems tight. The only drawback is the windows are single glazed and as the main roads are nearby it may not be great for those who are woken easily.
title: Great value accomodation

review: Confession- I graduated from the Other Dublin University. Even so, I have a major grá (love) for this campus. I pass through every day to and from work and it's an oasis of academia (and tourism) in the city Center. Some day I'll even make it to the Book of Kells- once I've worked out at what time the queues are shortest.. but even so, I love the courtesy of having sunshades over the queue for the library- so polite. You don't see that in Paris..
title: Oldest university in Ireland

review: Had a tour around Trinity College Campus by one of the students who had only done one tour but she was excellent, very enthusiastic and knowledgeable. Was very interesting to look around and the personable experiences bought I to life of living on campus and the history behind the different buildings. However the queue for Bok of kells was quite long and was rather disappointing in the end.
title: Very enjoyable tour

review: When I booked I had a romantic vision of being in a wood panelled room with a large leather topped desk but the reality was really basic student digs. The room was large, a single bed and a shower and loo. Down the hall was tea and coffee making facilities. The college is beautiful, a stunning building and bang in the centre of Dublin. There's a cafe there The Buttery that does cheap studenty food, lasange, cooked breakfast etc that's cheap and not bad.The only drawback was check out was 10am and they knock on your at exactly 10am to get you to vacate. An hour later would be so much better. The room cost around 70 euros which is very good for the centre.
title: Bang in the centre of Dublin

review: If you are into dormitory accommodation, this is your place to stay. Great location.I will not take this kind of accommodation because it is too noisy ( students lot of loud noise all night ). Shared bathroom and if you are not slim good luck fitting into that shower. Shower size is almost 36" x 36".
title: Dormitory Accomodation

review: Clean, secure and central in Dublin. Expensive for what it was - a tiny room with single bed and shared bathroom worked out at £50 on HostelWorld for a midweek night. Should be cheaper as comparable prices around Dublin can get you lots more for an extra £10 or £20.
title: Goldsmith Hall Accommodation

review: I booked this for a city break with my daughter and was attracted by the central location. Accommodation in Dublin is relatively expensive, particularly the city centre hotels. I booked online and chose a twin ensuite room but what we actually got was a whole apartment with 2 single rooms, a bathroom, a lounge and a kitchen. We were only there for one night but if we'd been staying longer we would have made more use of the lounge and kitchen. It was clean, secure, had free Wi-Fi and was located in a nice quiet corner of the campus - ideal for our needs. There was also luggage storage available before check-in and after check-out, which was handy.
title: Great location at a reasonable price

review: Central, but quiet location, clean room and bathroom, very helpful staff. I had a private room which was not too small for a single person. Kitchen facilities were ok. Would stay there again next time!
title: Helpful staff!

review: The location is fantastic. We stayed in a two room apartment at Botany Bay. It is basic but fine. There were no cooking pots although there was a cooker. But Maureen, the cleaning lady, was extremely nice and helpful, and she found us some pots. Main issue is the price. We paid 800 euros for six nights plus 60 for a camp bed for three of nights. This was the best part of 1000 euros for STUDENT rooms for less than a week.Also the door cards stopped working several times and we had to go back to the accommodation office repeatedly to have them reactivated.The restaurant in the campus closes at 15.30 which is very early.On Friday night the students upstairs were extremely extremely rowdy and disruptive and were shouting and jumping around like a herd of animals
title: Central, quite ok accommodation, but very expensive. Maureen the cleaning lady great. Extremely noisy students upstairs.

review: Dublin is not a cheap place to visit, but every now and then a bargain surfaces amongst the greed of a constant roundabout of tourists.For those that want a bargain, and are not worried about a luxurious stay, then I can highly recommend Trinity College Campus accommodation for a stay in Dublin.From May until September when the students are not on site, the accommodation can be rented out, and for a fraction off the cost of a normal hotel stay.The accommodation is basic, and by that I mean, a bed, table, wardrobe and for me a shared bathroom and toilet. But you get what you paid for, and at £69 for a nights accommodation in the heart of Dublin, it worked to my pockets advantage.
title: Excellent value

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: I travel a lot and normally stay at airport hotels the night before I leave for an early morning flight and this one met my expectations. This trip I was with family. It was a basic airport hotel -- nothing fancy but fit the bill. We did not eat at the restaurant in the hotel. Though there were other hotels closer, I did not want to hear airplane noise. The shuttle ride was short. Just make sure you book it early to get a choice of departure times.
title: Easy to get to

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Hotel was under construction and we were not told prior to arrival even though a Hilton Honors member. Service tried to be helpful but due to inexperience failed. Plenty of other choices around airport for accommodation
title: Nice try

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Standard Hilton fayre here. Truly nothing exceptional. Bar area could do with a makeover. Rooms are fine. This hotel suits those who need overnight accommodation for early flights. It's not cheap either and they've just started charging for the hotel airport shuttle!
title: One night only for connecting flight

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Older hotel, however room was clean and comfortable. Food at hotel bar was poor. Over cooked meat and guacamole was brown. Shuttle bus driver was friendly and attentive. Fine for one night before flying.
title: Average

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Pricey for what you get; we paid 123 euros for the night. On arrival about 6-7 pm we asked to book the 7 am shuttle bus to the airport the following day but we were informed that it was already full and we could only book for the 6.30 or 7.45 am times. This was disappointing as this meant we lost half an hour of sleep as we unnecessarily had to get the 6.30 bus. Next time we will book the bus shuttle time before we travel. There was some small blood splatter stains on the bed duvet which although small I didn’t like. Bed comfortable and toiletries provided. The room was a bit stuffy as you cannot open the windows which we like to do.As breakfast isn’t served until 6.30 we got a breakfast brown bag the following morning for our travel which was very basic but better than nothing. It would have been nice to have a few more things like a breakfast bar and a hard boiled egg. The location of the hotel is good as it is near a large shopping centre and couple of eateries. We ate in the evening in the nearby American diner which was just okay.
title: Pricey for what you get.

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Enjoyed a few days here visiting with friends and family. The room was quiet and very clean. Front desk personnel were extremely helpful. Our dinners were great! They served breakfast until 10:30. This was great as we are late sleepers.
title: Lovely Hotel with great service!

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: The Hilton was as expected. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and the necessities were adequately provided. After traveling to Dublin, Madrid, Paris, London, and then back to Dublin (Hilton) for a one night stay before hopping on a plane back to the States we were a bit tired and decided to eat at the hotel restaurant (Burnell). We were not expecting much but were more than surprised. One of the best dining experiences we had during our trip and we ate at many fine restaurants. Also, the shuttle to and from the airport was very convenient. But beware there really is not much to do at the hotel's location so if you are looking for the Dublin experience: it will not be found unless you take a taxi for a 30 minute ride. Good job Hilton Dublin Airport team.
title: Comfy beds and an excellent restaurant

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: After waiting over 1 and half hours at airport for the shuttle which was supposed to be half hourly, we complained upon check in and it was just dismissed as though they couldn't care less. Room was spacious and clean. Service and food in restaurant average. Not the best for Hilton.
title: Poor service

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: I favor Hiltons and this was just an OK Hilton. A little frayed at the edges, but worth staying in for that early flight the next morning. It's about a 15 minute bus ride from the airport, and the shuttle service was a bit erratic -- not on time as scheduled. Wish the hotel lobby had 24 hour coffee, but took it away at 6:30 am, which seemed a bit chintzy. All in all, a 3.5 stars.
title: Not on airport campus, an OK Hilton

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: A little far from airport and shuttle requires fee. Free for HH members. Dinner was good, also had entertainment in bar, which was also good. Bed was a queen but was two less than twins couples together, not great, but we were exhausted and slept well.
title: Pre-Departure Hotel stay

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: You would think being relatively close to a hotel would make this place business focused. The wifi is practically useless no matter what on you choose. Rooms are comfortable and spacious but a bottle of water would be nice. Massively over priced for what you get and neither breakfast nor parking is included.The check out process is pure chaos, queue skipping and staff making a phone call while dealing with you is not what you;d expect at a hilton.One of the lifts was out of order and the signage to guide you to the reception was bizzare to say the least.On the approach to the hotel there is no clear signs (at night) to guide you to the hotle or the car park. When you eventually find the car park it is not obvious which way you should go in or out of it either.Some small changes here would make a big difference.
title: Wifi is a utility, not a luxury - Rooms over-priced

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: We stayed on the return leg of our Italian holiday - they treat their diamond members very well, we were upgraded to a lovely corner room. Combined with complimentary breakfast the stay was great value. Given the size of long stay parking in Dublin, and the frequency of the buses to the car park, you can get to the hotel quicker than your car most times. Pity the shuttle doesn't run for an extra hour as many European flights arrive around midnight - the taxi is only €15 though.
title: Very comfortable hotel, away from the husle and bustle of the airport

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: First time I was not happy with your facility, have stayed there numerous times. The restaurant / bar upgrade was a step in the right direction but the drop off in service and attention to detail on food orders was definitely a step in the wrong direction, hope fully this can be fixed before it causes you to loose loyal customers.
title: First time unhappy with overall experience at your facility

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: We spent 2 nights here one after arriving and one before leaving. Great rooms, some shopping and food close by. Also breakfast and bar/ restaurant in hotel. Staff was excellent, helpful and friendly. Prices are reasonable. Shuttle to the airport, but be sure you get outside early as they fill up fast. Would stay here again. There is a shopping mall across the street with grocery store as well. We did not have time to go but looks fairly large.
title: Close to Airport and Dublin

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: A really disappointing Hilton. Firstly, the 10.20pm hotel shuttle didn't show up to the airport as per the schedule - annoying in the height of summer but if the weather was bad or if it was the depths of winter, I would be going nuts.There was a chipped cup in the bedroom and there were marks on the splashback if the bathroom sink - obviously not been cleaned properly after the last occupant.We went out on Saturday and when we got back late on Saturday evening, our room hadn't been serviced which was really annoying - especially as we're supposed to be valued members of the Hilton loyalty programme. We had a late checkout booked as my partner is undergoing medical treatment and I knew he wouldn't be bright eyed and bushy tailed the next day yet despite having the Do Not Disturb card on the door, we still had housekeeping knocking on the door 2 hours before we were due to check out.The buffet breakfast was terrible, lukewarm everything and dried out to within an inch of its life.There's work to be done here
title: What would Conrad say?

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: quiet calm and clean and only place we could find..thank you for such great service..and helping us out ..honored to stay and loved having your bus shuttle too even for 5 am in morning.. thank you we enjoyed our stay
title: excellent place to stay

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Went for a drink last night,restaurant and bar area was just renovated. 7.10 for a pint bottle of bulmers, 5.95 for pint of bud. Crazy, will not be going back unless I remortgage my house. Very slow bar service.
title: Prices in bar are outrageous

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: The hotel was excellent and surprisingly quiet with a big wedding going on. Room was as expected. We did have to wait for the shuttle for 20-30 minutes upon arrival but it was a busy time, especially with a large group arriving along with us. Shuttle ride was about 10-15 minutes.Drawbacks-Left on 6:30am shuttle so missed breakfast. Was told there would be a breakfast takeaway for us but I didn't see one nor was offered at checkout.-Was given a voucher for 2 free drinks at bar due to slight mixup with shuttles etc but the drinks appeared on our bill at checkout. But were quickly removed.-Had hotel call for cab and they asked cash or credit. I said credit but when cab showed up they had us as cash. Not sure whose mistake but left us scrambling a bit to find atm in the city for the return trip.Other Info 20 euro cab ride to airport. 20 euro cab ride to Dublin city. I'd say this hotel is halfway between airport and city so I'd have to say if we had a later flight I probably would've preferred staying in the city and taking the bus back and forth to airport. Not a slight to hotel, just whether or not you want to walk home or cab home after a late night out.
title: Not "AT" the Airport but close enough

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Hilton's restaurant, Burnell, has undergone an amazing transformation. Its redesign merges perfectly elements of new and old Dublin and is a dining experience all will remember whether your stay is for business or pleasure. This Hilton is situated as a gateway into the City, the townships of Malahide and Howth and destinations worldwide
title: Hilton's Restaurant Burnell is great dining experience.

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: The hotel was close to the airport. The shuttle service was on time getting us to the airport. The hotel has all the amenities you need for a stay. The rooms were spacious with comfortable beds and very clean.
title: Convenient

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: This is an older property which appears to be in middle of renovations. The room was large and very comfortable. The bar and restaurant were very poor however but seems to be undergoing some much needed changes.
title: Nice Location

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: We arrived very late due to flight delays and without luggage. Pro Tip - shuttle stops around midnight so get a cab if later than that. We were greeting by a very friendly front desk guy who saw I had checked in on line earlier and quickly had keys for us. Hearing we had no bags he offered up a comp shaving and dental kit. We had a late night room service offering of a decent pizza and a couple glasses of wine...which all hit the spot just fine. We had a quiet and comfortable sleep. Breakfast the next day was very good. Shuttle back to airport was fine and we were off.
title: Good for overnight stay before exploring Ireland

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Picked up at DUB as per schedule by the shuttle , checked in promptly & politely . I was able to select my room on line before my arrival which was very useful. Dined at the hotel's Burnell grill - good food & service. I would definitely stay here again if I find myself on an overnight stay for DUB !
title: Good airport hotel.

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Great location for both Airport, Howth and even for the City as it's an easy drive any way. Hotel is modern so well appointed and clean. Rooms here are bigger than standard. Comfy bed and bedding. Restaurant and bar area very good and well above the normal drab Hilton style. Food in restaurant was superb quality and again well above what I have previously experienced at Hiltons. Great stay and lovely staff too. Recommended.
title: Great Hilton

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: We stayed for one night, prior to catching a flight from Dublin airport. Our room was spacious and modern with a large, comfortable bed. The airport shuttle ran to the published schedule and allowed pre-registration for the trip to the airport in the morning. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly and courteous. Breakfast had a wide selection and everything we tried was fresh and well prepared. We will definitely return if we need a hotel convenient to the airport in Dublin again and would certainly recommend the Hilton to others.
title: Modern, friendly hotel convenient to the airport

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Nice clean hotel with friendly staff. The family room was a little small when all the beds were set up. Pretty quiet even though we were on a busy street. Nice big shuttle to the airport. Kids beds were fold out chairs were not comfortable.
title: Nice modern hotel

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: Stayed in this hotel before flying out the next morning. It was convenient to the airport and had a shuttle service. We took advantage of the shuttle by returning our rental that evening and taking the free shuttle back to the hotel. The ride to the airport the next morning was 2 euro per person so well worth the convenience. The room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast in the morning was pretty good. No complaints and would stay here again.
title: Nice stay on our last night.

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: We have stayed at the hotel recently and the hotel hasn't got any nice feeling, decor isn't the best, hasn't got any special feature or characterWe have ordered a cheeseburger with chips for dinner and the bacon and cheese weren't cooked properly than the waiter has bought new burger but she hasn't bought chips until we have asked where they are and chips have been brought to us only 25 minutes later. We had a cheeseburger but no chipsWe had a breakfast there as well and the choice was really small and not enough items to eat.
title: It is only ok

hotelLocation: Hilton Dublin Airport Hotel Malahide Road, Dublin 17, Ireland
review: AWFUL. Don't stay here. Elevator broken. Very poor room service. Computer issues. Over priced. When we checked out the card to open gate in parking did not work. No one there to help. No phone to call to get assistance. Very big hassle. Stay at the Maldron. Closer to the sirport. A better value and no problems.
title: Dublin Airport Hilton

review: The House offers first class accomodation in a very convenient location. Excellent breakfast. Coffee facilities in the room would be a bonus, but is available in the lounge 24 hours. Staff really helpful and obliging.. secure parking off road.
title: Highly recommended and centrally located.

review: From the moment we arrived at the Pembroke Townhouse Hotel we were made to feel as welcome as if we were staying with friends. Lovely touches like homemade elderflower cordial at reception and a kitchenette opposite reception where you can make tea and coffee and help yourself to gorgeous home baked cookies before flopping into the comfy sofa and armchairs in the lounge area. The staff are all extremely helpful and seem happy to go beyond the call of duty to ensure their guests' comfort. We had asked for 2 rooms next to each other and got 2 rooms in their own little corridor which was lovely. The rooms are not high spec, but clean, quiet and the double beds are huge and very comfortable. Good TV too. Breakfasts are really worth including in your booking. Really the best hotel breakfasts I've had in a long time. Home baking with heavenly soda bread, scones and cakes, even homemade baked beans! The waiting staff were lovely and made each morning a treat. The location is perfect, as it's a 20 minute walk away from the very busy centre, so convenient, but a lovely place to begin and end a busy day of sightseeing in Dublin. And in the evening, if you want to stay close to home, a few v good restaurants within a 10 minute walk. We will be back to Dublin and definitely back to the Pembroke Townhouse Hotel.
title: Home from Home

review: Very good clean bedrooms, big size, clean bathrooms and friendly staff. Close to city and public transport. Thought it should be a little cheaper though. The wifi was excellent. Defintely recommend it
title: Very good

review: A very good travelodge on the outer edges of the city, but a good walk in, and the busess stop right outside and are every few minutes, so no problem with getting in and out. No cafe onsite but a cafe a few doors down that does a really good breakfast and was reasonably priced.
title: Good stay

review: The only noise was the caw of early morning gulls, and it was on a side street that offered pubs, shopping and only a few flat blocks from the main street and the on/off bus. Rooms were large, good bathrooms, and the front desk is helpful.
title: Great value

review: Was very pleasantly surprised at this beautiful hotel it's so spacious and rooms are very generous in size the staff were just lovely and very welcoming breakfast was included in our stay and there was plenty of it will definitely stay here again and on the plus side you are within walking distance to shops temple bar etc highly recommend it.
title: Overnight stay

review: We got dropped off at O'Connel's street from the air coach 700 and the hotel was pretty simple to find from here. It's around a 10 minute walk from the spire in the centre.we already had a good idea of what the hotel looked like from the entrance so we just walked along Talbot street and it was straight forward to find. Only a short walk meant the hotel was in good location. The rooms were in good for value with the location. Breakfast was lovely, good selection with the buffet. Also the carvery was good value for only €8.
title: Holiday / short break

review: Stayed here when attending a concert in Aviva. Location is excellent beside train and bus stations. Hotel is dated, rooms were ok. View from room consisted of a high wall with barbed wire at the top! Breakfast was good. Staff were fine. Security measures in place with buzz in doors. The room cost €240 which included breakfast. I suppose that's Dublin prices!!
title: Expensive stay in Dublin

review: Pluses: Perfect location - close to everything, including a bus station, from where you can get a bus or taxi to the airport. Nice walk to the city centre - 10 minutes away. The hotel and rooms are finished with enough good materials. Breakfast rather good. Big and comfortable room. Disadvantages: Small and uncomfortable bathroom. Strange numeration of rooms (for ex. 311 next to 315). Food could be better. Some elements destroyed (for ex. wallpapers).
title: Solid, average hotele in British style in the city centre.

review: First impression, reception area looks nice and clean. The receptionist was polite, but not very friendly. There is a lift to bring you up to your floor, we were on the 3rd floor. When we got into the room, we were quite disappointed with how UNLIKE the photos on the website the room was, especially the bathroom! It was so small, and did not look anything like the rooms being advertised! There was no shower gel or shampoo in the bathroom, just a really ugly box in the (tiny!) shower attached to the wall, but this was actually empty! The shower itself was also quite dirty, and the taps were broken and there was a dead fly on the blinds. (photos are with the review)The breakfast was not nice, and although it was included in our hotel package, we chose NOT to eat here on the second morning. The location, however, was amazing, approximately 5 minutes from the Spire. I wouldn't stay here again, or recommend it to a friend, unless it was certain the room would actually be nice!
title: An okay hotel for one night

review: We really liked this hotel. The bus stop to the airport is close by, as are shops and pubs. We had a nice quiet room on the first floor which was cleaned every day. The breakfast is great en we enjoyed our stay very much.
title: Great hotel, great location

review: This hotel is convenient to city center and to the bus and tram and so a lot of tour groups stay at this hotel. The room was the biggest I have stayed at in Ireland. The breakfast was very good and so were the beds but, the front desk people were clueless. There was a problem with the computer payment system; we got charged twice for the same room both in advance and at check in. We were so tired that we did not catch the error at the time, and so we had the hotel reverse the charge when we got home.
title: Good for a night's stay to see the city

review: For a city centre hotel this place is well below standard. Very shabby dining area, breakfast limited. Room ok ish, (if you don't mind crawling on all fours to use the room safe). No shelves or rails in bathroom. Staff pleasant and car parking secure, but overall very grubby.
title: Pretty Average

review: We booked this hotel from January and we get a "reasonable " price ( 160 euro/night , breakfast included ) . We stayed some years ago somewhere nearby ,and we liked the zone , it is good for trips , for walk ...This hotel is not too good but also , not too bad . The room ( we had 210 ) is clean , normal size , almost pretty but hasn't a minifridge , air condition ... Well , Ireland is not a hot country but the room needs some air condition , at that price !The breakfast has not fresh vegetables , not at all ! The coffee is not too good !
title: Good location

review: So: I booked this through Booking.com, just after having secured tickets for the only U2 concert in Dublin this year. Hotels were literally disappearing in front of my eyes, so I needed to move fast - even so, I baulked a bit at the €250 per night they were charging - without breakfast!A good location - the bus from the airport stops right across the street, and I could walk to Croke Park in about 20 minutes. The door was locked when I arrived, at just before 11pm - I contacted reception on the intercom. They had to tell me when they'd unlocked the door - there was no other indication.A decent-sized room, with a very pokey bathroom - plenty of towels were provided, but there was nowhere to put them! The bed was comfy, but I was glad to have good earplugs; I was on the first floor, and the double glazing did nothing to block the noise from the street, or the trains that kept rattling by, to and from nearby Connolly Station. Not to mention the lack of soundproofing from other rooms in the hotel. I was also annoyed by the broken hall light outside my room, which meant I was groping my way in the dark!
title: Badly overpriced for U2 concert

review: Ripley Court is in a great location super close to OConnell street and across the street from many bus stops including the airlock busses. Helpful staff. Rooms are spacious and have good decor, however it is a bit dated. Linen and facilities are clean but some work could be done e.g. Tiles were off in our bathroom behind the door and there was some water damage in the vanity. No fridge in our room which was a shame as purchased cold foods/drinks couldn't be kept in the room. We had a good double bed (a bit firm but ok), desk, table and chairs, side tables, safe, luggage rack, ironing board and iron, tea/coffee facilites. Bathroom amenities were a pump of shower gel on the shower wall and hand wash, no shampoo, soap etc. Room serviced daily and pretty quiet. Breakfast was included in our rate and really good. Full English breakfast or continental, included bacon, eggs, toast, cereal, pastries, juice etc. Hotel also had facilities to pack you up a take away lunch but had no evening meal service. Overall we would stay again and recommend this hotel!
title: Great location great breakfast

review: Had a lovely room in this hotel with a four poster bed and had the best nights sleep I have had for weeks. The staff were friendly, efficient and knowledgable. Had a good breakfast buffet with all the Irish breakfast things and also plenty for vegetarians.
title: Great nights sleep

hotelLocation: Dublin Citi Hotel 46-49 Dame Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The only two positive things I can say about this hotel 1. Location2. trinity barBut that's where it ends. Room 308 is really no more than a box room and was extremely hot!!!!. We had to have the window open but the noise outside although I expected was far worse than I expected. There is a fan in the wardrobe but was twin beds and couldn't cover both beds. The lift still isn't working as already reported on hereWould I go back to Dublin again, yes in a heartbeat but never Dublin Citi Hotel
title: Disappointing

review: Stayed as couple with 2 friends over the weekend. In our opinion this 3 star hotel offers more than other 4stars that I have seen. It may not have the latest technology or the hyper modern rooms, but it's clean, decent size of rooms and bathroom and the reception staff attended to our (not so many) needs. We did not use the restaurant but coffee is great. Our room was facing the back/court. Don't know what the reason was, but our rooms were insanely hot although the outside temperature was not hot at all. All in all, great place, on foot to city center, temple bar, grafton street in 15 minutes max. We will come back!
title: Great location, good value for price

review: Literally the worst hotel Ive ever stayed at. Checked in and get to our room it's small and stuffy even with the window open on a very warm day. Then the night comes and it is loud. Not even from the train/ bus station there are what sounds like a billion drunk people on the streets below screaming like a bunch of obnoxious a-holes. We even closed the window and had ear plugs in and could still hear them. Don't know what it was from as there is no pub that close that I was aware of. Do not stay here if you want any sleep.
title: Horrible

review: Small rooms without any of the frills, but to be expected for 3*. No air conditioning and with the windows open you can hear outside and the Luas. The big selling point is the location, it is 1 min walk from Connolly station and 5 min from IFSC,So very convenient for business travelers.
title: Close to the IFSC

review: Stayed here for a concert in Croke Park which was a 15min walk. The hotel is ideal if arriving by bus. Our room was at the back of the hotel and the trainline was literally outside our window which was noisy and had trains on it until just after midnight on the Sat night (thank goodness we were out most of the night!), in the morning they started up again. Our room also looked out onto the pub and youth hostel down the alley so had the pleasure of hearing lots of loud drunken late night talking and as it was hot in the room we had to have the window open for some fresh air. The room also lacked plug sockets. Down stairs reception is bright and modern but upstairs and the rooms are a little dated.We had our evening meal in the bar and we enjoyed it although the bar area is quite small and you may struggle to get a table. Breakfast was in the restaurant and there was plenty of choice.Staff we came in to contact with were very friendly and helpful.I know hotels put prices up for a concert but we really did pay over the odds for a room here. I would stay hereI wouldn't stay here again for more than one night due to the noise at night.
title: OK for one night stay.

review: The Marker is a 5 star hotel from the minute you walk into the lobby. The service is second to none, the check in process delightful remembering you if you stay frequently. The rooms are sizeable with very comfortable amenities. Bathrooms are modern updated with radiant flooring. Restaurant has great breakfast options and the bar has a nice whiskey selection. No doubt this is my hands down favorite hotel in Dublin.
title: Favorite hotel in Dublin

review: Excellent service and staff so helpful. Will definitely return!Loved the little treat left in our room for wedding anniversary.Unfortunately we were unable to go up to rooftop bar as when we arrived back to hotel it had closed which was disappointing.
title: The MARKER HOTEL

review: I always enjoy staying the Marker, it's right next to my office. The feeling is very modern and chic, sort of like a W hotel but with more personal distinction. I like the big rooms and most of all the BIG bathtub! Two things perturbed me a bit in this stay:1. Forgot Wristbands in my hotel Room and they ended up not being found. Very strange.2. Was told to wait inside for Taxis, although a line of Taxis was outside.. what's the holdup?
title: A good hotel but left a bit sad about items that were lost in my room

review: We loved The Marker! The location is great.. close to everything but not too close.. you felt as though you were in an exclusive area on the water and only a short 15 MINUTES walk to Grafton Street. Service /staff was EXCELLENT.. Loved the spa and rooftop bar. We will be back!
title: First time to Dublin

review: Had a great stay at the hotel from check in to check out. The staff were not only extremely friendly but very helpful with assisting us with our car trouble (flat tire) and recommending touring and restaurant options. Beautiful hotel with great upkeep. Only slight issue was with the breakfast selection which wasn't vast and lacked fresh vegetables. Nonetheless, will highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Dublin
title: Excellent hotel with great helpful friendly staff

review: The Marker has great staff. When you check in they walk you right to the elevator and ensure everything is set for your stay. The rooms are large and quiet. The staff take great care in their evening turndown and cleaning service. The Marker is the best hotel I have stayed in in Dublin.
title: Excellent Hotel

review: Reception staff was very friendly, beds comfortable and rooms very clean, hotel is located right in the heart of the city centre so what more would you want to enjoy your mini trip to Dublin. The breakfast was divine, couldn't hope for more! Would highly recommend it!
title: Friendliest staff ever, spotless rooms, delicious brteakfast!

review: Book there and go back! A nice spot to relax and enjoy the city close to the city. Definitely a place I will go back next time I will be in town. Located in a new area of the city with every convenience needed to enjoy yourself.
title: Nice place in a nice city

review: There is no other hotel in Dublin which provides you with more modern amenities. It's QUIET for sleeping, yet he bar downstairs is always buzzing with energy. The housekeeping staff is second to none. Our room was serviced twice daily. The beds are incredibly comfortable. The area is so unique. You can see out your hotel window to the top tech company buildings in the world. The Bord Gais Energy Theater is practically in the lobby it's so close.I researched hotels/neighborhoods in Dublin for months before our trip. I narrowed it down to The Merrion, The Westbury and the Marker. We visited the westbury and the merrion during our trip for drinks and dinner. We are so glad we chose The Marker to stay. It is out of the busy tourist areas, but yet they are still a short walk or cheap cab fare away (7-10 euro). The docklands area is a remarkable sight as well. The three tourist buses stop around the corner if you desire that. And the buffet breakfast....wow. Make sure you have a meal at Osteria Lucio, which is about 5 minute walk away. Casual and delicious meal.
title: Just book here. Stop looking anywhere else!

review: I had one night here on my own while I was working and for just me it suited well enough. Unfortunately my girlfriend joined me for the weekend and I just didn't feel comfortable letting her stay here.My immediate grievance is that they took a photo of my passport and both sides of my debit card. If I suffer identify theft in the short future, I certainly know who to blame. This is not an appropriate behaviour!Next, the hotel is not terrible but there's just nothing even slightly impressive about it, and many things that just chip away at it.The location is ideal for busses, trams and taxis with the stop outside the hotel. The downside is that the stop is right outside and at least midnight, you have the related noises of them.It's also not in a particular nice area to walk back to in the evening. Dark streets, under a railway bridge, and as a result I really wished I had chosen somewhere more central.The bedroom was tiny but appeared clean, despite one of the windows being filthy oj the outside. The Wi-Fi is very poor, and the television tuning wasn't even worth turning the television on for; 2 channels had a reasonable picture but with static for audio and the rest were unwatchable.Leaving cheap laminated notes/instructions for the guests all over the hotel room also just looks tacky.The doors in this building don't seem to fit the frames so all night we heard doors being slammed shut (including the front door to the hotel).The breakfast was poor, continually running out of items and didn't particularly taste fresh. Also while we were having breakfast, part of the plaster wall fell down.Special credit to Lucia though; who is easily the most unapproachable person I have ever come across. This was the first person I met when i entered the hotel and as she checked me in, it was clear she wasn't interested in me as a guest. I gave her the benefit of the doubt but the same attitude existed at breakfast.If it was just myself, I wouldn't have cared too much about some of these but I just felt embarrassed to being my girlfriend to this hotel.I wouldn't even consider staying here again.
title: Feels like a motel/hostel

review: A fantastic location, in the centre of temple bar. This hotel is very clean. The staff are very friendly & welcoming... Great rates for its location & facilities.Lovely tea & coffee served in reception, which is a very nice touch. This hotel has special rates with the car-park opposite, which is a major plus for central Dublin. Love it here, already booked for my second visit....
title: Spot on!!!

review: We stayed here for one Saturday night before the Coldplay concert. Although it was expensive £315 for 1 night, all hotels are about that in centre. This is in a great location. Bathroom is massive. We booked the exquisite double room and it was lovely
title: Great location, comfy bed, amazing bathroom

review: The Hotel was ok. I had read that the hotel had been renovated prior to booking. The common areas were very nice, but our room was less than great. We had a triple room, which was located at the back end of the hotel. our first issue was the hotel has no air conditioner, which as a whole wouldn't be an issue, but the area of the hotel we were in (room 312) was about 10 - 15 degrees warmer than the rest. Inside the room it was boiling. The room had 3 single beds, and fit just about that. There was just about 12" in between each bed, and maybe 1 1/2 feet at the end. Pretty tight with 3 people and their luggage. Thank goodness we all had carry-ons only. Us and full size suitcases would not have fit. The bathroom, small as well, had no counter space and the shower stall was just that. You had to shimmy to get in and out of it. There was nothing remodeled in the room and definitely showed wear, with cracked tile around the sink area. The staff was mostly friendly and the location you can't beat for all of the tourist attractions, but if your more than 2 people and/or staying for more than a few days, I'd try somewhere different
title: Fine for a weekend

review: Stayed over night when visited Dublin for a ZZ Top gig. When you first enter, the ground floor looks suspicious as there's nothing there bar a lift and entrance to TGI Fridays. When you arrive at reception on 1st floor you'll start to see the quirky and charming nature of this hotel. It's a bit of a maze on the upper floors. Rooms are small but comfortable. Bathroom was clean and spacious. The bed in our room was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in!! Staff were pleasant and ready to help - we left our luggage in storeroom to go exploring the city. Breakfast buffet offered reasonable options for a small boutique hotel - everything was nice and fresh. Overall highly recommend.
title: Weekend trip to Dublin

review: We stayed at the Fleet Street Hotel in Dublin in July 2017. The location is really good, right near Temple Bar and very close to the bus stop for Galway. The hotel is above the street level so you have to take the lift or walk the stairs, and they have security at the door in the evening and at night to control access. The decor is modern and the staff were very friendly. My brother, a smoker was pleased to learn that they had two outdoor terraces available for smokers.
title: Fleet Street Hotel Great Location

hotelLocation: The Belvedere Hotel Denmark Street Great, Dublin D01W1C0, Ireland
review: The price is maybe a little bit higher than one expects, but just after your arrival you realize why. You are welcome by smiling and efficient staff. Then you visit your room which is spacious and luxurious. Perfect location and amazing breakfast!
title: Very nice

hotelLocation: The Belvedere Hotel Denmark Street Great, Dublin D01W1C0, Ireland
review: Every time we asked for something we were told no. For example, do you change money - no, do you have a laundry service - no, do you have a computer I can use - no. But the worst was our second night - we called to see if we could dine in the hotel and were told yes. When we went to the dining room we were told we couldn't eat there because there was no food. Then we were told we could eat in the bar, but someone from the front desk came and said no we couldn't. We asked if we could order a pizza and someone had to go ask the chef. Eventually we got a pizza (probably frozen) and it was awful. Apparently they cater to tour groups and were only feeding the tour group. We did go to the Irish Night on our last night and it was wonderful, however, the meat was dry and tough. We travel a lot and this was a very strange experience. The room was stuffy and the last night there was a party or a fight going on in the street and we had to close our window so it got even stuffier.
title: The Hotel of "No"

hotelLocation: The Belvedere Hotel Denmark Street Great, Dublin D01W1C0, Ireland
review: I was looking for a cheap weekend break to see the sights of Dublin. This hotel is two minutes walk from O'Connell Street where you can catch the hop on hop off bus to tour the city. I believe the airport bus is right outside the hotel. Mark and his colleagues are extremely helpful. The breakfast was lovely and vegetarians can request mushrooms and tomatoes, also eggs are available to be cooked to your liking. We booked the Irish night and a three course meal and this was all superb. The entrance of the hotel and toilets are lovely, however the bedrooms are a little dated and damaged but I do believe it is all down for refurbishment. Only used as a base and suited us perfect
title: Excellent staff

hotelLocation: The Belvedere Hotel Denmark Street Great, Dublin D01W1C0, Ireland
review: We had a quad room which was a good size considering there were 2 of us. Shower could be improved. Attention to detail needed in rooms as we had coffee, milk and sugar but no tea! One of the cups was cracked which we then threw away as it got washed up and put back!!Breakfast was OK. Don't think the morning chef was well trained. Restaurant staff also need training. When you refill a dish you don't put a dirty spoon back in (: Good selection though.We also had dinner in the hotel which was good and we thoroughly enjoyed the Irish Night we went to.
title: Short City Stay

hotelLocation: The Belvedere Hotel Denmark Street Great, Dublin D01W1C0, Ireland
review: We stayed in a triple room for one night.The room was clean and had comfortable beds. There is no air conditioning which meant the room was very warm. There was a small window which we opened but were awoken by noise ( bins being emptied) very early.We had breakfast in the hotel which was ok, very limited for vegetarians.The location of the hotel is the best thing about it, very close to city centre.Alright for one night but we would not be keen to stay longer.
title: Good location

hotelLocation: The Belvedere Hotel Denmark Street Great, Dublin D01W1C0, Ireland
review: We were down in Dublin for a concert, so just stayed one night. The hotel is in a good location when traveling from the North. We got parked on the street opposite which was handy! We stayed in a refurbished family room which was really nice, clean and comfortable. With cool coffee machine! My husband had a meal in the hotel, it was good and value for money. Breakfast was ok, seemed busy due to tour groups! Overall a lovely hotel and would stay here again!
title: Great hotel!

hotelLocation: The Belvedere Hotel Denmark Street Great, Dublin D01W1C0, Ireland
review: double room adequate, bed a bit small and quite stuffy in July but side road relatively quiet. Breakfast plentiful but a little disorganised, single coffee machine and some waiting for food but guess better is fresh than warmed for hours.Our shower room was brand new and freesat TV. We only paid €139 B&B, if you paid much more I think you would be disappointed. Helpful staff on reception but only one small lift.
title: good location, hotel OK if you get good discount.

hotelLocation: The Belvedere Hotel Denmark Street Great, Dublin D01W1C0, Ireland
review: My friend and I stayed in this hotel a couple of weeks ago. I booked thorough booking.com 24 hours before we stayed. The hotel advertises no booking fee on their website but apparently according to one staff member in the 'fine' print it states that the hotel will put a holding fee on your booking but your card will not be charged. When I checked out I paid for our stay. That was two weeks ago and the holding fee is still on my account and there is essentially 300 euro in my account I cannot access. I just wanted to let future guests know as this has been a serious inconvenience for me this last two weeks.Hotel was fine, bed was fine, bathroom.
title: Be careful - read the fine print

hotelLocation: The Belvedere Hotel Denmark Street Great, Dublin D01W1C0, Ireland
review: I specifically requested a quiet room when making booking & the possibility of a newly refurbished room. Had a bad feeling when there was a snigger about the possibility of a newly refurbished as we were getting a mid summer madness deal but was guaranteed a quiet room which was crucial for our stay! Confirmed upon arrival "yes, we will have a quiet room". Lying awake the last half hour due to a delivery van with carpet clean outside our wide. We awoke often throughout night with street noise. Was told parking was 10 minutes walk but never told it was Clerys Carpark & drove around in circles to find it. Have to spend another night here, very unhappy, never again. On first floor, restless sleep with important day ahead, yes it is what it says; " mid summer madness".
title: Awful

review: If you like a small room, untidy floor and industrial extractor fans all day then this is for you! I've stayed in this hotel before and took into account the location and the fact that the building is old. The beds were comfortable. However, this time there was no escaping the fact that the room had not been cleaned and the noise level was beyond ridiculous. Previously I had been at the front of the property so nightlife influences things considerably. But the room this time was so small there was no escaping the noise. It sounded like the window was fully open - and it wasn't. The only quiet place was the bathroom, and had there been a bath I most likely would have slept there. Having had a terrible sleep even with ear plugs, I stepped out of the bed to go for a refreshing shower and found that a piece of pepper that had been around the bed - not mine - became stuck to my foot. The level of gross was not pleasant to say the least.The bar is lovely, the location great if you're completely deaf and the rooms a roll of the dice. For the area there are better choices that give a good nights rest.
title: Terrible

review: The Central Hotel is in an amazing location, right in the heart of Temple Bar area and super close to all the amazing bars and shopping areas. It's 10 minutes dander to the nearest tram stop (Jervis) making it so easy to get anywhere in the city! There is a bit of noise from the street at night but that's really all you can expect from being so centrally located. The hotel is a bit old fashioned (if that means anything to you!) but it's clean and the staff are all lovely. I don't think the look of the place really matters anyway, a hotel is a place to sleep and especially in Dublin where there is so much to explore I was certainly not worried about the décor! It's an incredible price for the city especially when you consider the spectacular location and I would recommend it to anyone!
title: Great hotel

review: Great location, Great old hotel. Wonderful atmosphere, especially the Library Bar. Staff helpful and friendly. Downsides are no A/C, and you get street noise all night. But easy walking distance to sites, shopping, and nightlife.
title: If sleep isn't required...

review: We stayed in the central as it was one of the very few hotels in Dublin available, Now we know why it was. Its tired and worn out, small old fashioned rooms with no double glazing to block out the street noise which continues until after 3am. The general decor is old and worn, the curtain in our room was splattered with what appeared to be liquid makeup and the standard of cleanliness in general was poor.I wouldnt recommend staying
title: Worn Out and Noisy Hotel

review: The hotel is attached to a disco bar. Loud music until 3AM! The nights were warm and there was no ventilation/AC. The staff not the typical Irish hospitality. It is centrally located. Definitely not worth staying. Worst hotel of our month long trip.
title: Mr.

review: Very centrally based character Victorian hotel. Good value breakfast(E10). . Within walking distance of most central Dublin attractions (5 minutes to Grafton Street, O'Connell street, Dublin Castle etc)
title: Excellent Location

review: Outdated. No air conditioning. Tiny, dirty rooms. Soiled bed linens. No screens in windows. Loud music every night until 4 am. Rude staff. Overcharged on bill upon departure. All around huge disappointment. Only saving grace is location. Not worth the money.
title: Great location awful hotel

review: Unlike the pictures on their website the room was very, very tiny. The two twin beds were actually pushed together and with a nightstand on both sides of the beds. That was the extent of the width of the room. The floor boards in the entire hotel creaked and moaned as you walked across the floor. The window opened all of 8 inches; with no air conditioning and only a fan to cool down the room we felt like we were sleeping in a sauna. It was horrible! The shower had no cold water. We called to get it checked out twice. When they "fixed" it the second time, the water went from scalding to HOT and for some reason the cold water from the sink no longer was cold either. Try brushing your teeth with warm water. Yuk. We tried to spend the entire day sight seeing because we dreaded spending any time in the teeny, hot room.
title: Great location horrible hotel

review: I recently was at Fleet Hotel and was very disappointed with the accommodations.When we arrived we were asked if we wanted the breakfast the next morning for 9 Euros a piece. I asked if I needed to pay for it that night and the desk clerk said no but they would put our names done. My daughter and I got an ally room where the noisy from outside was ongoing. ( we tried to close the windows to buffer the noise but there was no Air so the room became extremely stuffy. The inside noise was just as bad if not worse. the walls were paper thin and every time a door open and closed it vibrated throughout the room.The next morning when we went downstairs for the breakfast we told the hostess what room we were in and I proceeded to get my coffee and plate of breakfast food (by the way the canteen was extremely noisy as well), the hostess comes over and states that we had not ordered the breakfast. At that point I had had it. I went to the front and told them that I would be checking out of the hotel a day early due to the lack of sleep due to the noise that my daughter and I dealt with the night before as well as the embarrassment in the canteen when we thought we had lined up the breakfast from the night before. They refused to credit our account, Told us what did we expect from the Temple Bar area which is in the City Center. I explained that the noise was NOT just from the outdoor area but from the HALL as well. They refused to compensate us in any way!!!!!
title: Noisy and not very friendly

review: We stayed at the Fleet Street Hotel several times recently. This hotel is close to many of the pubs and restaurants in the Temple bar area. It is also close enough to walk to the museums, Trinity College and other attractions. The hotel was very nice and clean and the employees were very attentive to all our needs. We had a room on the second floor above a small side street, be aware that noise from the streets and bars will be loud. The ear plugs should have been a good clue for this. We did close the window on the third night and the noise was reduced and the room temperature remained quite comfortable.
title: Fleet Street Hotel - in the middle of the action

review: Fab little boutique hotel lots of cute pluses but a mixture of rather tired and old and more modern - staff so friendly and helpful breakfast adequate not wonderful great location for temple bar and their own bar is brilliant great live music
title: Stop gap

review: We stayed here mid-June for three nights. The location was excellent. We didn't spend anytime in the Temple Bar area but the hotel was right in the center of everything we wanted to see - walking distance to Trinity College, Grafton St. St Stephen's Green, and Connolly train station for the train to Howth. The hotel was clean and surprisingly quiet given all the other comments about noise. We were there Mon-Wed so perhaps it's quieter early in the week. Our room was in the back of the hotel. We slept with the windows open.
title: Centrally Located

review: nice quirky little Hotel which was clean and comfortable. We arrived late afternoon very tired only to discover we need to lug our four cases up and down several flights of stairs not a great start to our stay. The rooms although very clean were very small and the bathroom and shower even smaller and no storage facilities in the bathroom and very compact in the bedroom .Not ideal with a lot of luggage. The room looked out onto the back of the property not nice view the window opening was small and the room was very stufy and warm. Free wifi was very poor.
title: good location in Temple Bar.

review: Stayed one night. A Saturday night.Right in the heart of Dublin, the hotel is clean and tidy. Staff were excellent, polite, helpful. if you want a good night's sleep be sure to get a room at the back of the hotel, as the rooms that face onto the street are very noisy all night. they do leave ear plugs out for you which is a nice touch. Breakfast was very average.
title: Nice but noisy. Excellent staff.

review: Room was cozy and clean. Difficult to get to our room with the set up of this hotel. Had to take the elevator to the 3rd floor then go down a flight of stairs, walk a hallway, then climb up a flight of stairs. Positives were that the shower had great water pressure, nice location, and nice outside space. The staff were very helpful. They brought us a fan as the hotel doesn't have air conditioning and helped book a tour.
title: Fleet Street Hotel

review: Dublin city centre is quite expensive so this hotel felt like a deal compared to some others, but for the $300+ CAD we paid it wasn't anything special. Clean, comfortable, and good location but can be noisy from the pubs nearby. Would stay here again if visiting Dublin off-season when the prices are lower.
title: Good location, average hotel

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Room was nice and clean, air conditioning worked great, also had two big windows to open for fresh air. Wifi worked at times, was a little slow. Breakfast was delicious, just wish they had a little bit bigger variety. All service was very helpful and friendly. Perfect location for everything. Would absolutely return !
title: Really enjoyed this place!

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This was my second time staying at the Paramount Hotel, you cannot fault the location, on a quiet street just off temple bar you are in the centre of it all. The rooms are spacious and come with plenty of storage and we had a very good sized bathroom too. We were bed and breakfast, breakfast was lovely, nice choice of cereals and continental but we opted for the full Irish breakfast and we could not fault it. For the price you pay I don't think a bad word can be said about this hotel, staff were also very kind & it's always great when you can leave your luggage at the hotel! I am planning another trip to Dublin in October and will be picking this hotel again.
title: Perfect Stay!

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This hotel is in the heart of temple bar, the room was clean and comfortable & staff were generally very polite & professional.There was street noise but we slept really well and it didn't disturb us.The only issue was at breakfast. Staff seemed very unorganized. We heard several guests complaining because their orders were wrong even on quiet mornings. On one occassion the buffet had no bread or croissants and guests had to ask for this at 9 am ! Breakfast was supposed to run until 10 am so we of expected there should of been plenty of food left . The waitress went and got more croissants when requested but first served herself and one of the other waiters before putting it in the buffet for guests. Other guests consequently didnt get any croissants and were understandably disgruntled especially as we could see the staff eating the food we had all paid for. It was really bizarre!! The same waitress also dropped dirty cutlery right next our table when we were eating and rather then picking it up and apologising , walked away laughing.There just seemed to be one good waiter called Stephen doing all the work! Despite this the irish breakfast was cooked well and we liked it. The hotel is easy to reach on the 747 bus from the airport and cost 12 euros for a return.We liked the queen of tarts cafe next the hotel which was great for lunch & cake & we would recommend the botanic gardens which has free entry and is a short bus ride away on the number 9 bus from oconnol street.
title: Great location. Lovely hotel... just one issue

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Spent two nights here on a visit to Dublin.There is a sign at reception asking you to excuse the appearance while renovations under way. I seem to recall it was there some years ago when I last visited.Hotel is fine if you are only using it to sleep over.It is a bit gloomy and needs some modernisation.Breakfast whether cooked or continental is fine.An ok hotel to use as a base when visiting Dublin.
title: Reasonable Dublin Hotel

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This is a great location if you want to stay in the Temple Bar area. Staff was very helpful, breakfast was delicious. No Air conditioning so can be noisy at night if you have your window open. Depending on the time of year, it may not matter. We really enjoyed our stay.
title: Great location!

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Very, very old fashioned hotel but with all facilities you need. Could use an update or renovation. Irish breakfast or continental buffet as you wish. Very friendly personal, gave us a lot of information regarding the city.
title: City trip Dublin

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Paid extra for a top floor room with a balcony. Room was newly carpeted and decorated, had a very comfy bed and excellent showers. No problems with noise. Breakfast was goo. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good value for money.
title: Good all rounder

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Hotel staff was very friendly. We had room 504. Confusing at first to find the elevator that goes to the 5th floor. Great big room with a balcony with outdoor table and chairs. It wasn't too noisy at night since we were on the 5th floor. Great location.
title: Great location in temple bar

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We only stayed one night we arrived early and our rooms were ready nice surprise, room was quite large, bed was good and the location was excellent for Temple Bar area. Staff were amazing whey could not do enough for us from arranging a cab to take us to the harbour next morning, to telling us a place to dine and getting us ice. Nice hotel would definitely stay again when Dublin.
title: One Night Stay

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The right hotel in every sense!!Location, hospitality, service and superb quiet room.To top it off a wonderful Irish breakfast.Staff throughout are there to make your stay and this they did from reception, restaurant and maid service.To top it off the location is ideal for everyone.Thanks and see you soon.
title: Simply the Best

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Stayed in July on a Saturday night have to say it's a great hotel and well run will definitely use again. Turks head is a great bar for a night cap breakfast was cooked to order and plentiful. Thank you to all at the Paramount.
title: Very central clean Hotel, pleasant staff with a good breakfast

hotelLocation: Essex Gate, Parliament Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This hotel is just as the photos show, lovely rooms, we had room 314 right on the corner with nice views down to the River Liffey. Yes it was noisy at night if you had the window open but that's why you stay in Temple Bar for the night life, once you have a few refreshments you don't hear the noise. Staff were lovely and friendly, we arrived early so went for breakfast and were called when the room was ready which was an hour before listed check in time.
title: "As it says on the tin"

review: We stayed here the last night of a trip, because it is close to Connolly Station. We arrived back in Dublin and had an early flight home. We booked a family room and it was comfortable; two single beds were placed in a room with a double bed. The shower in the bathroom sprayed water everywhere, as the glass shower door would not stay closed. It was a bit messy, but as we were there only one night and did not shower until the morning, there was no point in complaining.The hotel has a nice restaurant, is close to the train station and Red Luas line, and is within walking distance to the airport bus.
title: Close to Connolly Station

review: Stayed here for a total of two nights in one of the premier king rooms. The room was modern, spacious, peaceful and most importantly spotless. All the staff from check in to check out were extremely friendly and helpful. We ate in the bar and sampled some of there tasty cocktails which were also faultless. Overall we had a wonderful stay and will definitely be back to this beautiful hotel.
title: Modern clean &a friendly hotel

review: I came for a weekend with friends. This hotel has been recently refurbished and extended. We were staying in the new part and our rooms were lovely with lots of nice touches. The air conditioning, lights and curtains are all controlled by a panel beside the bed. Each room had a Nespresso coffee machine, safe and fridge with complimentary chocolate, crisps and water. Our rooms also gave us access to the private club rooms with a lounge, outside seating area, newspapers and on tap tea, coffee, fruit and biscuits. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant. It offers a bistro style menu and all meals were very good. They also have a nice bar area and a good cocktail menu.Breakfast was good, we had the choice of a continental breakfast in the upstairs club room or a full cooked breakfast in the main breakfast room. All staff were polite and helpful. I would stay here again.
title: Great stay

review: I recently stayed here for two nights and must admit that I had been dubious having read the previous reviews however I could not fault this hotel ..... and I would be quite hard to please.Bedroom was spotlessly clean, bed very comfy and peacefully quiet. We enjoyed breakfast on each morning, buffet style with a varied choice to suit all. We also dined in the restaurant both nights - food was excellent. Specific compliments and thanks to David, restaurant, who is charming, his customer service skills are fantastic and he is a credit to this hotel.
title: Excellent location, facilities and staff

review: We stayed as a couple in the hotel based on reviews. However we paid over 200 euros per night for a tired room. On arrival the reception area was very impressive. However on check in we were directed up a corridor through a security door into what seemed to be a back hotel. The room we were given was in a back corridor with tired facilities that overlooked another part of a hotel. Very disappointing especially considering the price we paid for 2 nights.
title: Very expensive rip off

review: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the North Star with my boyfriend and it was amazing. I had stayed here about 3 years ago in a standard double room and even then it was good, but since then the hotel has been refurbished to a sleek, modern décor and this time I stayed in an Executive Club King Room, which was well worth the money. The standard of luxury is brilliant and they really have gone above and beyond to make it worth the money. They have upgraded the rooms with smart technology, so we could operate all the lights and even open and close the curtains with a touch of a button. There was also complimentary Dairy Milk chocolate in the fridge, which is always guaranteed to win chocoholics like me over. We also had access to the rooftop lounge, which wasn't quite what I expected As well as that, the hotel was just a high standard, robes were provided and the cleaner did a brilliant job. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking for something more high end, I absolutely loved my stay here and it really made my trip to Dublin brilliant.
title: Absolutely brilliant

review: The hotel was clean and modern, and room was very spacious.My only complaint would be that there was no air con in our room and as it was facing the main road it was too noisy at night to keep the window open.Otherwise, staff were very helpful and the location was very good. Would stay again.
title: Clean and modern

review: What an enjoyable hotel. The rooms appear to have been recently refurbished and modernized.Gym is way more than adequate, internet also. Would have liked more and varied TV and movie choices. Located very conveniently to the tram and bus services.
title: A nice way to start our vacation

review: Arriving at North Star hotel in my car I soon realised that the nearest parking was 1 mile away where I had to drag 3 bags from. The reception weren't that friendly and advised me there was no lift to the 2nd floor with my bags. I went in the summer (25 degree heat), no air con in the room ( although a 4 star) and had to suffice to opening the windows which over looked a busy main road and very noisy, so no sleep was had during the night I stayed. I was meant to stay 2 nights and checked out after 1.I stay at a least 2 hotels a week and normally 4 star. Worst 4 star hotel I have stayed in for a while and not impressed by the cost nor the location. AVOID!The only positive was the restaurant in the hotel who were excellent and great food.
title: Not what it was made up to be!!!

review: Not worth the cost -definitely doesn't deserve 4 stars, probably not even 2.- faulty plumbing, we had to change room. Twice.- faulty elevator (one permanently out of order,the other unpredictable)- noisy (!) rooms - you will hear (and feel) the trains passing every 10 minutea and your neighbours coughing, so imagine what else you will hear in the halls...- outdated rooms - dirty carpets on the floors and broken floor tiles. Orange and brown seems to be the trend.- location ok central in dublin (10-15 min walk to centre and temple bar but across the river) however we had daily fights and drug deals taking place on the doorstep of the hotel, so slightly dodgy...- hotel policy: we don't provide you a mini bar but please don't eat ANY of your own food on our premises. What?!
title: Not worth the cost

review: Booked to coincide with U2 concert in Dublin. Bit nervous as appeared just out of town & overlooking train lines, but shouldn't have been. Great location for train (Conolly station) & tram (Luas) 50 metres away, no more than 5 / 10 minute stroll to O'Connell street and heart of Dublin.Great room, in the new / recently renovated section of the hotel (The Address).Staff helpful. Internet access (WiFi) was good / as expected for a hotelHighly recommended
title: Great Stay

review: Hotel was very comfortable.Food was good.The staff were very pleasant and helpful and couldn't do enough for us.I couldn't find anything negative about our experience.Would definitely recommend it and would go back.
title: Family short stay

review: I would say half of this hotel is 5 star and the other half is 3 star... Our first experience was with the 3 star portion; also known as the older part of the hotel. You need to be specific when you make your booking that you want to stay in the newer, air conditioned portion of the hotel. The rooms were still nice in the older portion, but as others are mentioning, it gets hot over there without AC, you face a train station, and there aren't elevators to the floors. My wife had a polite conversation with the front desk (no screaming or demanding; it's not their fault we didn't research the hotel long enough to understand the layout), and we stayed in the newer portion of the hotel for the remainder of our trip. The front office manager was EXTREMELY polite and super helpful (ask for Ela!), and she put us in a super nice room in the newer portion of the hotel. From then on, I would give the hotel a 5 star rating. This was by far the nicest room we stayed in throughout all of Ireland.
title: Great stay with exceptions... Pay attention at point of booking!

review: We got the airport bus into Dublin which was really easy, it stops just down from hotel. We didn't realise we'd actually booked premier rooms, so we had access to the premier lounge on the top floor! This included free bottles of water, tea, coffee and biscuits all day, and a light breakie in the morning - cereal, yogurt, fruit, croissants etc - all we needed which was perfect! Room was fab, big comfy bed, lots of space. Bathroom was nice but my only gripe would be that it's not very well lit in there, it's like it's missing a spotlight. Dressing gown and slippers in the wardrobe, coffee machine, lots of storage space. Reception staff really helpful, they'll book taxis for you. Shops and city centre maybe a 10-15 min walk, and temple bar maybe 30 min?? We got taxis during the evening if going out, it was too far to walk in heels! Great stay, id definitely stay again! Thank you x
title: Great stay!

review: Coming in from Belfast by train, catching flight out next day, North Star was a great pick. Across the street from Connolly Station and a couple of blocks from the Flybus stop, transit was a snap. Complimentary upgrade to 6th floor room was most appreciated, making for a quieter stay (it is close to train tracks). Had dinner at hotel restaurant and staff friendly and food very good. Room was spacious and bed very comfortable.
title: Convenient for travelers in transit

review: I was staying several nights in the hotel. It was great. The best experience was contributed by the consultor (concierge) name - KEIRN HE WAS HELPFUL AND KIND AND HE MADE MY STAYING MUCH MUCH BETTER ☺️He is an asset to the hotel , and I will sure come back because of him.The only thing I didn't like was the BAD behavior and very in kind of the reception stuff called - EvaGILAD
title: My staying in the hotel - GREAT EXPERIENCE

review: Stayed here a few times when going to a concert. Bus station and Luas across the road so handy. 5 min walk to city centre. Rooms fab, had everything, wifi, fridge. Great choice for breakfast. Staff fantastic. Highly recommend. Roll on September for another concert break! Hopefully the band doesn't cancel this time!........
title: Concert Break

review: I booked this hotel recently for a trip with my two teenage children. It is in a great location however I had a number of problems with my stay which I don't think the hotel staff seemed to give enough attention to. Firstly when I arrived, I was told that I had only booked a double room. I explained that I had double checked my email and it says triple room and I paid more, to which the receptionist pointed to his form and said no it was a double. Clearly this was not my fault or the receptionists fault but his response was pointless. There is obviously an issue between the booking site and the hotel details. He did find me a room with a double and single bed and I was grateful as we were all very exhausted from an active day.When I got to the room and ready for bed, we discovered a problem with the electrics, only one plug in the room worked. As it was late I decided to get some sleep and report in the morning.I reported the problem to the receptionist on the morning and he advised he would get someone to look at it.We arrived back to the hotel late that evening and I asked the reception staff if he was aware if the plugs had been fixed in my room. He didn't know anything about it and I hoped this was a good sign. Unfortunately when we got to the room there was no change. Again as it was late we just wanted to get to sleep.I reported the problem to the receptionist in the morning and when she checked the system she said the fault had been noted but there were no maintenance staff available on a Sunday to fix it.
