The fan provided a welcome cool room. The windows opened as well, providing fresh air. Whilst there was some noise from outside it was not excessive or disturbing at all.The breakfast was fabulous, great choice and no rush!
title: Great location

review: Excellent location - the hotel is situated on Temple bar, very helpful, pleasant staff. A bottle of fizz and box of chocolates were left in the room for my birthday. Great place to stay if you want to be in the heart of temple bay.
title: July birthday trip

review: Excellent visions of beauty great for the young and the old ,suits all needs entertainment and food plus plenty of history spots too also getting about is made simply with local travel service and taxi,s
title: Birthday visit

hotelLocation: Cavendish Row, Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin 1, Ireland
review: We have been at this hotel for the third time now. This is a clean hotel with friendly staff in walking distance to the centre. Sights and bus stops are also just a few minutes away. To us it is the perfect accomodation for a city trip to Dublin.
title: An ideal place to stay

hotelLocation: Cavendish Row, Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin 1, Ireland
review: Stayed in Dublin one night, had reserved parking which is very safe & secure. On entering hotel was surprised how large it was, although it has kerb appeal from outside its very deceptive as to how large this hotel is! Staff were very friendly and our room was just superb! Top floor with surround balcony (view not great but it suited us smokers!) Room was very clean & spacious.
title: Great location, friendly staff.

hotelLocation: Cavendish Row, Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin 1, Ireland
review: I've just returned from a 3 day mini break , 4-7 August 2017, from Dublin. I stopped at Cassidy's 4 star on O'connell Street. The hotel was spotless and the staff couldn't do enough for me. The breakfast, self service was awesome and you could have as much as u liked! The double room was very clean and was attended to every day. There is a free gym on offer. The main area, Temple Bar is only about 20 minutes walk. This is the 2nd time i have stopped here and would definitely stop here again next time i come to Dublin!
title: Lovely Hotel

hotelLocation: Cavendish Row, Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin 1, Ireland
review: The hotel is very well located withing walking distance to the city centre. We had asked for a quiet room and ours was indeed very quiet.We had reserved a twin room and we benefited from a spacious family room with 1 double bed and two single beds.The staff are very friendly and helpful.
title: A good hotel to visit Dublin

hotelLocation: Cavendish Row, Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin 1, Ireland
review: We stayed at our usual hotel four of us and had a lovely room for the four of us as well Irish breakfast was really yummy as usual we also did the hop on and off bus where ch was only 17 euro for the day mus add Guinness factory and prison should be booked n advance there was at least four football and rugby matches going on as well recommend dublin for a break booze is xpensive food prices reasonable pity weather was iffy but not cold
title: Yearly break n dublin

hotelLocation: Parnell Square West, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Spent one night at the Maldron Hotel with my wife. Having previously stayed there on a lads rugby weekend.Breakfast is very good, the rooms are nice and come with trouser press & tea/coffee making facilities. I used the hotel car park that was cheap compared with other parking available nearby, although very limited and tight. Reception was prompt and helpful. The lifts require a room key when going up from reception. This is added security. overall, a very pleasant stay, that is in a good location to access central Dublin.
title: Dublin visit

hotelLocation: Parnell Square West, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: The hotel is used by tour groups and we arrived a day early for our Trafalgar tour. We had a small room but it was clean and good enough for 2 nights. The breakfast was the best we saw in 10 days in Ireland. The selection was wonderful. If you could not find something to eat you have a problem!The location is not near much. Don't bother with the pizza place across the street. It's a min 10-15 min walk to O'Connell street and a grocery store or anything else to do. It is right around the corner from the Garden of Remembrance. It does have A/C which is nice when Dublin is 82 F.I would stay closer to downtown next time.
title: Nice hotel with great breakfast!

hotelLocation: Parnell Square West, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: The hotel is well located to access the main city areas on foot and is a 10 minute walk from Croke Park if you are visiting to attend a concert. The staff are friendly and welcoming, rooms are of a good size, are well furnished and equipped. The price for a one night Stay was very expensive but that was due to the popularity of the Band playing in Croke Park. We would definitely consider using this hotel again
title: One Night Concert Stay

hotelLocation: Parnell Square West, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: room was of a decent size and clean, outlook wasn't very good but then we didn't go there to stay in room looking out of window. the staff on reception were brilliant very good at their jobs . felt that safe hire deposit was a bit steep at 50 euros we didn't take credit cards so was 50 out of our spending money I think 20 would of been a better price to ask, the 50 was returnable so safe hire cost nothing but it meant 50 euros was tied up until last day , cant comment on food as we didn't eat in .bit lack in communication reguarding the amount of milk we were left there was 3 of us first day 4 little pots left we like 3 each there is very little milk in 1 pot reception were happy to give us more , day 2 we left a note please leave us more milk we were left 5 pots not even enough 1 cup of tea 2 of us so we had to get more , day 3 note ignored again we said please leave us 9 pots again 5 pots were left was frustrating would of been better left too much surely they must realize those pots of milk hardly contain any . other than that moan which was annoying hotel was good.
title: nice stay

hotelLocation: Parnell Square West, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Location not as central as advertised. Booking in was very slow and when I got to my room it was for a disabled person. That meant the sink was at wheelchair height and quite unsuitable. However my room was changed promptly when I complained.I paid for my daughter who was arriving later and she was asked for payment, a note on the computer would have avoided that. also a friend who booked later was charged 40 Euro less for his room.....how annoying!!
title: Slightly disapointed

hotelLocation: Parnell Square West, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Just spent 2 nights here and staff very friendly and very helpful, check in smooth,quick and bags held securely until room was ready and also for the full day on departure. Clean room and bathroom and clean towels both days. Perfect location for exploring all Dublin, after reading some reviews was worried the location was not in a great area but to be honest found all parts of Dublin city very run down and hotel location no worse than main tourist areas.seems a lot of investment in parts of the city, road improvements and building work but sad for the city along both sides of the Liffey as every other property run down, shabby and lots of buildings closed and decaying.The warmth,friendliness and craic of Dubliners makes up for everything, fabulous people. The green hop on and hop of bus tour is absolutely brilliant and true Dubliners driving and telling the history and and present about the city,well worth doing the tour.Brilliant city for shopping and amazing parks.Highly recommend a meal at O'sheas across from the Brazen Head oldest pub in the city.
title: Great location and friendly and helpful staff

hotelLocation: Parnell Square West, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Don't get me wrong there is nothing actually bad about this hotel but on the other hand there is nothing particularly special either. It is just in need of a bit of tender loving care and a big bank account, it's time for a refurbishment it's tired and showing it's age. The room was a bit cramped but that was in part due to it being a bit over stuffed with furniture, the beds were comfortable and the room was clean apart from stains in the nets, room 307. It's on the main road but the double glazing works well and the road noise is well subdued the same can't be said doe noisy bedroom doors shutting in the early hours of the morning as late night revellers return making rather too much noise, their consecutive nights. We enjoyed our breakfast and found all the staff to be good.
title: It's OK

hotelLocation: Parnell Square West, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Stayed here on a bus tour of Ireland. The rooms were clean and comfy. We were very tired and slept well there. The staff was helpful. There is security on the doors upstairs which I liked. We walked a couple blocks to a nice cafe/lunch. The breakfast was a nice "full Irish" breakfast buffet with good coffee. Everything was adequate and nice, but nothing out of the ordinary. I would give this a 3.5 rating. Dublin is a busy city but definitely needs some clean up of the many tired areas. The people were all lovely and kind. Really enjoyed our brief stay.
title: Ireland Tour

hotelLocation: Parnell Square West, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Visited here for one night yesterday for my wife's birthday. The hotel is a ten minute walk from O'Connell Street, so a bit of a trek after a night out (especially with heels on says the wife!). Upon check in we were met by Antonio who was very polite and friendly. The room was great, very spacious (room 107, which is or was a room for disabled persons). My wife mentioned to Antonio upon check in that it was her birthday and when we returned to the hotel later in the afternoon there was a happy birthday note along with wine and chocolates which was a lovely touch! Very comfy bed and very clean. One slight issue was the cleaners were very noisy from quite early and we wanted a lie in. Hardly mattered though. Fabulous hotel and we would definitely recommend and would visit again.
title: Excellent accommodation

review: This hotel is within walking distance of St Stephen's Green and also to offices in the Ranelagh area. The service is impeccable and the staff is fantastic! A special shoutout to Fabrizio for taking care of our family while we were waiting for a room. The breakfast buffet is to die for! :)
title: Excellent hotel near city center

review: I checked into an okay room on the fifth floor, but the carpet was worn and the furniture in need of replacement. I called the front desk and the young woman who answered the phone was at my door in a few minutes to a new room. It was on the third floor-recently renovated. The room was the same size but what a difference when its clean and has a robe in the closet. This faced the canal and she was worried the train noise from the nearby Luas would be an issue - it was not. The wait staff in the hotel bar/restaurant was great too.
title: Quiet and clean and recently renovated

review: My husband and I enjoyed our stay very much . The hotel staff were very friendly the breakfast was excellent . The location was a little out of the city centre for our liking . This did not cause us a problem as there were taxis outside the hotel resonantly priced to transport us wherever we wished to go .
title: A Very Enjoyable Stay

review: Nice quiet area but not far by cab to anything. Nice employees. Rooms a tad on the smaller side for my liking but all in all everything was fine. Great looking breakfast bar, good cocktail lounge, and underground secured parking.
title: Good place to stay

review: Overall a great place to stay. Good location. Some noise through the closed window but very little. Internet connection was good. Room was clean. Bed was very comfortable. Bedroom was nice and big. Good service at the counter
title: Great place

review: I needed two rooms for three days in Dublin for a family vacation. Lucky I had some points to cover most of the cost and found this great place. Location was good, hotel was clean and bright , and the staff was outstanding.
title: Great stay in Dublin

review: I've stayed at the Dublin Hilton twice on business, for a total of three weeks. It is a solid choice for business travelers to Dublin, and is conveniently-located next to the Green Line Luas, for easy transport out to the business parks and suburbs south of the city.Check-in has been quick and professional, as was check-out. I've had rooms on both the 3rd and 5th floors, and there is an important difference between the two, even though the 5th floor is ostensibly reserved for HHonors Silver members. I much preferred the 3rd floor room: while both rooms were clean, plenty big, and offered a desk and chair and a comfortable king-sized bed, my room on the 5th floor, while it had been recently remodeled per the front desk, had *no* usable power outlets on the headboard wall. No place to plug in my phone to charge and use as an alarm or charge my watch. The lights on either side of the bed were wired into the headboard behind the bed and whatever outlet they plugged into was inaccessible.I had to call the front desk and get an extension cord sent up, which I had to run all the way across the room next to the TV stand in order to get the power I needed on the nightstand shelf. I've *never* stayed in a hotel, of any class, that didn't have power available at the head of the bed, and I am astonished that a business-friendly hotel would overlook this critical feature.The second issue I had with the 5th floor bedroom was a complete lack of dresser or drawer space of any kind in which to put my clothes. The television console, with its mini-fridge and pull-out shelves with a coffee/tea maker had no drawers, and the hall closet had an open shelf at the bottom in which sat the safe, and an open shelf at the top with a spare pillow. BUT NO DRAWERS. Again, I have *never* stayed in a hotel that did not offer at least *some* storage space for clothes.My room on the 3rd floor did not have either of these problems, and was perfectly acceptable. It also had the bonus of having a nice coffee/tea maker near the elevators along with a snack stand on which there were croissants and pastries in the morning, and either cookies or donuts in the evening. The sweets weren't incredible-tasting or anything near it, but the gesture was nice.If I stay in Dublin again on business, I would consider the Hilton again, but would definitely not accept a room on the 5th floor. I don't know if the remodel was only partially completed, but the lack of the two amenities I mentioned above make them unsuitable for me, and I would imagine, for many other travelers as well.
title: Solid Business Hotel near the Canal

review: Situated on the canal away from the crowds this hotel permits good sleep. Our room was a good size, the bathroom actually had a bath and there was a fridge, safe, hairdryer and ironing supplies. The decor was modern, all the staff we encountered were very pleasant and they responded to a problem I had with the safe extremely quickly. It is only a 10-20 minute walk or short taxi ride to the central attractions. There is a gym which we did not use or you could run/cycle along the canal path.
title: Good place to stay away from the crowds

review: Rooms were the usual great Hilton quality and layout. Most of Dublin within walking distance. Location near the LUAS was an added bonus. Pub next door was excellent and it seemed to be a local hot spot.
title: Great hotel, great location

review: Nice clean rooms, friendly helpful staff. Good buffet breakfast, didn't see an egg chef though (omelletes etc.) Plenty of parking spaces. A short taxi ride from the centre or 15-20in walk. Comfortable beds, good internet connection.
title: Sanctuary in middle of Dublin

review: I am a Silver member so check-in the day before online to make sure I get a room away from the tram - if you get the wrong room here it is incredibly noisy. My room was very quiet and the bed comfortable. The lighting in the room is not bad for a business hotel. The breakfast is comprehensive and very tasty with good bakery selection. Staff are pleasant and helpful.
title: Average Hilton

review: While staying in Dublin for one night I stayed in the Hilton, very pleasant stay. Breakfast was a little bit limited in offerings, could have been better. Stayed in a twin room, staff was very kind and helped me finding my way around town.In general, I had a very pleasant stay. Would recommend it to others.
title: Great for one night stay

review: Awesome canalside location. Well laid out building. Easy walking distance from key attractions. Great staff, nice decor. Decent views from almost every side. Also easy to drive to with great self parking. Good breakfast and nice pub with live music. I'll be back!!
title: Perfect location, well kept property.

review: Stay here for the U2 concert. Arrived around midnight and the greeting was very professional. All interaction with staff was very pleasant. Great place to stay. About 10 minutes walk to park and shopping area. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Dublin Hilton

review: bad hotel..very old rooms.high value for qulaity.....i wold definitely not go there again. the staff was good.asdfhjkloiuuyrwqxcvbm,,lloiuytfffvjjjljllklkn,./;jjhghvvnm,kkjiouiy7tfcgvm,;op[[';.kfdjlkgtyo0yio50rie9uejdklsmclv,;b
title: hotel

review: Helpful and hard working front desk staff who were patient with all our questions (from Fair Family), good location, comfortable rooms, great breakfast...Woke up early one morning and sat overlooking the canal and watched the city come to life.
title: Enjoyed our stay

review: We have just returned from a fantastic three night stay in Dublin & couldn't fault this hotel. Clean, modern and with a great bar and restaurant if you need them. Room was lovely and staff were all really friendly. Not right in the centre but only a pleasant 10-15 minute walk to Grafton Street or you have a tram stop literally right outside!!!! We used to walk in during the day and catch the tram home from Grafton street at night for €1.60pp. 5 minutes later we were back at the hotel!!! Perfect and means it's just a little bit quieter and more relaxed than staying in the centre. Loved Dublin as a city. Don't expect anything hugely picturesque but is has a brilliant spirit and wonderful, welcoming people. Eating and drinking is a joy as there are just so any places to choose from. Transport options from the airport were superb. We chose the Airlink and it dropped us off about a 10 minute walk away. The Guinness factory is obviously on most people's list but the Jameson Experience is also well worth a visit. Even if you don't do the tour, the bar is superb and has a great atmosphere. The zoo is also a brilliant visit and great value at €17.50.
title: Perfect hotel for an fun filled trip to Dublin!!!!

review: Stayed here for three nights and enjoyed our stay, with one exception being that the air conditioning in our room did not work. Parking costs €15 a night, which is a little steep when you are paying a lot of money for the room/dinner/drinks anyway, but compensation is that you can easily walk into town, thus saving parking fees there. Great breakfast choice with lots of coffee options, nice breads and pastries, yoghurts and cereal. No fresh fruit salad (canned does not hit the spot in August), but great start to the day. Bedrooms of a reasonable size (dearth of plugs), comfortable bed, ok bathroom (shower curtain) great toiletries. All the staff were helpful and friendly and made the hotel a very welcoming oasis. Highly recommended.
title: Friendly staff, convenient location, good size room, good breakfast, expensive parking

review: Nice clean rooms with modern bathrooms. Nespresso machine on the floor with nice selection of coffees and cookies was a welcoming touch. Friendly staff and good location just out of the hustle and bustle of the city center. Would stay again
title: Pleasant stay in Dublin

review: The location was a bit out of the way of the centre, it took us about half an hour to walk in. However, just outside the hotels is a tram stop which takes you into the centre in about 15 minutes. It wasn't close to any restaurants, so you would have to go into the centre.The room was lovely, it was very clean and comfortable. We stayed over the new year and we didn't have any issue with noise.
title: Bit out of the way

review: On the whole there is nothing wrong with the Hilton Dublin and it is an entirely acceptable well positioned place to stay, but for the price and in comparison to other hotels in Dublin it doesn’t exactly call you back.The rooms are clean, adequately sized, bed and pillows are comfy, excellent air conditioning and wifi and good shower. But the towels are thin and worn, there is no vanity kit in the bathroom and no water in the room. Yes yes, we know that Hilton blue members don’t get free water but just because that’s what it says in the manual doesn’t change the fact that guests expect it and other hotels across the world and Dublin provide it. If you can’t or won’t provide it, please put water coolers on each floor.The breakfast once again is adequate but cheaply done. Self-serve tea and coffee, tinned fruit and basic cereals, pastries and hot food. There is cheese, meat and yogurts and you won’t go hungry but once again entirely forgettable and much better elsewhere. The one positive is that you can ask for a paper bag to take a few things away (if you can find anything you’d want to).The gym is disappointing. These days hotel gyms are a differentiator enabling guests to work out while they travel in the same way they work out at home. But the Hilton gym is just very basic – a few cardio machines, a set of dumbells and a couple of benches. Yes you can work out but a few investments here would really pay off for the hotel.In the same way as the hotel is forgettable, it appears that guest are too. The staff are helpful when you ask but they don’t seem to really care about guests.I would stay again if needed but there are definitely better places to spend your money in Dublin.
title: Acceptable but forgettable

review: Close to Dublin City centre. Easily accessible with the Luas Tram- Claremont street stop on the green line. Stayed overnight after a concert at 3 Arena. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Room clean and well equipped.
title: At the heart of the city!

review: Great experience! Lovely hotel with excellent food! Rooms are tiny but we spent our time exploring the city anyway! Had dinner there and loved the entertainment. Asked for special accommodations and they were provided without fail.
title: Great experience! Lovely hotel with excellent food! Rooms are tiny but we spent our time exploring the city anyway!

review: Stayed here for long weekend as we were attending Coldplay concert at Croke park, it was quite expensive I must say for 3 nights, the staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival with us being early they stored our cases and told us to come back in a couple of hours and they would get us a room which they did which was good as check in wasn't till 3, the reception and bar area was lovely bright and airy the bar prices were reasonable we didn't eat at the hotel but menu seemed lovely, the room wasn't as special as I thought it would be considering the price and it being a Hilton could've been doing with a lick of paint and the bathroom with a freshen up, the bed wasn't the comfiest either but that's due to personal taste, quite a walk from the centre of town depending the way you walk tram stop is right outside and frequent to take you into city, over all was a nice stay, would stay again if got a better rate for the rooms
title: Stayed for long weekend for Coldplay concert

review: The only thing was to far from city center. All the rest was great The people where very nice and friendly. The canal in front was great and beautiful. I recommend this place any time. Food was great, bar also. loved it
title: Great stay

review: Stayed at this hotel for two nights at €249 per night only to find out in the mornings breakfast was not included, disgusting in my mind. I really can't see how they can justify such a rate then charge for breakfast??
title: Great hotel but charges were scary

review: Stayed here with my daughter. Room had view of Grand Canal. Close walking distance to main attractions- staff friendly and made us feel special. Great bar food- good deals. Would highly recommend. Clean and tidy hotel and rooms
title: Brilliant

review: Stayed in the Hilton after previous stays throughout UK. Disappointed with this one, hard bed, no milk or teabags in my room despite asking twice.Charged for water, none complimentary when asked. For the price paid it wasn't good
title: Disappointed

review: Just home from a two night stay. Had a deluxe room which was spotless and comfortable. Excellent shower, quality bath products and excellent touches throughout. Bar has been refurbished and is excellent. Well priced with a good product range. Bistro food was excellent also. We also had breakfast with great choices on offer and a buffet area that was so clean. Special thanks to all the staff. Two Italian waiters in the bistro and the Bulgarian girl at the breakfast area.Hotel is in a great area. 5 mins from city centre yet in a nice affluent area of the city. As a frequent visitor to Dublin I am happy to recommend!
title: Brilliant as always

review: Nice hotel but very definitely overpriced especially the added cost for breakfast! Apart from price, very clean and very high quality that you would expect to receive from the Hilton Group anywhere. Recommended all the same!
title: Hilton Dublin

review: This is a top class hotel 5 minutes from Dublin city centre. It is beside the tram line which can bring you to St Stephens Green or to Dundrum in the opposite direction. The staff here were so helpful we met Lisa the duty manager who could not do enough for us she was friendly warm and welcoming as were all the staff here. If you are going to Dublin city centre this is the hotel for you. Great value and great food with a modern bar
title: Top class stay in heart of Dublin

review: This hotel is in a great location with easy access to trams and 15 minutes walk to Stephen's Green. The staff are excellent, breakfast is good and the bar area serves great food too. The rooms are in the process of being refurbished, I believe floors 1 & 3 have been completed but you pay a premium to stay in one of these rooms. We stayed on floor 5, whilst acceptable the rooms are tired and "well worn".
title: Great location, friendly & efficient staff...

review: I had the pleasure to stay at the Hilton Dublin recently as it is one of the hotels recommended by my company. The location of the hotel is definitely very convenient within a walking distance of our offices. The staff is very friendly as well.The breakfast is very good with great choices of food.On a different note, I was expecting a little bit more of the bedrooms which are bit outdated (specially the bathrooms). It was a bit of a disappointment.
title: It's a "ok" Hotel

review: Beautiful, comfortable hotel. Lovely restaurant and friendly staff in all areas. For me, however, the star of the show is Philip D on concierge who is possibly the kindest person I have ever met. I hope I have the opportunity to revisit Dublin and if I do, I will be back. Thank you Philip! :)
title: Lovely Concierge

review: Lovely lobby, good location, next to airport bus stop, rooms slightly better than a premier inn. Hallway to room worse than average. Dirty, shabby, etc. Was expecting something nicer for the price. Perfectly nice hotel that is currently undergoing construction, mostly very nice staff, but not sure why it calls itself a boutique hotel.
title: Meh

review: The hotel was clean and is in a great location for walking to lots of nice bars and restaurants, as well as historical attractions. The major disappointment was that there was construction within the hotel or right outside and each morning at 7:30 we were awaken to very loud noises and bangs.
title: Good location, but disappointed with noise level in morning

review: I stayed in the Trinity City Hotel recently for a birthday celebration. It is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location. I particularly liked the inner garden area where we had a fabulous barbecue. The food was delicious and the staff were very friendly. The room was extremely comfortable. I would highly recommend the hotel and will definitely pay it a visit in the future.
title: Beautiful hotel, ideal location.

review: It is great with amenities, a restaurant, and a bar, great location, a gym and lots of things are in walking distance to the hotel also taxi service is fast. You can also get bonus miles with United too. There is no spa in the Hotel. I would stay there again.
title: Hotel

review: Plush, decadent and totally over the top décor - loved it!Great location. Breakfasts good, restaurant food very good and the pub a great place to spend some time.Room very spacious (we had a room in the annex) and the service was good.
title: Beautifully Decorated

review: While visiting my friend from Ireland, we wanted to stay at a hotel close to all amenities. This hotel did not disappoint! It is a stunning hotel, with amazing staff and service, it is central to everywhere you can go. I would highly recommend this hotel, and I hope to return in the future.
title: A Visit From Canada

review: Stayed for 3 nights while going to see u2 at crooke park. The location is great you can walk to everything. The staff were really helpful and friendly. Breakfast lovely. The room's really nice . Beds so comfy really couldn't fault anything was a brilliant few nights stay. Would not hesitate in staying here again. Spot on !
title: Great hotel

review: No room service. Painfully slow check in and check out. Housekeeping not up to 4star standard. Convenient location. Very friendly bell staff. Sorry to say we will stay somewhere else when next in Dublin.
title: Not worth it

review: My husband and I flew back yesterday after a week in Ireland. The day before we were to fly out our rental car got broken into and our belongings were stolen. There was glass all over the inside of the car. We were in between cities and our next hotel for our last night there was the Trinity City Hotel. When we arrived the staff heard what happened and we were greeted with the most friendliest faces and genuinely concerned. Little Philip (bellman) greeted us and proactively brought out a vacuum and helped my husband clean up all of the glass. He was so friendly and personable and wouldn't even accept a tip from us. The man at the front desk (apologies) i do not remember his name also made sure we were set up appropriately and made sure we were ok. Beyond those two men who stood out to us, the property is beautiful and very clean and unique. We will definitely return!
title: Incredible Staff and Beautiful Property

review: Stayed at Trinity City while in town for U2 Gig at Croke Park, for only one night, wish it had been more. A slight mix up regarding payment at checkin that was dealt with swiftly and we were off to our room, very nice indeed, stylish well decorated with everything you need. The most comfortable nights sleep we have ever had in a hotel, (we have noted the make of pillows and mattress and will be purchasing ourselves) We sat out in the courtyard for lunch with the gargoyles and crocodiles in the sun, delicious steak sandwich and beef burger. The décor throughout the hotel is very Quirky and fun, animal statues, huge mirrors, chez lounges, a piano, beautiful fireplaces etc. Breakfast is spot on too,buffet style but plenty of choice and very tasty, poached or fried eggs need to be ordered.  On checkout we left our bags with Phil the Concierge, a very charming and warming chap full of knowledge and jokes. Only a 400m walk to Grafton Street, Dawson Street and Temple Bar.We go to Dublin as much as time allows and know for sure this will be our base every time from now on , A Jewel in the Capital of The Emerald Isle.
title: Found What I'm Looking For......

review: This was a lovely hotel for a two night stay. The rooms were spacious, with a comfortable bed. The tall "headboard" triples as a closet and a nightstand: there was a small cutaway with outlets just above the bed to charge phones and place other items. The closet was cut into the sides of the headboard. I would note that there wasn't much space to hang things. The bathroom was very spacious, with a large tub/shower and lots of counter space. The lobby and lounge were nicely decorated. The lounge is popular in the evenings and plays pleasant music. The staff is very friendly and efficient. It's also a short walk from all the bus stops.
title: Gem of a hotel in central Dublin near Trinity College

review: The room was clean and comfy, if a little close to the kitchen. Fortunately, we live in New York so don't mind cooking smells wafting up to our room. The staff was friendly and professional. Best of all the breakfast was out of this world. Many, many choices and coffee to die for! YUM.
title: Cosmopolitan

review: My husband and I stayed here for the last 3 days of our honeymoon this summer — and despite the unfortunate construction going full strength at Trinity — we had a really wonderful stay. When we first got to our room, we could hear hammering almost right across the wall, so we asked for a different room, and the staff was nice enough to find us something a bit quieter on the other side of the hotel. You could still hear it during the day, but it wasn't too bad. They also brought up 2 glasses of prosecco, which was a sweet touch. The rooms themselves were very nice and comfortable, and we loved the bright, trendy decor. The hotel itself is in a perfect location, too. Just far enough away from all the bars so that you're not in the thick of it, but within 10 minutes walking distance to Temple Bar. The only down side was that when we bought a bottle of champagne elsewhere, my husband went down to the bar to ask for 2 glasses, and they wouldn't give them to him unless he bought them full of prosecco.
title: Beautiful hotel with friendly staff in perfect location

review: We had a Georgian suite,shabby chic,building construction going on,adding new floors on top of the hotel,noisy,especially if trying to catch up on sleep after a flight,in the afternoon.Had trouble with wifi on my iPad,no reception,but my wife's iPhone was ok,other guests had similar problems with some phones,they said it was my iPad,but as soon as we got back to the airport,it was ok.Good location,but for the price wasn't that impressed
title: OK,Hotel

review: Not sure how this hotel gets four stars. Without the five star service, this hotel would be a two star. Rooms are small and dated with limited ability to cool the room. Small window with small circular fan. Tiny beds with older mattresses. That being said, the service from beginning to end was first rate. Location is also very good. Close to many of the main attractions.
title: Thank goodness for the service

review: My friends and I had a great experience at the Trinity City Hotel. Really friendly staff and our room was gorgeous. It's very clean and a real quirky hotel close to everything. I would highly recommend!!
title: Amazing!

review: My friend came over to visit from Canada and we wanted somewhere central to stay in Dublin. We got that and so much more from the trinity city hotel. Starting with a warm welcome the moment you step through the door by the concierge to the friendly receptionists to check you in. All staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were spotless, with beds you had to force yourself to leave!! I've been here twice and look forward to another visit in the future!!
title: Friend from Canada

review: Spent the evening relaxing in the lobby/bar. Food was delicious and it was a very easygoing vibe to sit and relax. Had to wait a bit to get our servers attention, easier to just go up to the bar and order. Recommend the Crème Brulee!
title: Great eats just off the lobby

review: We booked here for three nights from Calgary, Alberta Canada. Clean spacious renovated rooms, helpful staff and the best location. Close to Temple Bar but not so close that it was crazy noisy or busy. Right across from Trinity College 4 star hotel - I would give it five.
title: Great Find in Dublin

review: Decor is fun boutique from lobby to room. Stayed on 4th floor Executive room-clean & quiet sleep while Dublin has construction issues. No noise from fire station but room has only sky light windows- don't open- temperature fine even with 80+ days. We did have fan in room too.Room as pictured online. Bus pickup -airlink or 15 just outsde while Temple Bar short 12 min. walk or Book of Kells 5. Didn't eat there but enjoyed the bar. Check in quick-staff friendly & concierge helpful with transportation info/taxi on time.
title: Good location jump on bus too

review: Trinity Hotel located in the heart of DublinFood in the restaurant is excellent. Staff are very attentive. Accommodation is comfortable with a fun design theme. This hotel is not an ordinary one. Decor is edgy.
title: Dublin Central

review: Went for meal with work colleagues, very disappointed with reserved tables which were unsuitable asked for other options, really didn't like the attitude of the supervisor ( well think she was) and found she had a very smart attitude and a comment was a made that I did not like about the numbers for the booking ,service improved when another waitress took over but we were not asked if we wanted another drink, when drinks came order was partially wrong ( after us having to ask for another drink), the food was bland and deserts only ok. I have eaten bar food in this hotel and it has always been really good so it's hard to understand how the restaurant food was so bland, overall stressful experience , felt like we were " high maintenance" ( even though we are not) , definitely won't be back on a work team night out , considering we were spending over 200 euro one expects more and should be made feel welcome . We were asked if everything was ok but I didn't feel this was genuine. I will return to bar as service and nibbles always good but wont be returning with work colleagues as was unfortunately embarrassed for recommending this venue. We had another corporate meal night out last week and went elsewhere, your staff need to up their attitude to get repeat clients back ( as I say the waitress was actually friendly and nice but the supervisors attitude was not good.) The only positive thing about the night was the atrium type restaurant was very relaxing for chatting and the beer was really fresh as per usual!
title: Very disappointing meal and service and attitude, bar food is better here than restaurant

review: I stayed here for 2 nights with my partner for his birthday.Let's start with the positives, there is actually only one - location. The hotel is in a great location, within easy walking distance of Grafton St, Temple Lane, O'Connell St etc. Price - poor value for money. Our room was small for the price we paid and the bathroom is in need of maintenance. Our shower had been cracked and glued back together. Shower power was also lacking. What was particularly frustrating though was that on both nights we stayed the hotel was hosting private functions, a retirement party and a wedding which restricted the 'normal' guests use of certain parts of the hotel, courtyard etc - no reduction in price was offered despite this. The noise from the hotel is significant also (we had a room facing onto the courtyard).Staff - rude and inattentive. We had a problem with our room key card, it wouldn't open our door. When asking reception for help, rather than just fix the problem we were told very clearly it was our fault as we must have had the key card next to a bank card or mobile phone which then affected the magnetic strip!The lack of courtesy of staff continued at breakfast. Despite the extortionate room rate breakfast was not included, however at check in, reception had authorised 100 euros on our card "to make it easy for us to pay for any costs we had while staying in the hotel e.g. Breakfast/room service". Upon arriving at the breakfast, we were told "we have no record of this so you will have to pay cash". I asked if it was possible to check with reception, reluctantly he did and we were left to wait in the queue holding up other guests. He returned said "okay that's fine" and gestured us into the breakfast room. No apology, nothing!At check-out, we were then presented with a bill for €28 - for the breakfast. We explained the situation about the €100. We were then told this was for the hotels safety and would be refunded to our card in up to 5 days but meantime we had to pay another €28. This was completely different to what we were told at check-in and effectively they wanted €128 when we had only spent €28. This mattered because we were using a travel money card, not a credit card which had a set amount of money. If we had been told the truth at check in, we wouldn't have done this. Again staff were rude and treated us as an inconvenience, quoting "hotel policy" rather than acknowledging their error and the ridiculousness off the situation. Only when I refused to pay the additional €28 pointing out they actually were due us a refund of €72, they somehow changed their minds about charging us the extra €28, our refund did not credit our account though until 4 days later. Again no apology!I have no issue paying higher hotel prices providing you get value for money, friendly and courteous hotel staff and full access to the hotel facilities. And if something does go wrong that it is addressed quickly and with an apology where necessary. I did not get any of this at the Trinity, I will never return and wouldn't recommend to anyone. Dublin is a great place and thankfully has lots of other hotels to choose from, I would recommend you do.
title: Good location but overpriced with rude staff

review: After getting married abroad in December, my husband and I held a party to celebrate at the Trinity City Hotel.I cannot recommend it enough, this hotel is a gem. It's beautifully decorated with a fantastic garden at the centre that was perfect for a warm evening. The staff are wonderful, in particular Mihaela for her amazingly calm organising and Stephen for his attentiveness on the night. The food was stunning and catered for all tastes and dietary requirements without issue.We're both from Dublin so the central location was perfect and allowed our guests to go out or get home easily after the party ended. My husband and I stayed at the hotel that night, assuming we wouldn't sleep after such an exciting night but the room was so peaceful and comfortable that we just passed out until our breakfast arrived the next morning.Despite living close to the Trinity City Hotel, I will definitely find a reason to come back and stay!
title: This hotel is a gem!

review: I booked this hotel when I saw Colplay we're going to be at Croke Park, the location is really good, the airlink stops right outside the hotel (opposite side of the road) & Temple Bar is only a 10 minute walk away & it only took us around 30 minutes to walk to Croke Park, you can get the 7A bus right outside too which would take out most of the way but the roads were closed for the concert so it was quicker to walk there & back! The hop on hop off bus stop 15 is also directly opposite the hotel.When we entered I was impressed with the decor, it has a very luxurious, boutique feel about the place.We arrived at about 3:30pm to check in, 3 staff on check in, we waited around 10 minutes & were given our room keys for floor 4, there was a wedding going on in the hotel so we had to walk through all the guests to get to the lift, we struggled to open the lift area door with our keys & someone else opened the door for us, we found our room & our keys wouldn't work, my husband went back to check in, by this time reception was chaos with lots more people checking in, finally got our room keys sorted & into our room.Room 439Nice size, no view & very dirty windows, I'm aware construction work was taking place on the upper levels / roof.The lighting in the room was fine during the day, but impossible to apply make up in the evening as there's just one lamp by the mirror, the bathroom needed a good bleach! The tiles, floor & grout was disgusting! The shower wasn't very good at all, coukd do with more shelving in the bathroom, the bed was comfortable & a nice size, the pillows were great! Disappointed with the tea / coffee lack of biscuits & hot chocolates for a 4 star hotel, the hairdryer was good. If I stayed at this hotel again, I'd want a different room.BreakfastYou can stand waiting at the please wait to be seated stand for a while, I had to ask for coffee as I saw everyone else had some on their table but we weren't asked, a member of staff seemed to only be clearing tables & not assisting anyone, but I think he was new.Good choice of food, shame there were no beans though & you have to ask for fried eggs but I made do with scrambled, but there is fresh fruit, even fresh honeycomb & continental breakfast as well as cooked English. Bar & RestaurantWe ate here twice, we both had the burger & fries & on the second evening, we only wanted something light, so we had the soup, both meals were really good & the staff were great. Concierge was very helpful & check out was ok, although we wasted sometime with the receptionist logging in & back out because the system wasn't loading, checkout was 12pm which was good, our bags were looked after for a few hours as our flight wasn't until 5:30pm so we went for a wander before heading to the airport.
title: 52 hours in Dublin

review: My travel tour agency recommended this place. I have since told them to stop. I am on my second and final stay of 2 nights. Room came with air conditioning but it was broken. Mentioned it 3 times and was assured it would be checked out. I still have no air conditioning. I have sleep apnea and cooler air makes my breathing easier. I did request a fan and after second request it finally showed up. Could not sleep with windows open as I was next to fire house and road noise. The first nights dinner took 2 hours to show up and my wife's lamb was cold. My sons fries were old and stale. Not acceptable. One positive is the morning breakfast buffet. It has a great selection of foods. They even offer gluten free bread. I found staff to be dismissive with discussions about food and rooms. I have a large family and will tell them not to stay here on their next visit to Ireland. I am unsure if problems stem from management or owners who do not care about maintenance and upkeep. Avoid it like the plague
title: Would not even tell an enemy to stay.

review: The hotel is very well located. We stayed for two nights. Rooms are clean but despite the moderate temps in the 60s it was uncomfortably hot in the rooms and the windows barely opened so did not provide much relief. Stay did include a very nice breakfast buffet.
title: A mixed bag

review: The hotel is quite old but very clean. It is set in the heart of the city and is opposite over the bridge to the Temple Bars. Lots and f bars and good things to eat.They do a great breakfast, as much as you can eat for 10 euros.They have live music every night.A restaraunts which is open fronted so you can get into the swinging city while you eat.
title: Buzzing City, plenty to do and see

review: Me and my friend came here on three separate occasions throughout our holiday, we had dinner one evening food was great, drinks were good. We had a night out in temple bar area and this was the last stop for us because we were staying right beside the bar, there was a great band on, great end to our night.
title: Great food and atmosphere

review: Wife booked this as it's cheap for the Dublin city centre area. You'd not know it though.Staff are brilliant and can't do enough for you. The room is up there with some of the best I've stayed in. Massive comfortable bed. Our son looked dwarfed in the huge single bed.Bathroom slightly dated but well stocked and clean.Nice river view from our room over the Liffey.Breakfast was included and was very good.
title: One night Dublin Stay

review: We'd a great meal in the terraced area. I'd wild mushroom risotto. We'd chicken wings. Kids had ribs. Lovely friendly staff. Reasonably priced. Went in to main bar (up to 9pm with kids) as some Irish dancing and traditional music was on. I'd a lovely passion fruit and ginger mojito cocktail. Very good. Great atmosphere and interaction by band members. Would definitely go back here for their Celtic dancing night (downstairs) which was fully booked. Looked like a quality and varied menu, unlike the themed night menus you might see in Spain which are limited.I would make a Beeline for here again, now that I know about it.
title: Great family meal, friendly staff

review: This place is in a perfect location. Not RIGHT in Temple Bar, but across the bridge from it. So you're far enough away from the crazy, but not too far! The hotel is old, but clean. Beds were comfortable. Staff was very friendly & helpful. Breakfast was just ok. It's located on a very busy street, so if you leave your windows open at night, prepare for lots of shouting drunk people & lots of traffic. But I think that's part of the charm of Dublin. I think it was a good value for the price.
title: Location, location, location

review: Absolutely loved the Irish dancing. However, I have to give a shout out to Shauna my server. I work as a server in a hotel and I know the difficulty of serving customers when 10 things are running through your head. Shauna was absolutely fantastic and she was so helpful and kind! You never know lads, I might steal her from you to work for me!
title: Great Service!

review: This is right on O'Connell bridge so you're perfectly central. The room was nice, we had a huge comfortable bed, it was clean and spacious. The only problem was that our room was up 3 or 4 flights of stairs and they had no elevator. I wouldn't of minded, it's just that the person I was with has a disability, but when we mentioned this to the staff they were more than happy to bring our suitcases up to the room for us. We had one drink in the bar, just one, because it was pretty expensive for a single pint. But that's to be expected in a central city bar.Overall, would stay again.
title: Perfectly central

review: Just stayed at the Arlington for the U2 concert. We were greeted by Maggie at the reception and she went over and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. This hotel had great atmosphere, good food at great prices. The staff was exceptionally friendly. The Arlington is located right in the heart of the city so everything you need can be within walking distance. Next time in Dublin, we will definitely book Arlington. Cheers,Steve OCMD
title: Exactly what we needed

review: Great location. Close to Temple Bar. The hotel is old and could use some updating. The beds were very comfortable. There is no mini refrigerator or microwave in rooms. Which would have been nice since the portions at the restuarants are soo big. It would have been nice to be able to bring back the leftovers to reheat for a midnight snack. The steps to the room are a little tricky. Especially coming down. Be sure to stay to the left of the steps when coming down as the the right side of the steps cut short on some steps. Causing one to fall. Would be nice to have a railing on the left side coming down the steps as well. Overall the hotel was very nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again, for the location alone.
title: Arlington Hotel O'Connell Bridge

review: I just checked out of here after staying 2 nights. I just did not feel comfortable as a guest here like I had at the 4 other hotels I stayed at throughout Ireland. It was old, noisy, and the staff were not very friendly. It also had no A/C in the room and the bad ventilation in the room made it very warm in there, even in the early morning. The beds moved easily also and were not very comfortable. The only benefit to this hotel is its location, being in walking distance to many landmarks and places of interest.
title: Not Impressed.

review: Stopped in this hotel for a drink. It was about 7:30 pm on a Monday night and quite a few people already in and enjoying themselves. Live music, meals etc., The atmosphere was really good, its was just a pity my wife and I were just in Dublin for a couple of nights as we would have liked to have seen the Irish Show and have a meal.So we drank up and left to visit other places.Would certainly recommend
title: Great Atmosphere

review: I have just got home from a a hen weekend in Dublin, we stayed at the Arlington Hotel. The hotel is beautiful and full of Irish charm, it looks a little worn in places but I personally felt this added to the charm. The staff were all incredibly friendly and accommodating, when I first arrived the hair dryer in my room was not working however they sent someone up immediately to fix the problem. The Arlington hosts a Celtic Night each night which consists of a 3 course meal a live band and Irish dancers the evening costs around €34. We attended this on the first evening and it was absolutely fantastic! The music was beautiful, the dancers were stunning and the food was delicious! (And they do not scrimp on the portions!) The leader of the band was funny and entertaining and I felt this was the perfect introduction to Irish culture as I had not been there before. The hotel breakfast was great and they had something for everyone, after a couple of boozey nights the fry up was just what I needed to keep going! The only criticism I have is that the pillows were a bit hard but that really is nit picking! I thoroughly enjoyed my trip and my stay at the Arlington and would certainly return.
title: Fantastic experience at the Arlington Hotel

review: Just had one night here and loved it. Great little hotel, slightly aged but with a great atmosphere. Brilliant pub and great live music. STaff were very friendly and helpful. Walking distance to most attractions. The sun was shining - the perfect evening and night in Dublin. If you are not seeking absolute 5 star luxury, this is a great spot. Saying that it is clean, comfortable and well serviced - all you need for a good nights sleep in a great location.
title: Great location and fantastic atmosphere

review: We spent one night at the Arlington Hotel O'Connell Bridge after arriving in Dublin en route to Westport. We chose this hotel because of the location and it ended up being a great choice. If you want to be close to the action in Dublin, this location can't be beat. It's north of the river, so a tad quieter than being in the Temple Bar area, but just as convenient for accessing restaurants, pubs, shopping, and many tourist attractions. From the airport, the hotel is easily accessible from any of the city centre buses (both the 747 Dublin Bus and 700 Air Coach stop on O'Connell street, just around the corner from the hotel, although the 747 stop is closer).One huge perk that we didn't even consider when booking is that this hotel has fantastic amenities of its own. The hotel bar and restaurant are lively, with live music in the evenings. It is also the location of the Celtic Nights dinner and show, which hotel guests can take in at a reduced rate. We also took advantage of the hotel breakfast, which was great as well.We had a great stay and would definitely stay again when in Dublin!
title: Great hotel, fantastic location!

review: Only the location was great. I found the hotel very expensive for what it was and they are living on the location. Otherwise very average as far as service, quality and standard are concerned. Would look further next time.
title: Only the location

review: We arrived with our family for one night. We found the hotel to be in a great location and was beautifully appointed. We had spent a lot of money on a double room since we needed two beds for the kids and one for me and my wife. We had dinner and drinks in the restaurant by the lobby and listened to some great music and saw an example of Irish dancing. All seemed to be going well except around 7 PM the Dublin city road crew started erecting barriers right outside the hotel and within half an hour had started jackhammering at the street. At 10 o'clock the racket continued and we thought it must be finishing by 11. I called the front office and was told by someone that the front desk would call me back. They never did. I called back again around 1045 only to be told that someone was going to look into contacting the city to find out when the road crew would stop doing the work directly outside of the hotel. Keep in mind that our room was on the third floor facing the street and even with the windows closed it was too loud to sleep. No one called our room - again. At 12:15 I had to go down to the lobby to find out what was happening. The gentleman behind the desk could not tell me what was going on. He said he could not give me another room because it was completely booked. He said he would leave a note for the manager, who had gone home for the night, to speak with me in the morning about the noise. The hammering continued till around 2 AM. We were booked to be at a morning Dublin bike tour at 9:30. At 8:30 I went down to the front desk to check out. Granted, the whole family was pretty tired from the lack of sleep. I asked if there was any note attached to my file about speaking to the manager. Again the new person behind the desk, a nice woman this time, knew nothing about my complaint regarding the noise at night and had nothing to say except the manager would be in at 10.  So for anyone staying at the Arlington, you're going to get a great hotel and a great Irish experience so long as nothing unusual happens. As I've said in my note, I tried three times to communicate with the front desk. They told me enough to send me on my way but never dealt with the problem. Granted, the construction wasn't their idea, but nor was it mine. And at the end of the day I had paid for a room to sleep. They got their money but we didn't get quite what we wanted.
title: Great hotel, indifferent customer service

review: We arrived as a family group of 8 adults for a birthday celebration for a weekend.On arrival the welcome was very friendly and warm from the reception staff. We arrived before breakfast had ended and were directed to take breakfast at the residential rate.This service level was evident throughout the hotel for our entire weekend, nothing was too much.Rooms were large and well presented, food,drink & service excellent with entertainment every night within the hotel.10/10
title: Family celebration weekend

review: So many reviewers extolled the location of the Arlington Hotel in Dublin that I'd be remiss to go on, except wow, it really was so easy to walk and grab the streetcar a block away. That said, the room was not the most luxurious I'd ever seen, and I was glad for that. It was clean, quiet and comfortable. Maid service was good. Bathroom was quite spacious and nice, and the front desk folks were courteous, if less-than-attentive. It's a busy place, but if value and location are tops, and you don't want squick, I wouldn't think twice about recommending this hotel. And the Irish Breakfast/bar/restaurant facility in-house was fun! Do check out Govinda's vegan restaurant a block away.
title: No surprise: Great Location

review: Came across this hotel as we were on the way to temple bar. We never got to temple bar !! Fantastic night of live music, it was a rock band the night we visited and it was so much fun. Great atmosphere and everyone singing and dancing mixed ages but more our age (50s) than full of youngsters !! food was available but we didn't eat. Drinks were cheaper than temple bar which means a lot on a night out in Dublin !!! It was about 14 euros for a pint of Guinness and a vodka and coke ... which was cheap after the band there was a dj with more dancing .. we left around 2.30am and felt like we had had a fantastic night out !! Great find !! Would return !!
title: Saturday night out

review: Arrived early in the morning and not able to book in yet, which was fair enoughHowever staff very pleasant and helpful, taking our bags and locking them up for later when we did check inLocation is perfect, right on the Liffey just off O'Connell Street, 100 yards from Ha'Penny Bridge and a 10 minute stroll to the Temple Bar area (over the river)It's an old hotel, has real character, the bar was huge and nice, the breakfast area was also great There was a bus stop right by the hotel for the tourist loop buses (all 3 of them) and we used them straight awayThere was loads of cafe's, shops and a cracking doughnut shop close to the hotel, the location is fabWe arrived back later in the day to check in, we collected our bags and it took no time at allThe room was as expected, a double bed, a window that opened (fresh air), bathroom, TV and plenty of power points, handy nowadays and hanging spaceThe room was perfectly good, very clean, if there was a negative I'd say the bathroom was a little tired and I hate shower curtainsHowever tired is acceptable when it's as clean as it was so no issuesThe shower was hot and very powerful, a major plus and I was glad the window opened as the rooms (and the hotel itself) was very warmThere is no air con (usually not needed to be honest) and as it's a very old building, it stays rather warmBreakfast is served in the large breakfast room, cost was e10 for people from the hotel and e12 for people off the street, the continental breakfast was e7We all really enjoyed the breakfast, there was hot sausage, bacon, fried and scrambled eggs, black and white pudding, hash browns, mushrooms, beans and suchThere was lots of different breads on offer and they were superb, all locally produced, the croissants were also very tastyAs much tea, coffee and juices as you can drinks - a VERY GOOD breakfast and well worth e10 and set us all up for the day ahead Breakfast staff again we're great, very chatty, down to earth and helpful, staff in ther hotel were a credit to the hotelChecking out took moments and our stay was overNegatives....Nothing really, maybe the bathroom could do with an upgrade as a little tired but it was very clean so no real issueThe hotel was very warmPositives....Staff were really pleasant, very chatty and helpfulGood breakfastGreat location right on the river and near Ha'Penny bridge and Temple BarValue
title: great staff, great location

review: The hotel location is excellent centrally located . We arrived early to drop of bags to be greeted by friendly staff who gave us all the information we needed to get to croke park.The rooms were very clean and comfy. The food at the hotel was good and reasonably priced as well cheaper than temple bar which is totally a rip off. The live music was excellent as well .I Would have no problem booking the Arlington again
title: All Ireland semi final

review: The fire alarm went off repeatedly early in the morning but the hotel made no attempt to let people know these were false alarms. This is absolutely unacceptable. Otherwise the staff were very helpful and kind- apparently students, and understaffed. The fault lies with the owners/management.
title: Nice location, but safety concerns

review: great hotel , situated on o,connell bridge, entertainment was good food was good, rooms were good, if its a younger type of nightlife you want then its just a walk across the bridge to temple bar, this hotel is very deceiving, doesnt look that big from outside , once inside its amazing
title: great hotel

review: The stay was alright, but not worth the $200 price tag. The lobby area and bar are nice, but the room aren't anything fancy. I've stayed at better holiday inns in the US. The location is fantastic though, so if you're just going for that, this hotel is great.
title: OK Place To Stay

review: Stayed here for 3 nights and must say what a lovely hotel this is, our room was huge and airy beds just slightly hard but managed a good sleep, I'd definitely recommend eating in the hotel too its really reasonably priced compared to the rest of Dublin!!!! Would definitely stay here again!!!!!
title: Fantastic

review: Stayed in July 2017 with a friend - hotel is excellently situated, and has good bar food . Rooms are a bit tired but the price was reasonable for central Dublin. At night the room was very hot though, that would be my only real complaint. Watched the traditional music and dancing show one night which was great! Overall a good place to stay and would stay there again.
title: Great location, nice bar and entertainment

review: We unfortunately stayed here three nights as our first stop in Ireland. We shared a king/two twin bedroom on the first floor for one of those nights which was miserable. The hotel is very dated but the location was great so we muddled through our stay but left very sleep deprived. Our shared room was directly over the bar so we heard music most of the night. I would be shocked if there was any insulation at all in between the floors. On top of that, the room was very hot. There is no A/C so if you want to be cool at night, you need to leave your windows open which means you will hear everyone walking home from the bars at 2:00 a.m. and you will be awakened by the sun at 4:30 a.m. in the summer. There was no sheet (which I learned is typical in Ireland), only a thick covered duvet. One woman at the front desk staff was grumpy every time we went up there. However, the woman who sat us for breakfast every morning made up for the bad experience. She was delightful, cheery and remembered our large party liked to sit together. The breakfast was typical and pretty good. I can't say the same for lunch....very mediocre. We enjoyed the fact that there was a large breakfast and lunch room where we could sit and play cards during down time. The elevator was weird in that you had to insert your card every time you used it and it took several tries to get it to read properly. Overall, the hotel seemed dirty and desperately needing updated. Our party of 11 was supposed to return to the Arlington for one night after our tour of Ireland but we switched to another hotel because our experience was so bad.
title: Good location does not equate to good hotel

review: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting Dublin. On arrival staff allowed us to leave our luggage so we could explore the city before checking in. The hotel is situated in the heart of Dublin and sits right by the Ha' Penny Bridge. We can't fault anything about this hotel. Staff are very helpful and welcoming, the food is perfect and the bar is the perfect place for the 'crack'. We payed to attend the Celtic Night which is situated in the downstairs area of the hotel and I would highly recommend this for all people, young, old, especially families. The food and music really made our trip even more enjoyable.
title: Perfect

review: My mother in law booked this hotel for a family trip, I would never have booked this hotel in a million years on the face value. However I had no choice but to stay, the bare minimum I require from a hotel is its clean... This hotel was filthy, that's enough to not to ever book it - please see the pictures. Quick points *There was no AC * The taps didn't work *The shower leaded and was wrapped up with tape *Its noisey *The view from the windows in our room was laughable, lovely roof covered in AC units that don't work! *Bathroom covered in mould *Stained sheets - I could go on!Do not be fooled into thinking the location will make up for negatives of this hotel, there are other hotels - book those instead! That's the hotel, the dinner & show... The table layabouts was rubbish, the food was in-edible, IT WAS INSANELY HOT! The service was terrible! It was so loud, you could speak to someone next to you. I watched another couple leave midway through their starter it was that bad. It's over priced, and NOT worth it!Please I implore you NOT to book this hotel *do not waste your money.
title: Our worst hotel stay... Do not book.

review: a nice old fashion hotel. located about 10 - 15 minutes walk to Grafton St. It offers the basic amenities which you can expect. It is in need of some renovation. Rooms are well equipped. It is a nice and comfortable stay.
title: Old fashioned but nice

review: Lovely service from the team at reception including Daniel (evidently there are three Daniels). Rooms are spacious a little dated, especially the bathroom fixtures, but clean. Bed excellent. Great location for National Gallery of Ireland and city centre attractions.
title: Service and location overcome dated rooms

review: Booked this hotel for a long weekend to Dublin. It was an easy stroll to Grafton Street and O'Connell street. It was the staff that made this hotel. We arrived at 10am and Daniel on reception did a bit of shuffling and gave us a room straight away (the same for the couple in front). Not many hotels do this - this was a real bonus as we could get in immediately - no hanging around and storing bags. Nice comfy lounge. Good self service breakfast - with delicious yoghurts. Nice pub opposite called the Ginger Man. Just round corner from national gallery too.
title: Great location, nice friendly staff

review: Stayed 8th July 2017. Room was pleasant and comfortable, however at €300 our expectations were not met. I passed on breakfast (even though it was paid for) looking unappetising and poor quality. Dining room is very outdated. A good morning how are you when greeted would be nice upon arrival to the breakfast room! Check in was VERY poor. 3 phone calls and 1 visit to the hotel and the parking situation was still not made clear as the parking facilities for this hotel is not straightforward. Make use of your website! 2 trips back to the desk to get the room keys to work correctly? Staff need serious basic training at reception we feel. Lastly, staff were friendly however the guy supervising/managing the bar/restaurant area on the 8th needs a proper talking to. How he treated and spoke to the staff was shockingly horrific. The Swearing, the tone he took, the body language, pointing fingers and raising of hands and physically rushing past me that I nearly dropped my drink actually unsettled me to the point I had to leave. He is in the wrong job if he gets that angry! I felt so sorry for the waiter. 100% Out of order! I won't be returning.
title: Not deserving of a 4 star rating

review: Picked this hotel because I was going to be in Dublin for one night after touring Ireland.I'm so glad I did. The location is fantastic for the center of Dublin. Close to bars, restaurants and shopping. The staff couldn't be more helpful. A pleasure to deal with. The room was comfortable, ample sized. The only drawback is the fact that they are renovating so the smell of paint was in the hallway and there was scaffolding on the window, but no noise.
title: Great hotel, great location

review: Trinity City is a very nice hotel in a great location. They are building a 4th floor so keep in mind that they start drilling pretty early during the week. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Go see Gary and Radi at the bar!
title: Very Nice

review: We stayed in the 'Tara Rooms' which was quite luxurious. The beds were very comfortable, lovely decor and lots of room for our three teenagers. The location is excellent and was the reason we chose it as we only had one day to explore Dublin. The reasons for only 4 stars - the exercise room was closed and this was very disappointing. We paid well over $300e/over $500CDN for one night (and this was the pre-paid price) so not having really any other amenities was a bit of an annoyance. The hotel has a partnership with Trinity College to use their pool however this is an extra cost. The breakfast - the 'discounted' price for hotel guests is 14e per person....not in this family's budget! Dublin is a VERY expensive city, we get that, but at least have the gym available or offer a room discount if it's not in use. Or how about a free pool pass when the gym is down? Tip - for breakfast we went to Sparta right around the corner and had fresh pasties, yogurt and a stack of bananas for just over 10e.
title: Very comfortable but pricey

review: We stayed for a weekend and were very happy. It is a bit pricey but you are right in the heart of the city so we expected to pay more. The lobby is really pretty and different with all the purple décor and it was very comfortable to come back in the evening and have the couches in the lobby to relax and have a drink or quick bite. The breakfast was pretty good and the staff was very friendly and helpful . Our room was big and had a separate sleeping area for our 2 teens which was great. We loved it and would definitely stay again .
title: Beautiful Hotel and great location.

review: As soon as you walk in the foyer of this hotel you are like wow. There is a dog statue that I couldn't help but hug. The door man was so helpful, you could ask him anything and he would help!! It is very central so when you're drunk and trying to find your way back you're lucky as Temple Bar is only 5 minutes away. Also a heads up go to the doughnut shop on the bridge. YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.
title: You Donut Want To Leave

review: The O'Callaghan Davenport Hotel is located near the center of Dublin, Ireland just a block north of Merrion Square. It is also located about a block east of Trinity College and several blocks south of the River Liffey. It is also located next to the house were Oscar Wilde grew up (it is now some type of small college). The hotel is located about 9 miles from Dublin International Airport or approximately 25 minutes by taxi (longer if you are in rush hour).I stayed here for 2 nights in late May with my wife and youngest daughter and thought the hotel was nice and also thought it was in a great location near many major tourist attractions. We paid $240 a night for a triple room (one king size bed and a twin bed) which I thought was pretty reasonable. Breakfast was not included and was 15 Euros per day per person. I thought the lobby and bar area were nice looking and I also liked my hotel room (the carpet and furniture were updated). In addition the room was above average in size. The front desk people were friendly but there only seemed to be one on duty at any given time.My only complaint was the poor breakfast service. The main breakfast room was full so we had to go to the bar area where the guy working there was lazy and would not help us (I thought he was a dishwasher or cleaning person). We had to walk back into the other area and ask for help. Finally one of the employees brought us some coffee and asked our server why he was not helping us (and then he blamed it on is for not asking for help).Overall I enjoyed staying at the O'Callaghan Davenport Hotel and thought the hotel was nice and I really liked its central location. If you are staying south of the River Liffey I recommend this hotel.
title: Nice hotel in a good location

review: To say that the Davenport needs an update is an understatement. The O'Callaghan sister hotel across the street, the Alex just got one. That said, it was clean, and the bed was comfortable, which was a plus. I had a jr. king suite, which was roomy, but the bathroom was kinda small. But, it was bright, clean, and the shower was hot and strong. The staff was friendly, and the bar was nice. I didn't do the breakfast there. I looked at it, and it didn't look to appealing to me so I went elsewhere. That said, there is nothing really wrong with this hotel. I can't give it an above average rating, though. Would I recommend it to someone? Sure, if what you are looking for is a clean, convenient place to crash and you understand you are not getting 4 or 5 star accommodations. Also, take into account that the reviews about the air conditioning are right on. Ours didn't work very well at all. The staff was friendly enough to get us a fan, which pretty much solved the problem. This goes back to what I said about it needing at update. Bottom line - it's a fine place to stay if you know what you getting, and I probably would stay there again if I couldn't find a little bit better option, but I was there on a busy, busy weekend, so this was it for me.
title: Tired hotel, but clean and in excellent location

review: We celebrated our honeymoon in Ireland, and my husband booked a room at the O'Callaghan Davenport Hotel. From the outside, it's a beautiful hotel, and when we checked in, it was a beautiful lobby. I was really excited! And then we walked into the room. When we walked, there was an issue with the electricity within the room. We called to the front desk, who called several electricians into the room to fix the problem. The electricians came in and out of the room for an hour, and were able to fix the issue, but we lost an hour of our time, with no apology or compensation. The room was comfortable but a bit dated and really needed to be remodeled (the bathtub had wood on the sides???). Additionally, there was spots of blood on the shower curtain, and the clocks were set at the wrong time which made us an hour late for a tour. With all the hotels in Dubin, I wouldn't book this one again.
title: Lovely Facade, but huge Disappointment.

review: Stayed here for U2 concert , friendly / informative staff upon check in. Room was good size and spotless , not the mist modern room but well maintained. All the staff were great and had a good breakfast the next day. Very central location. Hairdryers in bathroom should be in a museum , did ask if they had a better one we could borrow but never heard back. Overall good stay .
title: Good experience

review: Nice hotel in the entry and dining room. The bar was ok but the rooms were very very small. I would not stay here again. I would rather spend some money investing in a B&B and a larger room. The people here were very friendly though. Listen, I hate to give anyone a review with less than 4 stars but this hotel just has very small rooms.
title: Very small rooms/Stay in a B&B

review: Most reviews are spot on. This hotel is small, smelly, and needs to be renovated. It was not at all what i was expecting paying 4 star hotel prices. The biggest con was the A/C did not work and when I called reception all they did was bring me a portable fan. Seriously?!?!?! Do yourself a favor and chose another hotel.
title: Mediocre Hotel

review: The O Callaghan Davenport Hotel was once quite a landmark hotel at the heart of Georgian Dublin? that was 20 years ago. While the historic exterior of the hotel is still attractive, the hotel inside has a tired look and is definitely in need of refurbishment. That said, the location next to the recently re-launched National Gallery of Ireland has a brilliant location and the famous Irish pubs of Dublin's lower baggot street with great breakfasts and bar food all day, including my favourite Doheny and Nesbits as well as Toners.
