Staff were very pleasant and helpful but during my four night stay, the fire alarm in the whole hotel went off several times in one day and I had to quickly get dressed and run down the fire escape stairs along with all other guests. This was very annoying- particularly as the hotel manager said that the cause of the alarm was steam from showers in some of the bathrooms!. Well - Fix it please!I booked a delux king room. There was a kettle and tea/ coffee making facilities but NO mini-fridge. This is a big draw back during the hot summer months in Ireland. No complimentary bottles off water - even on the day of arrival. Small bottle of water were on sale at the main reception deck or one euro . Breakfast was hood value at 10 euros per day- additional to the room price. I would rate Davenpprt as a three star somewhat tired looking hotel. It has lost its sense of sumptuousness and I would not stay there again.
title: Comfortable stay but fire alarm in hotel kept going off and had to vacate my room each time

review: I love this place. Just as well I had not paid for breakfast, as I was generally sleeping to late in the morning. This was the comfiest, quietist and darkest room I have ever had the pleasure to sleep in. I loved the vintage feel, and would argue that it should never be updated. Our suite was the perfect size, and offered us a comfy environment for a week of relaxation. I am already planning another week at the Davenport.
title: Planning my next visit already

review: We had 5 nights here on a sight seeing trip to Dublin. The welcome was warm abd service was friendly and efficient. The twin bedded room was spacious and comfortable. Two local pubs made up for the rather brightly lit and unatmospheric hotel bar. The hotel's position close to Merion Square Trinity College and the National museums was ideal.
title: Friendly efficient service

review: Rooms were small with no working A/C. The hotel is fairly centrally located and near Trinity College and walking distance to many of the tourist attractions. Staff was responsive but insisted that A/C worked when it didn't. I didn't find the front desk staff to be as proactive in offering suggestions as the staff at most other places are.
title: Nothing To Write Home About

review: This is an older hotel and we were with a tour group so our rooms were "run of the house" which usually means not as updated and sometimes without much view. That being said it was very comfortable and clean. Everything was in working condition and beds were comfy. WIFI worked well and was free. Our breakfast had numerous choices that were well displayed and tasty. The location of the hotel is great for exploring. The Airlink Express bus 757 (to/from the airport) is just 2 blocks from the hotel. Recommended.
title: Nice Stay.

review: Whilst it is getting on in age the Davenport was still very comfortable. Bathrooms a bit old fashioned but everything you need is there and the staff can't do enough for you. Buffet breakfast as good as the other hotels in Dublin and Belfast that we stayed in.\Great location to walk to everything.
title: An old fashioned hotel but comfortable.

review: Danilo was a friendly ahd helpful man who got us quickly registered and tried very hard to help us get registration problems sorted out. He was back in the morning and promptly got us checked out and called a cab to get us to the train. Breakfast was good and it was filling. The room was wonderful and comfortable. We recommend the hotel to anyone who is going in this area.
title: Thank you Danilo

review: This old classic hotel is a bit worn but worth it. It is in close proximity to Trinity College, the newly renovated Art Museum and not far from the main shopping area. The rooms are of adequate size and they hay have king rather than double beds (always a good thing)!
title: Convenient location

review: Wonderful hotel at great price for Dublin and for July. Clean bedrooms, friendly staff. Very central for all your shopping needs. Dinner was lovely and served by a lovely waitress called Amy. Problem in the kitchen with our order and chef was very rude shouting at her (he made the mistake) so everyone in the restaurant could hear. Amy was so professional and polite to us and apologised to us for his rudeness. She even made time to have a laugh and joke with us. Breakfast not as good as selection limited but will definitely stay again.
title: 1 night shopping stay

review: I stayed at the Maldron, Smithfield for 5 nights, whilst working in Dublin. I thought the hotel was hugely over priced - up to £142 per night. The sink was cracked, very basic toiletries - a squirty bottle of lux, poor quality towels, cheap tv (walkers - not a make I am familiar with), very limited channels on the tv - 15 of them, colby trouser press and iron - with a completely worn out cover. I thought the breakfast was very average and understaffed, kept running out of stuff and having to ask for it to be replenished.The staff were the one highlight, they were very helpful and efficientFor the money paid, I would expect an awful lot better. I am glad work was paying, as I wouldn't spend my own money to stay here
title: Poor quality for money paid

review: Stayed her for three night is April as part of a trip with friends. In a good location near the hop on hop off stops. Grocery store right next door with hot food available. The rooms were clean and staff were very friendly. Had lost my charger and the front desk loaned me one for my stay. Had a little mix at check in, but think that may have been the travel companies fault and not the hotels. Would stay here again.
title: Nice place for the money

review: Well I would recommend the Maldron Hotel in Smithfield, certainly for the price that we paid for a room for four people sharing, with breakfast included.A convenient location away from the hustle and bustle of Temple Bar and its environs, yet not too far away (10 minutes walk) from the centre of Dublin itself.One of the Dublin Pass attractions is directly across the courtyard outside the hotel (Jamesons Whisky Distillery).A convenient fresh produce supermarket is situated next door to the hotel in case you need to stock up on fresh essentials for your day trips around the city.Would have no hesitation staying at this location again.
title: Worth the money we paid through Expedia

review: I was truly expecting more from this hotel based on the photos online. The site describes its rooms as "luxurious and spacious rooms for a good night's rest". The only truth to that description is the spacious room. However, luxury and good night's rest were lacking during our stay. Between the outdated room/bathroom, air conditioner not working and the hard/uncomfortable bed, we missed out on the "luxury" and "good night's rest" portion of the website description. While the hotel was centrally located, it seemed overpriced considering its rate, no breakfast included, outdated rooms and uncomfortable bed.
title: Misleading online photos

review: My family had several rooms here recently and for a night on our way to Killarney. The rooms we had included a double bed and a twin. That worked well for my husband and I and our son. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. As is the case in my places in Ireland, there is no ac so you need to keep your window open if it is a warmer evening. When the windows are open, you get a nice breeze. We were on the 6th floor and it is a quiet area, so there was no problem with doing so. Next to the hotel is a large market with food, fresh pastries, drinks, and other assorted good. Across the cobblestone way is Jo's Burgers, as well as a great breakfast place called Sparks and the Cobblestone, a traditional Irish Pub is right across the street. It was a perfect place to stay for the evening. The one drawback is keeping the windows open on the lower floor, where another family member stayed, tends to be more difficult as there is some noise on the street. Also, to put your car in the garage it is an additional 14 euros a day and you have to pay every time you take the car out and return. This is the reduced rate when you stay at the hotel. The staff was so helpful and accommodating especially those working at the front desk and for the evening we stayed there it worked out well.
title: Would visit again

review: I stayed here for work, my room was clean and spacious with an amazingly comfortable bed. TV a little small for the size of room and distance from the bed, but not a deal breaker. Free WIFI, lifts to all floors, ability to check in online and print boarding pass for flights. Breakfast had ample choice and service good. Overall happy to stay at this quaint old charming hotel and would recommend.
title: Comfortable stay

review: When we first arrived there was a bit of a mix up with our room that the staff fixed as fast as they could. Our room was rather spacious. The food was good, but make sure you get down early out much of it will be gone.
title: Comfortable

review: We had planned to stay here for our whole trip but when we arrived we had to move hotels due to a flood on our floor. We stayed a night at the Alexander location. The St. Stephens location is definitely nicer of the two. Great location and walkable to all the sites. It's quiet at night and it was great to run around St. Stephens green in the morning.
title: Nicer of the O'Callahan's in Dublin

review: we had 2 rooms both in the new part, very nice rooms . Very upmarket hotel, breakfast was a full Irish but with a rocket salad on top which was something I was not used to. but all in all a nice hotel in heart of everything..and you could park out side ..
title: excellent hotel

review: Nice Hotel in perfect location. Cozy and clean rooms and the staff is very friendly. The hotel is located at St. Stephens Green Park. There are a lot pubs and restaurants around. Only ten minutes to Temple Bar. The breakfast is very good and you can book three categories.
title: Nice Town-Hotel

review: We stayed as part of a group. Our room was "run of the house" as per our tour. It was nothing special with a view of a wall 10 feet away. However, it was clean and functional. The beds were comfy and the WIFI worked well. We had breakfast included and it was reasonably good with nice choices.We did have a group dinner one evening and it was very well done with hot, delicious entrees and good service.All in all, this is a well situated hotel in Dublin and is very near to the Airlink Express bus 757 to and from the airport. Recommended.
title: Good Stay!

review: Hotel is in a very good location, walking distance to many of the important places to see and things to do. Stephen's Green is right next door and is such a lovely place to wonder. The Hop On Hop Off bus stops right by the hotel. There are a lot of hotels and pubs/bars around so you'll be spoilt for choice.Staff is friendly and efficient. We had a room on the top floor which was nice and quiet. Windows can open, which is becoming more and more rare in hotels nowadays so that was good.Little things like the toilet seat being broken and no hot water in the shower in the morning weren't great but the bathroom has both a bar and a separate shower, which is nice and spacious. Beds were comfortable enough so I had a few good nights sleep, which is always nice.Free Wifi, no parking (I don't think).Overall, a very nice stay in a great area and we'd come back.
title: Great location!

review: Stayed here 15/16 July as we had tickets for River Dance at the Gaiety Theatre...just a ten minute walk from this hotel.We arrived early but our room was ready so that was great. Reception staff were lovely as were the housekeeping staff when we got lost trying to find our room.The room was huge, the bed was huge and everything was spotless.Had a very good nights sleep considering you are just on the edge of busy Grafton Street and the Luas.We were even able to have a well deserved lie-in as breakfast is served till 11am on a Sunday.Breakfast was delicious. Cooked to order and while you are waiting for that to arrive you can help yourself to the well stocked continental breakfast...meats, cheese, fruits, pastries......The waiting staff are excellent. They make sure you have everything you need and then leave you alone so you can have a wonderfully relaxed breakfast. At no point did I feel the need to wolf breakfast down for the next guests.I have stayed in many Dublin Hotels over the years and atlast I have found one I will return to.
title: Excellent stay

review: Only stayed in the hotel for one night. The room was a big enough room for city centre hotel. Comfortable furnishings. The windows were onto a busy road but we're completely sound proof. The bathroom was a little dated but more wear and tear than anything else. It had a bath shower so not for those with mobility issues but fine for us. The shower had great power. Didn't get breakfast so can't comment. Overall it's good value for what you get for a city centre hotel.
title: Good location for shopping!

review: So far not impressed! Poor service in bar .... only three tables of three and two bartenders and a manager behind the bar! Room has mould in the shower.... door in hallway squeaks sooo bad anyone have some WD-40? Definitely not a four star.
title: Ugh!

review: I am a big believer that a hotel serves the trip; I don't need fancy or endless amenities as I expect to be travelling the city.O'Callaghans totally fit that bill! The location in the southwest corner of St. Stephen's Green made just about everything south of the Liffey accessible within a 15-20 minute walk. The room was spacious and clean and the hotel bar was a good place for a final drink, so long as your day was ending but midnight (which was rare). There was also an excellent burger/fries food truck set up across the road after 10:00 each night for a late night meal.The only issue we had was, being there in July, we found the room very warm and the AC not very effective. Opening the windows did he trick but we were on the front of the hotel, with a busy street and team line below us. That said, we generally managed pretty well, keeping windows open most of the day and closing them our (few) hours of sleep. But the morning's were warm!!All in all we enjoyed our stay and would stay again !
title: Outstanding Location, but a Little Hot!

review: We booked this hotel as we were going to a concert in iveagh gardens and it was a good location. On arrival there was only one staff member on reception, at a weekend and as she was dealing with someone we were left waiting which wasn't a great first impression. The hotel seemed a bit tired to me interior wise, both the lobby and our room. The room was a nice size, the bed was comfy and I liked that they use eco friendly toiletries in the bathrooms. There was however a fingernail sitting on my bedside table which may seem fussy but it was one of the first things I saw on a dark wood surface so I don't know how the person cleaning the room missed it and it made me wonder what else has potentially been missed. I thought the bathroom had no toilet roll holder but then I realised it had, it was just broken and still there but not functioning. The bath panels were also mis matched. These may seem small details but they were not the standard I was expecting from the hotel and for the price. The check out was really speedy and they held bags for us until later that day. All in all an ok hotel in a good location that I won't rush back to.
title: Good location but a bit tired

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: We were staying in this hotel for one week and loved it.Nice, clean and modern decorated room. Very comfy bed and pillows.EXCELLENT LOCATION!!! Surrounded by best restaurants in Dublin, very close to the beautiful Stephens park as well (worth a daily walk).Highly recommended!!!
title: Excellent place to stay in Dublin

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: The service at this hotel was very polite and focused on customer satisfaction. It was easy to deal with any of the staff. The rooms and public areas are clean and in good condition. Nice breakfast and good food in the restaurant. The hotel is within a walking distance from the city center and pricing was reasonable. A nice innovation to have the gym in the sixth floor with a good view out.
title: Excellent service at walking distance from city center

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: This is a new beautiful hotel but it is very warm and there is no AC and one window only opens a small amount. There is small fan but the room is stuffy and hot. Unpleasant sleeping conditions. Ice is only from room service. Not my favorite place.
title: Beautiful but

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: The place is beautiful spacious and elegant. The lobby is filled with amazing decor. The staff are very nice and helpful. The dining area is huge and has a great atmosphere the menu has a big variety to choose from. The rooms are nice nothing special just plain and a little cramped. There is a free shuttle bus to Dublin airport every 15 minutes which was very handy. If you were in a rush you could just pop your hotel card into a box and they would come and check it out for you which in my eyes was a great idea. Considering the price and the standard of the room they lost one star but everything else was really good and I definitely recommend it.
title: Beautiful

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: The Clayton Hotel was a lovely base for our mid week break in Dublin.It was a 15 minute walk into the city centre, with bus stops situated outside the hotel. There is car parking available at the hotel for a discounted rate of €13 per day if you are a guest.The breakfast was nice, with a good choice of cereals, fruit and breads. The cooked buffet was good considering how many they are catering for, although for how much they charge for breakfast, better quality sausages wouldn't go amiss.With the exception of one receptionist, the staff were friendly and helpful. The concierge, if you managed to find him, was very helpful and knowledgable about the city.When booking the room, I phoned to book as I needed to request a cot in the room, and could not do this online. I was not given the best deal over the phone, I could have saved more choosing my deal online, but took the hit as I needed the cot - which was provided free of charge. Upon checking in though, this addition was not added to my room and we had to wait to check there was a cot available, which luckily there was. Also, the receptionist who checked me in did not give me any information regarding the restaurant times, breakfast times, check out times etc. Not a major problem, but it is a basic requirement when checking in, and certainly one I would expect from a 4 star hotel.We enjoyed our stay, it was a very comfortable, clean room. I must complement the housekeeping team, they do their job exceptionally well and I could not fault the rooms at all.
title: Mid week break

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Its just a short bus ride into the city (opposite side of the street, 2 euros, exact money; taxis no more than a tenner inc a tip) hence we rounded off our trip round Ireland with a couple of nights here to see Dublin. The hotel is fine, everything that you would expect, incuding the Dublin price of 170 Euros per night excluding parking and breakfast, plus (unexpected), a 3am wakey wakey call from a fire alarm error. But overall, this is a hunky dory hotel and we had a happy time there.Now do be careful if you order breakfast and parking on arrival. We bought both for two nights and paid up front. So receiving an extra charge upon leaving was a bit of a surprise, since we'd had no extras. Apparently we had only been charged for one day's breakfast, not two. So I paid up, but did check the bill. Another surprise, the second day's brekky was more expensive than the first - as we had 'not pre-booked it' - but we had. At length the lady at reception agreed to refund me the difference - but then noticed she had not charged us for the second day's parking. So all in all, I was going to have to pay more. We called it quits. So if you do order breakfast on arrival, do double check that they have it recorded.
title: Short bus ride from town

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Myself and partner booked this hotel last minute and where not disappointed. From the man on the phone to the check I'm a reception they where all so friendly and helpful. We headed into town but came back to the bar for a few drinks which was relaxing. Breakfast the next morning was delicious and plenty of hot and cold food to suit all. Look forward to returning soon.
title: Fantastic

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: A recent one night stay was our first since the hotel was rebranded as Clayton.Delighted to see the hotel has reclaimed many of the characteristics which made the old Burlington such a great Dublin hotel.We were greeted by friendly,professional reception staff and although we arrived in advance of official check in time we were allocated a room without difficulty.The room was well equipped, spacious,comfortable and quiet.Breakfast which goes on until 10.30am is excellent with a wide choice of fresh fruits,cereals and hot food.Restaurant area is quite large but the staff have no difficulty in providing an efficient service.Hotel location is excellent just a short bus hop into city centre but there are a number of very good pubs and restaurants in the vicinity if you want to give the city a miss.I look forward t staying here again.
title: V/good Hotel

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Loved the location and the staff! We arrived well before check in time and our room was ready and we were allowed to check in, excellent since we took the red eye from NYC! The staff was very helpful with all our questions. I traveled with my parents and each evening they had dinner and a beer in the restaurant the staff and service was also excellent. Good rates for a three person room. The room was very nice, clean. Loved that they had an American outlet in the room, plus gave out adapters at the front desk free of charge!
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: On our arrival Sunday evening the 6th of aug we dealt with a blonde foreign lady who was very ignorant and didn't make us feel one bit welcome. I also didn't understand what she was saying even when I said sorry could you say that again, she wouldn't repeat what she said. We were also told we would have to PAY for parking ? €26 for the two nights! A bit ridiculous considering we paid €240 for the two nights with just a bed. The breakfast was also robbery €13 for a fry and €5 for a bowl of coco pops a bit crazy if you ask me . There was no electricity in our room from about half 10 Monday night until we were leaving Tuesday morning. Had to use a light on our phone to shower and go to the toilet . We were woken up to building out the back too Tuesday morning and you could also hear everything happening out in the hall as the doors don't seem too sound proof . Poor stay overall .
title: Bad stay

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Staff was wonderful. Hotel was very clean. We did have one glitch and when we told the staff about it, they immediately apologized for the inconvenience and provided us with a free dinner. Hop On / Hop Off bus passes by every morning at 9:35, so you have no problem getting to great attractions.
title: Wonderful Hotel

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Came here for the first time excellent hotel. STAFF friendly and helpful rooms spacious and clean. This is a well run hotel food and drink excellent would definitely recommend to others and I will be back.
title: First time

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: No longer a DoubleTree hotel! Very disappointed with this hotel. It is modern in design but lacks character. We found the front desk staff to be rude, others in the hotel ranged from pleasant to unpleasant. Charge daily for parking and breakfast is 18 euro. It is away from City Centre so you will need to take transportation into the rest of Dublin, a bus stop is outside the hotel but the staff was not at all knowledgeable about the routes. Rooms were hot and had poor ventilation. There was a portable air conditioner in the room but it did not perform well enough to cool the room. Even opening the windows would not bring in enough cool air.
title: Rude front desk

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: The hotel, restaurant, cafe and room was incredible!! We arrived well before our reservation and our room was ready and they let us up!! Perfect for a quick nap before exploring! We recommend if you are exploring a lot of Dublin, get the Dublin Pass, we saved a lot of money and time this way!!
title: Great Hotel!

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: I had to cancel a booking at very late notice, but the Burlington (Alanze in particular) were so easy to deal with. I have been there before for functions and the staff are always helpful. Quality of food is good and the hotel is kept very clean! Based on the level of customer service I will definitely stay there next time!
title: Reservations help

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Recently got the chance to stay at this hotel on business for 2 nites. Food offerings in coffee bar and breakfast were excellent and staff at coffee bar and breakfast were warm welcoming and friendly. We will be returning.
title: Great staff.

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: I booked my stay last minute on the day I was travelling. The reservation person I dealt with, Stephen, was so helpful and friendly. We got a great rate for bed and breakfast (perhaps due to how late we booked). When we arrived the hotel was quite busy but they had every desk open. We were checked in by a lovely Duty Manager unfortunately I forget her name. On the day we stayed the weather in Dublin was very warm, this hotel does not have air-conditioning but when we got to our room they already had the blinds closed and a fan running to cool the air. I hadnt stayed her before but I will definitely go back.
title: Great Customer Service

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Overnighted here after a late arrival into Dublin Airport. With 3 kids and 2 adults we normally have to swallow the cost of 2 rooms. I was so impressed they offered a family suite! Beautifully appointed rooms and plenty of space. It's a gorgeous hotel, the staff are friendly and kind. The breakfast was incredible!
title: Super hotel close to the Airport

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Very nice room however the AC was out of order. Large room and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast is good. Busy hotel just a 10 minute walk from St Stephens Green and Grafton Street. Air coach operates from outside the hotel directly to the airport.
title: Good hotel and great location

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: As you walk in the door a warm greeting from staff receptions staff 4of them happy to help. Food great breakfast fast and no q dinner good food staff happy to help bar staff knowledge good nothing to much trouble. General manager always available upon request and alway around hotel keeping eye upon the operation thank you Clayton court the best so far this year.
title: Amazing

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Great position for getting aboutClean and friendlyGood serviceRooms were stifling Too warm with no aircon They bought a mobile unit but it was so noisyA lot like a Premier Inn but twice the priceBreakfast option was fabulous with a full Irish or a selection of cakes and pastries (Both if you want them)Easy access to Taxis outside the hotel
title: Nice Hotel but over priced

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Although is little bit far from downtown, it can be a good choice: Clean, silence, good connection with Airport - bus 700 in front of the hotel with a schedule . For downtown you can find 3-4 buses opposite hotel for different direction. Bed confortable and ketle for tea and coffee.
title: good hotel for a city break

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: My husband and I stayed here on Sunday 26 th June . We arrived at 2.35 pm to check in but our room wasn't ready which was fair as we were 25 mins early . We took a seat like we were asked and tried again to check in at 3.05 pm . Unfortunately our room wasn't ready so we were told to leave our bags with concerige and try later . We left the hotel to get some dinner and returned and tried again to check in at 4.45 pm . We were asked to present proof of our booking by the young man on the desk as they had no record and then we were told for the third time our room wasn't ready . We were annoyed at this stage and he offered to get the manager . He returned after almost ten minutes to say room was ready ( no manager ) . We received no apology no welcome to the hotel ( that seemed to be only for the guests who's rooms were ready ) and no refreshments while we waited . We like a lot of the guests checking in we're in town for the Phil Collins concert and the room prices were increased to reflect this 239 euro plus 13 euro for parking . Gate for the concert opening at 6 pm so not giving us adequate time to refresh before hand . We weren't the only ones having trouble getting our rooms on time and the manager should have come out to apologise but he left the young man on the desk to deal with disgruntled guests . If the hotel can charge almost double for the rooms on these occasions then maybe they should ensure extra housekeeping staff on duty to ensure rooms are ready . We had just returned from a 3 week stay in Canada where we found the hotel service outstanding and front desk staff excellent and always so welcoming. Shame we came home to such poor quality service in our capital city . Maria Cleary
title: Poor check in service

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Stayed here several times when it was the Burlington hotel and owned by the Hilton doubletree group...never had any problems always a very comfortable stay. Our room was on the 6 th floor which had air con which I am led to believe not all rooms have it so it probably only a major factor when the weather is hot! Only a 10 min walk to town and walking through st Stephens green is a very pleasant walk as the grounds are kept very well. There are always taxis outside this property so great to hop into and buses from across the road go to town. We get the air coach from Dublin airport to right outside this property and from across the road to go back to the airport. The breakfast is great, enough to set you up for the day a good variety. There is a Bar which serves food / snacks too( check times didn't use it on this occasion but have used it in the past) maybe be different since the Clayton group taken over this property. There is also a fitness room which I walked past swiftly!
title: Returning home!

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Sadly this trip was disappointing due to his hotel. Rest of Dublin great but avoid his place. Sewage coloured water in bath....problem unresolved even though changed rooms and only comp offered was a glass of wine. Couldn't drink or use water in my room and had to wash using bottled water like on camp....duty manager lady pleasant but ineffective in sorting base issue. Have never complained before but added to false alarm at 3 this morning too, no breakfasts for that price....not value for money....don't want single people....rip off
title: Dirty water and no breakfast for three nights over £412

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Arrived at the hotel about 8.30pm after only booking about an hour before hand on booking.com and parked the car and went into reception. Got a really good first impression. Reception was lovely and the guy checking us in was very nice and welcoming. He also told us the bar served food until 10pm which we were really happy about. Got in the lift and went up to leave our bags in the room before dinner. Room was OK. Was nice and clean but it was small. And the shower had no power in it at all.Went down to the bar then to get food. I got the chicken wings to start and my partner had the leek and potato soup - both which were really nice.For mains my partner got the beef rib which he really enjoyed and I got the Thai green chicken curry. I would defo recommend not to get it. It did not look appealing at all. I have attached a picture of the curry. It came out cold - both the rice and the curry. We said it to the waitress who was really nice and she took it back to the kitchen. About ten minutes later it came back by a manager who did not even say sorry. Curry was hot, rice was still cold. I did not want to say it again so I had a few spoon fulls and then realised I could not eat any more. It was revolting. It was watery, bland and there were no vegetables or anything in it. Just the sauce and the chicken. I put my knife and fork on the plate in the 'finished' way while we finished our drinks. I seen three waitresses look at my plate but chose to avoid me as they could see I didn't eat any of it. In the mean time I saw three other people send back their food. Two of which were at the same table. When we finished our drinks we asked for the bill which they brought us for €74 euro for four drinks, two starters and two mains. We paid and left (with my food still in front of me). The second I got up I seen the waitress to straight to my table to clear my plate, which she obviously just didn't want to ask me what was wrong.. Also there was air con blowing right down on our table making us freezing cold and we asked them to turn it off but they couldn't which we understood as all the air con is connected to the whole hotel.That curry just put me off everything.It was about half nine when we ordered and service dies stop at ten so they were probably trying to rush it. But I saw three other people send back they're food too.When checking out the next day, we had to pay 13 euro for our car to be parked at hotel.Would not recommend
title: Would not recommend

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: If I could give it more stars, I would as everything was wonderful from the moment we checked in and out. Our room was spotless on arrival, they had even taken the time to leave a complimentary pudding with Happy Birthday written on it for my boyfriend as we were celebrating his birthday while there.We stayed here for 6nights and cant grumble about anything. Every day the room was cleaned, bins emptied, towels and toiletries replaced. I think the housekeepers do a wonderful job and I found it refreshing that they take the time to talk. We ate in the hotel bar on a couple of occasions and found each meal to be made from good quality produce. I liked the fact that all the sauces were is separate dishes instead of on the plates as not everyone likes to have their food plastered in sauce!! All the waiters/waitresses were friendly and took the time to tell us the best bars to go to in town for live music.Breakfast was busy but the staff handled it brilliantly, I don't think I would have been that calm!! Such a wide range of foods were on offer, they even had plenty of gluten free produce.Finally the front desk staff, from my observations they get the brunt of visitors complaints as check in does seem to be a bit of a nightmare at times. Due to this some guests were extremely rude to them. Granted there didn't seem to be enough staff on reception but that doesn't give the rite for guests to be rude!! That's what the manager is for!We had a wonderful 6 night stay and would defiantly stay there again.
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Stayed here recently for a concert and I was really impressed with the place. Very easy to get to from the city centre by bus and taxi. Rooms were very comfortable now and had no problems with them.The bar has a and avoids being claustrophobic like a lot of hotel bars by having lots of space.Bar staff were brilliant and quick with the drinks. Shoutout to David who was really welcoming and recommended some great cocktails.Overall I enjoyed my stay and would recommend.
title: Great hotel with great staff.

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Stayed here with a large group of colleagues for an awards event. Facility caters to groups/businesses as they have a very large well equipped conference center. Rooms were clean and adequate with no frills. Regular rooms (which I stayed in) do not have air conditioning so I had to keep the window open. This made it hard to get to sleep because of the noise from outside. Hotel is within walking distance of St. Stephen's Green (15 min) and Grafton Street (20 min). We felt safe walking this at night as well.
title: Large, modern, clean hotel within walking distance of tourist sites

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: The Clayton is excellent value for money: modern and very clean rooms, lovely breakfast, but most importantly staff who is extremely committed! We celebrated our daughter's birthday there and they went out of their way to make sure that she is truly spoiled. The city center can be reached by taxi easily, but it can also be a pleasant 10 to 15 minute walk to St Stephen's Green. And not to forget, the Canal Bank Cafe is just one minute away from the Clayton.
title: Excellent value for money - fantastic staff

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: I returned for my third visit to this hotel last week for an overnight stay in Dublin. The first time I visited was when the hotel was a Doubletree - that was an excellent stay with a large room and good views. I returned in April this year for the first time as the Clayton and also enjoyed the stay, although that time I had a much smaller room and a view of the buildings at the back of the hotel instead. Because of this, I booked an Executive King instead of the Standard Room for this visit as I hoped it would be for a larger room similar to my first stay. You can imagine my absolute awe when I was - out of the blue - upgraded to the Presidential suite upon checking in. The member of staff who checked me in was so, so lovely and I only wish I had asked for her name to be able to mention her directly in this review. She even took the time to ask the next day how the trip had been and I left feeling most looked after - thank you.As for the Presidential Suite.. I was speechless. It was beautiful - with wonderful views, a living area, dining area, kitchen, two bathrooms, two coffee stations, a walk-in wardrobe, a study area and the most comfortable bed. Needless to say, none of the intended plans for the city that night took place as it was much more enjoyable to just have a few drinks in the hotel bar and enjoy the wonderful accommodation instead!The Clayton has excellent parking facilities, bus links outside the front of the hotel and cheap taxi fares into the city centre. The reason I have continued to return here for short stays in Dublin are because of the amazing breakfast buffet, the fantastic bar and the excellent staff. For those driving down from the North, the hotel is so convenient to reach from the motorway and your car is secure (no tricky, underground car parks with narrow spaces here).I knew I would be returning again anyway based on previous experiences, but after this last visit I don't think I could speak more highly of this hotel. Looking forward to another night in the Autumn to escape from the humdrum of daily life. Again, a huge thanks to the wonderful lady at reception for making this visit so much more special.
title: Amazing upgrade from the loveliest staff member at reception

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Nice hotel but nothing exceptional. If it was cheaper, I would recommend it. Clean but some days we had to ask them to clean our room. Dublin is not very hot but I had many years since I last visited a hotel with no air condition in the rooms. The front desk was very friendly and helpful.
title: Not bad but not good either

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: We stayed here for 2 nights 17th and 18th July 2017 for my 50th birthday. Good points good location, good breakfast and nice lobby and bar. Bad points no air Con in rooms and the rooms were uncomfortably warm. Check in the worst ever, the manager checked us in and he was so rude - on the phone whilst checking us in the entire time - no friendly chat we were not impressed. The water in the showers was scalding hot and we asked to get it fixed, although someone came to look and said it was fixed - still too warm to use! Check out the girl couldn't have cared less about our stay. Maybe a course on how to provide good customer service would go along way in this hotel!
title: Lacking in customer service

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Currently in room on 5th floor at 2.02 am with the incessant thud of drum and base. Torn duvet cover on bed. Still at least I have no fear of actually being able to sleep! Book a different hotel if you actually expect to sleep in your room.
title: Bring your earplugs

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: This hotel defines what three stars is - middle of the road. While staying there, I had an equal amount of good/mediocre at the hotel. Staff: Front desk staff was nothing short of superb, but the folks at the entry/bellman area were utilitarian at best. When I asked for a taxi, the gentlemen directed me to walk to the street to wait at a taxi stand (the hotel had a courtyard style entrance - can easily accept a queue of taxis).The dining staff was friendly, but the again, it was offset by mediocre (mediocre is generous) food.My room was clean - VERY clean, but I get the feeling that it's been quite some time since any serious money was spend on remodeling any part of the hotel.Stay here, but manage your expectations in advance of arrival.Location is really good
title: Average Hotel - Ambivilance

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: My wife and I stayed at the weekend. Very nice and comfortable room. The hotel was busy with a nice atmosphere. The staff were attentive and polite. The hotel is in a great location for a Dublin visit. I would recommend.
title: Good Hotel

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Comfy, familiar and straightforward. Front desk was pleasant and helpful. Rooms and lobby were pleasant and clean. Maids were prompt and nice. Beds were comfy. Towels were big and soft, plenty of hot water. No a/c in rooms. Window opens marginally. Fans available. Large bar that was under staffed but had great drinks and food. Bar staff was funny and friendly. Restaurant - Buffet breakfast was super with large selection. Dinner food was great but wait service was horribly forgetful with slow kitchen. Location is residential, takes 25 minutes walking to get to city centre. Some other sights within walking but most will require bus/cab. No view from rooms. But that's not what this hotel is about. It's one that meets all your requirements with good quality and comfort without any particular pizzazz. Warning - lots of tours stay here. They were superbly managed by hotel but some travelers don't like to stay with roaming herds.
title: Comfy, familiar, and straightforward

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Just left The Burlington and felt I had to post this. Beautiful hotel and can't really fault it for comfort and appearance. However, we just spent the night in room 788 and never slept a wink. A domestic argument in room 786 until the wee small hours put paid to that. My partner was going to phone police. It was that bad. Paper thin walls didn't help and we heard everything. There was wall punching, door slamming, roaring, shouting, swearing, what appeared to be slapping and lots of crying. It was nothing short of a disgrace. The management had already said the hotel was fully booked so no point I asking to change rooms. It was 5am before we got any sleep and only then, because the female left. I accept that this is no fault of the hotels but I paid for a bed to sleep and couldn't. It wasn't cheap either. I reported to the girl on check out who seemed wholly disinterested. Always liked the hotel but doubt , I'll stay again. Going home completely wrecked after what was to be a comfortable hotel stay
title: No sleep whatsoever

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: This hotel is well situated and the breakfast is very good. Complimentary wifi is a welcome surprise. Rooms are clean and comfortable, but by no means match up to their price. Some Reception staff weren't helpful, and we never were able to make that overseas phone call from our room. The dining room staff were wonderful, as was the concierge. Service from the cafe if ordering from the kitchen was very slow.
title: Expensive for what you get !

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Arrived late evening and check-in was quick, no issues. Hotel is nice, clean and comfortable. Room is big with a comfortable bed and pillows. We eat food in the bar on the first night and it was nice but limited enough selection. Breakfast wasn't included in our room rate but there is a nice coffee dock in the reception area that serves lovely coffees, scones, fruit etc. Prices reasonable. There was Air conditioning in our room as we were on the 5th floor but the unit was extremely noisy when it was on. Without it the room can become extremely warm and stuffy. Hotel is within walking distance of St Stephens Green, comfortable shoes advised if walking. Overall had a nice experience staying here. If in Dublin again for a concert and prices were reasonable I would consider staying here again.
title: Concert Weekend Stay

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: The hotel itself is quite nice and clean. However, when I arrived at 5:00pm my room was not ready and the staff took over an hour to get a room for me. The staff clearly need training in customer service. It is very expensive, and in no way justifies the price. I will not stay there again.
title: Grossly overpriced with unhelpful staff

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: As usual this is written as a wheelchair user.The room was quite a good size, although I did find it a little neat for my electric wheelchair. There is a separate section of the car park for disabled badge holders, and this is opened by asking the concierge or reception to unlock one of the bollards, so if you are a sole disabled traveller it would be worth having the phone number in your mobile so you can phone in and ask, rather than struggling out of the car and then back in again.The bathroom is very well appointed, with a 'roll-in' shower which has a height adjustable seat and what I thought were sufficient hand rails. The toilet itself is raised with handrails on either side. The sink is lower so is convenient for a wheelchair user. The bed is level with a wheelchair. There is one pull cord to summon help, and this is in the bathroom, I think another cord at the side of the bed might be beneficial.The lifts beside reception are a wee bit on the small side, but there is a bigger lift to the side of the breakfast area and I found that one much easier to use.The food in the restaurant is lovely, but there's a few too many dishes with fish/seafood, or olives, which cut what I was wanting quite a bit, but I had a steak one evening which was lovely.The staff were helpful and on the whole our stay was very pleasant.
title: LOVELY HOTEL BUT A LITTLE HARD TO FIND

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: On arrival at the hotel we felt we were inappropriately greeted at the front desk with an unwelcoming attitude in comparison to other guests, checking in parallel to us who were provided with maps and received a friendly welcome. On the first evening what should have been a relaxing bar experience after our journey was another disappointment. The bar man focused his attention solely on mature American guests and ignored us, when it was quite clear that we had empty glasses on our table and required service. There was certainly no excuse for this as the bar was not busy. In addition our bar dining experience was yet another disappointment. Having ordered and received our steaks they were both not medium/well done as requested, in fact they were medium rare. No service check was provided to enable us to easily rectify the situation. One would expect this to be a natural part of the food service in a hotel of this standard. Worse was to come, we attempted to order desert only to be told that the kitchen was closed. Again guests would expect to be warned of the impending kitchen closure whilst finishing ones meal so that any final orders could be fulfilled. Staff attitude and communication left a lot to be desired in this instance. After receiving a lack of information at check in we approached a member of staff in the coffee area to enquire about hotel facilities. However before he could ask him a question he stated "ehhh I'm kind of closed". Yet another example of an unwelcoming and poor staff attitude! At check out one would have expected front desk personnel to make the standard enquiry about our level of customer satisfaction for the stay. Again, such was not the case and we were not given the opportunity to register our disappointments. In the light of the experiences encountered during our stay I feel that we were poorly treated and experienced inferior and unsatisfactory levels of customer service as outlined, whilst clearly being victims of ageism and discrimination. A special birthday treat became a major disappointment which we did not anticipate. Throughout our stay this hotel certainly does not match hilton standards and in addition does not provide a clearly stated "make it right" policy which that chain utilises. This is a totally unacceptable state of affairs reflecting very poor customer service for a major 4 star hotel where guests are not treated equally regardless of age. Thank you for taking time to read this. Please share it with your employees so they are aware of their atrocious standards of customer service which directly result in customer dissatisfaction. I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone.
title: Great hotel but staff let it down

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: Stayed here for 3 nights with family and enjoyed it a great deal. The rooms are very nice and modern, newly renovated, clean. The washrooms are very clean and newly renovated as well. The location is a bit away from the city centre in a mostly residential area but only about a 20 minute walk to the centre or a cab ride of 8 euros or so. If I had to come up with a complaint it would be the long walks from the elevators to the rooms. Aside from that everything was great. I would certainly stay here again upon returning to Dublin.
title: Excellent Hotel in Decent Location

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: We have just returned from a a two day stay at this hotel. This is the first hotel where staff don't greet you and say hello. No contact at all through the whole check in very clinical. Staff in the restaurant clearly had been trained in the same manner - "where is the warm Irish Charm". The service was slow in the restaurant and the service was very disjointed. The second night it was quicker especially when we asked for bill. The bathroom was small. The bedroom was clean and comfortable. We had breakfast in the coffee bar in reception and it was fine - sorry staff again can't take orders correctly and no interaction with guests. Would not be going back
title: Staff need trained in customer service to improve service urgently

hotelLocation: Upper Leeson Street, Dublin D04A318, Ireland
review: I absolutely loved this hotel. The breakfast is just fantastic. Well cooked, huge choices and set us up for the day. We were also delighted by the bar. The first night, due to arriving late, we ate in the bar. So pleased we did as the food, ambience and service was fantastic.It turned out to be one of the best, and cheapest, meals we had whilst in Dublin. It is unusual for a hotel restaurant to be so very reasonably priced. We would have eaten there again if it had been our choice (in a group) as subsequent meals eaten elsewhere proved of lower or equal quality but far more expensive. Rooms were clean and spacious. It was quiet. The staff were polite and helpful. I admit the initial impression was that it was a little 'tatty' in places but it turned out that the 'mottled / distressed glass' near the bar is designed like that! My fashion radar is obviously off kilter. Would absolutely recommend this hotel.
title: Loved it. I would happily go back tomorrow

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: I stopped by here before my business meeting to find that The Gresham has now been rebranded as Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham. It's still as impressive as it was before and the selection of teas and coffees were second to none. It's a wonderful place any time of the day!!
title: Early morning coffee

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: We've stayed in lots of Riu hotels all over the world mainly resort type properties for a couple of weeks this was our first city centre Riu Plaza hotel for a few days.Lovely old building that's obviously had an extensive refurbishment. The rooms are well finished with a roomy ensuite. This hotel is right in the middle of the action on O'Connell street and is therefore a great base to explore Dublin. The Writer's bar hankers back to a previous age of sophistication, and was made complete by a group of guests dressed to attend a "Great Gatsby" event. It felt very 1920's. The service is just formal enough to feel a bit special but the friendliness of the staff stops any chance of stuffiness.And an added bonus to anyone flying to Dublin the Express Aircoach stops right outside.We think this now is our go to hotel in Dublin, really enjoyed our stay.
title: Lovely city break hotel

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: On the plus side, bed very comfy, room large and clean.Now for the negatives. Accessing the hotel by car. You have to park underground accessed down an alley way used by drug addicts, you cannot get directly into the hotel without a room card so have to walk found with all your bags. We got lucky as a staff member was in the lift and took us up.Up to our room was fine and room itself was ok, nothing extra special. But the heat hit us immediately and the AC was not yet "commissioned" windows hardly opened and the noise from gulls and roadworks was unpleasant. Water scalding hot even on low setting. Then the shower made an odd scheeching noise.Very little sleep due to heatExpected better for the price
title: Very over priced and disappointing

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Had a wonderful stay here back in July, the location is absolutely wonderful and within walking distance of shops, restaurants, cinemas and bus tours. The hotel was under construction during our stay which didn't affect the charm of the hotel whatsoever. All staff were friendly and welcoming. Looking forward to coming back next year.
title: Great Location

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Just terrible stay. Never wrote a review before but feel the room was so bad people should know. No air conditioning in 25 degree heat, needed to leave windows open so sea gulls and other birds squawking 24/7 sounded like something out of jurassic park. 22 inch TV about 20 years old with patchy sevice. Couldn't use the shower as it was broken. Honestly worst hotel room I have ever been in. Can't say anything about staff as we just went out as soon as possible. Oh and €25 for parking a day. DON'T STAY HERE.
title: The Gresham

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: This is my third year bringing a group to the Gresham. It seems to get better every year, from the exceptional service to the superb rooms. The location is great, right on O' Connell street within walking distance to lots of attractions. Looking forward to returning next year.
title: Weekend in Dublin

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: The hotel upgraded our room and a bottle of wine, on ice, awaited us when we entered the room. A thoughtful touch for which we were very grateful. In spite of the ongoing renovations the hotel is very elegant, but comfortable. The Writers' Bar very welcoming and the food served there was extremely enjoyable.All that said, it was the friendliness, and, easy professionalism of the staff which enhanced our stay. Our sincerest thanks to everyone there who made our stay so enjoyable.A thoroughly recommendable hotel in the centre of Dublin.
title: an enjoyable visit at the Gresham

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: This Hotel was recommended to us by the Travel Information Booth at the Dublin Airport when we arrived. They made the reservations and gave us a reduced price. We wanted something in City Centre that was walkable to sights. This hotel has alot of history. It has been renovated. Our room was clean and comfortable, not a large room. The proximity to everything we wanted to see in Dublin City Centre was perfect for us. We did not eat here.
title: City Centre Grand Hotel

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: My sister in law contacted the hotel on Tuesday 18th July to inform the hotel that she would no longer be able to attend due to unforeseen circumstances. She was advised that she would not be able to amend the date or be issued with a refund. As she was under the impression that the booking had been fully paid for she offered me the room as she did not want to let the reservation go to waste. I knew I would be travelling late and called the hotel to query the latest check in time and when the residents bar closed. I was advised that 12 pm was the latest check in time and 11 pm was the closing time for the residents bar. This was misinformation as my husband rang straight after and was advised that you could check in at any time and the residents bar in fact closed at a much later time. We explained the situation over the phone and was told to come on ahead. When we arrived we experienced the most unpleasant check in I have ever experienced. We were met by an extremely rude member of staff, who really should not be dealing with the public in his mannor. Judging by his dress code and age I would assume quite a senior member of staff. As the first point of contact to the hotel please retrain this man in customer service. When my husband was trying to explain the situation he kept rudely interrupting saying ‘you do not understand sir’ and at one point during this conversation my husband was trying to resolve the situation by simply stating the booking reference number and he assumbed this was a six digit pin and he said he did not want to see information of this type aand my husband also explained that we had came here on the understanding that the room had been paid for fully. In response, the staff member seemed to become quite irritated with us so my husband went to the car to get his phone to phone the person who had made the booking. This person was willing to confirm her card details over the phone and pay for the room as she thought the room had already been paid for anyway as if we had not turned up to take the room the money would have been taken off the very same card infact. We were cautious about paying for the room when asked in case this meant that the room had been paid for twice. The member of staff refused to speak to the person who had made the booking over the phone and stated that he needed the card to be physically in my husbands hand there and then in order for the payment to be taken. Due to the treatment we received from this staff member if it hadn’t have been so late at night we would have turned around and went home. The staff member showed us a complete lack of respect and we were left feeling disappointed. Very poor customer service for a hotel of this star rating. At check-in time we were not informed of breakfast serving times or locations. We assumed that are door would be knocked 10 minutes prior to breakfast serving time as this is the procedure used in many hotel that we have stayed in over the years. At this point my husband mad the full payment for the room in order to avoid further embarrassment. It is key to note although we were in the position we were able to pay for this reservation at such short notice many couples may not have been able to. Next we were issued with our hotel room key and handed over to another staff member who brought us to the car park and brought us to our room . This staff member was extremely helpful and courteous. After leaving our luggage in our room we headed down to the main bar area for a few relaxing drinks after the whole ordeal. We were served our drinks by a Barman by an extremely friendly bar man but unfortunately the pints that he pulled had absolutely no head on them and were flat. I could clearly see this man had not received proper training in how to pull a pint correctly .My husband had to change his drink over to wine as a result of the standard of the pint served , and my husband would not usually enjoy this as his main drink in the bar. When we arrived up to our room afterwards we noticed our room was very clean although the décor was quite outdated and the bathroom looked like it was from the 1960s. To conclude the are much better hotels based in the Dublin area with better locations, service as well as value for money. I would not advise anyone to use their hard-earned money staying here if you wish to feel valued. The old beauty and charm of the hotel has gone , that my mother and father talked about as they stayed here for years. I would have hoped the standards would have raised instead of dropped.
title: Terrible visit

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: We received a voucher for one night in the Gresham which we enjoyed it was room only rate for the price breakfast should have been included. The food is very expensive the rooms are lovely and clean but very small and also the beds are not very comfortable and very small
title: Good

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: The hotel is sadly no longer the elegant, good service place it used to be. Bad service and poor food in the restaurant, but in particular nasty insulting baggage clerk in the storage room. I checked out at 10.30 AM and then realized at 11 AM that I had left my belongings in the room safe. I returned to the front desk and the helpful assistant asked the baggage clerk, David, to accompany me to the room. His reaction was one of great anger at being disturbed although he was not busy and when I INSISTED and after more than 1/2 hour, he accompanied me, insulting me all the way up in the elevator and along the corridor "how could you be so stupid" "don't you know how hotels work?" "You are wasting my time". I got my belongings as the safe was still locked, but I am very disgusted that somebody like him could be employed there, who else has he insulted?? I bet I am not the first and management does not seem to care. Dublin has many good hotels, so there is no need for anybody to subject themselves to such insulting behavior.
title: Extremely nasty porter in baggage room

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: We stayed for a 2 night break July 2017, in the Gresham, Dublin.It is centrally located, comfortable, peaceful in the middle of everything you'd want.Walk out the door, all kinds of services are on this street.Transport is so easy, good atmosphere. Staff at front desk are helpful, courteous, professional.Considering the ridiculous price of hotel accommodation in Dublin, this was not too expensive. I would need a really good reason to visit Dublin, and need to stay overnight though, to pay these prices.
title: Central convenience, and comfort.

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Despite the ongoing renovation work the staff we encountered were all courteous, friendly and very helpful. We had a beautiful room in the College Wing and we slept so well. Bed was very comfortable and room was warm. Hotel is in the heart of the city and we walked to wherever we had to go, Dublin Castle, Temple Bar and Iveagh Gardens to name a few. We didn't eat in the hotel but only because we were out so much. Car parking facilities are great if a little bit of a hassle trying to get parked outside the hotel to check in first before you can access the car park, you need your room key for the lift. Loved our stay.
title: Elegance and Classy

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: This hotel is one of our favourites when over visiting Dublin - business and pleasure. Staff are very courteous and go out of their way to make one feel welcome. Rooms are very comfortable, clean and provide all the necessities for a welcoming overnight stay. Room service was efficient and food reasonably priced for Dublin city centre.
title: Central Location steeped in history

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: When I booked this trip I was a little concerned that the hotel would be much different now that it is owned by a new company . I was pleasantly surprised that the things I really loved about the Gresham on three previous stats have not changed- the staff are still friendly and helpful. There is a safe feeling about the property, and the service is stellar. There are some changes being made to the structure itself but it was not inconvenient at all. The housekeeping seems to be magic. I would leave my room in the morning and immediately my room would be spotlessly cleaned, even if I was only gone a short time! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a convenient locations and a feeling of respect for their guests. Lovely visit!
title: Another wonderful stay at the Gresham

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: We arrived two hours before check in and were offered an upgraded room straight away to compensate for the final week of upgrade works in the hotel. Reception staff extremely helpful in particular with regards to car parking under the hotel and how to access out of normal hours. The parking was 17.50 for the overnight stay. There is a lift from the car park to the hotel reception- just make sure to read the notices in the lift to check which floor to get off at. We did not use the bar/restaurant facilities as we had other commitments but both looked lovely. Our room was on the second floor - lovely comfy bed, immaculate shower/bathroom (no bath). Great nights sleep - silent - could not believe we were facing the corner of O'Connell Street Upper so quiet. Plenty of taxis outside and other transport options available. Great location for sightseeing, shopping, nightlife etc. Will return here.
title: Sumptuous stay in city centre hotel

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: I stayed at the Gresham Hotel in Dublin recently and wasn't disappointed. Check in at reception went smoothly, I was served by a lovely pleasant lady who gave me a complimentary room upgrade and what a room it was too! Overlooking O'Connell Street, the room was absolutely beautiful and very clean. We ordered food in Toddy's bar and it wasn't as good as we would have liked it to be. We were disappointed to find that the service was slow and the food was only warm when it was served with only small portions too. When asked if everything was ok I did inform the staff of this but the only response I got was 'sorry'! I definitely wouldn't eat there again as it's not good value for money at all. The breakfast was better though. They claim to serve until 10.30am but if you aren't down before that time most of the buffet has been put away and only a small amount of hot food remains available so get down early!Finally there is renovation work underway at the front entrance which is surprising for the time of year. I would have thought that this type of work could have been completed early Spring or in the Autumn time not during peak season. The workers are very noisy resulting in some difficulty hearing the very good reception staff. They too appeared frustrated with all the noise from dropping tools and banging equipment. All in all a great stay, costly but then again it's in the heart of Dublin so really expected. I would definitely return to this hotel but only if guaranteed a room overlooking O'Connell Street as the other views are not good at all!
title: Beautiful hotel but food is average

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Right in a great spot for all the attractions and walking distance to most of them this is a great place to stay. The breakfast is well done and lots of selection as well as the in house bars and restaurant. The main concern was the lack of air conditioning that made the night stay uncomfortable. At one point we were getting heat when it should have been cooler air. They said open the windows but the seagulls are quite active and make noise all night. The room could have used a bit more finish but overall we would stay here again provided the air conditioning was fixed
title: Central Dublin stay

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Needed a room for 1 night while on route. Trying to book over the phone was a disaster. After 10 minutes my name was down and we started to spell the name of my spouse - so had to abandon this and book over the website via smartphone. The standard room at 145€ proved to be exactly that - standard functional and located in the lesser places of the hotel: next to ventilator shafts and the service/laundry rooms. But the noise from the nearby road works was extreme and continues during the night ! All windows closed but the airco was "set" at a fixed temp of 23,6 deg C which is too warm. Hotel lobby was being refurbished as well. Prime location though.
title: Check the road works

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our circle Ireland bus tour. The hotel is very nice, lots of services, great bars and restaurant. The location is absolutely fantastic and can't be beat ! You are right in the heart of the action and all kinds of eateries, pubs, shops are adjacent. Easy to walk to all from here. The rooms here are large, great wifi, nice beds and comfortable linens/pillows. Only problem we had was air conditioning is poor or wasn't functioning in our room. The lowest we get the room temp was +21.6 and it sounded like it was working but never cooled properly. Not really an issue though as there were there large windows that fully open so it was cool enough. There are two pubs that are top notch within steps of the hotel. Madigans is right next door, went here fro drinks twice, nice place ! Murrays just up the street a half block was an outstanding place ! We dined here on our last night with 5 others, awesome food, service and live Irish music. There is lots of shopping near this hotel, great stores for everything you need. We thought this hotel was great and would stay here again without a doubt.
title: Nice hotel and great location

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: hotel was ok, hotel seemed a little tired / old fashioned, breakfast was very expensive. bar was fine. this was a business trip so not looking for much, but wouldn't be happy to stay here for a personal visit.
title: business trip

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: The Hotel Riuis a beautiful hotel located very strategically to the heart of Dublin. We could walk anywhere we needed to go. Wonderful staff and good food. Our only issue although minor was they never repaired the towel warmer after numerous request.
title: Ireland 2017 Grand Circle Tours

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: We stayed here one night as part of a travel package for the U2 show at Croke Park. The location was perfect for walking to and from the stadium. The location is also convenient to walk across to the more interesting areas south of the River Liffey. I found the area immediately around the hotel not so interesting as there were a lot of shops, many being chains (I'm not much of a shopper).The lobby was nice and we had great service from the bar and at the front desk while we waited for our room and again before a pre-concert event. Breakfast was included with our package and it was a very nice buffet again with good service.The room itself was small and seemed especially so compared to another hotel we had just stayed in the two prior nights. But the accommodation was clean and relatively updated, the bathroom nice - it actually had a fan! (I can think of very few, if any, bathrooms with fans in the places I've stayed in Europe.) The bed was comfortable, though also small for two. Our room was 1013, in the college wing, which was nice because there were very few rooms on that stretch of hallway.The only downside was being on the first floor and basically at the corner of a couple busy streets. The taxi stand was right below our window and there was one across the street for another hotel. It being Saturday night, there were a lot of people out late so we could hear a decent amount of street noise. It wasn't terrible, but I'd want to be in a different room if I stayed again. That said, I'd probably try a different hotel next time I'm in Dublin.
title: Some Good Points

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Very well operated hotel with very good staff that are so helpful. Clean throughout. .The breakfast is a good choice. The room size is more than adequate some are very large. The personal products are of quality.
title: ME

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Stayed for 1 night with my wife. Beautiful hotel in great location however very poor room service menu - asked for cheese plate but told chef had finished for night so not available! Would have expected a quality hotel to do better.
title: Poor room service

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: This hotel is a landmark in Dublin City Centre and I spend many an afternoon in Toddy's so I was excited to stay in the hotel.Check in was ok.I arrived early and was not expecting my room to be ready. And it wasn't . I was pre checked in and told to come back after 3 I paid in full and I went on my merry way . I didn't even comment that all customers before and after me , who also arrived early , were all given room keys :(Anyhow I returned at 4 and told the lady on my desk my name. She frowned at her screen asked me to spell my first and last names etc etcI asked if I could possibly have a room with a bath. She told me all rooms had bathrooms ! I refused to say " a room with a tub " it's Dublin after all.Got to my room eventually .it was fine. Tiny but adequate. Very ugly view. No shower cap so I used the laundry bag. Good supply of milk though and what toiletries were there were nice. The duvet was nice and light which I appreciated.All in all . Fine for a night . Very central . The concierge was the highlight. More friendly than all the other staff put together. The temporary entrance was a disgrace though. Tiny hall way with builders equipment thrown in the corner and rubble on the carpet .
title: City Central

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: We paid €450 for a room for the U2 concert, on arrival we were told that our room had been upgraded to a suite. When we arrived at the room it was quite small, the only thing to suggest it is a suite was a larger bathroom, otherwise the room was dark, really hot and stuffy. We put the air con on when we left the room and when we came back it was warm. Sleeping was unbearable and we couldn't contact any of the hotel services. In fact when we came back all we could see was security at the front lobby and nobody at reception.When we asked to speak to a manager the next morning he apologised about the air con and was aware they had a problem with it in the hotel. No gestures were offered and guess what...€450 does not include breakfast, it is disappointing to see these hotels totally rob people when an 'event' is on.I will never be back here again, the Shelbourne is the place to stay!!
title: Appalling

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: The service here is exceptional, so you can't go far wrong. The first week I stayed they upgraded me to a suite - hot, but lovely and spacious.
