The second week was a considerable step down - a tiny room, no air-con, road drilling just outside the window. I complained to the duty manager and they had moved me to a quieter, cooler, bigger room within the hour.Overall I would recommend, they work very hard to make their customers happy and most of the property is spectacular.
title: Beautiful (though in some ways a real mixed bag)

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Stayed in The Gresham for one night before leaving the country. Paid 200 euro for a room without breakfast. For this price would have expected much better service. Arrived about 11am knowing this was too early for check in but needing to drop luggage and enquire about possibility of room availability. Traveling on my own with lots of luggage and a very tired young child. No room available (fair enough) but was told I would get a phone call as soon as possible when room available. Never got that call! I left my luggage, went to bar to order food, found my own menu, nobody served me despite waiting several minutes and I left to find something on O'Connell St.Three hours later I rang hotel and was told no room still available. Child now asleep on top of me and I pleaded with receptionist who then found one. I arrived back to hotel to lots of people checking in. I queued with child asleep in my arms and looked around to see if chair in reception but none there! Nobody came to my assistance during that process despite me struggling to hold my little boy. I eventually grew tired of receptionist chatting to a customer at concierge (not checking in, just chatting) and I asked for my room key. She then kept asking me for my luggage tag despite the fact my hands were completely full. I told her my priority was child and room and I could worry about luggage later. She finally let me go and then I wandered forever through long corridors holding child (staff looking at me but not offering direction or help upstairs) and eventually found the room. Room very underwhelming. Old fashioned and not in a charming way. Children's channel not working on tv. Child disappointed at this. Bathroom had no shower cap, none of the "extra" little things like cotton wipes etc. Very basic things provided. Definitely overpriced for 200 euro. The service was poor with the definite exception of Dino and another porter the following morning - both had the customer service the Gresham used to be known for. While the location is excellent, I will not be in a hurry to return. Would recommend shopping around for better service. To management- if you read this review I suggest you ask reception staff to consider needs of parents traveling with young children. Disappointing overall
title: Poor service

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: very expensive for such an old fashioned place. After paying as much money as we did you would expect a little more comfort. quite disapointed. On the plus side the staff were as accomodating as they could've been.
title: Overpriced.

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: The hotel is located in one of the few monumental buildings on O’Connell Street. Check-in was easy. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful although some were difficult to understand because of their Spanish speaking background. My room was on the street side overlooking O’Connell Street. The room was not big but clean and comfortable and well isolated. I did not hear street noise. An excellent breakfast was included in the rate I paid. Most of the city sights were on walking distance. There is stop of the Aircoach to the airport in front of the hotel.
title: Stylish hotel, great location

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Very nice room, wonderful and helpful staff and concierge. Two restaurants in hotel, and terrific full Irish breakfasts available daily. Its location is central to much of Dublin's tourist sites. Hotel is located on busy O'Connell Street - buses and tour guides readily available.
title: Charming hotel

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Stayed in the Hotel Riu Plaza for one night for the Coldplay concert at Croke Park. Chose the hotel based on its location but would gladly stay there over and over again. We had a wonderful stay. The staff were incredibly helpful from check in to check out and we had an amazing room in the College Wing, complete with a plate of cookies, wishing us a happy anniversary. Really stunning room, spacious and comfortable and fabulous bathroom too. Was worried about the noise from O'Connell Street but we honestly didn't hear a thing.Lovely bar on the ground floor as well with an extensive gin menu in particular. Would gladly stay here again. In fact, we tried to get a booking for this weekend as it worked out so well, but unfortunately they were sold out. Next time for sure though!
title: Short Stay for Croke Park Concert

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: My husband and I stayed 1 day/1night at this hotel after our 7 day tour of Ireland. First of all, the location of this hotel is absolutely perfect!! So, if you want to stay in the city center, then this place is for you! You can walk down O' Connell Street and you are in the city center. There are multiple shops, restaurants, coffee shops, and everything that you need as you walk out from the hotel. Also, the Hop On, Hop Off bus has a stop right outside the hotel! The AirCoach (Blue bus) also has a stop just right outside of the hotel. I cannot say how impressed I am with this bus service that is offered between the airport and the city center. You can just purchase the tickets from the bus driver. It is either 12 or 14 euros (I don't recall 100%) roundtrip to airport and city center per person. So you cannot go wrong with that, and it is much cheaper than a cab.Overall, the hotel was decent and comfortable! The front desk people are very helpful and friendly. The room itself was very small, enough to fit a queen size bed, desk, and two smaller chairs. The bathroom was decently sized, and it had a towel rack heater, which was a nice surprise. The one thing I didn't like about our room were the paper thin walls... I could hear when someone was flushing the toilet at 4am. But, I got over that! I would definitely recommend this hotel for its location. And in the end... you are in Dublin to enjoy the city and its sights and not stay in the room.
title: 1 night stay

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Not great, but nice. Helpful front desk staff, but most were difficult to understand. It seemed they all wanted to speak Spanish with an Irish accent. Not good for the vast majority of the life-long English-speaking world.Very good location. Clean rooms that are well-appointed.We paid maybe 20 Euros each for the breakfast, but had to get take-away breakfasts for two of our three days there due to early tours and an early flight. What we got with the take-away breakfast was an apple, a banana, and a very small muffin. No more. That was a complete rip-off.I would not return. There must be better options in Dublin.
title: Just Okay

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: The location is perfect, in the heart of Dublin, which means walking distance to all the main attractions.The staff was super friendly, the room was great and very clean. Excellent breakfast. Super recommended!
title: VERY GOOD HOTEL !

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Location was great - very accessible. Airport bus stops outside and there are local bus stops and a taxi rank in front of the hotel. Staff were varied - some very friendly, others not so. Our first room was dark, barely bigger than a broom cupboard with no aircon. We asked to be moved and the new room was better. There was a lot of noise from the plumbing/bathrooms from about 5am. Breakfast was buffet style, it was acceptable. Coffee was appalling. Good job there was a coffee shop a few doors along.
title: slightly disappointing

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: This was a great base of operations from which to start our Ireland vacation . it's very central and within an easy walk to pretty much everything you might want to see in Dublin. Rooms were clean and the bed was comfy. staff was good and the restaurant / Breakfast were good as well
title: Not bad

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: A clean hotel in a nice location near to markets, restaurants, pubs & shopping streets... the personnel of the hotel is quite welcoming and available ... you can easily walk your way to Temple Bar and no need to catch a cab by night
title: Clean & near everything

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Room was perfect, one of the nicest I have stayed in. Large room and bathroom with everything I could need provided. No noise at night and staff were friendly and helpful - check in and out was done with no fuss. Location of the hotel is ideal for a trip to Dublin and I would absolutely stay here again.
title: Really, really good!

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: What a lovely Christmas spirit in Dublin. The Christmas lights are delightful especially Grafton street and the Buskers on Christmas EVE.The Gresham is my choice of hotel every time I go back to Dublin .Its central,classy and comfartable
title: Dublin at Christmas

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: I stayed here recently with my husband. It really has the wow factor.From the moment we checked in until we checked out it was bliss.The staff cannot do enough .The breakfast is fantastic with plenty to choose from.The beds are comfortable and the rooms spacious.The location is right on O Connell street close to everywhere.I totally recommend the Gresham.
title: Top Class

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: This wonderful hotel is situated exactly at the first bus stop of the AirCoach from Dubln Airport, on the main thoroughfare of the city. It is a short block from the Gate Theatre. The staff were really friendly and helpful, our room was perfect and the bathroom boasted a luxurious bath as well as a shower.
title: Superb Location

hotelLocation: 23 Upper O'Connell Street, Dublin D01 C3W7, Ireland
hotelName: Hotel Riu Plaza The Gresham Dublin
review: Delicious meal - I would recommend the beef rather than the hake. However, portions were very small for the price! Delightful surroundings with nice background music and friendly staff. I will definitely return in the hope of larger portions!
title: Delightful lunch but paid the price

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: very helpful staff, security gentleman was informative and was willing to answer any queries i had, could not fault hotel, parking was easy and I felt my car was safe outside hotel. Room was clean and comfortable
title: anne

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Stayed here before flying out to Bulgaria for a family holiday. Rooms were really comfortable and spacious. Was so comfortable and staff were so friendly. Breakfast was really good and an excellent price. Would definitely recommend it.
title: Night before flying out.

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Krystel found us a great room, helped us arrange a shuttle, directions to airport, really appreciate that she understands family. She was patient, kind, and helpful. I have already recommended to friends flying into and out of Dublin.Thank you for a great stay!!! We will definitely be back!
title: Krystel was wonderful!!!

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Stayed here last week before early flight the next day. Really enjoyed it as staff so pleasant and helpful, from reception to bar staff and the bus driver who brings you to and from hotel to the airport. Had a lovely dinner in the bistro with a very relaxing atmosphere. Best hotel food we have ever had so compliments to the chef! Room was very comfortable with great bed and spotless bathroom. Tv has best reception ever and WiFi is fast. Got a great deal for stay and parking for the week. Will be back next time we are flying and highly recommend this hotel.
title: Great staff and sevice

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: I had an overnight at the Metro Hotel to catch an early morning flight. I needed dinner, and the service there in the restaurant and lounge is fantastic! Waiter Mario and bartender Taylor were professional, efficient and friendly. I had time to sit at the bar after dining and had some nice conversation. It gave me a good impression of the hotel, and that the management was hiring good employees. If I ever need to overnight again near the Dublin airport, Metro will definitely be my choice!
title: The service on the lounge/restaurant is awesome!

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Enjoyed my over night stay from start to finish after my holidayOn entering the hotel was greeted by most efficient friendly staff,got to the room and discovered the bed situation was not for me ,it was late at night and the reception staff changed the room immediately Greeted in the dining room next morning ,beautiful freshly cooked breakfast Overall appearance of the hotel was lovely and very comfortable,very happy with my stay
title: Over night stay

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Used parking space for airport & shuttle bus to Dublin airport. Driver of mini bus excellent! He is always so helpful with bags and children. Always so friendly and recognises us from previous trips. He is a credit to the hotel and he is the reason we return time after time.
title: Excellent Service

hotelName: The Morrison, a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel
review: My boyfriend and I enjoyed staying at this Hilton location, which was near almost every major attraction we went to see in Dublin. The view of the river is fantastic if you can get it, the rooms are quirky and modern, and the staff is terrific. Our only quibble was that the off-site parking nearby isn't ideal, as it is difficult to navigate a car into the narrow spots and maneuver in the tiny parking building. But that may be an unavoidable fact of staying in downtown Dublin, and the car survived just fine in any event. We would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Dublin.
title: Great Location, Excellent Service

review: The service at the Morgan Restaurant was simply outstanding. Nina, was extremely quick and accurate with all orders. Her enthusiasm was infectious and she sets a great example for all employees oat the Morgan.
title: Resteraunt wait staff was the highlight of our stay

hotelName: The Morrison, a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel
review: Stayed here 4 years ago. We were impressed then and again this time. Our daughter had a bit of an issue with a plugged sink but other than that it was great. Located near the Temple bar area plus a large shopping center. Staff treated us very well & the breakfast was excellent. Beds were also very comfortable. Only there 1 night but good preparation for the long flight home.
title: Still As Good As I Remember

hotelName: The Morrison, a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel
review: The hotel is located right in the city center, walking distance from many attractions.The service is really good and the staff were very helpful. The rooms are decorated in a modern lite style, which I really like.
title: The best location in Dublin

hotelName: The Morrison, a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel
review: Great location to be able to get into Temple Bar and other areas of DublinBar is well stocked and bar team all know what they are doing. Good service , same with the roomsParking is next door but easy to find
title: Right next to the river

hotelName: The Morrison, a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel
review: Our stay started in spectacular fashion: We arrived, exhausted, around 8 a.m. after traveling from the states. Our room wasn't ready of course, but we asked if another one was. Indeed a upgraded room was available right then, so we happily paid the $50E/night surcharge, went to our spacious room and had a magnificent four hour nap. We had a great bed; sofa and TV; desk area; ample closet; mini-fridge and kettle. The bath was spacious with a strong Swedish shower head. Quiet is extremely important to us. We were right over the road by the Liffey river, so there was a little noise but the windows had pretty good insulation and traffic dwindled in the evening. Actually more annoying were the hardwood floors, which creaked when we walked and when our neighbors upstairs walked.We had breakfast one morning; thought it was good but not outstanding. There is a pretty simple buffet of breads (usually very coarse), juices and cereals. You order hot items off a menu--standard Irish breakfast, omelettes, pancakes, etc. (Then again, we were never thrilled by any of our breakfasts over 17 days! This isn't France or Italy...)The staff was friendly and helpful. I wanted to print tickets for Dublin Castle and after I emailed it to them, they said, you don't have to wait around. We'll put the tickets in your room. And they did.The location was terrific: easy walking to all the major sites but not in a crowded location. We did feel the price was a little steep, but weighing all the pros, it was well worth it. We stayed in 11 hotels on our trip and this in the top 3!
title: Central, comfy and stylish

review: Great hotel , very funky vibe. Rooms are generous and well laid out. Get one at the back as the noise from Fleet st when it winds up late night early morning can be disruptive, but goes with the location. Great staff particularly Nina in the bar , very attentive and helpful.
title: Good location

review: We stayed here for the weekend and overall enjoyed our visit.Rooms are very generous in size and nicely styled ( would have been good though if the fridge had been checked as leftover food from the last guest was there ).Enormous bed, bathroom ok.We were glad we were on the third floor and facing away from the front as the hotel ground floor is incredibly noisy at nights on the weekend. From our room it was lovely and quiet.Reception staff often seemed distracted and while friendly, weren't particularly helpful. Arriving at 10pm on a Friday night didn't help as you can hardly hear yourself think with the nightclub immediately adjacent to reception.There was no concierge, no help with cases, no general information given about hotel e.g. Breakfast, amenities and one lift that wasn't working on Sunday morning.Location is excellent if you want to stay in the middle of Temple Bar.While we didn't eat here, we did have a drink and were surprised to see a glass of prosecco poured from the tap-flat and virtually undrinkable at almost 8 euros.
title: A bit chaotic

review: This hotel is located on Fleet Street, the epicenter of night life in Dublin, near everything. The downside is the noisy street, raucous crowds and by detention some of that spills over to guests. The front staff, and especially the manager, are very helpful and friendly. They worked hard to secure an earlier check-in and where helpful with bags.The room we had, second floor, had a king bed (they call it a queen room but it's an American king) and for the price decent size. The bathrooms are not large with a bath shower. We found both room comfortable (no air conditioner) with comfortable bed. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast that's got everything you need from eggs thru fruit. The downside --- the street is noisy well passed midnight and you can hear this in the rooms. At 6.15am someone pulled the fire alarm that woke the entire hotel. It's unfortunate that this happened but indicative of the area and some of the patrons this hotel attracts.Overall --- I found this a very well priced product, though the location versus noise a good tradeoff and would have given them four stars but the 6.15am false fire alarm forced me to downgrade them.
title: Great location but that's also the issue

review: Stayed here with my 3 friends for a night.Location: €8 Uber from connolly station or 15-20 minute walk. Perfect for pubs and clubs and sight-seeing. Location does mean it's noisy til 4am though.Hotel bar and restaurant: We are sharing platters for lunch which were amaaazing with really nice cocktails too. The bar is mad (in a good way) with brilliant music and quirky musicians playing bongos and electric violins, absolutely brilliant atmosphere.Rooms: Basic I thought but good for what we needed. Major comment here is that they are boiling, so warm I couldn't sleep and it wasn't overly warm weather outside, there was a fan though but not ideal. Decent shower, room design contemporary but I felt lacked features. There were only 2 plugs also.Staff: couldn't be faulted, all really lovely and very helpful both in reception and in the restaurant.All in all, great functional hotel but if you don't wish to experience Temple Bar particularly then it may not be the calm and relaxation you need.
title: Great for party atmosphere

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Minutes from O'Connell Street, Wynn's Hotel is a great, city centre location for business meetings, conferences and training events. The historic hotel provides a charming and welcoming working environment. The friendly staff team are very accommodating and professional. Lunch is excellent and the venue is accessible by all forms of public transport.
title: Great city centre conference location

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: The hotel has very high standards when it comes to premises and service. A special thanks goes to Claire, for helping us out with the bookings and check in. Even going the extra mile by supporting us with info related to Dublin.
title: Really Good Hotel and Service

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: My husband and I spent our first two nights in Ireland at the Wynn's Hotel on Lower Abbey Street in Dublin. The staff was wonderful, the bed was comfortable and the "full Irish breakfast" delicious! It is a lovely old hotel in a perfect location, with both a restaurant and bar. No taxi is needed to get everywhere you would want to go! Close to Trinity College and O'Connell street shopping, pubs and restaurants.
title: Wynn's Was Perfect for us

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Traditional hotel in a great location just off O'Connell St, by the LUAS (tram stop) and minutes from Connolly station (DART services out to Malahide/Bray/Howth etc). Great bar, free Wi-Fi in rooms...traditionally serviced. Nothing to dislike about the hotel at all. Was expensive for the night EUR187, but I put this down to U2 playing in town and all hotels were charging high prices. Nice traditional breakfast the next morning. Tip for visitors to Dublin, buy a Leap card at Dublin Airport. For EUR19 I got unlimited bus (including airport transfer), LUAS and DART services...well worth the money if you are travelling around using public transportation, though Dublin is a great walking city. Recommend Malahide for a upmarket seaside village and Bray to the south of Dublin for a more traditional seaside resport
title: Great location and old world charm

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: We had a one night stay in a very comfortable and clean room - at back so not a good view. The hotel is well decorated and style befits its history. Staff very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed a lovely full breakfast from a wide range of choices. Hotel could not be better located - ten yards from O'Connell Street and a tram stop just feet away from door of hotel. The Dining Room is lovely and bar has a good feel and serves good food. One negative point- there is no lounge to to sit around in other than the bar which can be busy. Overall a great hotel if a little expensive.
title: Very Good Service.

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Such a beautiful place. The staff were very courteous and knowledgeable about the area. The bar and restaurant have both great service and fantastic food. If you are planning on staying in Dublin then this is the place to start your journey.
title: Home away from home.

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: My husband and I stayed at the Castle Clontarf hotel on the last night of our 10 day stay, July 10, 2017. We wished we had stayed here at the beginning of our trip. It was AMAZING! Marcello was wonderful at check in, upgraded us to a junior suite. We absolutely loved the room. Four poster bed, wonderful period furnishings, and the bed was so comfortable. The restaurant was wonderful as well, our server Karen was very friendly. There is something to look at everywhere you turn! I highly recommend a stay here while you're staying in Dublin.
title: Best stay of our 10 day Ireland trip!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: This hotel was great from check in to check out. Clean comfortable and an amazing breakfast. The castle features are interesting. We got room service diner which was really nice. We booked here to be nearer to the airport for our flight the next day. Will do it again.
title: Great stay

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: staff excellent - food excellent - rooms are very tastefully decorated in keeping with the castle decor - beds really comfortable  definitely recommend this beautiful castle hotel to anyone - we were surprised to be upgraded to a king suite - stunning - can't wait to go back.
title: birthday treat

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We booked this hotel thinking it'd be cool to stay in a castle during our 3 night 4 day trip to Dublin. Hotel was beautiful and it was fun exploring the building but after the first day. novelty wore off and we wished we stayed closer to the city center. The surrounding town is small with not much to see; you would have to spend 35-45 min or spend $25-30 for a taxi to get to the city. We took the bus the first morning to the city but needing exact change was a pain so we took taxi next two mornings. Hotel has a taxi on standby so that was nice. Later learned the red hop on and off bus comes near the hotel which would have been a great option but not knowing we purchase green hop on and off bus when we first arrived in Dublin. Overall it was a pleasant stay and hot buffet breakfast was nice start in the morning but it was same menu every day.
title: Beautiful Hotel but...

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: What a gorgeous hotel! It is filled with history and art, all the nooks and crannies are full of surprises. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom and shower very nice. The breakfast is a buffet and offers many choices including classic Irish breakfast choices. The service at check in and in general are impeccable. Everyone very friendly and accommodating. Truly an experience in itself.
title: Beautiful!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Chose to stay here as a special treat to end our tour of Ireland. We opted for the Dinner package which turned out to mean we were able to choose anything off the Al a carte menu...and the food was fantastic. The staff were all really friendly and welcoming and overall the hotel did make you feel you'd come somewhere special. Our only criticism is with the room. The Dinner package came with a Deluxe room. This has been refurbished but it's small details which slightly disappointed us. In the bathroom the stem on the shower head was quite loose so the shower head could easily swing right over the shower screen. It was clear that although there were new wall tiles and shower screen they had left the old bath in... would have been so much better to have taken this out and had walk in shower instead... especially as the baths are quite narrow! The bathroom sink although a new modern basin had a crack in it. In the room the bed was very comfy, I can see that pillows could be a bit flat for some people but ok for us. Again just little details let the room down i.e paint marks on the side of the mirror frame because someone hadn't wiped it off when they'd painted round it... poor workmanship. Overall though the food and the staff make this place and we would recommend for anyone staying in Dublin.
title: Very good

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Had the pleassure of staying in this amazing hotel last weekend and what can I say only WOW. It was by far the most luxurious hotel ive ever stayed in. The rooms were just fabulous and we enjoyed a lovely meal in the bar before heading out. I would highly recommend this hotel if you ever travelling to Dublin for a night.
title: Pure Luxury

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: The Clontarf is a jewel! My family and I stayed for one night while traveling to Dublin from the US. The attention to detail made us feel we were all royalty. The castle itself is incredible and I would recommend anyone traveling to Dublin at least go for a meal there! It is an amazing experience to just walk in. However, if you have the time to spend a night (or longer) I highly recommend doing so. The location and convince of touring Dublin are worth the stay alone. The talented and kind staff are beyond compare. I'm so glad we found this hidden gem!
title: Lived like a princess

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: It has been remodeled to strengthen the walls and provide modern rooms without losing the flavor of the castle. Consequently, there are a lot of interesting nooks and crannies, staircases and balconies to explore. There are also several dining opportunities, but the bar is very popular, with a variety of food choices, from small snacks to full meals. It is a popular venue for weddings, christenings etc. It takes time to get a taxi, so plan ahead when going into the city.
title: It Really Is a Castle

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Our family only had 2 nights in Ireland and the Clontarf castle was a great choice! The rooms were great, the atmosphere was stunning, and the food in the restaurant was awesome!! Even our kids, who are picky eaters, found food they liked!
title: Beautiful stay

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Great food with great staff.Prices were not five star in a five star castle.Four poster bed was beautiful.Seemed to be a christening on the front lawn when we were leaving was just sorry i was not invited to stay longer.I am back shortly and cant wait.
title: Sublime comfort in a beautiful castle

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Stayed here on our last night in Ireland. A few miles from the Dublin airport. A wonderful experience. I agree with all previous comments. I was told that this was indeed the sight of the original castle. Supposedly, a wall in the reception area was part of the original. Regardless, it was well worth the stay.
title: A wondeful Experience

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Stay there. It is a wonderful experience. They have air conditioning and the old style large bath tubs for soaking your tired bodies after a long day of sight seeing. The breakfast room in the morning was the best catered one that I have ever experienced. They have every type of breakfast food that you could want. The bar area at night was also very elegant and comfortable. The nicest thing about the castle is its history and inside decor. They have a self guided tour to capture and explain all the paintings and artifacts.
title: Ireland 2017

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We stayed here for two nights after a seven day drive around Ireland. I could write a great deal about things that are excellent and very good about this lovely unique hotel but very little about things that went slightly wrong.Staff are very efficient and make you feel welcome, whether it is the reception, bar or catering personnel. Room was very comfortable and clean with all the normal support for the weary traveller. We use the Fahrenheit restaurant on both nights and have no complaints but plenty of praise. Looked after excellently by the staff there plus the food was very good.It is located out of Dublin but there are good access routes available by bus or taxi if you don't want to or can't drive. Large car park.Would definitely use this hotel again if we are retuning to this area of Ireland.
title: Two Night Stay

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Looking for a nice hotel for the last night of our week-long trip in Ireland, the Clontarf Castle Hotel seemed to fill the bill. In fact it did just that. The service, apart from checking in - was friendly and first rate, especially in the Fahrenheit dining room.
title: First Class Hotel

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Nestled in a quiet area, the Clontarf is a gorgeous mix of old and new. Uniquely decorated with both modern and historical elements, and a staff that truly aims to please. Large Knight's Room bar with excellent food and drink choices. (The small sIzed charcuterie board would be considered large at most other establishments) Many pretty seating areas to sit and relax and have a cocktail. Close to the airport and convenient to get to.
title: Beautifully maintained castle hotel!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Spent a weekend in Dublin at this fantastic hotel full of character.Room was lovely clean and comfortable.had dinner in knights bar a lovely irish stew.breakfast was self service with plenty of choice.staff were very helpful.
title: Clontarf castle

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: This was a wonder place to stay for our first visit in Ireland . the hotel is outside the main city limits, but it is a quick taxi ride from the airport about 5 miles away. The grounds are beautiful, the hotel is beautiful. The knights bar is fun great drinks especially the Noble Knight. Rooms are lovely front desk is very helpful and I have to say the breakfast in the morning is out of this world, was a real treat. You can also take a bus to downtown nice walk to the bus stop 10mins .
title: First time in Ireland

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Superbly located away from the hustle and bustle of Dublin Centre City, but only a 10-20 minute ride from it (depending upon which area you want to go to). The food in the Knights Bar is extremely good, with great portions and a range of lite fare to hearty dishes. The beds are comfortable but pillows are not the most comfortable, though both are fine for one night. The concierge and front desk are friendly and helpful, and were able get us checked into a room before 10am (our flight landed at 6am). The TV's in the room have internet and youtube as well. Breakfast in Fahrenheit provides both full Irish and continental fare and is the perfect start to a morning of exploring. The only problem found overall was that our door handle was falling off. Besides that, wonderful stay! A
title: Away from the city!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: I booked this hotel based on the great reviews from trip advisor and Expedia. It's located about 15 min away from Dublin's city center. It's quaint and quiet...great when you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I have to admit that the decor is quite cheesy on the inside. The hotel itself is overall pretty clean. However, I have to admit for a 4 star hotel the bathrooms inside were what my friend called "dingy." They were clean but the lighting was off and the tile grout was black in some portions. On another note, the staff are very nice and helpful. They have a restaurant inside that sells pretty good food. Keep in mind this is one of the only restaurants around the hotel since you are away from the city. Overall stay was pretty good.
title: Great place away from the city

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Very clean and comfortable! Staff treat the hotel as their own home, they care deeply about the facility and services they provide. Everyone goes out of their way to help. You won't have a better experience anywhere!
title: Excellent Experience!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: This is a must stay! It is beautiful inside and out! Totally worth it! I highly recommend you staying here! It is easy to use the restaurant and the staff is amazing! Not right next to the city, but very easy to get too!! Lots of resources and information given when you ask!
title: Absolutely AMAZING!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: The hotel is lovely and has very comfortable beds. My only disappointing surprise was that the rooms were not actually in the castle. The breakfast food was delicious and the bar was great. The reservations check-in team was mostly outstanding. Tina was especially friendly and thoughtful.
title: Wonderful short stay

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We attended a wedding here and the surroundings, decor and atmosphere were all exceptional. Additionally every staff member we encountered were professional and friendly but special mention to Lorraine who was our waitress during dinner. She made sure that everything went perfectly including making special arrangements for our fussy eating son, she's a credit to the hotel.
title: Wedding Reception

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Stayed at Clontarf Castle for the better part of a week, on business. 5 star all around! Room was wonderful, food was wonderful and the castle is gorgeous. Would recommend it to anyone considering a stay in Dublin!
title: Felt like a king!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: This was the first hotel we stayed at in Dublin and it was absolutely amazing. Not only was staying in a castle cool, but the stay and service was excellent. The rooms were very clean and we'll kept. The staff was very polite and very attentive to our needs. We only stayed 2 days but we'd definitely stay here again when we come to Ireland next.
title: Amazing Hotel!!!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: I stayed here for a company offsite with my team for a week. My entire stay was absolutely lovely and the staff was more than accommodating and pleasant. They were able to check in me early which was greatly appreciated. As this was an organized function, sometimes things have gone awry or don't run smoothly, but at Clontarf everything ran incredibly smoothly and the food and drink provided for breakfasts and lunches were fantastic, the dinners were amazing and again, I can't say enough of how lovely and accommodating the staff were. Aside from that, the rooms were comfortable and the property was beautiful. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.
title: Amazing experience

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Located in a beautiful neighborhood just outside Dublin, great location. Loved the medieval decor. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice breakfast. Comfortable rooms that have all the modern conveniences including USB ports.
title: Great stay, close to but out of city, loved it

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We started our Irish holiday with Clontarf in Dublin. Am glad Contarf is away from the hustle bustle of the typical touristy haunts. Clontarf Castle is in a nice neighborhood and most of the old castle is preserved. The rooms are modern and you will not miss a conventional hotel. What makes it super special are the people who manage it. We were welcomed and upgraded into a family room so we could have more space. The chef even made a custom kids meal of buttered rice & veggies for the kids one late night after our city trip. Kiddos were also treated to extra ice cream by the team at Knights Bar. The Knight's Bar serves hearty Irish meals, so go on and enjoy their Lamb stew, Fresh haddock and even light eats. You would find local families dining out here on weekends. So, its always buzzing with people. Breakfast is a good spread and the breakfast rooms are nice & sunny. The rooms are spotless and the housekeeping fantastic. There's a gym for diehards. Taxis are just one call away. Airport or train station about 18-20 Euros max. If you're hiring a car, there's free parking. We would love to come back on our next trip to Dublin. Tip : Hire your car straight from the airport or online before u arrive. Saves you a few hours of back n forth. Use a taxi or bus for travel within Dublin.
title: Whatta way to start an Irish holiday !!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: I was here on a three nights' sightseeing trip with my teenage son, who had requested a comfy, quiet room and good breakfast. As mother and son, we also wanted twin beds. Clontarf delivered on all points. The room was not super large, but large enough, with a sitting nook, comfy high twin beds that were 120 cm wide, lovely locally made toiletries, and coffee/tea facility. European and American power sockets were a nice touch. The room was also very quiet. Breakfast was fresh, much of it was home-made, and it was beautifully served in one of the castle's characterful rooms. Travelling to and from the city did take some time: around 10 min walk to bus/DART, and around 10 min. transport time to Connolly station, leaving every 10 minutes or so. This was not a problem for us, who did not mind walking and had bought LEAP transportation cards. As one tour guide said, "there is no place in Dublin that's not noisy", and Clontarf was our quiet oasis after intense city strolls. Staff was lovely and very helpful but often busy - this is a place where you carry your suitcase yourself. I personally found the decoration of the hotel a bit kitsch, but my teenager loved it.
title: Ticked all our boxes

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We are just back from an amazing 2night stay in the castle. We had a brilliant time, the hotel staff were excellent with us and the food was of the highest quality. On the first night we ate in the Knights bar and we're well looked after and for our Anniversary meal we booked the Fahrenheit Grill and it was outstanding. This is one trip we will never forget. Highly recommended this castle.
title: Anniversary treat away

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Clontarf Castle staff made this visit a lifetime experience. This was my first time back in Ireland in 21 years. Special thanks to Marta who was originally from Poland and took a special genuine interest in our brief visit over to Kraków and Auschwitz-Birkenau. Then when we returned to Clontarf Castle, where Karen the Irish waitress was also just as kind. My apologies to all the other wonderful staff whose names I can't remember: they made this trip wonderful. Clearly whoever does the hiring around here is a genius because I've never seen such a group of hard-working and dedicated staff who genuinely take pride in providing their guests with a truly remarkable experience. Thanks so much.
title: Clontarf Castle staff made are amazing!!!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Only stayed in this hotel for one evening after an enjoyable week driving all over the lower half of Ireland, but it was a welcome ending to a wonderful trip. The ambiance of this hotel is excellent considering the busy Dublin area and, it is only a short drive to the airport. Recommend just walking around the hotel and grounds to take in some of its history. It is a quiet oasis within a busy city. Everything about this hotel was excellent and highly recommended.
title: A quiet oasis

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: I but away from the city center, which is actually very good depending on your "interests", but close enough by a bus or taxi ride. It's a castle but also a pretty modern hotel with very good service. Will definitely be back ... assuming I would go back to Dublin ... ;-)
title: Surprisingly good

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: The Location is not close to Dublin City making it expensive to get to and from the hotel. The Breakfast should have been included given the cost of the rooms. Hotel staff were friendly and accomodating.
title: Pricey hotel with average rooms

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Excellent stay at Clontarf Castle. Everyone was extremely friendly and efficient, which made our first visit to Dublin special. The local transport is within easy walking distance so it is easy to get into the town centre or further afield.
title: Lovely stay in Dublin

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We had a wonderful 3 night stay in this hotel. The staff was amazing and friendly. The grounds, room and hotel were absolutely beautiful and comfortable. They were so accommodating as we were a large party who needed assistance with a private dinner, golf clubs and the like. I heard the shower turn on in the middle of the night during my stay. It was much louder and longer than a slow drip. I sleep through everything so it was very out of the ordinary. I researched to find other guests who had similar experiences. For anyone looking to experience an encounter, we stayed in 221!
title: Beautiful stay with a friendly paranormal experience

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Excellent service & exceptional food. Have enjoyed AT in some of the finest hotels in Dublin (incl Merrion & Westbury) and enjoyed the whole experience here more. Afternoon tea with a lovely difference
title: Sparkling Fusion Tea

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: A modern castle hotel,much more live able and much much mores affordable than the other castles we stayed at during our 3 plus weeks in Ireland.The staff here was simply amazing without being overbearing.The room with its bed was our last great memorty of our trip.Even the lounge was fair priced were you weren't hesitant about ordering more than one drink.
title: Worth a Stay

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: The staff was friendly helpful and professional. The bar made the best drinks ,the way they are supposed to be done the food was great, prices were very reasonable and the castle was beautiful and well kept.
title: First castle

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We spent a wonderful afternoon in Clontarf Castle as part of a work related Family BBQ afternoon. The staff were attentive, the space was clean and the food was delicious. No detail is overlooked in this Hotel and I could not recommend it higher.
title: Afternoon out!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: I say hotel/ castle because it really is more hotel than castle. Our room was not ready at 2:00 and we were asked to come back in1/2 hour and it would be. We ate in the bar there at the hotel where the food was good, albeit higher prices as any hotel. Our room had a small section of the existing castle wall in it which was nice, but our window view was, well, a solid wall . It is absolutely beautiful regardless and the service is unequalled. We caught a cab to Grafton street (17 Euro) to go shopping. This is a major wedding and wedding reception destination and there were weddings booked while we were there, and it was no problem at all . A beautiful place to stay, but not the true castle experience I would have liked .
title: Lovely hotel/castle

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Stayed just one night at this excellent and very attractive hotel. Found everything to be of a high standard from check in, to bedroom with the most comfortable superking size bed. I am fussy about beds but have to say this was the best sleep in a hotel bed for a very long time as the mattress was top quality. My room, like the hotel in general, was very clean and well presented throughout.All the extras you could wish for were present in the room including A/C and it was nice that there was not just tea/ coffee making facilities but iron and ironing board. Decided to opt for buffet breakfast in the morning, having had the cost added to my bill at check in, to get a slight discount on the price and again I was delighted at the diversity of food beautifully presented in the breakfast room. It was an excellent meal. We stayed on a Sunday evening and it was so wonderfully quiet, room 341 at rear of hotel and no noisy guests to wake us up . Last but not least it is a beautiful and characterful hotel, just like the photos show and not boring and non-descript like so many other hotels. It is one hotel that stands out for quality in all areas that matter and I plan to return again soon as great location not too far away from Dublin centre and Howth with its amazing seafood cafes and restaurants.Transport required though to get to city centre or Howth. Good free parking at the hotel worth mentioning too
title: Wonderful overnight stay at First Class Hotel Highly Recommended

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Fantastic hotel with very nice and artistic decor. Rooms are maintained very well, neat and clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. Only problem is not having enough option in dinner for vegetarians. still very much recommended for overall comfortable stay.
title: Great hotel in Dublin

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Upon arrival at Clontarf, one is amazed at the visual appearance. It is a lovely property, including interior which is state of the art but very reminiscent of ...a castle. Colors are royal purple, fit for a king and a queen.
title: A modern day castle

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: This was a surprise for my boyfriends's birthday. As soon as we walked up the drive we were both very impressed, it looks amazing. Checked in by Marcello, there was a little wait...as he was arranging a couple of glasses of champagne and chocolates waiting for us in the room. Lovely touch, thank you. We also had four mini cakes delivered to our room before going out that evening. Brilliant customer service.We had a room at the end of the corridor, and it was smaller than expected. But it wasn't too much of a problem, still very comfy. The water pressure in the shower was a little lacking, but loved the toiletries, smelled delicious. The first night I struggled with the pillows as they are really hard. I then read that they had feather ones so requested some, only to be told they had run out. Disappointed by this. The bed was comfy but the pillows let it down.We had breakfast there, which again was fantastic. Lots to choose from and very tasty. On the second day though, we'd gone up to get a little bit more and when we came back to the table the staff had cleared our cups of teams cutlery away so had to ask for more.Overall we loved this hotel. The staff were very helpful and the location was good - we used the bus and train to get into the city and had a nice walk along the seafront.
title: Almost perfect

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: The time spent at the hotel was so beautiful. It has a cozy, romantic atmosphere, with lots of candles and classic music. It also smells very good (the candles?) and it has AC. The staff are all very friendly.
title: Awesome!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: My wife and I travelled with another couple from Canada. We spent the last night in Ireland at Clontarf after touring 1600 kms over 12 days. This was a great way to finish our great trip. The castle has a mix of modern and traditional to the property which really makes this property work the way it does. The pub and restaurant were amazing and the food was fantastic.The atmosphere was perfect as soon as we arrived and the décor suits their theme for a castle hotel.We can't think of anything to improve this location.Definitely recommend to friends and family.Definitely would return when travelling back to Ireland.Thank you for a great experience :)
title: Great place to finish a great trip

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: If you want to experience afternoon tea with a difference I highly recommend Clontarf castle's Fusion Afternoon Tea. It is an unique experience and I was delighted to partake on Sunday 30th July 2017 as a final treat and to end a perfect few days stay in Dublin with my daughter. We had booked for 1pm and I was pleasantly surprised at the seating area were the tea was to be served it added to the overall experience, large comfy chairs to sink into, table at proper height and beautifully set. Glass was the theme and crockery was all glass not the usual vintage theme which is used in most establishments so different and refreshing. Cormac the bar manager approached our table he introduced himself in a very professional manner but he was friendly which is also important, he helped us to sit back relax and look forward to what was in store. He had wit him a wooden box which stored all the samples of teas in glass storage jars he proceeded to explain the origin of each tea and we were able to smell each one (it was better than wine tasting) he gave his recommendations but the final choice was entirely up to ourselves. Michelle was in charge of serving our afternoon tea and Kirsty also helped, Michelle explained how the afternoon tea would be served, savouries first and she described what was in each treat and she did the same for the sweet section. She was very helpful and professional . The food served was of a very high standardand and was plentiful there was a combination of unusual flavours which worked. I have had afternoon teas in other establishments but i have no hesitation in saying Clontart Castle 's Fusion Afternoon Tea was the best, the attention to detail, the setting, the professional manner the staff carried out there duties and the food was superb, all these factors added to the unique experience of afternoon tea at Confarf Castle. Well done all concerned.
title: Fusion Afternoon Tea

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Visited here with my family, stayed for several nights, the hotel is set in small well kept grounds, they look fab, the entrance is magnificent and looks great. Check in was easy and simple, great communication from the staff, rooms are a little old-ish and little shabby, but nicely decorated with great air conditioning.Restaurant looks fabulous and has wonderful decor, service was great and that's it???? Food was not the greatest and was very out dated, definitely not two AA Rosette, vegetables where well over cooked and my steak was well blackened, even if I asked for medium?????? Desserts are old style.... not to sure about the concept working, restaurant is a bit dusty and needs a good clean...??????Breakfast was perfect, fantastic range of hot and cold food, more fruit would be appreciated, service was great and attentive with friendly greetings, great idea on the vegetable juicer and fresh honey. All in all wonderful experience, but try to work on the food.Bar area was very busy with locals having the traditional Irish carvery, it really looked good and must of been as the dining area was full. Great job.Great location and close to all major villages like Malahide and Howth. Close to the airport too.
title: Beautiful

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: This hotel is fantastically placed to explore Dublin (bus stop just a 5 minute walk). The character and design of the hotel is fantastic and the staff were so friendly and helpful. We were travelling with a 5 month old baby and they were always checking we were ok and if there was anything we needed.Rooms were lovely and breakfast was good although there was the occasional wait for tea during busier times. The bar had a good ambience and having drinks served to your table was lovely after a busy day.Overall a great stay - if we ever comeTo Dublin again we will definitely be back - great location for ferry port also!!
title: Great hotel, fantastic location, friendly staff!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: On our first visit to Dublin, we chose the Clontarf Castle Hotel because of its historic features and reputation for service. Once we arrived, we saw that the hotel had nicely integrated modern decor with the castle walls and interior. Our room, one of the few junior suites, was warmly decorated and spacious, with angled windows that overlook Dublin Harbor.We also appreciated the helpfulness of the front-desk staff, especially one who, late in the evening, tracked down and delivered to our room two long extension cords so my wife could plug in a medical device at her bedside. Staff in the restaurants were less attentive, but helpful once we approached them with requests. I recommend the Clontarf Castle Hotel for Dublin visitors, with a proviso that visitors should be prepared to take a 15-minute taxi ride from the hotel to get to attractions in central Dublin.
title: Picturesque and Welcoming Hotel

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Arrived early to be given the warmest welcome by Adam at reception who quickly checked us in and offered a few tips on what to do in advance of this U2 gig, including a map and directionsSuite was beautiful , bed comfy lovely toiletries and as we wee going out opted for lunch in the knights bar which as great too. Staff are helpful and knowledgeable , hotel lovely and overall perfect for our stay Adam seemed to be there for our every whim and really was the icing on the cake forOur stay ! We will be back
title: Perfect !

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Absolutely beautiful hotel. A must stay if you are ever in the Dublin area. The customer service is excellent. Staff is very friendly and go out of their way to help in any way they can and will do whatever they can to make sure your experience at the hotel is above and beyond with everything
title: A Must Stay

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We decided to add a 24-hour stay in Dublin to our layover on our way to London, Paris, and Rome. Clontarf was definitely one of the highlights of our stay. It is extremely difficult to find a single room for a family of 5 in Europe, so we considered ourselves lucky to even find one. The room turned out to be larger than expected, recently updated, clean, and luxurious. The breakfast was fantastic, and the hotel staff was courteous and helpful. We loved the castle feel and beautiful artwork. We will definitely be back on a longer trip to Ireland sometime in the future!
title: Surpassed our Expectations!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: State of the Clontarf castle for 4 days July 13th through the 16th had the bridal Suite was absolutely spectacular. Frederica Luke Elaine all of them were awesome they made us feel like Queens. The food was spectacular the ambience was out of this world and the high tea was absolutely delightful I would highly recommend staying at the Clontarf it's a fabulous place. Walking around near the Boardwalk by the sea is an awesome sight to see. I will return to Clontarf
title: Awesome

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We spent three amazing days at the hotel as part of a business trip. More than 40 of my colleagues stayed in this hotel and we were all very well looked after. The facilities were excellent, the meals delicious and all staff very helpful. I appreciated their help more so when I forgot to pack a pair of shoes and they found them and put them aside for me to pick up few days later on my return on the way to the airport. I particularly liked the stylish decor and the perfect combination of old building charm and new and very tasteful interior design. This place makes a superb wedding venue, is perfect as a business venue too and it can also make a special day extra special. I would not hesitate to come back again and bring more family and friends with me next time.
title: Professionalism & Old Charm

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Clontarf Castle definitely exceeded our expectations. The staff was warm and friendly, the rooms were spacious and well kept and the grounds were simply stunning. Your close enough to enjoy downtown Dublin yet also away from the traffic and noise. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again someday.
title: Wonderful Hotel

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: I spent 2 days here for a work conference, including staying the night. The staff were more than willing to go above and beyond with any requests, the rooms were nice and clean and the hotel itself is in a stunning setting - would recommend.
title: Fantastic experience

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: I organised a work conference here spanning 6 days with international travellers. The hotel couldn't have gone out their way any more if they tried. Exceptional customer service in all areas of the hotel from the corporate side to the reception and maid service, amazing catering and dining in the restaurants. The hotel staff certainly gave us the that warm irish welcome they are famous for and they certainly went the extra mile. The hotel is stunning and literally 10 mins from Dublin city centre and would highly recommend anyone considering in staying her to do so.
title: Highly recommended, amazing hotel

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We stayed in the Clontarf Castle due to its proximity to the Dublin Airport. Nice accommodations, including good bar/pub. I wouldn't recommend it for travelers who are seeking to spend their days in Dublin city center since it is a bit of a drive (or lengthy bus ride).
title: Clontarf Castle -- comfortable though a bit out of the way

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Clontarf Castle was better than I even hoped (and my expectations were high!). It's like staying in a lovely dream. The building and grounds are stunning, the food is delicious, and the staff is wonderful. Marcello is a great concierge - he worked with my friends and me on what exactly we wanted to do on our trip, and every suggestion he gave us was amazing.The hotel is located within easy access of the city center, but it's far enough away that it feels peaceful and serene. Book this hotel now - you won't regret it.
title: Best place I have ever stayed!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: It was the last day of our self-drive holiday in Ireland and I wanted to splurge on a castle hotel. I am glad I had chosen Clontarf Castle because it had all the elements I had wanted in a castle hotel - grand and full of history and yet with the modern amenities incorporated. We walked past 2 knights' armours on the way to the reception area, which was uniquely decorated with all shapes and sizes of ancient keys. For a moment I thought we were going to be issued one of those to enter our room! The room itself blew me away. It was spacious and luxurious and comfortable and distinctly 5 star. Our only regret was that we were only booked for 1 night stay as we had to depart Ireland the next day. We certainly ended our Ireland stay on a high note.
title: Out of this world!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Just stayed at Clontarf for two nights during July 2017. It is truly a special hotel and place to stay. The decor is just as the photographs show - ornate and quirky. Great art work through out the hotel. The location is a bit off the beaten path from the city centre but the #130 bus nearby will take you into town Or a taxi ride will get you there and back in 15 minutes. Breakfast is really nice and perfectly adequate with hot food, breads, yogurts, fruit and cold cuts. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Charming Hotel

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Our stay here was incredible - the lobby is maintained like an elegant medieval castle (with plenty of fun photo ops to be had) and the rooms feel like a modern luxury hotel. Breakfast was delicious in the morning, and our only regret was not having more time to stay and explore!
title: Amazing experience

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Cormac gave us a lovely welcome and introduction to the various teas, and really put us at our ease. The girls brought us lovely open sandwiches with a great selection of toppings, the deserts were fabulous, and we were encouraged to try different teas. We loved everything, but I think the orange and saffron creme brulee won out.I would highly recommend the afternoon tea experience at Clontarf Castle.
title: Lovely Afternoon Tea experience in a wonderful setting

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We booked our trip through a travel website and selected to stay here on the last night of Ireland trip. The staff was very nice and helpful and the room was clean and very comfortable. The food at the restaurant was also very good! Would definitely recommend this hotel to others!
title: Great place!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Love this hotels lobby built around the castle. Stayed one night while in Dublin for U2.Lovely room with a proper walk in shower not one over the bath. Breakfast was not included. Its a bit away from the city center. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Very nice stay

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: My wife and stayed here last weekend while in Dublin. This was an amazing hotel and we both have no reservations in giving it the full five stars. Prior to arriving we got a bit lost and Adam was most helpful over the phone in redirecting us. Adam was also very helpful and polite upon checkout too. During our conversation he informed us that he was a newer member of staff having only been there a few months; this didn't show and he is a credit to the hotel. Once we arrived, we were greeted by Luke who was professional and welcoming. He couldn't have done enough to help us, for example we were VERY early (check in is from 2 and we arrived at 10:30am) but he managed to get us an early check-in and a great room which in essence he had no obligation to. Thanks for this, Luke. The hotel is amazing. Plenty of parking spaces if you are driving (as we did; we hired a car from the airport) and good facilities. The outside face of the building looks original, authentic and simply stunning while the decor inside the hotel is equally as impressive. As you enter the hotel you are greeted by knights in shining armour, medieval type decor and a beautiful fireplace where we later sat by to who a delicious and gratuitously tasty/filling afternoon tea. The rooms are also beautiful: the bed was extremely comfortable and we liked the facilities such as the smart television in the room. We also booked breakfast in the morning which was tasty, varied and a great way to start the day. One thing I'd like to add before drawing this review to its conclusion is the fact that we had gone away for my wife's birthday and I'd treated her to tickets for The Riverdance. Now I can't remember actually mentioning this to staff but I obviously did at some point so when we came back after our night out, we had a hand written note from the "Lords and Ladies" of the castle wishing my wife a happy birthday and saying they hoped we'd had a lovely time watching The Riverdance. The note was accompanied by chocolates and an official plush toy/teddy for the hotel. This came as a lovely surprise and goes to show how attentive the staff there are and how they go the extra mile. Overall this was an amazing stay. This was our first trip to Ireland but we have traveled all over the world (east and west) and have high standards - this hotel met them and then some. Thank you and we look forward to staying at the hotel when we next come!David and Amy.
title: Brilliant hotel

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We have had one of the most beautiful Afternoon Tea experiences in Dublin. We were offered a great selection of teas, tasteful open sandwiches and decadent desserts. The service is just top notch! Kudos to all the staff especially Cormac our Tea Connoisseur and Michelle our Menu Specialist who took great care of our table.
title: An Afternoon Tea in a fairytale setting

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: We were greeted by a small, well kept garden and lots of lions. The hotel is beautiful, although we weren't too keen on our room decor. It was an interesting place to explore, with a last stop in the pub/restaurant for an excellent meal.
title: Not every day that you can stay in a place built in 1172

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Everything you could expect. Superb service from Check in to check out. Dining was fantastic. Rooms were spacious and immaculate. The artwork on display was an unexpected find. I would highly recommend to anyone.
title: Excellent

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: Stayed 1 night. Loved the lobby area with wood paneling, crests, knights in armor, tapestries and floral arrangements. The restaurant was very good for dinner. The hotel is not far from the center of Dublin.
title: Beautiful decor!

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: This hotel is nice but pricey. If you are looking for a real castle experience this is not the place. The front is a castle but the rooms are not castle like. The rooms are extremely nice and have great amenities. The drawback of the hotel is that there is nothing really in walking distance. The restaurants were decent but restaurant staff was not that great. There breakfast was disappointing.
title: Pricey Hotel but Nice

hotelLocation: Castle Avenue, Dublin D03 W5NO, Ireland
review: My wife and i stayed here last weekend as part of our wedding anniversary celebrations. We were also attending a concert at the 3 arena on Saturday evening. Entrance: We were particularly taken by the entrance and lobby of the castle hotel - it was charming and authentic. We saw a number of people enjoying afternoon tea (which looked very nice indeed). Check-in was incredibly smooth - We were checked in by a gentleman (Arjun i think - apologies for spelling/if this is incorrect). He congratulated us on our wedding anniversary celebration and gave us all the information we required. Room - (room 217) - The decor was classy with a twist and my wife and i really liked it. The bed was incredibly comfortable and a good night's sleep was had after the concert. If i had to find a negative I would say that the bathroom was a little tired looking in comparison to the very fresh and modernised room - although in saying that it was totally spotless and that's the main thing!Food: We had dinner in the bar - my wife had the fish of the day and thoroughly enjoyed it; I had the chicken burger and it was likewise very good. Portion sizes were generous. Definitely value for money and in line with other Dublin eateries. My favourite part though was breakfast the next morning - a lovely buffet selection of cereals, breads, fruits and cooked breakfast. Little freshly prepared smoothies and juices were welcomed too. I stay in Dublin quite a lot for concerts/weekends away and can genuinely say this was probably one of the best breakfasts I've had in the city.Special touch: The gentleman who checked us in left a little gift in our room for our anniversary whilst we were eating in the bar prior to our concert. This was a wonderful surprise. We tried to catch him again before his shift finished and didn't manage to, so please pass on our thanks. Location: The hotel is a good 10-20 mins outside of main centre of Dublin. If you have a car it's very easy to get to - 12 mins took us to the 3Arena - (or there's always the bus stop next to the hotel), but be aware of this and note that there isn't much to do directly around the hotel. This didn't bother us as the hotel fully met our needs but may obviously be a negative for tourists etc. Overall - a fantastic and thoroughly enjoyable stay. We will be back and have since recommended to family/friends.
title: Classic, Quality and Charming Clontarf

review: We booked a double-room, which was large. The breakfast pancakes were excellent.The staff is nice. The House is situated a 30 minute walk from the city-center. The shower-head was really disgusting, else-wise everything looked clean.
title: Large room, Great breakfast, Dirty Shower

review: I loved everything about this hotel! The moment we arrived we were warmly welcomed. The concierge was absolutely great. We were early for check in, so she moved some stuff around, and we were in our room within five minutes. They have tea, coffee, cookies and cakes in the drawing room, and the breakfast in the morning was delicious. The appearance of the hotel is quite grand, yet old school (in the best way). It is only about a 15 minute walk to the Oscar Wild statue and the hop on hop off bus stop. Also, it's less than a five minute walk to the dart station (train). I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Dublin. This place spoiled us!
title: Such a Lovely Spot

review: Fantastic location very close to Lansdowne Road DART station which gets you into the city in a few minutes. Lovely old house with good sized rooms and a nice sitting room with tea & coffee. The bed is good but the quilt was much too hot in July so had to use the throw as a blanket. The breakfast is excellent there is an amazing menu to choose from as well as a buffet. I will highly recommend this place to our friends.
title: Best place to stay in Dublin

review: I reread the reviews to see what I missed. Our room was dark, with one window and a stained, spotted carpet, a lumpy bed, and loud, young children running up and down the hall. Fifteen minutes from Dublin.Plusses: Free parking The parlor room was cozy and charming (though the chairs were worn and lumpy)The breakfast room was nice (though we had to wait to sit down)This is a three star, so don't expect more.
title: Just ok

review: It's really close to the stadium and stayed there while nothing was on there, so was perfect. The breakfasts were great quality. I had a really early morning flight, and they gave me a takeaway breakfast.
title: Great hotel in quiet location (when stadium isn't in use)

review: Booked here after reading the reviews and enjoyed a fantastic four day break. Despite arriving very early we were given the warmest welcome, our bags were securely stored and we were offered breakfast which was one of the best I have eaten. The full Irish is just that and worth every euro. Service levels here are way ahead of many top brand hotels and the friendly and charming staff always go the extra mile to ensure guests feel welcome. Our large bedroom was very comfortable and clean and the black out curtains ensured great sleep. The hotel is a short walk from the light rail service (Dart) which provides a very reasonable service into the city. There are also a number of decent eateries nearby if distance becomes a problem. Overall a fabulous hotel which we look forward to returning to soon. Highly recommended.
title: Amazing Accommodation

review: We stayed one night at the Ariel House which is located in a quiet area near the Aviva Stadium. The place is very quaint and has a nice vintage vibe and style. My only issue with Ariel is the creaky floorboards which may disturb guests. We had someone upstairs that moved around at night disturbing our sleep. Breakfast was great with a small buffet and cooked breakfast. Parking is available as well.
title: Old style hotel

review: Very nice rooms and great breakfast. Only issue is way too many stairs. The staff did help bring them back up to the lobby and then down again to the street, but there were a lot of stairs. They were very helpful with directions and suggestions. Not a lot of restaurants nearby (only 1 we found and it was in another hotel). Near AMerican Embassy and buses.
title: Very nice boutique hotel with good staff

review: The is a little gem of a hotel, in a lovely part of the city with easy access to the centre of Town. If you time from DART Train well, you be in the heart of Temple Bar within 15 minutes. Very easy to get to from the Airport, I got the Aircoach and got off at the Ballsbridge Hotel stop, but you have to use 487 Bus stop close to the US Embassy for your Air coach journey back to the airport. Just remember to get your Leapfrog Visitor's pass at the airport, they do 1 day, 3 days and 7 days pass to use on all the public transport in Dublin.Great bars and restaurants close by, Searson's is a great bar with a good atmosphere and they do great food as well. If you fancy a curry, you should try Ravi's kitchen, really friendly staff and fantastic food. Also for bits a piece you need for your days out, there is a Tesco Metro next to Searson's.The Hotel is 2 Victorian houses joined together, looks fantastic from the outside and they tried to keep as much of the old Victorian deco on the inside. The rooms are a very good sizes, as it is an old Victorian building, there is no Air Con. I am sure if you asked the might be able to supply with an fan for the room. I am only guessing they could supply a fan, as the staff were very friendly and super helpful. I found there was only 1 spare socket, I do have to remind everyone, this is an old Victorian house. So maybe bring a small extension cable with you, if you have many electric items need charging? So if there was more sockets and a fan in the room, I would of given 5 out of 5?I highly recommend and would come again, it was that great stay at the Ariel House Hotel. :-D
title: Excellent Hotel in a beautiful location
