Shout out to Nina (gorgeous eyes!), David - our favorite Irish actor, and Mark at the bar for delivering excellent drinks and tapas recommendations! We would definitively stay here next time. Steps from the Temple Bar's bustling streets.
title: Morgan Bar Bliss

review: Came into the Morgan for a quick pint or two. The young barman Josh was so nice and charming. Had myself in stitches the whole time I ended up having an extra pint! Great service , great ambience and the decor is outstanding highly recommend!
title: So classy

review: David in the bar makes a damn good coffee. On top of that, he was very engaging and friendly. Pleasant atmosphere in the bar area. Music not too loud, so conversation over a coffee or beer is great. Seats are plentiful and comfortable
title: Good Coffee

review: I stayed at The Morgan many years ago, and it was then a cool boutique hotel in Temple Bar. It still has its great location - step out the doors and your in the midst of everything on Fleet Street - but has lost quite a lot of its coolness. Apparently the owners are cashing in, and not re-investing in the hotel. The staff is nice, but at least two in the reception where claiming "I am very new, so I don't know", so checking in/out was a long and cumbersome and quite disorganized exercise. Our room was not ready until 4pm (our room was not ready yet, but then we got another room instead), which was also a let down. The room (we stayed in a junior suite facing Fleet St) was spacious, but worn down. Big cracks around ceiling lights, one light in the bathroom was broken and one bedside lamp did dot work (and couldn't be fixed by the staff). The bed was tired and super-soft (not to my liking), and the chair in the room was covered with a sheet to cover up the wear&tear. Only one TV, located close to the sofa, made it impossible to watch TV in bed (possible to live without of course) but good storage/wardrobe and good with a empty fridge (given that Tesco is just opposite the hotel). As mentioned, the location is VERY central for those who want to party. Impressive sound proofing though meant that if you closed the windows it got very quiet. However, then it gets very warm, and there was no AC - just a fan outside the sleeping area. The breakfast was non-impressive, with seating at large, shared 6-8pax tables. So, all-in-all, the location is great for partying, the hotel is from my perspective loosing its cool and is in a pretty worn-down state.
title: Good for party weekend, but not a great hotel

review: Called in for a light meal and cocktails, loved the outdoor area and decor. Food was delicious and David made the experience great for everyone- genuine, friendly and passionate about his work. Thanks and will see you on return.
title: Excellent

review: Second visit to Dublin for the U2 gig - the city was buzzing which was great, fantastic atmosphere in & around the hotel. We picked the hotel for the location & it was perfect, everything within walking distance. The prices were hiked up due to the U2 gig but it certainly wasn't worth the €350/night (room only!) this is a 3 star hotel at best.Cons: The room wasn't ready until 3pm (despite requesting an early check in as I'd flown overnight to get to Dublin). When we did check in we were a bit disappointed with the room - the hotel has a quirky style which would've been lovely when it was new but is now pretty dated and on the shabby side. The bedding and towels were more grey than white and the towels were frayed & shredded. There was an oversized (too big for the room) arm chair with a similarly grey cover with holes in and all of the lamp shades were wonky. The lighting was poor, particularly in the bathroom - not great for 2 girls getting ready to go out. The shower was over the bath & because of the slope at the end you have to do a yoga style back bend to get your hair wet, the angle couldn't be adjusted & just flops down, plus the shower screen doesn't extend far enough so soaked the floor, toilet & loo roll. There was no water & one bruised apple. It didn't bother us as we were exhausted the 1st night & out until 2am the 2nd, but there is a very loud nightclub on the ground floor that we could hear loud & clear even though we requested a quiet room. Pros: the staff were friendly & helpful, the food was great both at breakfast and in the bar/restaurant, lovely cocktails (Morgan Bubbles!) and wine. The location is fab.
title: Average at best

review: I stayed at the Morgan in April and came back to stay there in June simply because of the amazing treatment received. It's located smack in the city center. Amazing restaurants and bars simply stepping outside of the hotel. Got an upgrade due to overbooking and got the celebrity penthouse. It's got a huge terrace with camping van up there and is super cosy and got breathtaking views. Never ever stayed at such an amazing suite! The next time I got back I got a regular double room and it was superb. Comfy beds, all rooms have complimentary fruit in them and it's fresh and has an almost gothic design. Highly recommended this place!
title: Top notch hotel and treatment

review: I would have given the this hotel a 5 star rating if not for a few issues: Improvements - The hotel staff on arrival were not particularly friendly although some of the staff were very good; I booked a Love Room directly at least a couple of months in advance but was told it was overbooked and not available, we were given a suite instead but this was at the front and was too noisy and no air con and would say the decor was a bit tired; This hotel isn't quiet so if you are looking for something relaxing don't go for this, the bar is lively until very late and lots of outside noiseGood - Love Room is excellent, quirky and perfect for a couple; Location is spot on as everything is within walking distance; good toiletries from White Company; Given a EUR50 discount for the room on the 1st night but I would say they should have contacted me in advance to say there was an issue with the room; Love Rooms at the back of the hotel are air conditioned and much quieter
title: Modern Hotel in Great Location but some improvements needed

review: Absolutely great spot for cocktails - really great bartenders, got served by josh, great cocktails, and such friendly service from staff - David was lovely and great craic, if only more bars had staff like this in Dublin, will definitely be back!!
title: Wonderful spot :)

review: I was in on Sunday July 16th, your waiter David was one of he most helpful,genuine people I've ever met. So helpful,cheerful and definitely made our experience one to remember. A trust gentleman and made us smile, a trust asset to your team at Morgan bar. Can't wait to come back
title: Your waiter was a dream

review: Beautifully decorated comfortable rooms in the perfect location for walking to shops, Temple Bar District, Restaurants, and to tour the town. Staff was very helpful with providing directions and offering suggestions on what to do and see. Wouldn't recommend this area for families with children as it is in the heart of the bar district, but definitely ok for older teens and couples.
title: Modern Hotel with Perfect Location

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Lovely hotel, big modern room but small bathroom. It was very warm at night, ths lack of air con, and a busy street outside meant we could not leave the window open. As a regular swimmer, i found the pool far too warm, the warmest i have experianced.
title: Lovely, just too warm

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We enjoyed our one night stay on a Saturday night in July. The hotel is large and in the "newer" part of Dublin, so it lacks some of the charm of a boutique hotel. However, there are plenty of amenities (vending machines with drinks and adapters) and a nice, large restaurant where we had a nice dinner and enjoyed the very large breakfast buffet (not included in our stay). No air condition that I could find, so the room was a bit stuffy - opening the slider helped. It is a bit of a walk to the center of town, but it is pretty to walk along the river. The area is a bit deserted on the weekends, but it is nice to get away from the hustle & bustle.
title: Friendly staff at this large hotel

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Hotel was nice, the staff were friendly and helpful, hand location in dublin, breakfast was only ok.. water was only luke warm in rooms for a shower,you wouldn't be able to have a bath but had experienced this on another clayton in Cork previously and was told it was ok.. so didn't bother to report it as nothing would have been done like previously, thought it was pricy to be honest too
title: Gilrs night away

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Clean and uodated hotel with friendly staff. No privacy as we were given an adjoining room. Very warm with no air conditioning and hard to keep shade open to get air as hallwall windows faced our room. Shower had no water pressure.
title: Clayton Hotel

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Was great service, the location was great for my work and as a tourist, walked easily to the center.Got special services from the reception by a lady called Alessia.She printed for me many things that I needed and got answers to all my questions.The room was large and comfort
title: Was 2 days there

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Upon arrival we were greeted with a warm welcome and the appearance of the hotel was to very high standards, the check in staff were very friendly and eager to help, we had arrived far too early for our check in time which we were aware of anyway, but they allowed us to leave our bags in a safe room until it was time to come back, the hotel is located within about a 10-15 minute walk from the city centre including countless bars, restaurant and shops. The room itself we couldn't fault at all, everything was clean, tidy and very spacious, the beds were comfy, the bathroom was a nice size and it had everything we needed.On the last day of our visit, we had a flight that would leave us hanging around for hours, so after taking a walk to the shops we went into the hotel bar and took the weight of our feet for a couple of hours, to which we were approached by Derek who was very friendly and made us feel very welcome with being in the bar, absolute pleasure to talk to and chat with, the rest of the staff in the bar all seemed hands on and polite.All in all, the Clayton Hotel on Cardiff Lane is definitely somewhere I would recommend someone to stay at, it's a modern, classy hotel with everything you could possibly ask for in a hotel!
title: Fantastic hotel, definitely recommend!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Took my Mum to see Aerosmith for their final tour and found this hotel through Booking.com. We managed to secure a great deal. The hotel is very clean and decorated lovely. All staff members which we spoke to from Reception through to the Bar were fab- very welcoming and helpful.Ate a meal before the concert- Mum had a burger (the best burger I have ever tasted!) and I had the Thai curry. Great value for money and great food with a great atmosphere.Room was clean and pleasant. No complaints. If I was to return to Dublin, would definitely visit this hotel again.
title: Great stay

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We stayed here for one night perfect location really nice rooms clean and tidy the hotel staff were really friendly and a big shout out to the bar staff in Vertigo bar Ryan and Ivan brilliant service really looked after us a really great atmosphere I would definitely recommend this bar
title: Night in Dublin

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Recently my wife and I spent 3 nights in Clayton Hotel Cardiff Lane. The location was superb, a short walk from the shops on Grafton Street and O'Connell St. with the Bord Gas Theatre next door. The staff were friendly and the food was excellent (the chicken stir fry was something else), no need to go anywhere else to eat in the evening. We made full use of the Clubvitae leisure facilities (well - the pool and sauna) so we really enjoyed our short break.
title: Short break in Clayton Hotel Cardiff Lane in Dublin

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights while in Dublin for a pre-tour stop. It was recommended by the tour company. The hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a one mile walk from the Dublin old town so it is not a great location for a tourist. The hotel has no AC and was a bit warm during our stay. We asked for a fan and the staff quickly obliged. The included breakfast offered a nice selection and was good. There is really nothing bad to say about the place. It is just an average hotel.
title: Average Hotel

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Shared a family room with my wife and mother-in-law. Beds were fine, plenty of outlets, and decent sized bathroom. Room was warm but the entire hotel was due to the weather being warm. Was able to get a fan which helped.
title: First night in Dublin

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Me and my friend came to Dublin for a few days away and we were not disappointed! The Clayton hotel is in good walking distance to the centre with lots of bars to visit whilst on the way. We were dropped off by the airlink which was just across the bridge so it took us 5 mins to get to the hotel with no messing. On our last day we sat in the hotel bar and was greeted by Derek who was polite and welcoming. He told us we could stay and relax until it was time to leave for our flight. I would highly recommend this hotel as all the staff were helpful and friendly.
title: Great place to stay!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The hotel was beautiful and the service was superb. We were particularly impressed and touched by the personal high-quality service provided by Guest Relations Officer Derek Burke, who, upon hearing that we wanted some authentic Irish scones, made it his personal mission to surprise us with them when we were leaving! His personal service and attention to our needs were typical of this wonderful hotel. We look forward to visiting Ireland again soon and we definitely plan to stay at the Clayton. Thank you, Derek!
title: Great visit!!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: 30 of us stayed at the Carlton Hotel Cardiff Lane The Hotel is very clean bright and cheerful Derek Burke and his staff are amazing a pleasure to be around they are so helpful and nothing is to much trouble for them. We had the most wonderful time in Dublin and at the hotel the food was great Morning and evening this hotel is a credit to the city of Dublin I can't wait to stay again a lot of hotels don't cater for big parties but nothing was to much trouble for the staff here A big thank you to you all
title: Weekend Stay

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Very good experience with our children. Excellent service to give plenty of references for visiting Dublin. Comfortable rooms plenty of space and clean. The swimming pool and the gym are perfect for starting an energetic day.
title: Veru well located, Perfect service and deliciuos dinners

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: So made our way to the Clayton before our show at the Bord Gais theatre , Food and Cocktails are the best here... my 15 year old's 1st show, we were beyond excited.. got chattin to the lovely Derek about our show, he was so friendly, and the conversation was flowing when he realised we were a year early for our show "Wicked" . Devastated is an understantment, not to mention embarassment!! Thats when Derek stepped in and arranged for us to see Angela's Ashes instead.. knight in shining Armour, Saved the day.. cannot thank him enough
title: Derek made our year!!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Derek was so kind to help us when we had a mishap and saved the day he was so kind and sweet enough to help us .... we had an amazing day thanks to him, if it wasn't for him our day would have been ruined Thanks Derek
title: Derek saved the day

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I stayed at the Clayton on Cardiff lane for three nights on a business trip in Dublin. The room was clean, tidy, centrally located and the hotel accommodated my request for a room facing the Main Street. Helpful reception and bar staff. Room service food was good, and delivered well within the stated wait time. The bathroom was a bit of a let down. The shower curtain had mold on it (although a very tiny amount, but still visible), and the plug stopper in my bathroom did not work. I had to reach in and try to dig it out with a pen, and then with my hands, otherwise my shower would turn into a bath. Each day the room cleaner would put the stopper back in the bath so I had to dig it back out again when I wanted to shower - yuck! I was pretty put off by the end of my stay. Upon checkout, I ordered a taxi to the airport and requested a taxi that accepted card payments (as I had done several times before during my stay at the hotel). I arrived at the airport and, surprise, surprise, the taxi doesn't take cards and says the hotel reception did not mention it. It was embarrassing. I probably wouldn't stay here again. Considering the location and price range, there are other options.
title: Okay, but probably wouldn't stay again

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: 23 June – 26 June 2017.The Hotel is located in the Docklands (opposite the Bord Gais Energy Theatre).I don't know if it's been recently redecorated but everywhere looked and smelt new and fresh!I've visited Dublin quite a few times, and this has to be my favourite Hotel due to its high standards and location.It's about a 15 minute walk into the centre of Dublin, which was ideal for us as we didn't have to wait around for buses or taxi's, and it also means that you're away from the hustle & bustle during the evening ensuring a nice peaceful sleep after a busy day. I found all of the staff to be friendly & polite.Our room was spotlessly clean, the beds were very comfortable and there was ample storage room (wardrobes etc).We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet.I have to agree though with previous reviewers, that the only downside was that there was no air conditioning, so the room was hot & stuffy. I'd return here without doubt.Keep up the excellent standards!
title: My favourite Hotel in Dublin so far!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Party of 30 stayed at the Clayton Hotel Cardiff Lane Dublin We had the most amazing time the Hotel is really well run very clean Excellent food staff are so friendly and helpful nothing is to much trouble The Manager's Derek and Brian are wonderful they couldn't do enough for us. They made our staff perfect. The hotel is perfectly placed for everything you would want to do in Dublin. We will certainly be going back
title: Weekend stay at Clayton Hotel Cardiff Lane Dublin

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Great hotel in the Docklands. ideally situated for attending the Theatre in Gand Canal Square, the Convention Centre, Lansdowne Road (sorry, the Aviva) and the 3 Arena. Short walk into the City Centre and also on the direct bus routes to the airport.Great breakfast each morning, buffet style, also noted Gluten Free options available.Hotel and rooms were all very clean and everyone seemed to have pride in the hotel. All staff were exceptionally friendly, in particular the bar staff during the day at first floor and also the (older) maitre d at breakfast who all treated our daughter like an equal.Ground floor 'vertigo' bar was ok for a few drinks, but perhaps the best facility is the large swimming pool, sauna and steam rooms. Never really used these type of facilities on other short holidays previously, but made good use of them here.Would we go back, yes we would !
title: Hotel in great location

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We stayed in an Executive King Room, which was a decent size and we appreciated having a mini fridge and small table with chairs. Staff was responsive and helpful when we could not get the TV to work and some of the lights. Also when we stopped at the front desk with any questions. The bed was comfortable as well. We managed to use the fitness center 2 of our mornings before setting out for the days tourist stuff, which was nice to be able to do.The only problem we ran into with the hotel was when on our 3rd or 4th of 5 nights we had bottled water, chocolates and the newspaper appear and we had not had those things the first nights. We then checked more info on their website and determined we should have been getting those perks all along. We mentioned this when we checked out and had a discussion with the manger/trainee about this and that we expected a reduction to our room rate for those 3 nights we had not had the perks. She did take off $40/night for 2 nights and gave us a big box of chocolates to take with us and said she would contact us once she had a chance to explore what went wrong and when with the housekeeping staff. We never heard anything further from her however. We would consider staying here again as it was a comfortable hotel.
title: Nice Room, Away from the Busy Center of Dublin

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I deal with this hotel on a personal and professional basis, I find the staff extremely friendly and welcoming whenever I have an issue. I use the Clayton Hotel for my catering needs and the service I receive is next to none, from presentation to delivery. I go to Club Vitae on a daily basis and this is due to the fantastic service I receive, especially from the trainer Ciaran Ryan. Ciaran is passionate about achieving members fitness goals and always does with a smile and some cheeky wit which makes new members feel at ease especially in his classes. He's a fantastic asset to the Clayton Brand and has helped me achieve many of my personal fitness goals.
title: Friendly staff in Clayton Hotel and Club Vitae

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I stayed in The Clayton on Wednesday night with a group of people from Wicklow with intellectual disability. We were headed to see "Funny Girl" in The Bord Gais Theatre. The personal attention we received from Derek was second to none. He sat and chatted to our group and made us feel very welcome and at ease. He had two waiters attend to our every need during dinner and gave the lads complimentary chocolate boxes. He saw us to the door to wave us off when we were heading to see the show. His interaction with our group was so appreciated and made what was a very special evening to our group even more special. Thank you Derek, you were wonderful, we will definitely be back again! Aisling Geoghegan, KARE, Baltinglass
title: Top Class Guest Relations from Derek

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This is the first review I ever done but think its well deserved! I am a member of the Gym Club Vitae at this Hotel and a very happy member. The staff is always helpful and friendly and happy to see you! I have been training almost all my life in Sweden before my move to Dublin, and just recently decided to have a PT to see the difference in my training and get better results. So I have Jakub Gawor from Club Vitae as my PT since 1,5 month and he started by asking me what my goals are and what I wanted to achieve with my training. After that he helped me and made a meal plan that I follow and also training with him at the gym. He is a great positive and knowledgeable PT that I highly recommend to anyone who want to achieve good results. Thanks to him I have already seen great results in myself with his program. He really understood my goals and motivate me to every time give 150% on each training lesson! I highly recommend Jakub and the Club Vitae as your gym in Dublin :) HAPPY MEMBER :)
title: Club Vitae Gym in Dublin

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We reserved a table in Stir Restaurant prior to attending Angela's Ashes in the Bord Gáis Energy Theatre. There was a lovely atmosphere in the restaurant and the service and food offering was excellent. For our main course we had the roast chicken & haddock - both were delicious (see photos attached). We ordered Eton Mess for dessert and it too was divine! Would definitely recommend & will be back.
title: Delicious Pre-Theatre Meal in Stir Restaurant

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The stay was really lovely, great facilities, and friendly staff. Breakfast had a wide range to choose from. All the vending machine charges are made with your credit card upfront, so make sure to have one with you. Ireland also has different charging plugs, so make sure to bring one or you can buy one from the vending machine/front desk for 6eur.
title: Lovely stay

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Our trip to Dublin was spectacular and Clayton Hotel Cardiff Lane was a sweet addition to our adventure. I'd like to particularly point out Alessia at the front desk for going above and beyond in helping me. I was heading to the U2 concert on Saturday night, and Alessia was super helpful in helping me print out a hard copy of my ticket. We chatted about teaching and the beauty of Ireland. It's rare to meet someone who is so authentically interested in conversing and helping in the service industry. It isn't a stretch to say that when we return to Dublin to stay, we will choose the Clayton due to Alessia's hospitality! All the best, Dan and Rebecca O'Neill
title: Great hotel, wonderful staff!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The temperature outside is 14c and there is a tiny window in a room for four. If one person takes a shower the room is too warm. If two take a shower it's a sauna for the rest of the night. I have encounter the little window phenomenon throughout Ireland but his huge monster of a hotel is hot throughout. Sleeping happens after he room has cooled down - around 3am. Stick to airbnb. Most homes and flats have actual portals to the outside air.
title: HOT

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Room was clean and quiet. The staff were extremely helpful and the hotel is located across the street from a "Hop On Hop Off" bus that allowed us to get around to most of the major sites very easily. The hotel is also located within walking distance of several good restaurants and eating options.
title: great location

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Lovely room and leisure centre. Staff were very pleasant and we had a nice breakfast. We had a very relaxed stay.The hotel is within walking distance to lots of sights it is located near Bord Gais Theatre and Epic Museum.
title: One night in Dublin city centre

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Great room, super location, friendly staff. Can walk almost anywhere in city centre from here. Lovely breakfast with a big selection of traditional and healthy foods.Pleasantly warm pool great showers.
title: Night in Dublin

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This is a large modern hotel with good facilities. You can walk to Trinity College in a leisurely 15 minutes so it is outside the city centre but within striking distance. The theatre opposite means the hotel does a theatre dinner and the bar can be busy before the show starts. The reception staff were very nice and got us our room before check in time. The breakfast has a healthy option and there is a lot of choices. It was busy and I have to say, after some Donegal home cooking the food was not so great. Nothing wrong with the quality, just it felt like a canteen rather than a restaurant, with the food being a bit tired. There is an pub close by but like so many in Dublin they do not do food after lunch time. The room was an executive one which meant something significant I suppose, but it was spacious and the bath was big enough for a good soak. Just watch out for the hot water, it was really hot when cranked up to warp drive.There was not any water in the room, which was a little disappointing. Overall a nice place with predictable business type accommodation.
title: Large modern hotel near the river

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: A well run and clean hotel with excellent amenities , it was a pleasure to find a hotel with local Irish staff , whom , true to form , could not be more helpful .Excellent room , quiet and quality furnishings
title: Excellent hotel and location for business trip

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Every aspect of this one night stay was flawless, I would happily recommend. The reception desk is efficency, professional and friendly whilst not being stuff at all. The room is well sized with all you would expect in the form of iron and safe in addition to usual coffee making facilities. I also had a meal and was really tasty along with great friendly service.
title: Excellent

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Traveled to Dublin for the Liverpool FC game in the Aviva at the start of August. We arrived around 2pm and were surprised that our room was ready and we were able to go straight to it. We were then surprised to find the rooms were massive!! Then have plenty of free space, enough to fit another double bed if they wanted. Rooms also include a big bathroom (although the shower is not as powerful as I would like), a refrigerator and tea & coffee making facilities. Free wifi is also included in the room rate.I did not eat or use the leisure facilities so I cannot comment on these.Although Bord Gais is directly across the road I found that there is not much around the hotel except bars, and is a decent 10-15min walk to O'Connell Street so a bit out of the way. Aviva Stadium is also roughly a 20min walk away. Location is the only let down I had but it really was a fantastic hotel!I would stay here again not problem especially if there was something on in Bord Gais.
title: A one night stay

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: the experience was wonderful,the people are excellent,very helpful especially hotel management from Derek and Brian who always greeted us with kind hospitality and humour which we will always remember about the professionalism and A class service of this beautiful hotel and its staff,many kind regards, Frank Agnes & David.
title: Family Holiday

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The staff here is the best. Derek Burke went out of his way to make my stay the best it could have been and I could not imagine how he could have improved my stay. His friendly attitude kept me entertained the entire trip. Would fly back just to stay again.
title: Best Hotel Stay

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Had such a great time staying at this gorgeous hotel. The staff was so welcoming and helpful especially Derek who entertained us through diner and drinks. The food is great, the staff is even better! Can't wait to stay again!
title: Best place to stay in Dublin!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Spacious room, very nice decorated, good quality linen, comfy bed.Staff in the restaurant super professional, the food was delicious, many choices is the menu. Good ambient in the bar, nice food there also.Walkable distance to city center, right in face of Facebook officesThe only suggestion would be to increase maybe the spa staff. I mean, we've been there for 4 nights, and it was very difficult to get a free spot for a massage and a manicure - it's true it was Easter time tho.Overall we had a great stay, we would definitely come back
title: Wonderful

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: My partner & I stayed at The Clayton for one night, and couldn't fault a thing. The reception & checking in was faultless & all the staff on reception were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was lovely, big with a comfy bed, nice bathroom & good shower. The location is great, a 20 min walk into the centre along the river. The airport bus drops off & picks up right outside the hotel, as well as the hop on & hop on bus does, which is ideal. We did have a meal in the vertigo bar, which was very good although the service was a bit slow, it wasn't particularly busy but we still had to wait for over 35 minutes for our food, which came within 5 minutes of complaining how long we'd had to wait, but all in all it was no great hardship. The breakfast was very good, good choice, something for everyone & nice & hot.
title: Fantastic Hotel.

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Traveled to Ireland from Canada for a weekend Jun 1-5. Arrived in Dublin at 5:30am, at hotel by 7am. Room was booked for 3:00pm. Plans were in place prior to leave baggage at front and go about our day. Staff was amazing! Stated room was ready and that we could put luggage in room. Stunned when walking into room. Large, clean, wonderful. Front Desk guided us to the city centre to begin our 1/2 day tour. Finished that and returned for a much needed snooze. Advice on what to do and where to be Friday evening. Assistance on a bus tour of Dublin Saturday. The MOST AMAZING pool in the basement. Walked along Canal and such Saturday evening. Canal Days Sunday. Shown a route to take to AVIVA for the match Sunday evening. Ate at the hotel restaurant Sunday after the returning from Football. Travelled home Monday. Simple check-out.A TERRIFIC HOTEL
title: IRELAND v URUGUAY Friendly

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Easily my best hotel stay ever! The staff (especially Derek Burke) was so welcoming and friendly! Definitely recommend based on my experience! The bar has amazing food and drinks and the rooms are beautiful.
title: Amazing!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Stayed five nights with my wife during a Professional Nursing Research Conference. Hotel public areas and room very clean and comfortable. Was a bit hectic with many conference attendees checking in at same time. Hotel is in Docklands area but has restaurants, pubs etc within short walk. EPIC Museum a short walk. Property is a good 15-20 minute walk from city center, Temple Bar area, Trinity College. Bed very comfortable, restaurants and bar all good but I would rate breakfast buffet as average at best. Noise level a problem in our room (late night guests or ?). I cannot compare to other hotels in Dublin but I would suggest review of a wide variety of Dublin hotels prior to booking to get a sense of other properties.
title: Decent Hotel Away from City Center

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Clayton Cardiff Hotel. It is a great location on Sir John Rogerson's Quay near the theatre. Walkable to good restaurants. The hotel offers a nice restaurant with good breakfast buffet and gourmet dinner options. Clean rooms, good in-house health and fitness center. The staff is friendly and responsive. I lost an item and honest, customer-focused staff returned it to me promptly.
title: Elegant, upscale hotel with great amenities

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: My mother and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel during our visit to Dublin. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful from the bar supervisor Ivan to the ever so helpful customer service director Derek Burke. I would highly recommend it!
title: Wonderful Hotel

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Stayed there two weeks ago. Hotel lobby was nice and staff friendly. Besides the breakfast buffet when it opens no where to get coffee in the lobby. Rooms were just average and very hot. No air conditioning. Make sure you order a fan from the front desk. Breakfast buffet was also just average. Just like you get back here in the states at most places. They say its a short walk to the city center area but it took us about 25 minutes to get there. Not sure I would walk back by myself after dark along the river. It was our anniversary and the hotel left a card in our room saying happy anniversary and enjoy these chocolates. Funny thing is there were no chocolates left in the room.
title: average hotel

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Visited Dublin for a short family stay to go to an event at the Aviva stadium. From the moment we walked through the door of the hotel right up until we checked out the staff and facilities were fabulous. Every member of staff we encountered was polite and courteous and could not have done enough for us, nothing was too much hassle. Even on returning from the stadium along with quite a few other guests quite late in the evening staff were fantastic and very helpful even though evidently very busy. Our room was spotless and very comfortable. Food was excellent and lots to choose from. I will definitely be returning to Clayton Cardiff Lane on my next visit to Dublin. My only complaint is I didn't stay for longer.
title: Great stay

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Really friendly staff and a wonderful atmosphere at this Clayton Hotel. Within walking distance of everything I needed, going to the Aviva Stadium took me 15 minutes, heading into town for shopping took 15 mins.... Loved this spot and the food was fabulous.Deserves to be a 5* never mind a 4*!!! I'll be back!!!
title: Clayton is perfect for everything!!!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: located near downtown, walking distance to local attractions, large comfortable rooms, excellent food with a wide selection for breakfast, lunch and dinner.Pool was a perfect size for our 7 year old daughter, not too shallow or too deep
title: great location, clean and comfortable room. Excellent food and service

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I love this club. I have been going here for the last 5 months and i cant speak highly enough about it. You are always welcomed with a big smile and friendly chat. The staff are always on hand to help, especially clodagh. The pool is the perfect place to relax and unwind.
title: great staff in pool

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We had a lovely relaxing stay at the Clayton Hotel. The staff were very helpful, room was lovely, very clean and spacious.We were greeted by complimentary fruit and chocolates in our room! Breakfast was delicious, great variety of food.
title: Ann Madden

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The Clayton is in a great location near the river, our favorite pubs and restaurants are within 15-20 minute walk (O'Donohues, Bruxells, Mc Daids, Keoghs all about 20 minutes), friendly staff and management, rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious. Would definitely stay here again!! Oh, and they have room service!!
title: Quick city cenetr visit

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I would like to say what a fantastic Hotel this is. I am a member for the gym for the past 6 or 7 years, and I have nothing but god things to say abut the staff and facilities, everyone is so welcoming and accommodating especially receptionists Sarah and Andrada. The classes are great and intense, and the jacuzi is lovely.The Gym is also great at organising social nights out all year round.
title: Gym

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: My family room was grand and accommodating, spacious, the staff were very helpful and warm. the central location was a bonus and within reach. my daughter enjoyed the pool whilst i enjoyed the full use of the gym. the only downside is the construction next door to the hotel but then the windows shut off the noise.
title: Great Location for short family stay and lovely staff

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Really impressed with this city centre hotel walking distance to most city centre attractions . Reception staff very friendly and informative . Breakfast only which was delicious and again staff very attentative. Room was spacious and very clean . Gym/spa/pool facilities first class and again staff were Great. Highly recommend staying and will definitely be back
title: Trip

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: While traveling in Dublin we stayed here for one night. The place was a few blocks from Trinity college and about a ten minute walk to Temple Bar area. Nice hotel with restaurant and bar located inside. Clean room and modern hotel.
title: Just steps from major attractions

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Arrived at the hotel on Wednesday afternoon, I was standing in front of the reception with my child and waiting for check-in for at least 10 mins. The staff seemed very busy and had no time for greeting at all. I even had to say excuse me to get the attention from a member of staff even there's no one queue in front of me. Everything was fine until I checked-out next day, I said to the receptionist please book a taxi for me from Hotel to Dublina, guess what he replied, he said: just walk!I was literally stunned by his reply at the moment - none of any member of staff at the reception in four star hotels would be like this rude and unprofessional. I had to mention again I need a taxi from hotel to Dublina, he just realised his attitude is not suitable of what he said to a guest, then he quickly changed his way of saying and advised there were few taxis outside that we can hire.Thank you for letting me to have my taxi at the end, could managers please train up your staff at the reception?
title: Good location but don't feel welcomed as a leisure traveller

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: I am a member over a year now and my experience what a gym is really good.The staff is always helpful and friendly and always ready to help. The gym has a good set up. 2 months ago l decided to get a PT to help me achieve my goals. So I ask for Jakub Gaworas. HI made me a working plan and also training with him at the gym. After a month and a half l saw great results in me with his program. I highly recommend Jakub and the Club Vitae to everybody.
title: Gym

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Absolutely amazing hotel! Nothing was too much trouble and got great recommendations from the staff for nights out, cocktail bars and restaurant choices. Also enjoyed a manicure in the spa located within the hotel and couldn't be happier. For people going for the nightlife, the bar also has great deals for cocktails... and they do the trick!1000% would return, great place!
title: Loved it!!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The hotel was very clean which is always a plus. The staff was friendly yet curt at the same time. Just very efficient and businesslike and not very warm. The beds were hard. The food was expensive. They processed room assignments by first to check-in is first to get a room. I found this very odd given that the person ahead of you in line could be out on the town for hours while you sit in the lobby waiting for the next available room. The hotel was in a central enough location to allow for walking everywhere but if you aren't a big walker then you would want a taxi, which at times you have to call as there isn't a cue outside all of the time. I would stay here again if I couldn't find something better.
title: Been to worse, been to better

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The staff was so friendly and the room was lovely. It was in the business district but there was still a double decker bus stop for touring. The breakfast bffet even satisfied my kids! I would recommend the hotel.
title: Lovely stay

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This was my first trip to The Clayton Hotel, and I was very impressed from the moment I walked into the lobby. I knew that I was going to have a great stay and I was right. The bedroom was on the 7th floor and was stunning, comfortable and spacious. The beds were comfy and big. We ate in the Vertigo bar the 2 nights and the food was amazing. The breakfast was lovely and had plenty of choices of fruit, cereal, fry, bread, juice and toast. I had a very enjoyably stay and will definitely be back. Thanks to all the staff that took care of us, from repection to leisure center and all in between, especially Erika who organized our stay. I'll be back.
title: Shopping trip

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: This restaurant is situation in the Clayton Hotel opposite the Bord Gais Theatre and offers a pre theatre menu. That's where the conveniences end! Apart from one efficient waiter, the service was slow and disorganised, there appeared to be a total lack of communication among the six or seven members of staff who came to our table over the course of almost two hours. A group of work colleagues, all ladies, arrived for our reservation before 5.30pm for a much anticipated evening out. This was the third visit for some of the group. 20 minutes later the Manager noticed that we were still sitting waiting for service and was most apologetic. He gave us two bottles of Prosecco which were very welcome although given the heat of the room we would also have appreciated the jugs of water we'd asked for on arrival (they arrived at around 6.30). An hour after arrival we finally got starters and drinks and it was close to an hour and a half by the time we got our main courses. At 7.10 we had to make the decision to cancel the rest of the order and leave for the theatre. For those who had decided to skip the starter and enjoy dessert, this was a big disappointment. The icing on the cake however was when the Manager ran out onto the street after us and accused us of not fixing up the bill, despite the fact that we had paid his colleague in cash and left a €30 tip (this was an act of convenient mathamatics and not a reflection of the service provided!). He then offered all sorts of future compensation but I for one will never return to the Clayton Hotel, life is too short to willingly repeat mistakes. And while we were given the Prosecco and a discount off the bill for our inconvenience, it was never about freebies or prices, good management should realise that. As for the food, it's difficult to comment, it took second place behind all the other chaos. However I can say that the croquettes were delicious although a little cool for my taste (this could have been again due to the serving staff and not a reflection on the chef), the risotto was delicious. So, if you don't have any other plans perhaps give the food a try but expect to wait, and wait for it.
title: Stir Restaurant Pre Theatre Chaos!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The staff at the hotel were very friendly to my children and I along with our friends who were also travelling with us. The hotel was booked well in advance and although I was given the disabled room I had requested for my friend, this was quickly dealt with. My daughter needs to have some medication stored in a fridge and the staff were kind enough to have a mini fridge delivered to my room on the second day to stop me having to constantly run down to reception for it and the food she required for attending the Riverdance Summer School. The restaurant staff were very friendly and my son made friends with the Restaurant Manager. All staff were helpful ensuring our food was cooked correctly and that we were happy with it. The Club Vitae was open to us as guests and the pool although only 22 metres long was adequate for my son to practice his swimming. The gym facilities looked good although we did not use them. The only gripe I had was when I wanted to book an additional room for the Saturday night, the room rate quoted was very expensive and I felt they could have taken into account the 6 nights we had already booked and paid for. Car parking is available at a secure public car park a 5 minute walk away and a discount ticket is available from the hotel reception however like all car parks in Dublin, it was quite expensive.
title: Very helpful and friendly staff

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The staff was ok, the room was clean and the bed comfortable but nothing in my 3 days experience was above average. The room looks old, the design is not great, the view is non-existing. The location is great if you have business at Google or Facebook but is quite a walk away from the tourist center.
title: Nothing out of the ordinary.

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: 1 Double and 1 Single Bed in the room, pleanty of space to move about, tea coffee and kettle, Iron& board bath, hair dryer , Good Breakfast , very clean , Most of all GOOD FRIENDLY STAFF ALL OVER THE HOTEL.
title: Faultless .

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: Had a fantastic time here, we were upgraded on arrival by the very welcoming receptionist! Derek, one of the managers was great for welcoming guests, recommending restaurants and making sure everyone was looked after! Will definitely stay here again!
title: Fantastic!

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: The hotel is centrally located with easy access to the city, there are bus routes nearby.The rooms are comfortable, however there is no air conditioning which made for an uncomfortable environment as it was quite hot on the night I stayed. If you wan a comfortable pillow bring your own as the ones supplied were flat and lumpy.The staff were friendly and helpful regarding local venues. The check in and check out process was quick.I did not eat in the restaurant as there are many local restaurants serving awesome seafood.Not sure about views my room overlooked a concrete courtyard.
title: short beak

hotelLocation: Cardiff Lane, Sir John Rogerson's Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland
review: We based ourselves here for 3 nights during our stay in the city and the although not right in the centre, it is only a short walk away. Check in (and out) was efficient and without any fuss. The family room we occupied was huge with everything you need there including a basic ironing board and iron and tea/coffee making facilities. What sold it for us was the quiet and relaxing atmosphere. There was very little noise from other guests on our 4th floor room but some from the street (to be expected ). We didn't eat in the restaurant or use the pool so can't comment but cheap eats are available just around the corner (see Munchies review). Parking is available nearby but it is expensive, eye wateringly so! After unloading the luggage, I put the car in the Connolly train station car park. OK, it's about half a mile north from the hotel but at €9.50 per 24 hours, it's great value and safe. On the walk there, you'll see lots of other places to eat and even nearer in the square off Misery Street behind the Bord Gais Theatre, are more restaurants and cafes. The Clayton is a comfortable, modern hotel and we would be happy to stay again.
title: Quiet, comfortable and well placed

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: We recently revisited this superb hotel which is just a 15 minute walk to Grafton Street.The check in was simple and having a car park was great. Our room was very spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was very plentiful and the service was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel and I look forward to returning here.
title: Superb Hotel

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Quiet, understated, superbly located lodging with warm and gracious staff. The perfect dawn reception following a trans-Atlantic flight. A short walk across the canal to parks (aka squares), shopping, St.Pats and Trinity College. Just lovely!
title: Lovely Welcome to Dublin

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: My wife and I are enjoying our stay at the Mespil. The rooms are clean and well kept. Breakfast was quite good, offering a really nice variety of hot and cold items. The equipment in the gym was new and well maintained. Also a very reasonable walk (10 min or so) to City Centre. There are good restaurants right around the hotel too. Thanks!
title: Great hotel, nice location

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: I lived in the Baggot St area 15 years ago so when I came back I wanted somewhere close to the city centre where my wife and I could get to by walking, the Mespil is the perfect place to stay. In a lovely part of Dublin, the hotel is clean, spacious, very central and has very friendly staff, the free parking is a real bonus, but breakfast is a little pricy, so we got coffee and a breakfast roll nearby for a lot less. Overall it's a lovely hotel and is recommended for a stay in Dublin for 1 night or more.
title: Great location

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Arrived after a cramped, cold, trans Atlantic flight to be warmly greeted and told our room was available at 10 am! Excellent staff, quiet, well appointed rooms and a lovely walkable neighborhood with a wide range of restaurants, pubs and parks. Within walking distance of St. Stephens Green, city centre, and Trinity College. Highly recommend and will stay here again!
title: A Jewel of a Hotel

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: The Mespil hotel, Dublin was an excellent hotel but we were charged twice for the room so beware, keep an eye on your credit card account. Also the due to a bank holiday in Ireland the accounts department phone was not being answered, just a recorded message about how nice it was to stay at the Mespil Hotel then silence, tried twice, two international calls before trying the front desk and getting thing sorted, hopefully.
title: Charged Twice for Room

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Lovely hotel, has been updated lately, lovely furnishings, bright and spacious. Rooms clean and check-in was efficient, breakfast is buffet style- tea/ coffee and toast served. Breakfast area is bright and staff are friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend- very good location for Dublin. Perhaps only draw-back could be parking, we've been lucky every time we've stayed - (early afternoon check-in) to get parking at back of hotel however not sure if there is a lot of parking in this car park or if you would have to pay for parking close-by.
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Mespil proved to be a nice hotel while on our Trafalgar tour. We have nothing to fault with Mespil: rooms were comfortable, clean and our breakfasts were tasty. The location is OK to downtown Dublin. We don't mind walking so the 20 minute trek to Temple Bar wasn't bad. A working canal is between the hotel and the city.
title: Very nice--clean

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Lovely hotel in good location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was a good size and breakfast good. The only negative was the fact that there is no air conditioning in the room and it was very hot once the sun came up in the mornings. Our room was also very noisy each morning with bin lorries just below ... we had to have the windows open due to heat.
title: Nice hotel, good location.

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Really nice place near the Grand Canal, welcoming staff team and good dinner, my room was nice and quiet, but odd as it had 3 beds! Nice breakfast also. Would recommend good for business or leisure, didn't get chance to try the gym
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: For visiting Golfers this hotel is very good .Hotel parking for hired car, close to pubs and shops .Great service, friendly staff and extremely helpful reception staff.One warning -no tucker after 9pm.
title: Great Hotel

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Nicely presented hotel near to a canal. Comfortable rooms. Very clean. Nice walk in shower. 20 mins walk to the Bord Gais Energy Theatre and 10 mins to the National Gallery. Food in the bar was OK - not great. Breakfast was good but not exactly 'plentiful'. Staff were very pleasant. Easy to park. One of the better hotels I have stayed at in Dublin.
title: Good location

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Triple family room Very spacious, three full single beds which is a treat as many hotels provide a sofa bed for the third guest Very clean Good quiet nights rest Left hotel too early to have breakfast In a quiet area with plenty of choice to eat and relax
title: Overnight stay (1st night of Europe touring holiday by train)

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: I stayed in June for a week while on business. Great place very clean and the staff were really lovely and helpful. I would recommend but be aware no air conditioning in rooms only a fan which I am sure is ok bit we were there when it has really hot. Breakfast had alot of options and very good.
title: Very clean and nice place

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: We stayed at the Mespil Hotel for one leg of our Honeymoon. The room was very old and out dated but was clean. We happened to be in Dublin during some very warm temperatures and the room did not have an air conditioner. Staff were pleasant and overall experience was good.
title: Old but clean

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Stayed here recently with friends. Hotel is much bigger than expected and the rooms were spacious enough although not overly plush. The bar area was however beautifully decorated and was extremely easy to relax in. The Guinness was perfect and the staff were attentive. Located a short taxi ride costing about 10 Euro from the city centre I can recommend this hotel as a place to explore Dublin.
title: Nice hotel

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Hotel had large rooms with good sized bathrooms. There was no A/C but hotel provided fans and the nights were cool for sleeping. Their web site says they are air conditioning some rooms but when I asked I was told that this is not happening as yet. It was unusually warm when we were there - 28C.Food was very good and the staff friendly and helpful. Were only about 30min from some of the downtown sites and they give you a map which is easy to follow.
title: Comfortable hotel

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: It's a beautiful location, right on the canal and close to downtown, but not TOO close. The staff were very courteous and efficient. We got to Ireland quite early after a long flight from Canada, and the young man at the front desk had the housekeeping staff get our room ready within an hour, despite the fact that we showed up about 5 hours before check-in! They also helped us figure out just which bus to take to get downtown. The room was comfortable and clean, and there are several lovely dinner places within walking distance from the hotel. If I ever make it to Dublin again, I would absolutely stay here again!
title: Excellent service

hotelLocation: 50 - 60 Mespil Road, Dublin D04 E7N2, Ireland
review: Wife and I stayed here three nights; the room was spacious, and the bathroom was large as well. Great location right next to the canal with walking trails. Service was also exceptional; free access to business center was great for us to print tickets to attractions and boarding passes. The hotel also set up our taxi ride to the airport for a flat rate of 30 euros. If I'm ever back in Dublin, I'd stay here again.
title: Great Hotel

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Location is excellent as the Luas stop is directly outside the door. The hotel is just off O'Connell St, ideal for shopping, sight seeing or business. The hotel is in existence since 1845 and retains many of its old world qualities. Its an ideal central location for social or business meetings. The double room was quiet and peaceful with a good shower and tea making facilities. The bar food was very good and good value. A most enjoyable stay.
title: Old World Hotel in the centre of Dublin City

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: We stayed here for 2 nights in July - comfortable, friendly staff, good location. However, since there is no AC we had our windows open and I had to use earplugs for sleeping - our room faced the main street and there is a light rail train that stops right in front of the hotel. Breakfast was included which consisted of a continental breakfast AND order off the menu. We had to try the full Irish breakfast one of those days. They seem to be short staffed as we had to wait for a table to be cleaned both days. This seems to be a popular hotel for tour buses with older clientele. We are in our early 50's and we were the youngest people in the lounge one evening. It was our most expensive stay in Ireland but all hotels in Dublin seem to be pricey.
title: Noisy and older clientele

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: Wynn's Hotel never fails to please. This historic hotel is steeped in Irish history, yet the updated rooms are very comfortable. The breakfast which was unremarkable before has been revamped to a delicious spread. The fresh squeezed orange juice is delicious! The staff remember us from visit to visit and it certainly feels like a home away form home. A safe, comfortable, gracious place to stay in Dublin.
title: Lovely historic hotel wih excellent service and staff

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: We recently stayed at the Wynn's Hotel and we were very pleased. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was clean and comfortable. The free breakfast was delicious and there was lots to choose from- both hot and cold items were available.
title: "Great hotel with excellent staff!"

hotelLocation: 35-39 Lwr Abbey Street, Dublin D1, Ireland
review: from the moment we entered this grand old building we were welcomed efficiently by the reception staff the breakfast was 5 star in a beautiful dining area the room was small and had a musky smell i think due to the age the location was perfect in walking distance to everywhere which you need as the traffic in the city was pretty hectic however tram stop right out front i would definitely stay again
title: OLD AND QUIANT

review: A very nice hotel. Comfortable beds are important to us, and the bed was wonderful. They even had king size bed for us (we had to arrange for this ahead). The location is prime, centrally located, close to what we wanted to experience in Dublin. I would highly recommend Jurys Inn. It was a great stay.
title: Great place to stay for a Dublin experience

review: great location! warm room, needed add'l bathroom amenities and towels/pillows. bar area was nice to relax in after a busy day in the city. we didn't care for our room location because it overlooked the dumpster of the apartments nearby.
title: Our stay at Jurys Inn Dublin Christchurch in July 2017

review: Love staying here when I visit dublin. Great staff. Comfortable hotel rooms and great location . I did notice that toiletries were very sparce this time. Shampoo and soap provided- but call to reception if you need shower caps ? Surely cut backs should result in lower prices? Not so I'm afraid. Breakfast has improved I think. Fresh bread and hot food even for latecomers.  What really disappointed me this time was the bar food. We were in a hurry and just asked for sandwich and some chicken wings. The sandwich was smothered with mustard and arrived in a box with no garnish whatsoever. The chicken wings were inedible I'm afraid. No taste at all. So pale I wondered if they were cooked right through. The batter they used had no seasoning and tasted of cardboard.no taste on chicken either. Blue cheese dip was not pleasant. Very expensive too. Not a very good impression for our tourists. Really ought to step up and offer a bit more. Great hotel otherwise.
title: Good as ever - food a total disappointment

review: We really. Enjoyed our visit here. Pros include cleanliness, comfort, and convenient location near many attractions and hop on hop off tours. We also liked that we could buy bottled can water for our day at the front desk. Cons include the cost of parking the rental car in the nearby lot, view of the alley from some rooms.
title: Great location!

review: The hotel was recommended by a friend and confirmed all we expected. The location is wonderfull, opposite Christchurch Cathedral and within walking distance of most of the main attractions of Dublin. The staff was friendly throughout, the room spacious and very clean, the breakfast plentiful and of excellent quality. A strong recommendation if you want to stay in the centre of Dublin!
title: Wonderful hotel in a great location

review: Here for a very short stay to see U2 so the hotel availability was slim. Chose Jurys Inn out of remaining options because of location. Never been to Dublin before so this was a very good spot to start from. Staff was very friendly and the beds were comfortable. Overall, a little tired, a little expensive (it was U2 weekend), a little surprise with a dirty toilet when we got to our room, but a reasonable place to stay when you are looking for somewhere just to rest your head after a long day.
title: It'll do . . . .

review: Hotel well situated in the heart of Dublin and close to the nightlife of Temple Bar. I found the hotel itself to be a little tired with signs of wear & tear in some of the public areas. Having said that the bedroom was more then adequate with a good selection of both hot & cold food for breakfast, and hotel itself was very clean. Large tight car park to the rear which if staying at the hotel you get a discount on the cost.
title: Short Business Trip

review: This hotel was adequate for a one night stop on a recent visit to Dublin. Apart from a great location, there are limited amenities throughout. Although my room was a bit small, it was clean, with a comfortable bed and free wifi.
title: Basic but great location

review: The hotel is in a great location close to the buzzing Temple Bar area. Walking to the main attractions such as Trinity College, Grafton Street, O'Connell Street etc was easy from the hotel.Staff were very friendly and helpful with all our questions. The hotel is across from the Christchurch Cathedral which is beautiful view from the rooms at the from of the hotel. Breakfast was plentiful with a lot of choices and perfect to start the day. I would definitely stay here again and I would recommend this hotel if you come to Dublin.
title: A break in Dublin City

review: I cannot in good faith recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in the area. Our room was dirty, the floor was not vacuumed so there was hair all over the floor. There were stains on the wall. Our bathroom was dirty: moldy and a moldy shower curtain.
title: Dirty, tired old hotel

review: We have now visited many different Jury's Inns throughout the UK and our stay in Dublin at the Christchurch site was just what we expected it to be. From the efficient signing in process through to cleanliness of the room, the politeness of staff through to an excellent choice at the breakfast bar everything was just as we would have wanted it to be. The hotel is close to many main visitor attractions and is but a short walk down to the main shopping streets and even closer to the evening entertainment. A great place to stay to enjoy the people and sights of Dublin.
title: Another excellent visit to a Jury's Inn

review: Staff was friendly, but the room or condition looked nothing like the photos. If this was a $70 a night room that I booked for my family, I would say I got what I paid for - not for the $250+ a night I was charged.
title: Not what it appears to be.

review: 8 of us Stayed here for 2 nights at the weekend, we had 4 rooms and everyone had a lovely time. Rooms were lovely, they were clean with complimentary toiletries. Breakfast was €11 pp and was very nice, a good selection of food. The hotel is very central to temple bar area, only a 10 minute walk. Taxi rank is located right outside also, 5 minute walk to the 757 bus stop which takes you directly to the airport. Only disappointment was that we arrived at 1.30pm and asked if our rooms were ready (check in was a 2.30pm). There was 1 room ready, as we were early we didn't mind. We all went to the one room and half of us got changed and made he decision just to wait until half 2 for the other rooms (the lady behind the desk did say she may have them ready earlier). At quarter past 2 we went back down to check if they were ready, same lady said they weren't and they would have it ready at 3pm at the latest. Went back at 3 and they still weren't ready, after complaining they had 3 rooms ready for us within 10 minutes. We just felt we had a wasted a couple of hours waiting about, afterward we wished we had just left our bags and went out. Overall, I would stay here again for anyone thinking of booking.
title: Hen weekend

review: We stayed here our last night of our 8 night trip to Ireland and wished we had stayed here more nights. Convenient location, easy parking, comfortable beds, clean rooms and bathrooms, and friendly, helpful staff.
title: Comfortable and Great Location

review: Stay at this hotel if you need a clean room in a good location but it doesn't offer much else. Great location next to Christ Church, Dublinia Museum and Temple Bar area. Near Hop On-Off bus stops. Hotel had a very limited lounge/common area (aside from bar and restaurant). Breakfast was good but food quality in restaurant for dinner was poor. No fitness center. Staff was not very friendly and most seemed like they didn't like their job. Rooms were standard and clean. Overall, we just didn't find the hotel very inviting and comfortable...as a family we just didn't want to hang out there.
title: Great location but limited amenities

review: Our family stayed here for two nights at the tail end of a 2-week trip around Ireland. It was exactly as described--rooms are clean and modern, the staff is very friendly and accommodating, and the location can't be beat--directly across from Christchurch Cathedral, walking distance to Temple Bar, Trinity College, and many tourist areas! The room was small but comfortable. We did not eat in the restaurant or bar except for the included breakfast, which was fresh and convenient. We would stay here again.
title: Contemporary hotel in an ideal location for Dublin attractions

review: Arrived to find that 2 executive rooms which were booked were unavailable......but were 2 offered two double rooms at a discount and included breakfast in the deal......one of rooms was unavailable for at least half an hour but this did not prove to be a problem.....half an hour in the bar!!!With the amount of time spent in the rooms it was a win win deal! Would highly recommend this hotel
title: Stayed during Coldplay concert

review: Great service from the Front Desk! We arrived very early in the morning after being awake all night and we were checked in right away. Our room overlooked Christchurch Cathedral -- this hotel is in a great location to walk almost everywhere in Dublin. The only thing I would mention is that, although we were three booked into the room we were given towels for two on more than one night and had to chase down an extra set. Otherwise we were very pleased.
title: 8 Nights in Dublin

review: Our room was not ready when we arrived Dublin so we went out sight-seeing,lunch, pubs, dinner, and more pubs. We walked everywherel. We did not check in until 2:00 a.m. We over slept and ended up checking out late at 1:30. Reception was very understanding and courteous. Ask for a room with a view! Christ Church is across the street.
title: Great location and service!

review: We had a lovely 5 day stay at Dublin - Jury's Inn Christchurch. My boyfriend and I wanted to book a nice trip away for New Year to have a special closure for 2016 and beginning for 2017. Hotel is very central.. if you don't mind a little walk.. the hotel is within walking distance of the temple bar street(with the famous temple bar).. Guinness storehouse, Kilmainham Goal, Penny bridge,... etc. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms have everything you want/need. To my opinion they offer real comfort with an ironing board/tea service,.. We had a room with a view towards the Christenchurch which was a big pro.  Only thing I missed was a little mini bar. I do want to point out that most hotels who provide breakfast have a small offer. But here it was a big breakfast with a lot of variety. And normally I don't speak very highly about breakfast because I do love my breakfast and it's not easily to please me with that but this one just ticked all the boxes. Everything is also very clean and hygienic. Furthermore I also would definitely recommend to visit O'Neills bar and Elephant & Castle restaurant. O'Neills bar is a perfect typical Irish pub with live music.. typical Irish dancing and they have a food buffet bar with great food and a variety of beers available. I had the best chicken wings at Elephant & Castle ever. Never ever did I have such good wings. Try them both out!! I can't stress enough about how good our trip was and the hotel is just sublime for a 5 day getaway. You won't regret it.
title: Lovely New Years' eve getaway

review: I would definately recommend this hotel. Myself and three cousins stayed there and we were very impressed for the money we paid. Clean room. Cleaning staff were lovely and friendly and alway wanting to please. How can you not leave them a little something! ;)Breakfast fantastic and looked after my Coleiac need well. I would always go back for the right price. Also wel positioned for seeing the sights and experiencing the culture
title: Staff Friendly and keen to help. Nice and clean rooms

review: My husband and I stayed here last night (14th July) while attending a concert in the Iveagh Gardens. Check in and out was friendly and efficient, the hotel foyer is very pleasant and the fruit infused water is a lovely touch. It's really well situated as a base to see Dublin and close to some lovely bars and restaurants. Our room was clean and relatively quiet for city centre. We were very happy with our stay and we would definitely use this hotel again.
title: Short but sweet visit

review: This was my first visit to Dublin and my first stay at a Jurys Inn hotel. The location was great for us. It was a short walk from the Christchurch location to Trinity College, St. Stephen's Green, St. Patrick's Cathedral, and the Temple Bar. The Guinness Storehouse was less than a mile away. We enjoyed dinner at the steak restaurant across the street from the hotel.I thought the Jurys Inns was a great value. It appeared that most of the guests were, like us, holiday travelers. The room was clean and comfortable, but modest in size. The breakfast buffet had a variety of hot and cold offerings, all of good quality and well presented. I was especially pleased with the attentiveness of the staff in helping solve a problem that had arisen during the stay. They were helpful, with a genuine customer focus. I was favorably impressed.
title: Great value in Dublin City Centre area.

review: This hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and it was central to all the restaurants and entertainment areas. The view out of my window was stunning of Christ Church Cathedral. I really didn't want for anything.
title: Jurys Inn provided a great home away from home in Dublin

review: Great spot in Dublin in the middle of Temple Bar and the Guinness Factory (all within walking distance). Clean, staff is very friendly. Tub is a bit high for older folks (65+ give or take). Fabulous!!
title: Great Spot in Dublin

review: We had the executive rooms on the 5th floor.The rooms were not big but were adequate and clean. The beds and bedding were comfy. Our rooms were facing the street so I was worried about noise but we were high up enough that it was not a problem. The church bells opposite the hotel however do ring but it did not bother us. Breakfast was great. A full buffet Irish breakfast with lots of healthy options, fruit, smoothies and porridge too. The only issue was lack of air conditioning, as Dublin was unusually hot during our stay.I would book again.
title: Good hotel & great breakfast!

review: Friendly, efficient, clean. Great breakfasts. Good location - close to Temple Bar area, Guinness Storeroom and city attractions & cultural experiences. The restaurant menu looked good and was competitively priced.
title: What more could we want?

review: Great location for walking around. Staff was wonderful. Rooms are spacious and clean. If booking in summer be aware there is no AC. They do have fans and the windows open so didn't get too warm. However, we had a room facing Christchurch and with the window is open we heard the church bells all night. I highly recommend the hotel but if booking for the summer I recommend a room not facing the church.
title: Great Location

review: On a trip with my mom and sisters and we stayed here for 3 nights because of the location and good reviews.
