Staff were friendly, breakfast was good, rooms were clean (though a bit small), price was good and the location really was fantastic. Walking distance to temple bar and other touristy areas and bus stops right outside the hotel. My room had views of Christchurch which was just lovely though a bit noisy at night from cars and people in the streets. With a very clean room, updated bathroom and a nice breeze through our window, we were very comfortable. The others in our group were in a triple but they felt very squished and thought their room was a bit stuffy. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.
title: Clean hotel, friendly staff, great location

review: Arrived to the hotel and there was some confusion with our reservation. A quick phone call and it was cleared up. The registration staff was attentive and helpful to get us checked in. Got to our romm and we wwere set.This hotel is close to a lot of attractions and historic sites. Walking distance to Trinity College where the Book of Kels is housed and The Brazen Head (Ireland's Oldest Pub).Staff was helpful in directing us which way to go and about how long it would take. And after your walks, upon return to the hotel, there was a fruit flavored water dispenser which tasted awesome to quench your thirst.This was a great place to stay in Dublin.
title: Convenient Location and Great Service

review: I am very proud of my experience in Jury's Inn Dublin. I never stay in hotels and my interactions here were exceptional. Thank you to the staff for making it extra special for me. Cheers, slainte, thanks
title: Kyle USA

review: We stayed at Jury's Inn Dublin recently. The room was excellent, clean and very comfortable. Breakfast was good, although we followed the traffic light system but still managed to go when the restaurant was extremely busy and the food needed replenishing - so a bit of a wait. Food and service in the bar area was great. The staff at reception were friendly and efficient. This hotel was good value for money and is in a very convenient location for a walk around Dublin City centre.
title: Convenient location

review: Perfect hotel - even for 3 person in 2 person room! Quiet room, great and friendly staff, great location! Maybe a little bit too full breakfast room... and maybe a little too soft pillow on bed - terrible :) :) We've been many times in so called 4 star hotels but I think this 3 star hotel is one of the best where we have ever been. We are absolutely coming again!
title: Absolutely Great Stay!

review: Beautiful place and good service, good stuff Nice room, beautiful unbelievable view from the Windows Very Good location, near some minutes from the center of DublinNear Christian church and Dublinia and other famous places
title: Beautiful place And good service

review: Service was excellent. Great location. Plenty to see and do. People were very friendly and happy to help. I would stay there again and recommend to friends and family traveling to Dublin. Room was very clean.
title: Jury's Inn Christchurch Dublin

review: WE love this hotel, its quietness, its closeness to Historicl buildings, its cleanliness, its modernity, the room was amazing: the view, the comfort, very cosy clean, so was the bathroom . The staff was very lovely, we felt at home!!!!!
title: A DREAM COME TRUE!

review: great location ,good service, hotel clean and very comfortable beds but room hot only had a fan and window restrictors on windows provided hardley ventilation ,next time i would book some other hotel with air con .
title: great location

review: Excellent well-maintained facility and helpful front desk staff. Great breakfast buffet.Perfect location for buses, taxis & restaurants. Near Dublin Castle, Smock Alley Theater & pubs.As the Cathedral bells are frequent, ask of a room that doesn't face the bell tower.
title: Excellent facility & staff

review: This hotel has one of the best locations in Dublin! We could walk almost anywhere or easily get on public transportation for more distant locations. We also had a car, and this hotel has one of the EASIEST parking places in all of Europe. (Yes, we have driven all over with sometimes disastrous results.) They also had a fabulous cleaning crew that respected our privacy while keeping our room very clean, and unlike most breakfast places they offered link sausages. I practically teared up upon seeing them--having been touring for almost a month and seeing only European bacon, which is nothing like American bacon. There were also plenty of healthy choices! The room had everything we needed except wash cloths and a fridge (dang Americans need a fridge). The desk was sometimes overwhelmed, and so no one called me when my laundry came back. I had been told it would be back at 7, waited until 7:30, went to the desk, and they produced it from a backroom immediately. Oh, I almost forgot! Our room had an amazing view of Christchurch (see pic)!
title: Best Location and Breakfast in Dublin

review: 2nd stay at a Jury's (1st being Parnell St nearby). Chosen because of location. Easily within walking distance to most things, but so is Parnell. Family room ended up being a bed and pull put sofa bed. I felt bad for the kiddos, as the sofa was awful. I would not choose this set up again for the price. Room was crowded and stuffy. No AC, but fan in room. Quiet on the backside but not much of a view. We did utilize luggage storage before check in and after checkout; that was a great amenity! If choosing again, I would go back to Parnell: not much further and a much nicer facility.
title: Great location!

review: My family & I stayed here twice on our recent trip. Both times they were very accommodating to our elderly member and helpful to us all. We had to arrange the rooms between 8 in our party! The staff was helpful in accommodating us all! The location is very close to the "hop on-hop off" buses as well as the public bus. Walkable to most major sites in Dublin city center. Directly across the street from Christchurch.
title: Great Hotel!

review: Friendly, helpful staff, great central location with most Dublin attractions in walking distance or taxis outside and bus stops close by, including airport bus. Clean, functional rooms, value for money! Excellent breakfast choice/quality. Would definitely recommend.
title: Great Dublin hotel

review: A very clean hotel with friendly, helpful staff and excellent attention to detail- even free waters and candy in the fridge. The location was perfect for touring the city by foot or bus. Recommend adding the optional breakfast buffet, it was very good.
title: Attention to detail

review: Nice hotel in a good location . Rooms are basic but that's all you need for a weekend away . The breakfast was lovely with plenty of choice . Dublin itself is sooo expensive a round of drinks for 4 was around €29 !
title: Good location

review: This was a really great location. It is only a block away from the Airlink 747 dropoff and pick up point and perfect for taking the public transportation. We had the top floor quad room and were really surprised that we got free bottled waters (sparkling and non) and a whole bunch of flavored Walker shortbread cookies (I did not know that they even came in other flavors!), KitKats and some killer hot chocolate. Sean at the front desk was super nice and showed me where the sites are on the map and was patient with me when I realized I didn't need the breakfast on all of the days of our stay. The breakfast was really good though. I was able to sleep very well as we were far enough away from the madness of Temple Bar. The bells of Christchurch were really awesome too. My only gripe is no AC...so we opened the windows.
title: Close to everything, but away from the madness of Temple Bar

review: Although the hotel needs a little refreshing, its location near Christchurch Cathedral puts it near most of the major attractions in Dublin. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was wonderful - a great way to start the day. But the thing that really made the stay a great one was the staff. They were very helpful and accommodating. Loved my stay there.
title: Great location, wonderful staff

review: Stayed one night while visiting for a concert, hotel is well located for the Temple bar area. Friendly front of house staff.Rooms are quiet, clean and tidy, nothing to stand out as exceptional or worth the price asked though. Room was average size, nice bathroom, plenty of tea and coffee, comfy bed, didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food, bar was good, good atmosphere.All in all just average for the price charged.
title: Great location - pricey hotel

review: The hotel is located on several bus routes so it's easy to get around the city. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and pleasant. The hotel is located near the temple area. There are lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Would recommend
title: Very good.

review: Took the kids to the Panto at the Olympia, this was the perfect location. Everything was fine, staff was fine, family room, plenty of space. However the family room stunk and my wife found an old sock at the foot of the bed, the bathroom however was so smelly didn't even bother with a shower before we went home. We took it to the managements attention, they did offer us a different room but would never have fit the 5 of us.
title: Perfect

review: Stayed here for 3 nights / 4 days and we couldn't fault any part of the hotel. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out every staff member was polite, courteous and very friendly. The receptionist Sharzazz in particular was very good at her job and nothing was too much trouble for her. She was very happy and friendly but also professional at the same time, she clearly knows the hotel industry inside out. The hotel itself was great, room was clean and tidy and towels were changed every day. Breakfast is a buffet with all the usual cereals, fried food, continentals etc. We didn't eat in the restaurant so canny comment on that. The hotel bar was priced reasonably compared to the pubs and bars in the city centre. A pint of Guinness was €5.20 from memory. One thing I thought was a nice touch was vending machines on each floor, perfect for those midnight snacks! We'll definitely stay at this hotel if we ever visit Dublin again
title: Lovely hotel, excellent staff

review: Ideally located but rooms rather tired with limited facilities not compatible with the price or in a modern European city. Bed/pillows uncomfortable, small tv with few channels, shower ordinary, bathroom congested
title: Tip top location, rather tired

review: Average hotel. No great amenities. Not a full service bar, and the restaurant food was average. However, we had a very nice room, with a great view of Christ Church, on a high floor. When the windows were closed, there was no street noise. But, the hotel is in need of sprucing up. It's looking tired. Good location though.
title: Not what we thought

review: We often travel to Dublin 3-4 times a year to drink, have a good time, top up our 'plastic Paddy' batteries on traditional music, craic and eat well. We immerse ourselves in Dublin's fantastic friendly culture, historical allure, sport or musical events. The city rarely disappoints.When staying here, we are usually worse for wear imbibing far too much of the local vitamin heavy stout, so I couldn't tell you what the breakfasts are like. The staff at check in provide a standard admin service. Rooms are just OK. Entire hotel needs a refresh soon to justify the massively hiked, event fuelled costs. Some fresh air wouldn't go a miss in the rooms either.Location is perfect for everything in Dublin. 5/10.
title: Perfect base for Dublin

review: The price was reasonable when considering it's in the down town area. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The staff at the front counter, breakfast area, and house keeping were all fantastic.Would definitely return when back in Ireland.
title: Great location for Dublin Attractions, Great Price.

review: The location of the hôtel is perfect. Just between Temple Bar and the Guinness storehouse. However you must try to speak an other language for the the foreign tourists . The real issue is the food at the Kitchen: expensive and not good.
title: Holidays in Dublin good but..........

review: We loved staying here. Our view of Christchurch was amazing and we loved hearing the bells. It's in an area where you can walk to bars, attractions and shopping. There are also plenty of restaurants. We also felt safe in this location. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I loved the fresh herb and fruit water they had out daily as a welcome.
title: Great location!!!

review: This hotel is in the best location. Once we arrived from the airport by bus we could walk anywhere in a relatively short time. Plenty of restaurants nearby to choose from too. The room was clean with nice view of a little garden. Staff was friendly and breakfast was terrific. They even made me my breakfast in the kitchen since I have celiac disease and was concerned about cross contamination at the buffet.
title: two nights in Dublin

review: Our trip to Dublin was very nice. The hotel was pretty good, the city is very nice, the weather was great and the U2 concert was extraordinary. We also went to Bray, Kiliney (where the beach is beautiful) and Dorkey (where we had great lunch at The Corner Note)
title: U2

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: Really nice rooms, love that we can open the windows and get fresh air. The staff was really nice and accommodating. Its perfect to have a pub connected to the hotel where you can even charge the bill (at the pub) to your room. Only thing that was a little high price wise was the breakfast, but it was convent as heck, so we ate there each day.We will use the hotel when we are back in Dublin
title: Nice place, great place and has a good pub connected to the hotel

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: Arrived on Sunday morning at 0830 at was greeted by friendly professional staff. it was to early to check in so we were prepared to leave our bags there and look around dublin. while talking to the lady at the counter, I think it was the supervisor who came over and said there was a room available and we could check in straight away. After only two hours sleep this was excellent and little gestures like this would make us stay here again.the room itself was spacious, clean and very pleasant to stay in and the beds were comfy.Breakfast was excellent and the chef did a good job. overall an excellent hotel in a great location with excellent staff.would stay here again
title: Excellent stay

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: Lovely Dublin hotel in a good location in Dublin city centre. Pleasant bar and restaurant next door called The Gas works. Express restaurant in lobby. Very good Wi-Fi. Parking also available outside front of hotel
title: Pleasant

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: My dad and I stayed here in June for the Phil Collins concert in the Aviva. Both of us were very impressed by the hotel. The lobby was clean, modern and inviting upon arrival. Check-in was speedy and the reception staff were friendly and courteous. Our request of a twin room was met and the room was very spacious, clean and well appointed all round. If i had one niggle it would be that the bathroom was a little tired in comparison to the room itself. I cannot comment on The Gas Works bar. My dad and I headed down with the intention of having a pre-concert drink/food there but it was so busy we just couldn't be facilitated. Breakfast the next morning was very good and is certainly one of the better breakfasts I've had in a Dublin hotel. Overall I would certainly stay here again when in Dublin, and if you have a concert/event in the Aviva this is the place to stay as location-wise it cannot be beaten!
title: A great stay in the Grand Canal Hotel

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: I have stayed at the Grand Canal a number of nights over the past year and have been pleased each time. The rooms are clean, staff is very helpful and attentive and the breakfast buffet (or made to order) is excellent. The rooms are of average size and there is a comfortable chair and a desk chair in the room. There is no air conditioning but they did provide a fan when we requested. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path down by the Grand Canal but is less than a 10 min walk to St Stevens Sr or even less to Merrion Sq I like the location as it gives me a chance to walk and see Dublin vs coming out your door to a crowded scene like at some of the other more city center or Temple Bar locations. There is an attached bar which serves good pub fare and you can get a pint of Guinness or a local craft beer. The prices in the pub are reasonable and their is plenty of room for a group. I will continue to return to the Grand Canal when in Dublin and look forward to my next stay.
title: Great staff, rooms very nice and breakfast is incredible

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: Stayed here for 2 nights on a short visit to Dublin. Check in was smooth, with everything explained to us, staff were very courteous.Room was very spacious it had every thing including an espresso coffee maker also tea and instant coffee facilities ironing board and iron, terrific hair dryer, bath robes and a free digital safe.Both my wife and I thought the bed was really comfortable and we both had good nights sleep.Breakfast was good with everything you could ask for, full Irish or continental, cereals were plenty as were fruits etc.,Once again staff were courteous and more than helpful.Hotel was within easy access to all transport, buses and trains. The walk into town was a bit much for us as we are in our seventies so we took the train, a 5 min walk from hotel. It was only two stops and was well worth the €2.20 each to the busy and lively part of the city. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend.
title: Great 2 Night Stay

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: Clean, comfortable hotel while in Dublin for one night. Easy 15-20 minute walk to/from downtown. Full Irish breakfast in the morning was outstanding. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. The Old Schoolhouse restaurant/bar around the corner was one of the best dinners we had while in Ireland, and great atmosphere.
title: Great stay, good location

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: We stayed here as a last minute booking to see a concert in Dublin. Can't really fault it. There was a bit of mould on the bathroom celling so it could probably benefit with a lick of paint and a bathroom fan and there was water left in the coffee machine from the previous people. Fairly easy to get to but it's literally the only road in Dublin that buses don't go down but you can catch a bus or the dart within a ten min walk. Reception team were friendly and let us store our luggage before check in. Went to the Gasworks for drinks and food one of the evenings and it was reasonably priced and the staff were really friendly.
title: Quick trip

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: Very nice hotel, within easy reach of plenty of bars and restaurants. Close to Dart station and about 25 minutes walk from Connolly station.Rooms are well kitted out and comfortable. Nice coffee machine and mineral water included.Room rate did not include breakfast so we went out for brunch. Plenty of choice nearby.A little way out of the centre if you are staying for a few days and want to be in the heart of the action. However excellent for events at the theatres/ stadiums nearby.
title: Good location for 3 arena, Aviva, bord gais etc

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: A little way out of the centre but ideally suited to the Aviva (though I prefer The Pringle). I prefer to stay out of the hustle and bustle and you get far more for your money that way too. There's still plenty to see and do in this area and it's no more than a twenty minute walk to Grafton Street etc. Very clean, comfortable beds and tasteful decor. There's even a bar/nightclub beneath it though our room was peaceful when we stayed.
title: Excellent

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: Great time here what a bar great food and beer and especially great service....Irena is the best waitress ever as soon as we were at our table she had drinks in front of us brilliant and then we got unbelievable food it was amazing x
title: Class

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: This large hotel offers an excellent price for value ratio (probably one of the best on this side of the city).Very nice staff, good breakfast with table service for hot drinks and buffet for the rest. Pretty high standards in the bedroom and bathroom (I really liked their Orla Kiely soap, shampoo and body lotion). This hotel also offers a rather quick access to the city centre (20 min walk) or bus/train.Very appropriate for business trips (I have stayed there many times over the past year), maybe less for a romantic stay as this is mostly a business district.Only one issue: the restaurant downstairs is specialised in burgers and beers, not the ideal place if you're on a diet.
title: Favourite hotel this side of town for business

hotelLocation: Grand Canal Street Upper, Dublin Dublin 4, Ireland
review: Payed way too much for what we got. A little over 550 euros for four nights without breakfast. Location isn't too good either considering the price. Staff was friendly and helpful though. The cleaning was OK - could be better. And no minibar in the room. Will stay at another hotel for my next trip to Dublin.
title: Overpriced

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Very nice and super friendly staff. We had a concert at the stadium so it was perfect walking distance. The breakfast was a little crowded and they had run out of a few things but other than that it was great.
title: Very nice hotel

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Comfortable stay , gorgeous food would highly recommend , staff extremely friendly and accommodating! Very important to have friendly staff and these accomplished that!!! Hotel was well maintained and lovely to stay in overall
title: Lovely

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: We stayed in the skylon for 2 nights in July and had a lovely experience. We were very well looked after by the manager Colette who made our stay even better than expected. The hotel was really easy to get to from M50 and also only a 10 minute bus ride into the city or 5 minutes in a cab. We stayed in King suite and it was perfet for us. Clean bathroom - big comfortable bed, nespresso machine (always a bonus) and complimentary still water on arrival - it's the little things ♡ The breakfast was lovely and staff were very accomadating. I really couldn't fault this hotel and we will definitely be back again next time we visit dublin. Thank you colette for a wonderful stay at the skylon hotel.
title: Lovely hotel with easy access to the city center

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Wanted a place that we could dive to that would be convenient to everything without driving too fat into Dublin. This place was great. Large clean rooms, helpful staff, stores, restaurants, pubs, buses, cabs all convenient to hotel.
title: Great Place, Convenient to city center and sirport

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Nice very clean room nice sceenery good food in the bar. Good value for money. Take bus 16 to the center and to the airport. Nice area with small pubs or bars. Very kind service. We will come if ever in Dublin.
title: Near to airport easy access to town center

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: From the moment we entered this hotel, our stay was perfect. Room was beautiful and had everything we needed. All of the staff were extremely friendly, accommodating and were willing to go the extra mile. A special thank you to Hazel who found out we had just got engaged and gave us a complimentary bottle of prosecco - this made our stay extra special. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food but the bar area was lovely and the afternoon tea looked amazing! Although the room was incredibly hot, we were provided with a fan without even having to ask. This hotel is in a great location with lots of shops and restaurants on the same street. Number 16 bus from the airport it takes about 20-30mins and it drops you right outside the hotel. It is also a short bus trip to the city centre and buses are very frequent. I will be recommending this hotel to all friends and family, and won't hesitate to return when I'm Dublin next.
title: Perfect

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Myself and 3 other ladies went to the Skylon Hotel for lunch, which would be a regular occurrence as we enjoy the hotel and food. When we drove into the car park, we were greeted by a very rude man who looked into the car and said it was ' resident' parking only. I explained we went there a lot and would only be about 1.5 hours and he refused to let us stay. We noted about 5 or 6 empty parking spaces but still had to leave.
title: Not allowed to park and have lunch

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: This was a nice stay with a convenient location. The room was good but did show signs of wear. Our closet mirror had a huge crack down the side. The halls from reception also looked tired. The restaurant was good.
title: Good stay, good location

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: I've just returned from this hotel after staying with 13 of my friends for my hen!! Such a stunning well run hotel. The bar on Friday night was fabulous, atmosphere amazing and everyone was so happy! Rooms were beautiful and beds sooooo comfy. There's a bus stop right outside that takes you to temple bar for €2.70. Taxi from the airport was €16 and from temple bar was €8Oh and there's a dominoes pizza across the road too open until 4am! A real godsend! I would definitely stay here again if I came back to Dublin. Thank you to the skylon :)
title: An amazing hen

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Decent location..average old hotel. Prob wouldn't stay there again as I personally would prefer somewhere a little more clean looking and closer to the city. Bus ride is only about 10-15 mins however I myself would rather be in walking distance next time.
title: Not bad..

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: My husband and I stayed here while attending the Hans Zimmer concert. Room was clean and basic. Hotel itself was ok, clean. The hotel was further away from the centre and 3arena than we thought so having done a walking trip back from centre once, we took the bus after that. Skylon is great if you're going to Croker Park. If you're looking for a modern hotel close to centre then this is not the hotel for you. If you are looking for clean, average and a trek out of the centre this might tick your boxes.
title: Average hotel

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: I visited the Skylon at the weekend for lunch with family. We were heading to a big game in town so the Skylon is an obvious choice for lunch beforehand.We have been visiting the Skylon for many years. The food and service was always great. However, a number of months ago, they decided to no longer provide a carvery option for lunch. That in itself is not an issue as long as the kitchen and servers can work together efficiently to get orders taken, and food delivered, efficiently.Unfortunately, you may have seen on my previous review since the upgrade that the service and food was very disappointing overall. We hoped for a better experience on Sunday, but it wasn't to be.We arrived at 1.20 and met friends who had got there before us. Their lunch order took 40 minutes to arrive. The food was only warm, not hot. Our lunch took 55 minutes to be delivered. We almost had to cancel it as it was simply taking too long.It's hard to know where the problem is because there are LOTS of people serving in the restaurant. My guess is that the problem's in the kitchen. The fact is, the food was taking far too long to be delivered to lots of tables, not just ours.As mentioned, the Skylon is well located to capture trade from people attending games and concerts in Croke Park. However, they don't seem to be aware of this, and are certainly not taking advantage of it.When our food eventually arrived, it was fine. Certainly no better than what was previously available in the carvery, so the overall experience was poorer given how long it took.To the Restaurant Manager, my feedback is... Must Try Harder!Don't take my word for it. Try it for yourself.
title: Disappointing Service for Sunday Lunch

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Stayed with a group of friends and family for my hen do. Hotel is lovely and rooms great. The location is a bit far out from centre of town but is easily reached by short taxi ride. The hotel breakfast is lovely and staff helpful and kindly provided complimentary drink. Would recommend
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: I dropped in on saturday for a meal with my wife, and was attended to immediately by a very pleasant young girl,who unfortunately, disappeared just after taking our order.The food was served no more than 5 minutes later, (my wife wants one of whatever it was they used, she claims it would save her numerous hours standing over a cooker.) With everything piled in a heap on the plates topped off with meat., (not very inviting)My glass was picked up on two occasions before i had finished.the floor staff were dressed in short sleeved tee-shirts emblazoned with a picture of U2 on the front, and boasting team Skylon on the back, wearing runners (dirty) with some showing their ankles,On the way through the Lobby to the toilets i was confronted by a cardboard image of U2 staring after me as i passed, which was all i needed to p,,s me off.The only good thing about the visit was the two girls that supplied the entertainment to an unappreciative audience. Full marks to them,A previous reviewer referred to the Skylon as a 4 star that should be a 5 star, ? There must have been something in that visitors drink, Whoever is responsible for overseeing the dress attire of the hotel staff should be forgiven for having no finger nails due to an ongoing nervous breakdown complaint.The girl on the floor in my local should be considered for the job should the vacancy arise.
title: Floor Service

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Came and stayed at the skylon Friday 21st July to the 24th, not a bad thing to be said, my partner bought me here for my birthday and upon arrival a nice polite lady called hazel checked us in, then upgraded us to a king suite, we also got breakfast vouchers free of charge and a complimentary bottle of champagne. Thanks hazel On getting to the room we were loving how clean and tidy it was, bed was so comfy that we hated getting in our own last night. House keeping cleaned and gave fresh towels everyday.The breakfast was delicious and our evening meal on the last night was just as nice. Staff are friendly and helpful.Ideal hotel for those not wanting to stay far out as it's just a 10min bus journey in to Dublin centre. Bus stops right across the road and taxi service second to none.Would definitely stay here again
title: Jemma

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Coming to Dublin for a U2 gig our main priority was a hotel near to Croke Park, hence the Dublin Skylon.The room was probably over-priced but that was the only downside, everything else was great.We were upgraded to a family room on arrival so the room was spacious and very comfortable. Good in-room amenities and an excellent night's sleep with a good shower in the morning - that's most of what we look for in a hotel room straight away.Breakfast next morning was great - ok so that's not unusual in Ireland but still exactly what we wanted after a big night at the gig.What sets the Skylon apart though is the team and their service. They claim to be family-run and that's just what it feels like - really welcoming, friendly and professional with a smile.Many bigger hotels could learn how to do it from the Skylon team.We came for a great show. We'll be back at the Skylon next time we're in Dublin, whatever the excuse.
title: Great weekend stay for a big gig

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: First thought as I walked in, was is this an old people's home!?Not up to date quite shabby, beds comfortable, majority of staff were quite rude!! Not worth €600 euros for two nights per family! Breakfast was cold and oily.Not an amazing hotel. Wouldn't stay again definitely not a four star! Needs re checking!
title: Not very updated.

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Stayed at the Skylon for the Coldplay concert last month,my only gripe with the hotel was the price it's obviously costed to the fact its within walking distance of Croke Park, over £500 for two nights and didnt include breakfast at this price! We had a King Room which was considerably smaller than it looked on the photo! The room was clean, very warm though(fan provided) and the usual facilities. I will echo other comments in that the staff were extremely nice, all dressed up in their Coldplay tshirts and really welcoming!If you are travelling from the airport, I would get the bus (16/42) from outside the airport and it drops you over the road from the hotel and same going back, make sure you have the busfare in coins as the driver cannot give change (2.70 euros each way). You can also get the same bus into Dublin city - takes around 20 mins for the same priceYou do a great cocktail too...recommend the Bramble!
title: Great Location!

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: We stayed at the Skylon on July 20th. Very comfortable clean room. The fan in the room was most welcomed as it got very warm and stuffy during the night. . . However we were very disappointed with breakfast. The porridge resembled cement it was so thick ! I then decided to have cornflakes, they were cheap and chewy ( definitely not Kellogg's! ) I ordered a pot of tea and was so disappointed to find one miserable ( Tetley's ) tea bag on a string inside. . We do have lovely tea in Ireland . . It's called Barry's or Lyons !!! Having paid €174 for B&B . . We felt it was overpriced. Disappointing as it was a special occasion.
title: Disappointing Breakfast

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: We had a Family celebration in this Hotel 1St July We could not have picked a better hotel Service from check in till check out was faultless, and very friendly, and professional Rooms were very clean, and modern Food was excellent with very friendly servers Nice Bar area, with good drinks at reasonable pricesLocation is the best you can get in Dublin if you don't, the want to pay ridiculous city center rip off prices Location is 10 min drive by taxi from airport costing no more than20euroLocal buses from airport stop outside Hotel To city center is approx 20 minutes walk, or local buses outside hotel gets you there in 5 mins. There are some lovely pubs across from the Hotel ,and places to eat ,but food in Hotel bar is very good In our Group were people from Canada Scotland Holland ,all were very impressed with all of above Thanking all the staff at the Skylon Hotel for their friendly banter, and serviceAnd surely people will use the Skylon on their next visit to Dublin
title: 4star hotel deserving 5 stars

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: This hotel is in a great location, only around 15 mins from the airport and 10-15 mins to the city centre. The breakfast was amazing and the staff friendly and helpful. The lobby area is a little dated, however the room was a really good standard and we always had a peaceful nights sleep for the 3 nights we were there. There are a couple of places you can eat across the road from the hotel as well as a fish and chip shop and a Dominos. Buses run from outside the hotel and only cost £2.70 euros. Taxis are expensive but Dublin is expensive overall anyway so it is expected. Overall a nice, comfortable hotel in a good location.
title: Nice short break.

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Stayed here for one night and thankful it was only one night!! The rooms have no a/c and our two rooms were so different although they were right next to each other on the same floor. Because we had to sleep with the windows open we heard a barking dog all night long since the back of the hotel backs to some backyards of a residential neighborhood. The breakfast dining room was extremely warm as well to the point that unless you're wearing shorts and a t-shirt you are sweating.
title: Very stuffy rooms and also extremely warm breakfast dining room

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: This hotel is clean, comfortable and conveniently located. Near enough to the airport and to the city center. Always have water available, staff work hard to meet our needs. Good shower, quiet rooms...pretty much everything you want in a hotel. Staff helped us make our way around Dublin with good suggestions. Worth the price you pay.
title: Perfect start for a Dublin vacation

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: Just had a friends hen party in the Skylon last weekend. From the moment we emailed the hotel to book our stay right up to checkout the staff were fantastic. Our hens were made to feel really welcome and the hotel had left a complementary bottle of bubbly in each room as a special treat. Our dinner was in a private dining room and again the staff were so attentive and helpful. The hotel is really central and easy to get to. Thanks to all, you made our stay extra special and we came home with some fab memories of our night in Dublin.
title: Hen Party

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: We had a 28 hour Dublin layover and wanted to be withing easy reach of the airport. My parents and 2 teen age kids with us. The rooms were clean, the beds very comfortable. We enjoyed a pleasant breakfast in the dining room and the staff in all areas were lovely to work with. The location is excellent, easy from the airport and the bus outside the hotel goes to all the key Dublin locations. Local restaurants and pubs were great. Taxis were easy to get. I recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay again.
title: Well Kept and Excellent Location

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: This hotel is by far the best hotel we as a family have stayed in +we r frequent travelers. So helpful, welcoming + accommodating. We managed 2 get a free parking space @ the front. Another bonus. The afternoon was just so cute, we got it complimentary as we stayed on a Sunday nite. We had 2 reschedule a few things over r stay and they were v patient + understanding. We will def b back. Jade + Isaac r the stars of the show. The room was comfortable although sum AC wud have been good in the rare Irish heat. Thank u all @skylon so much
title: Mummy's birthday / girls trip

hotelLocation: 27 Upper Drumcondra Road, Dublin D09 V1Y2, Ireland
review: We have just returned from a great 4 night stay at the Skylone Hotel. We were attending the Cold Play concert at Croke Stadium and the location of the hotel was a short distance from the hotel. The hotel check in was quick and the hotel left a birthday card and bottle of champagne in our room which was a lovely surprise and gesture. The rooms are clean and tidy and had everything you need as well as extras like bottles of water/crisps. The hotel and staff provided an excellent service and we will definitely be staying at the Skylone Hotel on our next trip to Dublin.
title: Weekend away

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Stayed here for an early flight . Lovely and modern and perfect for early flight. Left car here for 5 nights also and it's cost approx 80 euros including the night !, we had to stay abroad for an extra night due to unforeseen circumstances and I emailed hotel about car and extra night. They were fantastic and responded straight away with no extra charge for the night,will stay again. Book directly through their website for a better deal.
title: Great deal

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: The room was very clean, comfortable and spacious. The main reason I stayed there was because of its location. The hotel has a service that brings you to and from the airport at no charge. They are very punctual.
title: Great place to stay close to the airport!

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: I've been staying here since June and have to say it's brilliant. Kate and the team work hard to ensure that we are happy. Food is good value and well cooked. Taylor in the Restaurant is super enthusiastic and always working hard. Shuttle bus to airport is handy. Have used other hotels around here this is the best by miles. 5 stars. Well done guys!
title: Great Hotel

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Once again we had the pleasure of staying at the Metro and once again the staff was excellent. Our luggage did not arrive for three days and the front desk did everything they could to make our stay pleasurable. They constantly helped us contact the luggage department and even brought us to the airport three times so we could check on our luggage. The shuttle bus driver was fabulous and even let us borrow some of his sports equipment so we could enjoy a game of golf near the hotel. Our room was perfect and every effort was made to make sure we were content and comfortable. Back there again next year for sure!!!
title: Always Helpful and Understanding

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Hotel is under renovation, but didn't interfere with stay. Rooms are clean but on small side. No A/C but they did provide a fan as it was warm. There is a shuttle from the airport but they charge 5 Euros for a round trip, which was fine but it wasn't advertised that there was a charge. Was first hard to find where shuttle picks you up and it is a short walk from the airport. Staff are friendly and very helpful and accommodating. Restaurant in the hotel is good; the breakfast is an additional charge from the room. There are no other restaurants or stores near the hotel as it is more of a residential area. Overall, stay was comfortable and convenient for our purposes.
title: convenient to airport

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Had an overnight stay. Room was a bit small but very clean and had everything you need. Dinner in the bistro was excellent. All staff very friendly and helpful. Car park facilities very handy and courtesy bus to the airport.
title: Try the bistro

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Very nice hotel. Very clean and room was spacious. Breakfast in the morning was basic however was nice. Overall good experience. Buses into town 2 minute walk. Shuttle bus on request to and from Dublin airport which proved very handy.
title: Metro

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: This hotel is very near to airport and I guess that's like their main advantage. Hotel staff was courteous and friendly. They upgraded/changed the room when requested. Breakfast was good and had decent spread. Rooms were spacious, clean and almost newly furnished. One drawback was that they don't have mini bar in their rooms. This hotel is far from city centre and it takes good 40 min to reach there. This hotel is good for the people who wish to stay near airport.
title: Decent place near airport

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: Located only 10 min from the airport, and a shuttle available to get you there and back. On arrival the check in was easy and fast, we let them know we needed a shuttle back in the morning, so they wrote our names on a list. The room was a little bit on the tiny side, the dresser drawer opened and hit the bed before it could be opened all the way. Its a little inconvenient when the blow dryer was attached to inside of that drawer. Just a weird set up, we had to put the room key in a slot in order for the lights in the room/bathroom would come on. Just a small room overall, had to jump over the bed to get back and fourth with 2 people in it along with 2 large suite cases.Dining area is large and it was very busy that night, the service was still very good. It was already late so we didn't try any food, only dessert. We ended up bringing our second drinks to our room.
title: Decent place near the airport

hotelLocation: Santry Cross, Ballymun Road, Dublin 11, Ireland
review: newly refurbished rooms. A bit noisy, but proximity to Dublin airport makes up for it.Full service restaurant. Wide choices on menu. Full breakfast or Continental breakfast available at reasonable prices.
title: Good choice for outbound travelers

review: This hotel is fairly modern with nice amenities. rooms are nicely appointed and the hotel is in a great location for any tourist activities on foot. Some say the rooms get loud on weekends. This was not our experience. If you are visiting Dublin this is the place to stay. It is also attached to a nice bar/pub.
title: Great Hotel in the Right Spot

review: Loved this hotel. It's newly renovated, modern, comfortable, clean, great customer service plus some little extras like ice cream at check in. Location was fabulous-you can walk anywhere from this location-right in Temple bar, 5 minute walk to Dame street, Trinity College, shopping on Grafton St, 15min walk to St. Stephens Green. Although Temple bar area is loud at night, we could not hear it from our room-it was very quiet. Best hotel of our trip.
title: Perfect Spot-best hotel on the trip

review: We stayed two nights at the Temple Bar Hotel as part of our trip through Ireland. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were able to check in early and were even given an upgraded room. We were at the back of the hotel, which was good since it shielded is from the noise of this rowdy district. The location is very convenient.
title: Great place to stay in Dublin

review: Good quality accommodation in a very busy and noisy street. Ask for a room at the back of the hotel if you don't want to be kept awake by boozy youngsters and VERY loud music in the street.The hotel staff were very helpful, even going to a lot of trouble to print our boarding passes for our Flybe flight the day we checked out. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel during our three night stay, as it would have added €120 to the cost of our short break! There are plenty of places on Temple Bar to get a full breakfast for half the price, or coffee and a croissant for just a few euros...try Centra, a convenience shop-cum-deli a couple of hundred yards from the hotel where they sell excellent croissants for €1 and a good cup of coffee for less than €3, take away or eat in.We got the bus from the airport to Dame Street, a couple of minutes walk away from Temple Bar, a briliant service which runs every 10 or 15 minutes and cost us £9 each return.
title: Good hotel in 'vibrant' area

review: Got it for its location. Absolutely right on temple bar area and walking distance to Molly Malone statue, where all the tours start in the morning. Can also walk to Grafton st and shopping area. You barely stay in the hotel being that its so close to so many things. First room had an outside facing window into a street but due to some construction noise in another building, we changed to an internal facing room with no view but room was fine. Everything worked well. I would say its a bit on the small side but probably the case with city hotels. Has all amenities. Can't go wrong choosing this unless you have a lot of luggage and need larger rooms.
title: Location, Location, Location....and a decent room.

review: This hotel is at the West End of Fleet Street in what is called the Temple Bar District of the Dublin. The significance of Fleet Street is the this the main happening area of the city with countless restaurants and pubs one after another from the end that we stayed for a half a dozen blocks. In other words, if your vacation involves wanted to plenty of food and drink options within an easy walk of the hotel, this is a great place. Fleet Street is one way and only allows some cars and taxis out front. Further, only the first two blocks are open to a few cars, otherwise it is pedestrians only. AS suggested in advance, we took the Airport Express 700 bus from the airport (7 Euro one way or 12 Euro round trip). The bus lets you out on the O'Connell Street bridge from which it is maybe an easy quarter mile walk to the hotel. Since this bus is an express few stops from the airport. O'Connell Street bridge was the second stop (maybe 10-12 minutes walk (easy), depending on the traffic lights. On the way back to the airport we also took the 700 Airport Express, the return pickup point was even closer. Just around the corner off Fleet Street - maybe a 100 yards and less than 5 minutes. Arriving at the hotel, reception could not have been more pleasant. We arrived around 8 AM and they allowed us early check in, which was nice as we dropped bags and were off immediately into the city. Throughout our stay, we found the front desk staff so friendly and informative. They helped us greatly in knowing where to go and how to most easily get there. They were an amazingly wonderful part of our stay. The rooms too were more than perfect to meet our needs. Truthfully, we were only in them to sleep. However, for anyone that wanted to spend more time within them for a rest or to watch TV, they were nicely furnished and comfortable. All rooms come with ear plugs. Let's be real, this hotel is in a party part of the city. Friday through Sunday may be a bit noisier with people in the streets having fun. We did not hear music from any of the nearby pubs, but could hear people when in our room. However, although my other half did use earplugs a couple times to help sleep, I did not. I had no sleeping issues during the eight nights we stayed. I am not lying when I share that over two dozens restaurants and two dozen pubs can be found within a quarter mile radius of the hotel. If you extend the distance to even a mile, you have more different choice than you could exploit if you ate somewhere different twice a day for three weeks. If you do not want great Irish cuisine every meal (but who wouldn't), you will find a Hard Rock Cafe, TGIF, Kentucky Fried Chicken, Subway, and Starbucks in the immediate block area. We had the breakfast option as part of our stay. The Toast Restaurant is off the lobby. It is GREAT. A buffet style restaurant with great fresh food - eggs (scrambled, fried, pancakes, waffles, sausage, bacon, ham, black pudding, white pudding, hot or cold cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurts, coffee, tea, juices, milk, fresh breads, rolls and muffins. This was also my favorite meal each day, getting us ready for a full day in the city or out in the country side. The pubs are great. Most have music, frequently live entertainment, and so close to our base of operations. Actually Busker's is a pub right in the hotel, which had great entertainment and cannot beat the convenience. Do not want to eat out? Literally directly across the street from the front of the hotel is a market, which has essentially any essential as well as fresh fruit, fresh baked goods, sandwiches, etc. Also, want to have a drink (beer, wine, other) in your room? You can get what you like right in this market. Need to exchange money? They can exchange at the hotel or at a nearby bank. However, they will honestly share that these will be the "worst" rates of exchange. Rather on day one, reception directed us around the corner to an Official Exchange Center - maybe three minute walk. We went here several times to trade dollars for Euros. How perfect? We also saw a number of attractions from the Molly Malone statue to the Archaeology Museum to Dublin Castle To Dublina to Christ Church to the Business Storehouse to the Jameson Distillery and more attractions. All of these were "walkable" from this hotel. Again perfect. We too took two days bus excursions out into the country side. The tour bus stop was only a block up from the hotel, less than 10 minutes walk. Again, making the Temple Bar Hotel a perfectly excellent base of operations. We loved our stay at Temple Bar and in Ireland. We would delay love to return. You will definitely have a great time in Dublin and the Temple Bar Hotel can help assure your needs are realized.
title: Perfect Residence in the Happening Area of Dublin

review: If you want to hear music loudly until early hours of every morning Temple Bar Inn hotel is the place for you. I am not that kind of music fan so I was really disappointed about the noise that came to the room from bars in this building and around the Fleet Street. I have to say that the location of this hotel is great near shopping areas and hotel staff is doing good work. But those are all the positive sides of staying here.The room where we stayed 4 nights was really basic and small. It even lacked elements like soap tray in the shower and hangers for jackets that we had to ask separetly. There were no ventillation so you had to open windows for fresh air to come in. And after opening the rhythm of bass drums was even louder until 3 or 4 a.m.All of this can be experienced in budget style hotels but not in hotels that cost over 250 euros per night. My advice is to go somewhere else if you are not wealthy bass drum rhythm lover.
title: Excellent choice for bass drum rhythm lovers

review: Lot's of great restaurants nearby, walking distance. I prefer the beauty of Ireland more than the party areas. Temple Bar Hotel room was great the double windows kept street noise quiet and it was nice to have a place that had air conditioning it was humid. The hotel has a great location not too close to the party scene but close enough to walk there. I only stayed one night and had to leave early so I didn't get to use all the amenities.
title: Temple bar is a busy party part of town, lots of restaurants, bars, music

review: Great location right in the heart of the action! Amazing front desk staff began with Tania helping locate lost airport luggage before, during and after my meltdown she was and kind and helpful. Ending with her blonde counter part (sorry I didn't get your name) recommending a great coffee shop the next morning. Quick to smile and ready to help. Thanks for all your help.
title: Adventure Ireland

review: Upon arrival, I was greeted with free ice cream which was perfect since I was in a hurry to get to my room, change and head out to the convention center which I walked to every day. Comfortable, clean room. I enjoyed the free little cookies and even the candy bar on Friday night. Yes, you are in a lively, loud area of the city. As mentioned ear plugs are provided to use. While there was a fan in the room, I did not use it. The room comes with all amenities (except conditioner which is okay as I packed my own upon reading a previous post). I could walk to many locations in the Temple Bar area including the locations of tours that I signed up for. I appreciated the free map and directions since well Google Maps had me going in the wrong direction.
title: Excellent location, friendly and accomodating staff

review: In terms of value I would give this hotel 5*, mainly due to the service, the cleanliness and the location. The breakfast could be better for the price (it is not included in the cost) as the selection is minimal however, as stated, the service was good. They offered a special Irish dinner and show with the neighbouring pub/bar. My girlfriend even got asked to try Irish dancing, which she did to her dismay! The experience was enjoyable and memorable however (more so for me I think). It is located in the centre of shops, restaurants and attractions and I would definitely recommend getting the 27 euro bus pass as it enabled us to go everywhere for the 3 days we were there- so much easier than paying for a ticket each time. I would also recommend going to the Guinness factory and the hotel is very close to this attraction. As it is in the centre we assumed it would be noisy however they provide ear plugs to help sleep. Overall, it was a great trip and we enjoyed coming back to this hotel at the end of a busy day!
title: Lively hotel in the centre of everything

review: My wife and I stayed for a night in the hotel and found its location to be super convenient to visit the various sightseeing locations around Dublin. Its proximity to locations such as Trinity College (about 3-4 mins walk), Christ Church Cathedral (10mins walk) and Dublin Castle (about 5-7 min walk) makes it easy to visit especially if you have a short time. Further, its not too close to the main part of temple bar, hence the noise wasn't bad
title: Excellent Location for Short Stays

review: Great hotel, clean, modern, comfortable. Located in the heart beat of Dublin. Very friendly and professional staff. Serve real scrambled eggs at breakfast buffet- delicious! Staff was very helpful in planning sightseeing around Dublin.Buskers was a blast with tasty pub food. Provided free shuttle bus round trip to U2 concert.
title: Top Notch

review: Stayed at christmas. Ideal location. Rooms were great for 3 girls although alittle cramped when getting ready. Free hot drinks on arrival was a nicw touch. Would stay again bur maybe in the deluxe suite
title: Great hotel

review: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel during our recent trip to Ireland and we are so glad that we did! Beautiful and comfortable hotel right in the heart of Dublin. The hotel staff was amazing! Especially Mario! They really went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one! We had booked several tours and the hotel was kind enough to hold our luggage for us while we were on the tours. They went out of their way to accommodate us. We will definitely stay there again!
title: Made our trip easy!

review: This hotel is in the middle of downtown, just above the action, that means that if you go in a weekend night you won't get to sleep unless you wear the earplugs that the hotel provides for you but honestly they do not serve much. The view from our room 217 was to the air condition machinery, another noise to add . When we checkin we were offer a room with air conditioning (even that in Dublin doesn't go over the 20 o.C ) with an over price of 30 euros, so we said no, that' s what we got!.The staff is friendly and the room was clean. The location is very good, you only have to put to the noise level at weekend nights.
title: In the middle of everyything..

review: This hotel is right in the heart of temple bar. Although the streets were very busy with hen and stag parties we couldnt hear any of this from the hotel room. Lovely decor and spotlessly clean. Children received ice cream when we arrived and they were delighted to find mini crunchie bars on their bed! The breakfast is very good. We will return again, hopefully!
title: Very good hotel

review: I chose this hotel for its central location and it paid off--it was really easy to get around the city from this spot. The hotel was modern and clean, and my room was well appointed and functional (and we had two bags of welcome snacks!). The only downside was the lack of air conditioning, which meant I had to sleep with the window open. Surprisingly, the street noise was not disruptive. The best part was the staff ... from our greeting at check-in (including free ice cream) through our check-out, the Temple Bar team were pleasant and super helpful. I'd definitely stay here again!
title: Attentive Staff and Great Location

review: This was our first trip to Dublin so we wanted to make sure we were centrally located. While the Temple Bar/Fleet Street area may be considered "touristy," and we usually prefer to stay off the beaten path, we wanted to make the most of our short 3 day stay in Dublin.We took the Airlink 747 shuttle bus from the airport which was about a 30 minute ride and the Fleet Street stop was about a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Really easy! We arrived early in the morning and were offered complimentary coffee. They didn't have a room ready but offered us a €30 upgrade to check in early, which we opted to do so we could freshen up after our flight and explore the city.The room was clean and spacious. We were a little concerned since we were given complimentary ear plugs, but we never had an issue with noise, even on Friday and Saturday night. My only complaint is that the toiletries provided were shampoo and body wash. This is a total nitpick since I usually pack my own, but this time I didn't and I could have definitely used some conditioner! Especially with the misty and windy weather in Ireland! The hotel is really perfectly located. It's toward the end of Fleet Street, so only a 2 minute walk to bars and restaurants, but it's just far enough removed not to be super loud. We really enjoyed how central it was and had a great visit overall!
title: Beautiful hotel in the perfect location!

review: Between London & Paris, the Temple Bar Hotel topped the list, both in location, friendliness of staff and a great room (No.330), no fridge, no worries, they carried a bar fridge in for us. Nothing was too much trouble. The Irish are known for their friendliness and we now know that to be very very true.Room was a great size and Tesco just across the road, let alone The Buskers Bar next door where we watched the Irish singers on their last night and the Irish jig. Great fun.No noise worries whatsoever. Robbie the bouncer was more than helpful and advised us to take an outing on the DART to a seaside village called Howth which we did and enjoyed immensely.If we could do the long haul from Australia, Ireland/Dublin would be the only place I would want to go back to.Thoroughly recommend this hotel to everyone.
title: Simply the Best

review: Hotel was just a block from the heart of the Temple Bar area, surrounded by good bars and restaurants, yet was happily a quiet, relaxing spot as well. Room was fine, breakfast was great and the staff was very helpful.
title: Great location, and a very nice hotel

review: We only had the pleasure of staying at Temple Bar Hotel for one night, but we were very pleased with our short stay. Temple Bar is the touristy area, but we wanted to be in the heart of the action, with restaurants and pubs everywhere you turn. We weren't disappointed!Check-in was easy -- and the free (and delicious!) ice cream was a nice touch. Our room was modern and spacious ... but had no air conditioning. Typically this wouldn't be a problem in Dublin, but we visited when the weather was quite warm. I discovered (on Tripadvisor!) that some rooms had AC, so we asked at the front desk. We were able to switch rooms for 30 euro -- best money spent that trip! Our new room was just as nice as the first, only cooler!The ear plugs on the nightstand with a note saying the area could be noisy (it is Temple Bar, after all) made us a little nervous. But our room (331) was quiet and we didn't hear a sound that night.Our rate included breakfast, which was delicious with lots of items on the buffet.We would definitely stay here again.
title: Modern hotel in liveliest part of Dublin

review: Stayed here Saturday 8th July for the Coldplay concert. The hotel and room was very clean and staff was friendly. The hotel had put on a free biz to and from the concert which was good. When checking in I was told that an extra €50 would be added as a deposit for the room but would be returned on the card as soon I we checked out, now this shocked me as the room cost €279 I would have thought that would have been enough. The room wasn't overly big we stayed in 426 didn't hear any noise which was good and slept fine. The receptionist had offered breakfast at a discount of €17 which we declined, personally I thot after spending €279 there would be more than a €3 discount. Reading through other reviews I see the hotel offered ice creams, little extras in the room which didn't seem to be the case in our experience. For location wise and cleanliness yes I would go back to the hotel but maybe think about little extras for all guests and not just some.
title: Coldplay

review: Stayed last minute at this Hotel in a Triple room. The room was great value for Money, very clean and decorated lovely. Very spacious too and nice big tv. Staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely return.
title: Great value for Money, very clean and comfortable

review: During a recent visit to Dublin, we stayed at the Temple Bar Hotel. Since our last visit to Ireland three years ago, the hotel has been completely refurbished. The reception spaces are both welcoming and stylish. Of course being in Ireland means that most people are very friendly. No exemption here. The staff was excellent. Our room was clean and very comfortable. What's important about this hotel is its location, right in the middle of Temple Bar, several streets of restaurants, music filled pubs, and shops. It was great fun to walk around and enjoy the sights and sounds. The only downside to the hotel's location is the noise. The streets are busy with throngs of people well into the night. Fortunately, the hotel's windows are well insulated and guests are provided with earplugs if needed. We had no problems whatsoever. It's a great place from which to explore amazing Dublin.
title: Great Little Hotel; Amazing Location

review: The only thing positive about staying at this hotel is the location. Otherwise, skip it. No air conditioning in most of the rooms, and the room was stuffy and cramped. We asked if we could get an aurcondioned room and was told it would cost 30 Euro extra.. You can hear the noise from the honkey tonk environment in the street, and the service was wildly inconsistent. My friend was offered complementary coffee and the next day I was rudely told to buy a cup for $5 US from a machine.
title: Ripoff
